column6: What a great discovery!  Took a chance on this Red Hook newcomer and had wonderful time.  The space is cozy and the restaurant has a warm and welcoming neighborhood vibe.  The food was wonderful!  We LOVED the fried artichokes and the cacio e pepe was among some of the best I've had.  We tried the panna cotta and tiramisu for dessert and both were heavenly.  Our server was a lovely woman from Italy named Jessica, who couldn't have been more friendly and attentive.  In fact, most of the staff went out of their way to engage and everyone was friendly.  This was one of my first times dining inside a restaurant post Covid and Bar Mario served up a warm and inviting welcome.
No comment
No comment
No comment
My wife and I love Bar Mario!! Must visit! If italian is what you crave, do not deny yourself the pleasure of visiting this establishment

This place is a gem!  Excellent dishes and wine-felt like we were in Italy! I highly recommend the Spaghetti Hangover and Ricotta cheesecake.  Although the place is small, EVERYONE there has BIG warm hearts to make you feel welcome, food came out quickly but not rushed and fantastic music, lovely experience!

This place is amazing. I would recommend it to all my friends. The ownership is warm and caring and definitely made us feel appreciated and welcome. The food was amazing and the drinks were out of this world. I wish I could give a 10 but it limits the stars to 5
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
My brother claimed this the best burger of nyc! We got the loaded fries and double burgers again. Phenomenal!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No table here but a good $9 double burger. They make everything fresh so you have to wait but it's worth it. The staff are friendly. The burger is nice and crispy and juicy. Great tasting!

Really good food at a busy location. I went to this location of 7th street burger and enjoyed the food and the space. This location has seats and bathroom which is great for someone who has been shopping all day and wants sit for a burger. The burger and fries lived up to their 7th street name. I got the loaded fries and the were so good. The even made my loaded fries with an impossible burger Instead of a traditional one. I was presently surprised! And the ube banana pudding... bomb. It is purple but you definitely want to get it while you're there
No comment
No comment

I came here for a Yelp Elite event, and it 100% lives up to the hype! I ordered a double smash burger with fries and an extra side of sauce and it was all so delicious. The burger patties were so juicy and flavorful, and the sauce was one of a kind. The fries were perfectly crunchy which was awesome! The staff was so kind, and my order was prepared so quickly! Will definitely be back!
No comment

I love that this chain keeps on opening more stores! The simple menu is proof that we don't need more than just a food burger and fries! The burgers are always perfectly juice and the fries...well it could be crispier but no other complaints. I love that this store has ample seating!
No comment

If you are looking for a classic In N Out type burger, then this place is decent.  They have a very simple menu.  For burgers, they have a hamburger, cheeseburger, and impossible burger.  There are three drink options: Coke, Fanta and Sprite.  There are two dessert options, both of which were pudding but different flavors.  I got the impossible burger which came with pickles.  The patty was cooked well though the burger was on the greasy side.  Fries were nice and crispy and went well with the burger.

I am SOOO happy with my experience at the new 7th street burger near the Moxy hotel! The cashier taking our order was extremely nice and the service to finish our order was quick. We ordered a cheeseburger, fries, and a wonderful Mexican coke bottle. The cheeseburger has a delicious house sauce as well as onions and pickles. The fries were cooked to perfection and came in very well sized portions. The burger was really lean and thin which I love. There were several small tables in the bright store with booths as well which was great. I highly recommend coming here for a quick bite to eat - especially before a game or concert at MSG!

This location is probably the best 7th street burger I have been to! Great seating space that allows you to enjoy the food immediately. They also have standing tables outside for people to use. This time I tried the double cheeseburger, loaded fries, and Mexican Coke. Everything is so delicious!! I highly recommend the loaded fries! It is so tasty with the cheese, onions, and beef! The fries are still pretty crispy with all the toppings. The burger is great as usual! The Mexican Coke has cane sugar for those who aren't familiar. The staff can open the bottle for you as well. Overall, this location serves food quickly, same tasty food, great staff, and large seating area!
No comment

Situated on 7th avenue just around the corner from the Moxy Hotel, this little burger joint has a spare but superb menu. I went for a Yelp Elite event and got a double cheeseburger and fries. The double cheeseburger had nice smashed patties, gooey American cheese, creamy house sauce (a tangy aioli reminiscent of that of In-n-Out), sweet caramelized grilled diced onions, and briny but tart pickles. The fries were crispy and seasoned with salt and pepper, the combination of which felt really fancy! Definitely a great place to stop by for a quick bite!

Anyone else feel like 7th street burger is stealthily taking over the city? I'm 100% here for this takeover. Came w my brother; we each had a double cheeseburger and Mexican Coke, shared an order of fries. Double cheeseburgers were cooked to greasy perfection. I think I'm addicted to this type of burger. My arteries certainly wouldn't be able to handle daily consumption, but it's such a treat to have it every two weeks or so- and especially now that it's nearly at all the areas I pass through or frequent, it's available whenever I've had a long/tough day! The definition of comfort food! Particularly love this location because it's got SEATING! And very clutch: BATHROOM! Well-lit, comfortable seating, great service, excellent ventilation (no greasy smelling clothes!)

BEWARE: Unsanitary location. 2 stars are for the delicious burger only. The cashier/worker was behind the counter BRUSHING HER HAIR next to the kitchen, hair flying everywhere. Absolutely disgusting with an open concept kitchen like that. She kept her huge paddle brush under the counter that she took out, brushed her hair/weave violently and then put the brush back under the counter.
No comment

Another solid branch for the new, expanding smashburger chain in NYC.  The double cheeseburger with disco fries is definitely the combo to get - and for some reason, this location was much faster at making the orders which I personally loved.  The seating here is also more plentiful.  Worth a stop!
Order this on Postmates. Wow. Simply delicious can y'all open one in Los Angeles pls!
No comment

Pretty good greasy cheeseburger and they give you a lot for fries which are $4. Came here for a Yelp elite event and glad I could try it! But to be honest I'm not sure if it's a burger I would crave like how I crave Shake Shack every once in a while. Idk there wasn't anything unique about the burger other than that it was pretty solid.
The burger tasted good, overall, but just thought it would be bigger, more filling, and that it would looked better though.

Very tasty burger but it reminds me of an old commercial " where's the beef " ordered a single. Mistake patty was very small and paper thin so the nice bun totally overpowered it. Sauce, onion and pickles tasted good but in combination with the bun outside of the wonderful grease beef was impossible to detect. Get the double however I feel $10 for the amount of beef it's not worth it.

Delicious burger joint in a pretty busy area. Yes, it's a bit greasy but dude, that's what burgers and fries are all about. Pretty reasonable prices for what you get. Sufficient seating at this location. Would definitely come back if I'm around that neighborhood.
No comment
My favorite East Village hidden gem that somehow isn't too hidden anymore, so happy to see they opened right near Penn Station! Easily best smash burger in NYC, will be the new go to on the commute
This is the best burger in the city! So happy they opened near my office. I got a single with fries. The loaded fries are also amazing. Highly recommend checking this place out!
Was a rainy night after watching a Broadway play. Came by and grabbed a double with fries and Mexican coke. Hit the spot.
By far the best burger in midtown!! If you haven't tried it yet then you must not love yourself..
Got the double burger and loaded fries-- did not disappoint!! Simple, but hits all the right spots. Would recommend
not much else to say besides go see for yourself! affordable, very tasty smash burger with unique house sauce. staff is fast and friendly! will be adding to my weekly rotation!

this place hits every single time, consistent delicious smash burger - love their focus on simplicity. their staff is always friendly too. hidden treat is the Baonanas banana pudding, a must try with burger and fries
No comment
No comment
No comment

We've come here several times as it's a convenient option in the neighborhood and it's very easy to get a reservation last minute. The food and drinks have always been good although nothing spectacular. The ambiance is pretty nice and they do a good job of decorating for different seasons/holidays. They also have good outdoor seating which we've enjoyed in the warmer months. My only real issue with this place is the service which for whatever reason has always been super slow regardless of how busy they are. Every time we've come, we find ourselves having to flag down anyone who passes by to get water refills, another glass of wine, the check, etc which really detracts the whole experience.
Beautiful place, good food staff nice and attentive and place was spacious. Will go back
No comment

Took off one star because of the waiter otherwise I have no complaints. We came in a Saturday during brunch. They let you order from the regular or brunch menu. We ordered stuffed french toast, Mac and cheese, meatballs, steak with eggs and vegan Bolognese. They give you a basket of soft bread and a pepper/tomato dip. It wasn't a long wait for food. Everything came out hot. My favorite dish was the Mac and cheese. After the waiter took our orders he never came back to the table. I even asked him for the check and he kept walking around the restaurant. My sister went and asked someone else for it again. I wish we could've given the water guy his tip. They have a men's women's and handicap bathroom. I would definitely come again.

Went here for date night and it was delicious. I would definitely come back. Everything was so fresh and tasty. The cocktails were on point. The burrata was creamy. The sauce for the scampi was buttery and lemony. I loved. I would definitely come back and try more items and save room for dessert next time.
No comment
The food was excellent here with very reasonable prices. The ambiance was also lovely with very friendly staff.
No comment
No comment

If you are looking for a quick go-to italian restaurant that is classy, this is the place to go. The ambiance is romantic, yet also a place you can go to with friends. They have classics like chicken and eggplant Parm but also a creative side to their menu like a giant truffle and stuffed cheese meatball. I enjoyed every bite of that appetizer meatball and would strongly suggest that everyone try it when you go! The drinks were made to perfection as I had a mango piña colada (different, right?). This is the type of place where you would go on a first date and it won't break the bank but it shows you have class (I saw a couple nearby on a date). They have outdoor and indoor seating and I like that their outdoor seating was on the side of their restaurant and not out in the street. Parking is okay, I found a spot right in front but that isn't commons.

I came here the other night to celebrate my birthday. The food was delicious. Some of the best Italian I've had in a long time but the service was really slow. My mom also told them it was my birthday and then they brought dessert out and she asked for candle cause it didn't come with one.
No comment
No comment

The place is large, with indoor and outdoor seating. The service was good. The pasta dishes were average, the lobster ravioli did come with a good amount of crab. Ravioli ripieni was heavy on the mushroom and the filet mignon did not come through.
No comment
No comment

Wanted to explore Williamsburg and found this place. It wasn't too hard to get a resi and I'm sure walks in would have also been fine. They gave some bread (which was very fluffy) with a red sauce. The sauce had a little bit of a red pepper flavor and was slightly sweet, but a delicious pairing with the bread. We got the Burrata Cheese as an appetizer to share which was also great. Then I got the fettuccine Verdi tartufate and my friend got a special they had which was called the mezzi rigatoni. She loved her dish and I also enjoyed mine- it was a little heavy on the cream which I had been warned about. The ambience inside was nice and the servers were very attentive. I would come here again- my only "negative" is that the vegetarian options are a little more limited.

I've been here a few times and it never disappoints. I had the squid ink linguini and it was quite a generous portion and delicious. the menu is on the pricier side but the portions are substantial and the food is always great. I also recommend the margarita (either plain or spicy-both are great).

From the flavors to the ambiance and service, La Nonna was an experience to be had many times over. Put simply, the food wad phenomenal with portions that guarantee you will not leave hungry! Try it and prepare for your palate to thank you.

This place is amazing! The dim light gives a cozy romantic vibe with candles lit on all the tables. They had happy hour drinks I had a margarita which was really good. The calamari was amazing!!!! My brothers mother in law ordered eggplant parmigiana I had ordered chicken parmesan with linguine, I feel it could've been more tasty if it had more flavor to it. It wasn't bad but ok could use more seasoning I will say it was very cheesy which I loved. I will go back to this restaurant but I'll order sacchetti Al peperoncino because it was amazing as well. Also the complimentary bread comes with a tasty sauce which is a sweet but with a hint of spice in the sauce which is amazing to dip the bread in. Overall the staff is friendly.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Love this place! Go for the food but stay for the drinks! The drinks are really good and pair well with the Italian classics at this place! The drinks are some of the best I've had in nyc! The atmosphere and ambiance makes this place a great date spot or dinner with friends spot. You also feel welcomed to sit alone at the bar and grab a drink and dinner from the bartender! Very welcoming and cozy place overall
No comment

The food is exceptionally bad. There are so many better options in the neighborhood. We ordered the eggplant, and it was nearly inedible and sent it back. We felt terrible doing so, and told the server we'd be more than happy to still pay for it, and they gladly accepted the offer with no desire to rectify the situation or offer alternatives.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Lovely ambiance, delicious food & huge portions, great service, and right off the river near the ferry stop.  As a bonus they have lots of gluten free options, and even a vegan bolognese dish, so a GF + vegan option that was fabulous.  Such a charming find.  Loved it!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Lovely ambience, very tasty Italian cuisine not to mention very affordable. Ideal place to take a date or a special event.

I came to try this pizza place after my boyfriend discovered it and raved on about how good it was! Otherwise I never would have bothered even going inside. The place had me at krispy Krust - they delivered what they promised! The moment I had my first bite, I knew this spot was the real deal. The pizza was so crunchy that you could hear every bite from across the restaurant! It was thin crust, my favorite type of pizza. I absolutely loved the sausage pepperoni since it's a classic. The chicken bacon ranch was also good, but is on the heavier side. I will have to come back again next time to try their margarita slice! Excellent spot right by the pier in Williamsburg.

This restaurant completely ruined my birthday. It was the worst service I'd ever experienced in my 32 years in NYC. The waiter who was rude when he took our order and then forgot to bring our order to the kitchen so we waited 2 hours for our food. By the time it came we were so upset and tired and angry that it wasn't even enjoyable. We had to even beg for our wine which finally came to us 40 mins after we ordered it. The meal was comped but I cried because it made my special day really depressing. The waiter needs to be fired immediately. Do not recommend and will never be back.
No comment
No comment
great service so kind. Amazing food i loved my experience here and the staff was so kind hearted.
No comment
No comment
Amazing food & amazing service. Best Italian food I've ever had!! Was at La Nonna for a work dinner and enjoyed every single bite of our meal!

Went here on a Friday evening with outdoor reservations. To start we ordered the scallops and fried calamari. Scallops were pretty good and cooked perfectly, beautifully plated. Calamari was also tasty but nothing out of the ordinary. For our entrees we got the rib eye steak and sacchetti al peperoncino. Both were pretty good and large enough that we took our leftovers home. Service was a bit slow but it really got bad at the end, after we finished our meal it took us almost 40 mins to get our waiters attention. At that point we didn't have time for dessert and just had to get the check. Overall a good experience but service could be improved.
Came here for our birthday last year; yeah it might have to be a tradition food was great experience was great would definitely come back !
No comment
No comment

First time here and it was great! The food was great! Everything tasted amazing ! The drink of choice was great(can't remember the name of it). Our waiter provided great friendly service also . And the desserts and cappuccino finish of the meal perfectly. When we were finish we took a walk on the north pier which is a few mins walking and the view of the city was amazing .

Perfect spot for date night, we went for Valentine's Day and the ambience was even better than I imagined. The service was all around kinda weird... which could have just been because it was Valentine's Day? But we seldom saw our server. And apps/bread were whisked off the table before we had a chance to say anything. Just some silly little moments. BUT! All of that evens out by how excellent the food is and how perfect the atmosphere is. Great options for vegetarians (the eggplant parm was exactly what I had hoped for) and the drinks are not outrageously expensive. I would definitely recommend :-)

I ordered the Fettuccine Verdi Tartufate to go and it was delicious. It was something different from the classic pastas. I wish they would have given me softer pieces of bread but overall enjoyed the meal.
worst "italian " food i've ever had in my life. the penne ala vodka was watery and had 3 tiny pieces of bacon in it

Stopped by here for lunch last month. Really liked the upscale decor on the inside. We ordered a little bit of everything and it was all pretty good. Not amazing but still above average.  The paid parking at the garage down the street is the chef's kiss. Would definitely come back here.

Came to La Nonna with some family after nearby SeaWolf was closed for a wedding. I am SO GLAD we found this place. They had a reservation available online, and we arrived about 5 minutes early. The hostess got us seated, and we loved the outdoor patio. We started with some cocktails and a bottle of rose, which was a great way to ease into the meal. As far as appetizers, I ordered the burrata cheese for the table, which came with the burrata, roasted tomatoes, gaeta olives, and balsamic pearls with some bread. Very good stuff. My entree was the tortelloni al Pollo which tasted fresh and came with very tender chicken. Sometimes cream-based pastas can feel like an adult mac and cheese, but I can promise you this one many many cuts above. Service was a bit slow at first but it leveled out. They were busy and there is a labor shortage, so I won't subtract any stars for that. I can't wait to come back next time I'm in Brooklyn!
Loved the Caesar salad. Good customer service. Great atmosphere.

Visited for a birthday dinner. The staff were efficient and friendly. We ordered Gamberi alla Fiorentina, Frittura di Calamari and Gamberi al Limoncello for starters. For entrees we enjoyed Gnocchi & Vitello Tartufato. Everything was delicious!

Had a reservation for two on a Saturday night. We were starving. I knew I'd fill up on the complimentary bread as I was eating it (I added olive oil to it, it was delish). By the time my ENORMOUS pizza came I could only eat one slice! The rest was taken home and enjoyed the next day. Blood orange marg was very very very good. I had two! My husband said the filet was 5/5. I'm giving a solid 5 stars for the service. My husband had a coke in a glass and when he picked up the glass the bottom of the glass fell off (like, it just fell off, he didn't bump it or anything lol honestly kind of funny) and Coke went all over the table. So many waiters came over to help clean it up immediately and replace the drink. Really appreciated their service! Super friendly too. Bathroom was clean (but stall is teensy tiny). We are never in this neighborhood but I would recommend this place to anyone if they asked for a great spot in Williamsburg with a nice view of the city right around the corner.

A girlfriend and I ordered La Nonna on a whim while craving pasta. I walk past the restaurant all the time but have never had it until tonight. It was so damn good. I got the Rigatoni Ripieni Cacio E Pepe and my friend got the Cavatelli Bolognese. Both were really great. Also split the Carciofi Salad. Delicious!

I was taken on a date here. It was a Tuesday night, not that busy. He made the reservation. We were sat in a corner in the back and it seemed as if the staff forgot about us. We sat and waited about 45 minutes to order and the food took almost the same amount of time. I'm not a local here but this took way too long  and by the time my food came, I lost my appetite. Maybe seat your customers where you can see them? Also the food wasn't that great to me.
No comment

This reservation started at 8 and ended at 10:30. This was not by design or because we were being leisurely. Yes we were a big party but we had reservations so they in theory should have been prepared. We had a variety of plates on the table that ranged from okay to good. I ordered the chicken parm with vodka sauce which I was excited about but it fell incredibly short. To be honest, NY is full of amazing Italian restaurants and this one just isn't it. I wouldn't recommend or return and to be Frank am being generous with a 3 star review.
I've always been tempted by their pasta and it did not disappoint! Unlike any other pasta I've had in NYC, truly. Pizza was so so but their main spicy pasta dish blew me away.
Great spot to go with a group of friends or on a date. The food is good with fair prices while the menu has a little bit of something for everyone.

Beautiful restaurant and amazing food! The decor is to die for. Went for my husbands birthday and they food and drinks were beyond amazing! My 2 year old loved the food as well. After you get to walk by the water! Great place for celebrations!
No comment
No comment

Been coming here for years, place is always great. Food is delicious, cocktails are on point and I have to say for the price point great bang for your buck. Advise getting a reservation because the place is always busy.

We tried this place for the first time via Uber Eats and it was delicious! Chicken parm with penne, cacio  e pepe, Caesar salad, and tiramisu - everything was super tasty! We can't wait to come in to the physical restaurant next time.
No comment

I enjoy the food here a lot but the in dining service is absolutely horrible. The staff is rude and not helpful. They took forever to bring out our food and we could not get anyones attention for 30 minutes and when I mentioned this they had an attitude. I will still do take out from here but would not dine in person in an establishment that doesn't know how to interact with customers.

Our favorite place to get Italian in Brooklyn. The place is very classy inside and the service is amazing! Employees are very friendly and hard working. The food is delicious and authentic. I would definitely recommend trying this place. You won't regret it.

Okay... I been coming here for Italian for like 4 years now. This place never misses the target when it comes to their entrees! Always ask for their specials since it is limited time only! But the ambience and atmosphere is amazing, for date night and a family outing! they add a sparkler candle when u say its your birthday, or anyones bday, (just hint hint) so this place is awesome, I will still explore more from them, keep posted for a new review this summer!

Great ambiance and attentive service but I was underwhelmed by the food and surprisingly I only thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary focaccia with the tomato sauce and olive oil. I would try again but I wasn't impressed with my initial visit.
Excellent decor, service and food. Classic Italian taken to a higher level. Prices are fabulous for Williamsburg. Can't wait to go again.
No comment
Service was excellent. The food was delicious and you can go for a walk by the piers after you eat!

Soooo good! First off, the bread they serve with some type of spicy/sweet marinara sauce was DELICIOUS. My friends and I were obsessed and asked for extra to dip our fried calamari in as well. Calamari was good, could use a little more flavor but was perfectly crispy, not too chewy. The red sangria was amazing, I would definitely recommend if you want something light and refreshing. I had the the Sachetti pasta very delicious! The server described it as spicy but it really wasn't that spicy at all. The sausage has a kick and there's a few peppers but not too many. Great meal at a great price. I would definitely come back again.
Don't go here. The hostess that looks like a fake Hilary Clinton only offered us seats outside when there were tables opened indoors. Happy covid
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friend and I came here a week after indoor dining reopened. The ambiance and food are really good but the waitstaff had us waiting a long time for service. They were quite crowded but didn't have enough wait staff to tend to everyone. The drinks are really good and they give a healthy portion of all their dishes.

Amazing food and amazing atmosphere. love the area as well, super nice in Williamsburg. Our server was friendly and respectful. i came here last Saturday with my girlfriends to celebrate my birthday. we all loved our dishes. lots of great italian dishes served here. we got a pitcher of the white sangria and it was so good. the bartender came over to our table because our waiter was busy and gave us a free White sangria pitcher as well. and one of my friends inspired a cocktail that he made just for her which was entertaining to have it all happen haha. great music choices and friendly hostess. i'd come here again! perfect for girls night out, date night, family dinners, etc. dress code was mostly casual.

Very nice, came here on a date food was amazing was recommended the burgers from a friend they were amazing, staff is amazing, our waitress Gabriella was so helpful and sweet. Definitely would come back
That's a nice fuckin slice of pizza! The dudes in here are nice as hell. I got one cheese slice fresh out of the oven. Nice nice nice!!

Beautiful inside decor with warm welcoming presence. Took advantage of the bottomless brunch and we were not disappointed. The Bellini and Mimosa drinks were very delicious. I ordered the steak and eggs which includes a side of fries and my partner ordered the truffle burger. Both dishes were fine and good. The staff was very attentive and followed all covid indoor dining procedures. Overall, I would love to visit again and try their Italian dishes!
Perfect for date night! The interior is beautiful with high ceilings and warm lighting. The Yelp pictures don't do it justice. The food was amazing. The server was very attentive.

The food here is really good (although not the best Italian I've ever had or even top 5), and it's a great vibe and location. It's a nice spot for a fun night out, and even their to go food is great. It's a good go-to spot if you live in the area.
No comment
No comment

This spot was a last minute find. We booked through open table 30 minutes before arriving. We received a call confirming our arrival 3 minutes before the time we booked( we were walking in as she called) we were seated immediately. Our waiter, Juan Carlos, was absolutely phenomenal. He was pleasant, soft spoken and attentive. He provided great recommendations for our appetizer and entrèe, refilled out wine glasses and was overall great. The food was absolutely delicious! ( Get the apple tart for dessert) great experience and highly recommend.

Came here for a date night dinner and it was amazing. I absolutely loved the food. It was well cooked, warm, fresh, truly the best. We ordered a bottle of wine and two entrees and the bill came out to around $112 more or less. We made reservations and our table was ready as soon as we arrived which was great. The waiters were attentive to our needs and constantly asked if we were okay. This was my first time coming here and it definitely won't be my last. The restrooms were spotless clean which I appreciated. Excellent organization as a restaurant, especially during the Covid outdoor dining situation. Thank you for a great experience !!
Excellent leisurely meal! Sat in the outdoor area which was nice, spacious, and dog-friendly. Overall, highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
What a GEM this place!!! A must go when your in Williamsburg,or anytime for that matter...

Tonight we had dinner at "La Nonna". From the moment we walked we were greeted by the hostess and we asked to be seated at the window and she did just that. She was very pleasant! Next, our server, Alessandro gave us stellar service. He made suggestions for our drinks, appetizers and entree. He made us feel so welcomed. We dined at another restaurant prior to coming here, (Queensyard at Hudson Yards)  It was a terrible experience and we left before we could even order. Terrible customer service from the hostess to the server. But La Nonna turned our whole night around. I recommend everyone give this place a try, you won't regret it!
No comment
Consistently a good meal, both in person and for takeout. Came here for dinner with a group once and everyone left happy. Definitely recommend.

Loved the whole experience eating here- good wine, great food, and a friendly, attentive staff. LOVED the warm focaccia with a sweet, sun-dried tomato dipping sauce they served us before our meal. Would love to go back!!
No comment

I came here for a celebratory dinner and had a wonderful experience! From the food to the service, everything was top notch. The sachetti were like little pockets of love in a flavorful sauce. My boyfriend had a surprise arranged in advance - the staff brought out a dessert with "congrats" written on the plate which is a great touch. My one knock is that the calamari was pretty bland and flavorless. I would choose a different option next time, but I'll overlook it because everything else was so great.
No comment
No comment
Unbelievable family dinner experience with an old school Italian restaurant vibe! Had the most delicious lamb, pizza, salad, pasta! Will most definitely be back.
No comment
No comment

Because of the restaurant "The Smith" I always want to try everyone squid ink pasta now. This one was good. Not great, but good. Was a tad bit on the salty side and personally I HATE heavy salted food so that was a turn off but overall, it's cool. I'll try them again and order something else (Ubereats)
No comment
No comment
Couldnt leave review on Uber Eats. Sacchetti Peperoncino & Pete Salad are out of this world. One of the best meals I've had in a long time. Nice job
No comment

Love this place! Amazing drinks (deff go during happy hour) and the food is so fresh and flavorful! Our server was attentive and kind. Hospitality, food and drinks are all 5 star! What else can you ask for?

Not at all impressed with our meal here. Salads were fairly basic and over dressed.  The veal dishes we ordered lacked any depth of flavor and the meat was quite chewy.  Also be careful about making any substitutions. When I asked to switch out the mashed potatoes for the pasta that came with certain other dishes, I was told no problem and received a small portion of linguine on my plate. Surprisingly the bill showed an up charge of $4 without the waiter ever mentioning anything. Not a good business practice in my opinion.  Won't be coming back.
Very hood service very good good. That green pasta and chicken Marsala... do it! Hood combo together.
Service is very very slow, but good is very very good. Order the steak! It's delicious. They do need to work on their service though..... waited 20 minutes for water
Food was excellent, service was prompt. Price was extremely reasonable . Highly recommend

3.5. Fine-Good service...old school ambience....solid food and martinis. Not too pricey//lovely if you're in the immediate neighborhood but I wouldn't go out of my way. Limitless spots for Italian all over the vastness that is Williamsburg that are worth a visit
Don't order the baked clams. What a joke, 7 littleneck clams for $14

I've ordered delivery and been to the restaurant and both times the pasta was incredible. The best carbonara I've ever had. Decent lasagna but my favorite pasta of all time is the cavatelli bolognese. I tell everyone I know to go here because the pasta was so memorable for me. I have yet to try their other dishes though. Oh and the tiramisu was very good too.

Deliciousness. Everything that passed by carried by the waiters had my head spinning.  It all looked and smelled so good. We started with this giant stuffed meatball. We also had a shrimp special that was wrapped in speck and a pineapple glaze. So delicious. For the main course I had the osso bucco that was served over risotto and my date had the lobster ravioli with shrimp & crabmeat sauce that was delicious. I wish I had room for dessert, but I couldn't do it. I will be back! The wait staff was very good and the Decor was warm and comfortable.
No comment
I love this place the food is always great. The food is consistently on point. If your in Williamsburg you must come here.

The seafood pasta was absolutely disgusting. The pasta was way undercooked and the seafood tasted stale and over cooked. It literally tasted like they cooked the seafood days ago then popped it in the microwave and left it in for too long. It just tasted like literal rubber. This place clearly doesn't care about the quality of their food. I'm not super picky but it's clear that they put ZERO effort into this food. I wonder if they taste the things they serve. If they did I'm sure the whole kitchen staff would quit. Wanted to like this place but it was shocking how bad it was...

Great outdoor enclosed seating area with heated lamps. Reservations recommended don't forget they close at 10pm due to Covid-19 restrictions. Otherwise great food and staff! Great spot for a date night or g2g.

La Nonna is hands down the best Italian restaurant in the Williamsburg area. If you are looking for authentic real Italian food - this is the place for you. The staff is amazing and very professional - and the ambiance is nice too. This is a regular date night spot for me and my boyfriend and we always will bring friends to this restaurant as well - as we know we can count on the quality of service and you literally can't go wrong with anything that you order on the menu - the food is all so amazing!!

Came here for a double date and the food was to die for. The atmosphere was romantic. The outdoor seating was plenty and on Saturday night the restaurant was very busy but the service was immaculate. Every table gets complimentary bread and a garlicy tomato sauce for dipping. The cocktails were so yummy we each had two before our dinner even arrived. I'd recommend the fettuccine Verdi tartufate if you love truffle.

Ate at this restaurant tonight. So glad they are open and serving again with some seating inside and heated tents outside. I've given this restaurant a five star review in the past and I'm happy to say they haven't lost a step. The service is impeccable, the food is fantastic and the owners are friendly. I'm never disappointed in anything I order from here. All the meals on the menu are delicious. This chef is truly talented and I consider him an artist. The flavor profiles he puts together are simply amazing. This is definitely my favorite restaurant.
No comment
No comment

I went here yesterday to celebrate Father's Day expecting  exceptional service unfortunately I had to wait over an hour for my meal.I understand it was busy but this is not the kind of service I am accustom to receiving.The fact I had to wait this long I really did not enjoy my meal.The braised short ribs was good but I just loss my appetite.
No comment
No comment

I was a fan of the La Nonna pizzeria restaurant. This one wasn't as amazing as the person who recommended place made it out to be. The food was just OK for me. The bread was a bit stale and the pasta a bit on the salty side. But our waiter was attentive and friendly and everyone was following COVID protocol for the most part. The menu is made available by using the scanner at the table to limit touching.

Lovely restaurant . You feel very welcome when you walk in. Beautifully decorated with a great bar. Bartenders were great and drinks delicious . Menu is really nice with a lot of great options . We were very happy with our appetizers, main course and desserts . Only negative was the service . The waiter was very lacking . We had to ask for bread twice, my husband had to ask for another drink twice and when we asked for more coffee we never got it. It was busy but not crazy busy , he needed to be more attentive to our table . Will go back but hopefully will not get the same waiter.

This place was beautiful, the service was timely, and the food was super tasty! I'm not a fan of pasta, but I was convinced to give it a shot here... it wasn't bad at all... but my favorite were the cannolis!

A few years ago I would have given la nonna a 4 or 5. This is more like a 2.5 but even numbers are what I've got to work with. We have ordered from here so many times since moving to the building next door and the food has gone SO far downhill. The last time I was there I spent over $100 and could have had a better dinner from the grocery store. I was super embarrassed that my friends were in Brooklyn and that's where we got food. They always get the orders wrong over the phone, things are always missing in delivery and the food has just tasted weird lately. My recent eggplant parm has eggplant that wasn't cooked at all... it was super hard. I hate that we can't order from our old "go to" anymore but there are just way better places in the area.

They never delivered my food and when I called they said it was coming then it didn't. Then grub hub called and they didn't even answer the second time. I waited 2 hours and it never came!!! For $22 an entre I want them to bring it lol

excellent italian food and ambiance. Everyone had a ball and shared dishes. It was delicious and will definitely be going back!
No comment

Very nice place and service was on point. The complete order was great. Very clean. The only thing you must pay cash I don't understand with a nice fancy place they have a credit card service.
No comment
Great meal here. Had the chicken parm with spaghetti and also the bolognese. Both were delicious. The service was friendly, and fast. The setting was nice. We enjoyed the whole meal.
No comment

I usually never write Yelp reviews but was very frustrated by this experience. We spent about 1000 dollars at La Nonna. The food itself was good but not sure if it was good value in terms of portions for the appetizers. What was upsetting was there was a lot of different tricks to upcharge us despite us already spending a lot of money per person. For example, they ask do you want still or sparkling water? We said still and they added on a $9 bottle of still water when usually you would just assume there would be free tap water. In addition, 20% tip was already pre-added to the bill and they did not mention this. So we ended up tipping an extra 18% on top of the original bill. Overall almost 400 dollars of tips for what should have been a 600 dollar meal. What's insane is that they failed to mention how we overlooked this. Was a good meal if you are super on your toes about not being upcharged, but really left a bad taste in our mouths based on sneaky practices. We will not be back.
No comment

I've been here a few times, the food is always amazing. I call, or setup a reservation,  just in case. The staff is really top notch. The skirt steak for the table looks to die for. Eggplant towers, Calamari, the table bread, with basil, tomato sweet, lil kick of spice sauce is killa! Come here hungry, be ready to eat, the desserts and a cappuccino to end it are a must. Don't dare leave without it... Atmosphere is upper casual, to dressy. Omg, almost forgot the Penne Alla Vodka sauce with bacon is too melt in your mouth... Looking for great for, HERE, HERE, GO NO FURTHER!

Back a year later and I'm putting the star I took off back on to give La Nonna 5 stars. I still say the portions aren't big enough, I'm a guy who likes to eat, so I order a pasta as an app and then get an entree. Tonight I had the stuffed pasta with veal for my app and veal scallopini with truffle cream sauce as my entree. The veal was so so tender you can cut it with a fork and the truffle sauce was absolutely to die for. I loved it.

The place and the food are amazing but they're lacking on the service, they took 20 minutes to bring water to the table and even tho they have a good and extend wine list, the server couldn't even open the bottle properly, that's why I'm giving this place a 3 star rating
No comment

The restaurant is beautiful and in a great location. Food is ok. It wasn't special but good. The ravioli repieni, fried ravioli stuffed with Filet Mignon was pretty good. I would have liked it if the truffle sauce was just a drizzle. It was a little too much sauce and overwhemled the ravioli. The baby Kale salad was extremely fresh. The Kale seemed like it was plucked from a garden to the table. The salmon entrees were good but didn't wow. They could've used a little.more seasoning. It was on the bland side.  Service was very friendly and attentive.

Yesterday I went to this restaurant with some friends. It wasn't a busy night, and somehow we waited longer than usual for service. However, the bread they give for starters paired with the chickpea spread is outstanding. The bread tastes fresh and is warm, and the spread had a nice flavor. I ordered the black squid ink linguini with seafood (saying seafood because I don't remember the specifics) and it tasted amazing. Everyone at my table was satisfied with their order so that's always a good thing to say. The restaurant also is very nice and has outdoor seating.
No comment
This review is only for take out.  Good food but the order came almost an hour late.  Worth going to in person but not recommended for delivery.

I've been to La Nonna 3 times and I've always had a positive experience.  The food is fantastic and the service is good.  During my last visit, my party of 4 shared the octopus and scallops appetizers, which were cooked perfectly.  I had the osso buco for my main course and it melted in my mouth.  Will be back again when in Williamsburg.

La Nonna is my favorite Italian restaurant in Williamsburg. A sophisticated take on Italian classics, the ambiance is relaxed and inviting and the decor is gorgeous. We tried the Kobe meatball, it was extremely filling but also so full of flavor. For my entree I got the baked gnocchi bolognese, and it was delicious. Dying to try so much more on their menu!

Chose to celebrate my moms birthday here and it was beyond amazing. The atmosphere, the service, the food  even the music was set to create a mellow and relaxing setting. We had the veal piccata and the chicken Marsala; I do recommend. My mom had the ravioli Ripieni di carne and she loved it; my highlights of the evening would have to be the complimentary bread and Marinara sauce that comes along with it also the desert; the pistachio crime brûlée . My waiter Alex was professional attentive and went the extra mile to get my mom a special birthday dessert. Will surely be returning...soon

So sad that my chicken parm was not edible...  due to the fact of being deep fried twice if not more  it became the texture of rubber and chewy fat.   (Chicken was gray ,shinny and the bead was all falling off ) The pasta was ok but a bit sticky. The sauce was mind blowing . The chicken I threw out and ate the remaining part of my meal . I feel  sick as heck after wards .  Literally threw up in my mouth about a hour later . I wasn't going to  even do a review but now since  they failed to refund my money like I was promised .  Leaving this review for all  and the owner ..   note.  The lady who answered and offered to replace my meal or a full refund  told me you deep fry the chicken lol and that Uber eats wouldn't let  the restaurant refund me on there side of the app. I've written Uber and hope I get my  money back because you food made me sick .  Chicken parm is the most basic Italian food to make . How the heck did this get so rancid and poorly cooked ?

The ambiance in here is awesome! Very elegant and clean. The servers are extremely professional and kind. The food is amazing!! Everything was delicious from the salad to the dessert! Would definately reccomend for an intimate dinner or group dining as well.
Love this place! Fresh authentic Italian food with a fine dining atmosphere. Love the modern twists on some of these dishes especially the wagyu meatball! So delicious!

My belated Father's Day dinner: Gnocchi of the Day ( of beets in cream sauce). Like my tongue threw a party for my mouth!

Great atmosphere for a birthday dinner. Drink menu is available to view on an iPad with a hefty selection of wines and cocktails, our group chose the red sangria which came at great portions for the price. The bread for the table was a nice way to begin our meal and all of the dishes that my group had were delicious. A list of about 10 specials for dinner with something for everyone!
No comment

Recommended by friend. The restaurant has a very nice vibe, bartender (Tressa) was very friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. She recommended me the Fusili Pescatora. Very delightful. Perfect for this spring weather. Not heavy and very balanced. Would definitely recommend this place. Another thing bathroom was very clean which is a plus for me. Staff are very friendly and on point. Great place to host big parties.
We ordered food for pick up this evening and the order wasn't ready for 40 minutes after the confirmed time. There was no apology and the clam linguine was incredibly salty.

This place is yummy, the ambiance is nice inside feels like a more upscale restaurant but with good prices. We love the chicken PARM dish it's phenomenal
No comment

La Nonna was a cool place the servers was really attentive! The reason I came here was for a bday dinner with close friends! We had a pre fix menu so I had limited choices but from the choices everything was great..... it was a lil on the expensive side but hey you pay for the experience too. I didn't give the place 5 stars cause my entree dish the chicken pre fix was small!! And very thin and a lil rubbery for my taste but other than that if u want to impress a girl and some good Italian food this is the place to go!

La Nonna is a decent Italian restaurant located by the East River in Williamsburg. The wait staff are all very attentive and really understand their menu. When asked for suggestions or trying to navigate the menu, they are always on their game. The food itself is good, but I've never had anything that's completely blown me away. Everything is mediocre and pretty main stream. The ambiance of the restaurant is nice and there is outdoor seating during the warmer months. That being said, if you're looking for amazing Italian food, there are much better places in Williamsburg.

I had a great lunch with my friend this Week     Very taste seared scallops with risotto black ink nice margherita spicy  great bar man ..... efficient service and prompt  and net not tacky or fake ....  will definitely  be back if I'm at Brooklyn thanks Nonna staff ... simple tasty food

Great spot in Williamsburg for all types of dinning. Whether it's date night, a family gathering, or brunch, La Nonna is the spot. Super cute decor! They have outdoor seating in the warmer weather as well. The portions here are very generous and the food is delightful. The staff is super courteous and friendly too! If you need a phone charger, they will let you charge at the hostess stand. There's a parking garage around the corner on N 5th and you can walk around the waters edge on the board walk. Great views of NYC. Highly recommend!

One of the best Italian restaurants in New York City! Their Margaheritia pizza is the best I have ever tasted! One of my favorite places ever and service is always great. Waiters are very helpful and give good advice. I definitely recommend going to La Nonna Ristorante & Bar!
No comment
No comment

I've had Italian food in my life plenty of times but nothing and no one adds up to this wonderful,delightful and tasteful food that La Nonna provides. The steak and sea food down to the sauce for the bread provided for appetizers is amazing. The environment is so pleasant and peaceful it's amazing. The music is calming and the staff is great. They're there when you need them. This is my first time here and I promise it's not my last. The calamari and oysters are to die for!!!!!

Recommended by a friend, and they did not disappoint!  Likely the best dinner I have ever had, Cono is a absolute food artist and his creations are second to none!  This will be a stop every time I'm in NYC!

My amazing bf took here to celebrate my birthday and from soup to nuts it was fantastic. The dipping sauce for the bread was seasoned to perfection the bread was soft warm and fresh. The drinks were incredible -- premium liquor and ingredients! The appetizers and entrees were excellent. The customer service was world class! This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Brooklyn!

This place is bomb! Alex treats me like family and the food is always top notch. They always have amazing specials whenever you go. Great for a large dinner, intimate date night, of a casual wine and App night At the bar.

We took our mother for her 79th birthday and I was so impressed. The environment is so soothing, we never felt rushed to leave.  Our waiter Edwin was wonderful and so accommodating. The food was amazing, the drinks perfection and the deserts heavenly.  We will definitely return.  La Nonna, keep doing what you are doing this is a gold mine. Much success.

Food is delicious here. It is a little expensive but was worth it for a special celebration. Baked clams appetizer was delicious although I was a little disappointed that the clams were so small - about the size of a quarter. Entrees ordered by us averaged $25 and appetizers were half that. Sangria was nicely flavored and welcomed on a very hot day. Service was attentive and bread was warm and refilled.

Highly Recommend this establishment! The place is absolutely stunning and the food is delicious! I came here for Sunday brunch and I have no complaints. Servers were very polite and attentive. Portions are very filling and you may order from their regular menu as well.

No comment

This place is absolutely outstanding! Me and my husband decided to have nice romantic dinner for two on a Saturday night, and that's exactly what we got! Service was amazing! From the hostess that greets you with a warm smile to all the staff on the floor. We waited for our table for a couple of minutes and the hostess suggested we have a seat at the bar! had a couple drinks there!!We had a super sweet attentive server, I believe her name was Catarina( i am not 100%sure) the food out of this world! You can definitely tell how much pride and work they put in running this restaurant! Great job La Nonna!

Great restaurant the staff is amazing the food is amazing everything is amazing. This is real fine Italian dining at its best. Highly recommend this place.

I've been here many times with family, friends and my ex too and even at their old location. The pasta and the pizza is great. My friend who's a vegetarian had good options to choose from. The wine is good too. I highly recommend it.

Had a business dinner at La Nonna, we had a number of dishes. Appetizers were fried calamari and a Mozzarella $ Pruiscutto special (fried) both apps were good, not great, but fresh, the calamari only had rings, which normally isn't the case in higher end restaurants, but either way it tasted fresh and wasn't chewy. A few of us ordered the pasta pescatore, was nicely flavored, the tomato sauce was a nice compliment to the seafood, but not a lot of seafood, was expecting more for price. My colleague ordered a risotto with salmon and didn't enjoy it much, the salmon was cut into scallop size pieces, very weird?? All in all a decent meal, but not great. I would give 3.5, but since yelp only allows full stars, I'll give them the benefit of doubt of 4 because the service was good.

My first review here likened this place to Olive Garden which after repeat visits I admit was only partly true. In fact they serve a lot of good classic old school red sauce Italians solidly and with pleasant service at reasonable prices.
No comment

The ambiance set the tone for one romantic evening. Very authentic Italian fine dining. Located in In one of Brooklyn's premier neighborhoods. Williamsburg. We didn't have reservations, unbeknownst to us lol. But the hostess was kind enough to find us a table. What can i say..... Great evening.

Classy, clean and VERY welcoming. I've eaten there 5 times already and enjoyed each & every meal. Love how their pasta meals range from Northern Italy all the way down to delectable Mediterranean dishes! Yum! This place shall NOT disappoint. Casual, but NICE clothing apparel, a must. Shoes & your top should not be 'street-like'. Very charming atmosphere. Place is always bustling, which means patrons LOVE it there! 2 thumbs up (and 5 starts), for certain!

Just finished a wonderful meal at La Nonna.  We were driving my son back to Williamsburg after celebrating Easter with our family in NJ on Saturday.  We had made reservations for 2pm on Easter Sunday for the three of us  and when we arrived we were promptly seated in a lovely outside area that we had requested on our reservation.  The food was truthfully amazing!!! The presentation of all of the food was beautiful, and the flavors of each dish were like little explosions of heaven on your taste buds.  The wait staff was attentive and appropriately engaging and the meal from appetizer and drinks to dessert and coffee was well paced and the three of us were comfortably ready to leave in 90 minutes feeling extremely satisfied with our first ever Easter dinner in a restaurant.  While we didn't sit inside, it was a beautiful setting and clearly set up for social distancing.   As an Italian-American myself, I can tell you that this is a must go to Italian restaurant.  It took the traditional cuisine to the next level and we will most definitely be back there to dine again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great atmosphere, great food and lovely staff.
No comment
Amazing old school yet modern Italian restaurant. Food is lovely and so is the service. It makes for a great date night. Hard to find Italian restaurants like this anymore.

I really wanted to rate this place higher since it's located in a chic neighborhood and had nice decor with good music playing in the background. The reason for my two rating is because when my chicken parm order came out, there was a hair on my plate right next to the food. When I pointed out the hair to the server, the first thing that was asked was if I wanted another plate?!?! Seriously? I found that to be a very odd question since it was a hair that definitely wasn't my hair since I just got the food. Then when the server brought it to the waiter's attention, the waiter stopped by and said it looked like an eyelash (gross!). Of course, I asked for a brand new plate, which took a few minutes longer to get. However when the new dish came, the penne wasn't warm enough. I honestly wasn't impressed with the level of service nor the fact that I wasn't offered anything else to offset the inconvenience or the hair near the food either. The food was okay but it's definitely not on my top places to visit again - sorry.
No comment

La Nonna is by far one of the top Italian restaurants in all of NY. Once you walk into this gem, you will notice the high ceilings and amazing decor. You will be greeted by the kindest people in the service industry. The hostess and wait staff are beyond phenomenal - I can't talk any more highly about them - they're simply the best of the best. Alex and Hans have been my servers the numerous times I've dined at this fine establishment. Now, what can I say about the food other then you will absolutely have your pallette dazzled. From starters to dessert and everything in between - AMAZING. I am so pleased and beyond satisfied every time I eat here. Some of my suggestions for starters: Polpettone di Carne & Burrata Deliziosa. For your main course: Pollo Maltese & Grigliata Mista. And, you can't go wrong with any of their desserts! One thing I would like to mention, listen to their specials! Their specials are beyond amazing and I highly recommend ordering one if it's your first time here. Also, their wine menu is amazing. If you're not familiar with wine, ask for a suggestion and they will definitely lead you down the right path. With all of that said, I highly recommend La Nonna!
No comment

Last night was my 34th birthday. We went here because of all of the great feedback we get from friends around the neighborhood. Unfortunately, they didn't prep the table, we didn't have any flatware or proper dinnerware at the table, the staff was sub par, and our server decided to leave half way through service without a word. The drinks were great but my food was ok at best. I lived in Rome for a while so I feel that I know how Italian food should be. That being said, a plate of green fettuccini soaked in truffle oil has never been something I had overseas. It was advertised as a wild mushroom fettuccini but it was really over cooked pasta in a fake truffle sauce. Mushrooms were barely recognizable. I would not recommend and I am sorry I wasted my birthday outing here.

The food, the ambiance, and the service speak for itself. The chef uses nothing but the finest of ingredients into every single dish brought out and the staff serve it with such grace. At la nonna, you can taste why it deserves all 5 stars.
No comment

This place is beautiful. Expensive but honestly the food is amazing!! The serve you nice soft flavorful bread with tomato sauce which I want right now. The sauce was a little sweet for some I guess but I thought it was so satisfying. As far as the salad...I got the pear salad and I scrapped the plate. We also ordered burrata caprese and it did not disappoint. Our mains we're gnocchi of the day and I got a mushroom pasta dish. I couldn't finish either between us bc I filled up on bread but wonderful.our waiter was awesome and was tackling a 30 person party with 2 other waiters and he was with other tables but he was so on point for almost the whole time. In the end we waited for the check for about 45 minutes bc at some point they disappeared. The place really is a gem. Even the hostess who had a name I hadn't heard before was very kind.  Definitely recommend

First time visiting. Place is so comfortable, nice ambience, tables not too close. Decorated nicely and cute bar. The service was fantastic. Thanks to Alex and the rest of the guys for making a quiet birthday dinner special. Will be going back for sure!

Lovely large venue with cloth napkins but no tablecloths.  Very good and very friendly service.  The food was good, but not exceptional nor memorable.  Pizza margarita had a very fresh tasty topping.  The biggest problem was the cracker like crust which wasn't able to hold up to being over-sauced.  The baked clams were ok, but should have been made with olive oil rather than butter that overwhelmed the clams.  The pasta was perfectly cooked and delicious.  It came with a broccoli rabe pesto and crumbled sausage.  Unfortunately, there was little broccoli rabe taste or texture, and the crumbled sauce was lacking in flavor and texture and lost in the sauce.  The tortellini special was over-sauced and too rich for the delicate pasta. The wine prices are very fair and the montepulciano I ordered was very good.

Great for large parties. Friendly staff. Well sized apps and mains. Only complaint I have is the place is in the dark side. We ordered a series of apps and pastas and everything was tasty. Would def consider coming back with a big group as this place is more spacious and seating is more comfortable.
No comment
Great food, authentic, Clams Linguini Vongola too delicious!

This place is beautiful but the service sucked in the food was the worst food I've ever had in my life the chef should definitely go back and talk to the grandmother to figure how to cook some real Italian food. He tried to pull a empanada off as a fried ravioli. The octopus was overdone it felt like it was saturated and vinegar. The bartender was dumb as a brick she didn't know shit about shine Nola. She didn't even know today's special the bitch passed me a written menu that she wrote Down her self.

No comment
The best Italian food I have had in a very very long time . There isn't one thing that's good .. every thing is good! The cocktails are amazing! The service is top notch! The restaurant is beautiful!
Authentic Italian cuisine! My boyfriend and I had a nice romantic evening here with delicious food. Can't wait to go back.

Okay food, but really overpriced for pasta. The amount of specials the waiter had to recite was mind-blowing, he needed to fold open a piece of paper for all of them. Can't blame him, there are simply too many. No way guests can even remember everything he recited, further more, it's kind of suspicious that a kitchen has that many specials. Pasta was okay, but the prices for them weren't. The La Nonna on Bedford that closed down was great, this place doesn't feel the same. The chic dial has been turned up to appear upscale, but it simply isn't. It's clear they care about their food, but the quality and price match is not there. At least not for us, gorgeous ceiling height and space, hope it improves.

came here for a lovely anniversary, nice place but i ordered SHRIMP parmigiana because i do NOT eat meat for over a year and they give me chicken!! Not only was that bad but the waiter tried to justify it with saying it looked like shrimp bringing the same food back to the table, when he obviously saw it was chicken he left and never returned.. RIDICULOUS AND ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE! my stomach turned and i instantly wanted to vomit from sickness! whats the point of ordering when you're going to get what they "believe" is your order?! i will NEVER return and will never suggest this place to anyone!!

We had La Nonna for dinner last night. We ended up ordering because we didn't want to miss the firework display. I've been craving Italian food as this time last year I was living in Milan and had authentic Italian food at my fingertips daily.We passed La Nonna on the way home and it looked authentic enough so we decide to give it a chance. Perhaps dinner is better in the restaurant but I can't imagine it makes a world of a difference. He ordered the Calamari Marinara with Spaghetti and I ordered Pasta Marinara. While the food was ok.. it was just ok, hardly worth the $21 for the Calamari Marinara and the $14 for penne with marinara. Not to mention the 6- 2inch pieces of bread thrown into the paperbag with the containers of food. We were only able to eat half as the rest was hard as rocks. All and all I'd rather pay a lot of money for a little food that tastes amazing rather than a lot of food that is ok. I might be open to trying brunch but won't eat dinner from here again.
These ppl know how to make pasta al dente full and fresh ingredients. Also the red sangria was great.

I stumbled upon La Nonna while strolling around Williamsburg with friends looking for a place to eat. When we walked in, we were promptly greeted, seated and served delicious bread with a tasty sweet and spicy tomato sauce. La Nonna is very nice and spacious inside, with dim  lighting that gives it a relaxing ambiance. Our waiter Alessandro was awesome! He gave excellent menu recommendations, thoroughly explaining all the specials. Our water glasses were continuously refilled and we were all given complementary glasses of wine with our YELP check-in. For dinner, I ordered the fried calamari as my entree and my friends ordered the Ravioli All' Aragosta and the Sacchetti Al Peperoncino. My calamari was tasty but nothing extraordinary. The best dish of the night was definitely the  Saccheti Al Peperoncino! Delicious little pasta purses with Ricotta and spicy ground sausage inside. Absolutely delectable! La Nonna also has a pretty strong dessert menu. The chocolate soufflé is a excellent choice! The presentation is beautiful and the dessert was quite tasty. Overall, this is a great place to have a nice intimate date or even a family dinner. Definitely 4 stars!!

After taking the East River Ferry over to Williamsburg to Dumbo, my husband and I decided on a meal at La Nonna.  It's a huge restaurant with very high ceilings and had more of an LA (?) vibe than Williamsburg.  Anyway - the food was amazing!  It was so hard to pick what to eat but we ended up sharing a salad and each ordering the kobe beef raviolis (one of their specials). And considering the service was attentive and so kind, we agreed La Nonna is definitely a restaurant we'd like to go back to.

The epitome of fine Italian food. Literally the best Italian food I have ever had the pleasure of eating. This place is the best...the atmosphere, the food, the staff... it cannot be bested. Definitely come here with family, with a date, with yourself.

Delicious food, excellent service, great ambiance & fairly priced.  I highly recommend a pasta dish, amazing!! Also, order a pie for the table as an appetizer, you won't regret it.  P.s. Don't forget to check in for one free glass of their house red.
No comment
No comment
I had an amazing birthday dinner at La Nonna Ristorante and bar. All my guest enjoyed their dinner. The parking is a great plus.
Food is wonderful! The drinks are superb! Great decor and vibe! Our waiter Alex is the best. We will def keep requesting him. The skirt steak is delicious. Our new favorite!

Wonderful experience, we recently moved into the neighborhood and our friends suggested this place for dinner, food was yummy, ambiance is great and service is excellent. We had the lasagna and the lobster ravioli, both were delicious. One of our friends had the veal and said it was excellent too, just keep in mind that the veal portion is huge so make sure you have good appetite! :)

I really like this restaurant, it's beautifully designed and the food is delicious. Great Italian spot in the neighborhood! I was disappointed twice with their menu: the pizza was terrible and their brunch menu sucks. Other than that...the octopus appetizer is delicious, all the pasta dishes are great and the steak was delicious. The staff is really nice and they have great wine options.

I hosted a 23 person wedding dinner party here with my new hubby and they could not have been more patient and accommodating. The food was great and the restaurant arranged a huge table for us in a secluded section of the restaurant. A week before the reservation I was in constant communication with the owner herself and she even let us bring in a celebratory cake from outside which her team cut and plated for my family and friends. Amazing care and service. Can't recommend enough, especially for group dinners. The beautiful decor in the restaurant was an added bonus. They'll take care of you!

What I really loved about this place was the service. We stopped in for a quick bite. We just ordered one appetizer, 3 bloody Mary's. the thing was, they were amazing. The bloody Mary's were yummy. They did all the fine dining tweaks with us even though, we were in there a total of 30mins. I hope to go back & have a proper brunch or dinner.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friends and I had a very bad experience last night for dinner. Service was horrible. The servers really did not care about our experience at all. The only thing worse than the service was the food. Appetizers were ok. Pasta and lasagna tasted like it was microwaved. We complained about the food just to give direct feedback, no one cared. Horrible experience.
The food and service was great. The ambiance was very romantic. The shrimp Parmesan and crab crake was delicious. The white sangria was also delicious. I recommended this restaurant to my friends.

Been here a couple of times for dinner. Service is consistent. The gnocchi is simple but by far my favorite dish on the menu - melts in your mouth and plenty of sauce. Restaurant is pretty big. Nice spot for a family dinner, baby shower or even romantic dinner. It's a beautiful space. We'll be back soon.

My boyfriend and I absolutely love this place, we go here at least twice a month the food, the ambiance, and especially the service is always amazing. It's perfect if you want a more elegant and less traditional spin on Italian food, although be cautious because the portions are smaller than traditional Italian fare, and that is probably my only complaint, having larger appetizer & pasta positions but, that does not take away from anything else about the place just order one of their amazing pizzas if you're worried you don't have enough!

Not what I expected. Thought this would be an authentic Italian Restaurant but it wasn't. I had the Parmesan Bowl and it had no flavor whatsoever. I wouldn't go back it's definitely not worth the time or money.

This restaurant exceeded my expectations with the food and their excellent customer service. I just want to thank Anna and Hans for making my mom's special even more special, given the large party. Everything went seamlessly.

The ravioli appetizer is amazing prob one of the best I've ever had in my life the pizza is so delicious and the owner makes this gorgeous restaurant so welcoming and amazing one of my favorite restaurants in Brooklyn by far

What an amazing wonderful experience I had last night.. First time and of course not the last, it was absolutely divine, from complimentary bread to the delicious mouth watering lasagna and pizza. Will be back soon and of course will make it a go to place. Ambiance and decor was romantic and a great place to celebrate anniversaries.
My favorite Italian restaurant in Williamsburg! Nice decor, beautiful scenery and the food is incredible. Loved the Cavatelli Bolognese an the Braided Shortrib

I absolutely love this restaurant. We go as a family to eat at La Nonna and have been doing so since their original location on Bedford. Everything from the quality of their guest service to the great tasting and looking food they put out is great.

This is my favorite go to spot for Italian. Lots of room, nice ambiance and the food is always consistent and superb! The chicken franchise is my favorite dish and is sooo good. The staff is super nice, the hostess is always pleasant and very attentive! Can't recommend enough if your in the neighborhood!
No comment

This 1 Star review is for the manager who ruined our entire experience. The food was fine, not spectacular, not bad. The service was mostly prompt and the waiter was a nice enough guy. So far so good until we go to pay. I've got a $60 OpenTable reward and the waiter needs to take my iPhone to process it. He brings it back with the screen cracked. The screen was not cracked when I gave it to him. He tries to play it off at first, "oh it just slipped" but then comes clean. He says he'll get the manager out. So she comes out. And starts making excuses "this is why you should've gone inside with him- we can't be responsible for this" You've got to be fucking kidding me. No apologies, immediately with excuses. That is the definition of TERRIBLE customer service. I get it- accidents can happen. The waiter was rushed and the phone slipped out of his hand. I can live with it. What is not excusable is a) trying to cover it up and then b) not apologizing / making excuses when you do screw up. We sure as hell will not be back here.

What a wonderful dining experience!  We didn't have a reservation so we opted to sit at the very spacious bar. Mark was an absolute gem! He took such great care of us and had such a warm and genuine personality.   We decided to eat a bunch of appetizers after Mark told us that there was nothing he wouldn't recommend, and what an excellent decision that was! I highly recommend the cheesecake and the ravioli stuffed with filet Mignon. Absolutely delicious!

Wow am I so disappointed!  Earlier today I made reservations for my boyfriends birthday at 8pm.  Around 7 I called La Nonna to see if they possibly had room for us earlier.  The hostess was SO rude to me I was just shocked!  She told me that bc of rain I still had my reservation but tables were first come first serve so we might not actually be seated.  Hmmmm... Ok?  What's the point of a reservation? Do what you need to in this time.  However, a call would have been lovely so I could have at least made other plans! In addition the attitude of the woman on the phone was just beyond!! I decided to call my other favorite Italian restaurant  Baci & Abbraci (I highly recommend trying them, delicious & excellent service) and made a new reservation.  I called La Nonna back to let them know we wouldn't be coming and the hostess hung up on me once and the second call back just put me directly on hold and never picked the phone back up. I'm so sad! We love this restaurant but after being treated this way we will not be back!
Great service. Elegant and cozy ambience. We ordered the scallops, Caesar salad, short ribs, and the prosciutto truffle mushroom linguine. Sooooo delicious!
This is the best fucking food I've ever ate in my life! Great service, beautiful bar maid,extravagant ambiance!!!
What an amazing Italian restaurant!! Very fresh and authentic. Great atmosphere and service. The Ravioli Nutella dessert was killer!! You must go it's so good!!
No comment

I don't do many reviews but had to after I went to La Nona with friends last night while I was visiting NYC.  Absolutely the best Italian restaurant in my book.  The staff was personable and attentive and the owner, Cono (a true Italian), stopped by to check on us.  Cono personally selected our meal and we were treated to an excellent 5 course dinner.  I will definitely be back.
No comment

Service was okay. Food was good but nothing special. Had the house special veggie lasagna and it was good but not great.  Moscow Mule was perfectly mixed. Prices and portions were a bit on the expensive side for what you get (quantity and quality). Server wasn't super knowledgeable or attentive but not BAD. Just....meh overall.

Went here late on a Thursday evening.  The restaurant is beautiful and it also has an outdoor eating area if interested in that.  We sat inside, we were immediately greeted by the friendly manager who gave us a very good seat by the window.  The waitress and bus boy were very accommodating.  I was able to order my favorite caprese salad although it was not on the menu, it was far from disappointing.  The complimentary bread with spicy pamadoro sauce delicious.  My husband ate two baskets of the bread by himself and later regretted it but said it was well worth him feeling overly full.  I had the skirt steak which was superb and my husband had a pasta dish which he wolfed down.  Everything was delicious.  Definitely will be returning
No comment

Called in for a reservation for two at 6:30 and was escorted by the kind hostess to our table. The food was great but the service was terrible. I understand due to the circumstances of the pandemic, staff may be short and waiting times for drinks, appetizers, and entrees may be a bit longer than usual. However, as the party sat down it would've been nice to have been at least offered water or having been asked for a drink order within the first five to eight minutes. Nonetheless, our waiter could've easily introduced himself and let us know we would have to wait a bit for his service. Still, more than 15 minutes have passed by and we're sitting dry at the table. Finally our waiter, or I thought, comes to offer water and doesn't offer any drinks. You would think a four star restaurant may want to up sell their best wine or offer their unique cocktails but none of that was recommended. My brother & I ordered a bottle of moscato which took longer than I hoped for. Soon we ordered our entrees, that came within reasonable time and it was well worth the wait. My brother ordered the chicken Parmesan with penne and I order the chicken Frances with linguine. Phenomenal food and even better serving portions. Thank you Chef! My brother midway through his first glass didn't like the wine which was noticed by our second waiter (our waiters switched) and recommended a better wine suited for his pallet. After finishing entrees and the wine we were hoping for dessert but wasn't offered any so we decided to go somewhere else. The food and wine spoke for themselves and lived up to the expectation. The service however, had a lot of room to improve on. My brother & I happened to think it was maybe the way were dressed that had something to do with our treatment?
