Best dish on the menu is definitely the basil fried rice - beware it is unexpectedly spicy for those who are not used to Asian spice levels!
This place is really nice...the atmosphere...the employees and mostly the food is outstanding...one of my favorite places in NYC!
No comment

Overall this place has really good Thai food, above-average but not necessarily the top echelon. So why did I give it 5 stars? For some reason, their massaman Curry is absolutely delicious. It's probably one of the best I've tasted and I have been all over for Thai food. My wife got the Drunken Noodles which were good, though to me the noodles were on the softer side and the flavor wasn't as bold. Now back to the massaman curry I'm not sure what exactly they put in it to make it stand above the rest. The curry itself is the right amount of thickness with the right amount of peanutty flavor. The soft white rice really compliments the flavor. I really like their use of the roasted cashews, it really brings out the flavor. Other places use roasted peanuts which really don't taste that good. And sometimes just end up soggy. The cashews here really take this dish up a notch. I'll certainly be back for more! As soon as I can find parking...
No comment

Best Thai food in all of manhattan guaranteed! I have tried many places all around the city including Long Island and Staten Island and this place is the best! The service and food are always top notch. Prices are low & quality of food is high. My favorites are the Thai wonton soup, edemame dumplings, and pad see ew beef. I'm telling you it's the best pad see ew by far and I've tried a lot. If you are craving some good Thai food come here!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Tuk Tuk's presence on Vernon Blvd. is understated.  Just a small sign that says "Tuk Tuk" with a stylized graphic of the iconic Thai micro transit alternative. The storefront admirably preserves the word "paints" in stained glass from a former tenant.  Otherwise, the sleek environment evokes a Thai sense of place without resorting to stereotypes. We only stopped in for a bite of soup and appetizers, Tom Ka Gai, Roti-Massaman, Pork Pot Stickers, Sticky Rice, Jasmine Rice and Thai Tea.  But it was all very rich and satisfying. The Tom Ka Gai soup was tangy and a little sweete.  The Roti-Massaman was so delicious, we kept finding more things to dip in the Massaman sauce when the flat bread was done.  If it weren't for the rice, we probably would have dipped pieces of the tablecloth to finish it off.  I'm not in LIC/Hunters Point often, but I will have to make a point of getting back.

This is hands down my favorite Thai restaurant in the city!  Very authentic food and atmosphere.  The servers are extremely friendly and the food is outstanding.  We come here about once a week - it's that good.  It even compares to the best meals I had in Thailand!  Highly, highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really disappointing. Only half our order was delivered! But lo and behold they were quick to charge us the whole amount and the person on the other end of the line was extremely rude and unhelpful. I was hungup on, overcharged and missing half my food.. thanks Tuk Tuk for ruining a wonderful evening!

I think it's a very decent place for thai food, i had pad kahing with duck  it was very good   My friend had mango fried rice  its also very delicious  affordable place for very nice thai food   Definitely will come back
No comment

One of the worst Thai restaurants I have been to. Given all the Thai places in Queens, it was definitely puzzling to see how this place snagged some decent ratings. I was super disappointed with this one. We tried 6 different dishes and we all disliked our food. I have had Thai food from grocery stores and bubble tea shops that tasted better than this place. Tom Yum soup did not taste anything like Tom Yum. Drunken noodle drank a bit too much of soy sauce. Duck was overly cooked and just lacked basic thai flavor. Not to mention it was pretty pricey for thai food. On top of that, service was mediocre, too.  Never going back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The worst restaurant experience ever! We ordered 6 dishes and only 3 got delivered. When we called and confirmed with Uber eats they confirmed that they were only given 3 dishes and rest 3 was missing. We called the restaurant and the guy was the rudest person I have ever come across in restaurant service business who refused to take any accountability and had the worst manners and customer interface! I have had restaurants make mistakes with orders which is always understood but this guy was the most adamant and rude person who actually hung up the phone on us without taking any responsibility! I never write bad reviews but this guy had the worst manners. Never ever order from here if you have some self respect and desire to get the food you paid for. The tuk tuk manager however was a decent lady and called back to acknowledge the situation and delivered the missing food later after the initial unpleasant experience.

Nice atmosphere and pretty decent and authentic thai food. The Pad Kee Mao (drunken noodle) with beef was a lot spicier than I expected. If you like spicy, this definitely has a good kick. Would come back to try their other dishes and thai tea.
No comment
No comment

I was very excited to come try this place! Haven't had Thai food since visiting in Thailand earlier in the year. We placed orders for the tom yum soup, the duckaholic and mee-kiew-hang. Service was slow but the food came to us in 15 minutes. We didn't think twice about it but by the time I had tried a few bites of my noodles, I felt a little off. Both of us got sick from this food - we should have known given how quick that food came that it was not freshly prepared. Won't be coming back.
No comment

Everything in this restaurant was so unbelievably delicious!!! Went here for my birthday dinner with family & friends. Tried spring rolls, Roti massaman, tilapia mango salad, pad Thai, pad see-ew, duck and mango with sticky rice. Every thing was so good!
I came here last night for my birthday the food was disgusting and the staff was very rude.
No comment
No comment
No comment

AH! Thai food is probably my favorite cuisine- either Thai or Korean.. it's always so difficult to choose. But what really stuck out to me about this place is that they have *authentic* dishes that you wouldn't find elsewhere. Also, I found myself not having to pile on an excess amount of spicy sauce as when you opt to order a dish spicy, you are most definitely going to receive it spicy. There was one dish that I couldn't even finish without downing a cup of water in between each bite (but I like experiencing that kind of heat). The ambiance of the restaurant is nothing special, however. Definitely one of those places where you go to catch up with friends for no special occasion. Also, I personally thought it was located in a pretty prime position on a busy street but it is a little easy to miss as it is tucked away between other prominent signs. The servers were super attentive and fast and very helpful when it came to ordering- they were very patient with my friend and I and answered our superfluous amount of questions. The Tom Yom soup is something that I CANNOT get enough of. I even bought multiple bottles of the sauce at home so that I may be able to perfect it myself after many disappointing experiences at multiple Thai restaurants but I could confidently express how much I loved it here. It wasn't excessively salty and lemon-y. The balance between the soup broth with how many/ how long lemongrass was simmered in the broth for was definitely perfected.
No comment
Their green curry is one of the best versions of the dish I have ever had. Fantastic!
No comment

Great friendly service!  Food was nicely presented.  The Duckaholic was good and came in a brown sauce with a lot of meat including the legs and breast.  My friend liked the Mee Kiew Hang.  It looks similar to the egg noodles and roasted pork you would get at a Chinese restaurant.
No comment
No comment

I wish I had visited Tuk Tuk more often while living in LIC. Though it can get very busy on weekends, their service is normally fast and efficient and the food is always delicious. I highly recommend the green veggie dumplings, Massaman curry with roti, charred beef salad and fried ice cream. I've never had a bad meal here and highly recommend Tuk Tuk for a cozy night ordering in or a fast, casual and delicious dine-in experience!
No comment
Never order take-out. It doesn't taste anything like it does in the restaurant. I have been coming here for years, I am so disappointed.  Sodium Bomb. Yuch. What happened?

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: 5-Stars for Consistency over 3 years! I live in the area and Tuk Tuk has been a staple. I tend to order delivery, though I have dined in as well. Both experiences offer the same quality which is nice because sometimes that isn't the case at other restaurants. And over the years Tuk Tuk has been able to consistently provide great Thai food at fair prices...and delivery is usually super fast. I usually go for the Chicken Pad Thai or Chicken Pad See Ew (dinner portions are pretty big, great for sharing or saving leftovers).
Came here for my birthday dinner with my family. We ordered a ton of different dishes. All tasted as expected. Basically, your typical Thai food in a nicer ambiance. Would come back for sure.
No comment

I have been living in LIC since 2007 and Tuk Tuk is always my go-to spot. The food is great and the service is good :) people who work there are always friendly and smiling. Whenever my sisters are visiting from Taiwan, Tuk Tuk is always their must go spot for the first meal. Aww!

I lived almost 4 years in Asia and travels thought south-est Asia on many occasions. This restaurant serves dishes that are nothing like Thai food. I had the worst pad-Thai I ever tasted. The curry soup was ok but with no authentic Thai spices and flavors. The atmosphere of the restaurant is casual, tables don't even have a tablecloth. Overall I think the food quality is poor and not a good choice for Thai food. This place is overrated and for the quality of the dishes, overpriced.
I LOVE LOVE TUK TUK. Every dish I've tried was amazing. Whenever I'm in the area I stop at Tuk Tuk!
No comment

Great food, great service, reasonable prices, and I love their Thai street food menu. It's also a major plus that they have constantly rotating specials. If I have any criticism it's that their beer and wine options are very basic, but they have a weekly corkage-free night. Love this neighborhood staple.
No comment

This place is highly rated for it's food, which i agree is good. The ambiance is nice and quiet and it has authentic feel to it. The staff were friendly and quick with our food. Although the food was good (very flavorful and aromatic) there was a hair in the food! Clearly hair nets are not a thing at this establishment as I've seen other reviewers attest to the same. It's a shame because the food is good but hygiene is poor.
No comment
No comment

Tuk Tuk is my absolute favorite Thai place! Usually order take out Pad Thai or Pad Kee Mao and the food always arrives super quick and still hot and fresh.  Have sat in the restaurant a few times as well and the service has always been top notch.  The flavorful spices of the green curry and massaman curry hold up to any thai restaurant I've been to in NYC.  But what prompted me to give them a 5 star review today was the  Kai Ra Berd or Egg bomb from the traditional Thai food section of their menu.  A hint of spice, stir fried ground pork with fresh basil over a bed of white rice, topped with an over easy egg with a golden yolk just waiting to be broken.  The dish was so simple yet so delicious.  I can't recommend this place enough!
No comment

The best Tom Kha soup I've ever had. It had the right balance of creamy, spicy and sour and plenty of chicken. I ordered the BBQ chicken which isn't exactly the best dish to judge thai food by, but it was a pretty solid dish that was very tender and juicy. The slaw was very delicious as well! I also tried the Gai-Pa-Lo which is very fragrant and and tasty. If I lived in NYC I'd pay them another visit to try out the rest of the menu!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I'm sorry but I had to give this restaurant 5 stars regardless of going back and forth looking for the restaurant like crazy. When people say it's a hidden gem, this is really a "hidden gem" because it hides right in the middle of the busy street (Vernon Boulevard). It's hard to find the place because the Tuk Tuk sign was so small hanging sideways and the front banner didn't have the name Tuk Tuk. I told the waiter to make sure they can be easily seen. Anyway, a lunch with my friend went very well. She and I ordered the same green curry with tofu and vegetable. Woohoo! It was so green that I started to envy the color of green. It's the color of the lottery winners of 1.6 billion from the 3 states! So the curry came with soup and rice. The soup was unbelievably tasteful and unbelievably excellent! I forgot to ask what type of soup that is because I was busy talking, of course. They serve us a lunch portion just the right size to hold the tummy till dinner time. The curry they served was truly rich with a pure coconut taste and spicy as per our instructions. I'm not sure what else went into that bowl but I was astounded. I'd definitely recommend the place and hopefully readers can find the restaurant easily, it's next to the bike shop right after you get off the train on Vernon Boulevard. If you're in Manhattan, coming to LIC is not a problem at all, it's the first stop in Queens via the 7 train if you take 7 at Grand Central that's even better because it's only 1 stop, which is less than 5 minutes. You want the best green curry Thai style? This is it! We asked for spicy and that's what we got. A very good listener! I plan to come back here with hubby!

Excellent service and food is amazing. Ordered Theron Yum soup and Pad Kee Mao. The soup was a surprise with a lemon taste with a little spice.  The pad Kee Mao was good. It was spicy and the beef had great flavor. I would definitely recommend this place for dining and for take out.

Came here the other night and it was perfect for the rainy day. The staff was friendly and attentive. The food was great. I am on a health kick and for the "eat your greens" and it tasted very clean but still spicy and satisfying. My partner ordered some sort of noodle soup with beef, looked amazing and he ate the whole thing. Will 100% be coming back.
Amazing. Hands down the best thai food in the neighborhood. Have visited tuk tuk over 20 times never disappointed.
Best Thai place!! Our favorites are pad thai , pineapple fried rice, massaman curry. Our dinner spot when we are craving a Thai food
Really good Thai food. We ordered Tom yum soup, papaya salad, pad see ew, eggplant stir fry and a seafood special. Enjoyed all the dishes. Ambiance is chill and casual and servers are attentive.
No comment

My bf's and my go to spot if we can't decide to where to eat. This place never fails us, our fav dishes are Roti-Massaman, Massaman Curry, Gai Ta-krai, Duckaholic, Thai-spiced Salmon and Salmon Lemograss.
No comment
I enjoy the vegetable pineapple fried rice with extra cashews. I get it delivered to my job and they deliver quickly!

In love with this place! Came by for lunch and tried the carrot soup, veggie spring rolls, curry fried rice, and drunken noodles (pad kee mao) with tofu and literally loved every single bite. And it was unbelievably cheap! We got all of that for $20 and the service was superb as well. HIGHLY recommend!
No comment

My fav Thai restaurant in the city! Casual but the food is great. My favourite dish is the Pad See-ew with beef. The local dishes section is also a fun section to try out new dishes I haven't had before. The Thai iced tea is great too!
No comment
No comment
No comment

By far the best Thai restaurant I've ever been to. Tuk Tuk is the reason why I continue to eat Thai! Their Pad See Ew is amazing. I also recommend the Duckaholic. Amazing, amazing desserts. This is definitely on my top 5 list for favorite NYC restaurants. You won't be disappointed!

Me and my girlfriend entered the restaurant to have some dinner and the first thing that struck me was that the mood lighting was a bit too dark for my taste. We got our food and I really liked it and the portions were huge. I liked the service. They were fast, hard working and very polite. The best part of my meal was the dessert. I ordered the french toast topped with honey and vanille ice cream. I loved it! A pity it was a bit to dark to really see my food...
I love this place . My favorite is the veggie spring roll from the lunch menu . There Thai ice tea is really good as well . The service here is fast and the staff is very attentive.

I had a beef dish that's marked as "majorly spicy". The waitress warned me when I ordered, but it really wasn't that spicy. :/ The portion was pretty big and tasted okay. I tried my friend's fried pork belly and it's so bland.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My boy friend and I had dinner here and the food was so tasteless.  The waiter saw that we didn't even touch the food and didn't bother to ask if everything was ok or if we wanted anything else.  I have a lot of experience with Thai food and this was by far the worst.  Will never go back again.

column3: Fosterstown North, Dublin, Republic of Ireland
column6: Yum!! Great food and very reasonably priced, the green curry was delish with the right level of spice, the ramen on specials was only so so, but lots of other options to pick from would def recommend for a chilled out dinner.
No comment
They have great lunch specials and the food is five star delicious. Best salad dressing in a Thai restaurant I ever ate.

Tuk Tuk is THE go-to place in my neighborhood for lunch and dinner. All curries with fried tofu and vegetables are heavenly, the staff is friendly and professional, take-out is speedy, and the prices are definitely reasonable. Their summer special of mango with sweet sticky rice is the absolute BEST!!! Great place for vegans/vegetarians.
My favorite spot for lunch! I love the chicken with pineapple fried rice lunch special. The service here is always great as well. If you're into Thai food and in the area definitely a must food stop

Had to had lunch solo on a Saturday, and had too many options in the area. I decided on this place. I figured it would be the best bang for my buck. Since I ate alone, I only ordered an entrée which was chicken pad thai. It was very good, portion was generous. Service was attentive as well. Would definitely dine here again if I'm in the area and want Thai.
No comment
I've only done takeout here once but had the best chicken Pad Thai I've ever had! It's such a cute place inside so I'm looking forward to coming back to dine in!
I had the Shrimp Green Curry and Tom Yum soup with shrimp.  The food was good and the service was good.  Clean place. Would go back again to try a different dish.

Food is ok. Spice is better in my opinion. Also has minimum for card. Ordered a dish that was $9.80. I didn't have cash on me and couldn't use my card cause it didn't reach their minimum payment of $10. Left my food there and went somewhere else.

Food and service is usually good here but today service was a little odd at lunch. I asked for a thai iced tea in a to go cup so that I can take it back to work and not have to down the whole drink. I've requested my drinks at other places before and never had an issue but at this place, the guy staff said no. He said we do not do to go cups if you're dining here and asked if I still want my drink to go. I said yes. So literally after we were done with our lunch, he brings over my thai iced tea AFTER we ate. Why can't I drink it with my meal? So strange. It's not like I'm asking for a discount. I'm still paying for the drink. Odd.

This is my favorite Thai place in LIC! It's better to dine in then get take-out. If you want take out you have to order on their website. I love the Pad Ka-Na. It's a garlic broccoli dish, not overly spicy, but flavorful. If you like spicy food there's plenty of options for that too.

Great Food, Service and Ambiance! This is the first Thai place we visited on our trip to NY and it certainly was a great choice. We ordered Tom Kha, Red Vegetable Curry & Pad Thai. Each one of those was Delicious. If we lived here, we would be eating there often!!!
My go to place to get some delicious Thai food delivered. Always spot on.
No comment

I was a frequent customer but I just had a very disappointing experience. Ordered pineapple rice with chicken and chicken was not fully cooked. Make sure everything is fully cooked before you give food to your children!

Solid Thai restaurant in the Hunters Point neighborhood. They have nice decor and a cozy atmosphere if you want to eat there but they also deliver (which everyone in the neighborhood uses). I recommend their green curry if you like spicy! Their noodles are also very good. They have an interesting dessert menu but not if you're just looking for something simple. They're a neighborhood staple and I don't seem them leaving anytime soon which I'm glad of!
many people during the dinner hours～but still nice services and the curry smells so good! The iced tea was out of my expectation! In a nice way!
My favorite lunch place! I always order the Panang Curry. It comes with soup in the winter, salad in the summer. Just a perfect meal!

My favorite Pad Thai in New York. Consistent, friendly, and fast service; they always get my order correct. Checking "extra spicy" when ordering online should be met with caution--my nose was running and my ears plugged up. I only checked that box once, but if you like a fiery level of spice, this is for you.
No comment

I love TukTuk. Best Thai restaurant in Long Island City Neighborhood. Their curry puff and Massaman curry is the best. Service is always amazing and don't forget to tip a bunch to the delivery guys! They're always so polite and nice. You go TUKTUK!
You can not ask for a better thai food with these really good prices. I'm crazy about  the pad kee mao
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had a fantastic experience here and have no complaints, except for the fact that they ran out of their mango w/ sticky rice. I came here around 8:30 on a Friday night with a group of friends and we were seated immediately. The decor is cool, modern, and earthy (something you wouldn't expect for a thai restaurant) and service is excellent. I ordered the Pad See-Ew which was delicious and fresh, wouldn't have changed a thing. I also tried the hot pot dumplings which were interesting (they're filled with ground peanuts and radish), and the charred beef salad was bursting with flavor. The salad might actually have been my favorite, but it is SPICY!

I honestly hate leaving bad reviews, but this was a disappointing experience that I feel the need to heed those who will be lead here by their high reviews. To keep the review simple, avoid the Red Snapper Fish dish as it wasn't fresh...before hitting the table, I could smell the "fishy-ness" radiating off the plate. Also to note, the consistency of the Red Snapper In The Garden was soggy and had the taste of freezer burn. My partner ordered the Magic Mushroom House Special... and let me tell you the only thing magical about the dish was that the thick artificial asian "gravy" that bathed the mushrooms didn't slide off the plate, land on the floor and cause someone to slip. With the reviews that this place received, I expected something completely different, something at least half decent.
No comment
No comment
Absolutely delicious. The thai steak was awesome. And the singha beer and the beerlao complimented the steak perfectly.

Came here to have dinner with my family for my cousins birthday. The service was really good, waiters and waitresses are very attentive and respectful.  The food was really delicious. The appetizers we had were curry puffs, spring rolls and chicken satay, all cooked to perfection and the sauces complimented each dish very well. Only took away one star because they don't have cocktails, just beer and wine. Looked forward to a lychee martini :(

Ordered the green curry and coco chicken. The green curry looked good and was very flavorful. It was very spicy too! Definitely The best I had. The jasmine rice had an interesting taste but it was delicious
Best restaurant in LIC! Great prices and always consistent and delicious. On of my all time go-tos

Great place. Large selection of dishes & very reasonably priced. The portions are very large & I always leave feeling stuffed! I've been here twice now & both times all people in our party loved what they ordered. If you go on a Wednesday evening you can also take your own wine & they will chill it for you in the fridge, which I thought was very kind.

I was looking for thai food within the LIC area and was delightfully surprised with this place. I had the Gau Ling dish, which was as advertised: "Majorly Spicy," and hit the spot. Quality Thai food, reasonably price and friendly service. I would definitely go back again.
No comment
No comment

Was there today. I had the Pad Kei Mau with Shrimp. Something missing that was there before in their sauce over many visits. Was spicy, but lacked tastiness and the noodles in the Pad Keu Mau were not covered in sauce ... i.e. the sauce wasn't thick enough. Definitely a change. Hopefully it gets its mojo back because it was a great place.
Some of the best Thai food we have ever had, and very attentive wait staff.  Everything was delicious.... some things were really spicy, but that was good too.
No comment
They have an amazing lunch special.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are big too.  Everything I have ever tried from Tuk Tuk was flavorful and I have never left without a to go container.
No comment

First time in NY and my first place was Tuk Tuk! It did not disappoint. We had the Pad Thai which tasted slightly different than what I'm used to in Cali but it was awesome! Maybe even better. I also loved that it had a ton of sauce. We also had the salad special of the day which was super refreshing and a nice alternative to our usual papaya salad. Highly recommend.
Consistently delicious. Always enjoy a good meal and  never disappointed. One of the neighborhood's best! Pineapple fried rice with chicken is a must.

I almost didn't come to this restaurant tonight, but I'm very happy that I did. It doesn't look like much from the outside but it's actually big on the inside. I came with two other friends and we had a great time. The food, ambiance, service, pricing and facilities are all great. I will definitely come back again :)
No comment
No comment
No comment

Maybe my review is biased since I've been craving Thai food for over a month now (this baby likes her spicy foods). Being a girl from queens I decided to try Tuk Tuk and make the trek from li to see if it was really worth the hype. I did my research and knew what my husband and I should order, and he's glad I did! I got the pad ke mao which is so good I would name my child after it! I don't know how they do it but the flavor starts out subtle but as you're chewing you get a build up of flavors -spice, sweet, tangy - everything that makes Thai food so unique!  I normally don't like shrimp in restaurants but I gobbled up the ones in this dish because they were perfect. I MADE my husband switch from getting a pad Thai to massaman curry and he's a believer! His exact words were "I'm going to order massaman curry everywhere I go now". His dish was phenomenal! I hate curries and coconut milk but I couldn't help myself from going back and helping myself to his food (what's mine is yours right married people?). Only downside was portions which I felt were a tad small because an Hour later I was starved. I will definitely be back because the area is gorgeous and the food is to die for!!

This is my go to spot for Thai food and definitely the best Thai place in LIC. I always order Pad See Eew, but the trick here is to make it spicy so that you can have the sweet and spicy combo which is delicious! (Warning, it is burn in your mouth spicy so I would suggest balancing it with a Thai iced tea). Dinner prices are reasonable - most dishes are in the $11-$13 range, specials are a little more expensive.
Egg bomb was great! Simple and traditional. It was a little too warm to sit by the window during summer thou. The AC couldn't reach that specific area of the restaurant (near entrance)

Tonight I ordered delivery for probably the 700th time. The food here is delicious and never fails to hit the spot. It's one of my top choices in this neighborhood when I'm looking for some good food and a little heat. I order the duck panang almost every time (pad see ew is great as well) and it has excellent flavor. Delivery is almost always early (today it came in half the time), which is very much appreciated when the food is this tasty!

I was at Tuk Tuk a few years before and it was great. But this time around, the Thai food is OK at best (I'm Thai). The Pad Se Ew didnt taste fresh, and the Pineapple Fried Rice has absolutely no taste. Such a waste.
No comment
Very nice dishes with reasonable price，had a great time there their fishes dishes are terrific.

Surprisingly large space compared to some other restaurants but the decor isn't anything special.  But, good Thai food in the area! Had the Roti massaman for appetizer, which was deliciously peanutty. Their Kai ra-berd and curries are also very good! Will def come back and try some of the other signature Thai dishes.

Many of my friends have had bad experiences here related to rude staff and errors when ordering for delivery but I've tried to overlook this because I enjoy their dishes like the pineapple fried rice and pad kee Mao. But when you walk in and you're the only customer and the worker stares at you saying "no outside beverages" and throws out your recently purchased coffees without remorse, that makes me not want to return. He probably knew we would stay since it was pouring outside and every other restaurant was on lunch break. Like this ain't some fancy 5star restaurant; is my innocent cup going to ruin the ambience? If anything, it makes me want to not order a drink from them even more. I understand every restaurant has its own policies but I'd rather go somewhere else with better customer service.

I've enjoyed going to and ordering takeout from Tuk Tuk for a couple of years now, but the quality of the meat has really gone down hill. The chicken is very tough and woody the past few months, so I don't know if they have a new supplier, or they're reheating it. The other day I ate in and had to send the dish back as the shrimp was spoiled. I've never sent a dish back anywhere ever. I would give two stars, but they're so nice, delivery is fast and hot, and normally the food is pretty good. Unfortunately, my experiences lately have been subpar. I hope things improve.
No comment

This is my go to lunch spot. I usually order take out for lunch. My favorite dish is green curry with chicken EXTRA spicy. They really know how to put a spicy kick to the dish! For some reason, I am always craving spicy food and this place always satisfies it!

Tuk Tuk has been my go to Thai place since moving to Long Island City in 2007. They are consistently great. I'm a vegetarian so I mainly order the Pad Thai with Tofu, Pad See Ew with Veggie Duck and and any and all off the fried rice and curry dishes. Always friendly, service is outstanding and food is delicious!
No comment
Good, solid Thai food with nice ambiance.  Not crowded on a Monday night.  The egg bomb was good as were the summer rolls.
No comment
One of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to. Portions are decent in size (not too large not too small). Food is delicious without being overpowering. Service is nice.
No comment
Some of the best thai food I've had in NYC. Very, very tasty. I love the Duck dishes and the pineapple fried rice. So good and very good service. I wish they would deliver to Greenpoint!
Great service! Our server was very smiley and gracious/accommodating toward us -- a rarity in NYC. Great flavors, cute decor... a nice place to gather with friends for dinner!
I really like Tuk Tuk! I've enjoyed the panang curry with both tofu and chicken. This is the perfect spot to order take out in LIC on a cold rainy day. Love it.
No comment
No comment
The padthai was ok. But I was disappointed at the portion they give us for Roti Massaman. $5 for a small piece of pancake was not worth it.
Hands down one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to. Full of flavor! Good service, they seated us right away, tons of seating space. Paintings on the walls are super cool.
Horrible service. Don't go. They will serve you dinner and check at the same time. And throw food at you. Stay away
Everything was dry but ok. The prices were steep for what it was. It felt like good Chinese takeout,

I will definitely not go to the place again. Today we had three people there for lunch. My food was ok but my friend's was not. The worst part is the waiter's attitude. One of my friend got a Pad Kee Mao which had half toppings cold. When the waiter served our table, he told the waiter with good manner. We all thought it was not that serious and just wanna the kitchen aware of it. Surprisingly, the waiter replied so improper; he said they always cook Pad Kee Mao "like this" more than once. Personally I would not say he was gentle but a bit aggressive instead. All of us felt uncomfortable. Before we left, the guy said the same thing again. It was too hard to communicate with and this time is really the worst service I had so far during the five years in NYC.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The place is pretty big, from the outside it looks small though. Very spacy, and as soon as you enter the greeter set you up with a table. Food was alright, wasn't too pleased. The service was alright as well nothing too over the top, there when you needed them but never checked on us. I felt my dish was to dull, not enough spices, tasted like regular chicken from any restaurant. The thai iced tea was a bit watery, but still enjoyed it.
No comment
Still good.. but dropping a star as i'm pretty sure prices have gone up about 20%+ in the year I've been here.
No comment
You want a piece of Thailand than this place is it. Want to experience Thailand than this restaurant is it! Super cute and really good food! First time and i was impressed, beers were good too!
No comment
Such a delicious, quick, super friendly spot! Love their pad thai and tofu green curry:-P

We had the Yum Vegetarian Duck (crispy mock duck with mango, lime leaf, cashew, mint. tossed in spicy lemongrass-tamarind vinaigrette). It was the best we ever had. Tried ordering this dish in other Thai restaurants and it doesn't compare. Also had the Massaman Curry with tofu, which was very good. My friends had the Spicy Pork Spare Ribs and they enjoyed it very much. I would go there more often if I was close by, but would definitely go back at least a few more times.

This is the worst restaurant experience I ever had. I used to be a loyal customer sine I work so close to the place and I like Thai food. However, during my most recent visit, I ordered an appetizer that was not of my like and asked to change it for something else. The manager refused because the order was already placed but not he refused to change it but he charged me for it. When I inquired about it he was unprofessional and rude.
No comment
Too much unnecessary seasoning in their foods. I've been to Thailand many times and I know Thai food pretty well I'd say. So no! This place was disappointing. Also the service wasn't that good.
The food was delicious, it was priced well, and the service was amazing. I couldn't drink water as fast as these guys were refilling it

Review of lunch delivery. Ordered lunch at 11:30am expecting it to be here by noon. Ordered pad Thai with shrimp and roti with massaman curry. Came 50minutes later! This place is like two blocks from my apt. Delivery guy decided to help himself with the tip and took it out of the change he gave back. I have him a "what the hell" look. Pad Thai came with a really bland soup- soup was a broth soup thickened with flour and flavored with pepper. Tasted just of black pepper. Yuck. Pad Thai portion was half of normal portion for a buck less the price (what the hell). Shouldn't lunch be a better value than dinner? The grossest thing was their roti with the curry. The roti was whatever, slightly on the poly soggy side. The killer was the curry- extremely grossly sweet. Tasted like they used peanut butter and added sugar and spices.. Ugh made my stomach churn. And all this took 50minutes...why?
No comment
No comment

Since I found out this place by chance, Tuk Tuk has became my favorite spot in the city. I usually go there almost every once a week or so. Thai Steak with sauce is my favorite and grilled salmon as well. The service is very exceptional. "Tum" is the best server ever.

Food is so yummy! If you love spice but love to actually taste your food, don't request to make the food spicy. It's seasoned just right. Service is good. There's some wine but I think they allow byob. Great prices too. Yum!
One of my favorite go-to restaurants in LIC. For reasonably priced, casual, spicy Thai food with great service and always a seat open, come here! BTW, Wednesday nights is BYOB with no corkage fee!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Mediocre pad thai (actually bad-tasting to me, something off in the sauce). Friendly Service.

My go-to place for waterfront picnics at Gantry Park... Thai take-out for picnics in the park? Why not! I recently discovered the roti massaman appetizer, and used the leftover massaman sauce over my pineapple fried rice. Genius move.
Love this place!!! Delicious food and awesome staff. My favorite is Pad Thai noodles with veggies and tofu :)
No comment
Great food, nice location. Sooo convenient on the way home... Love this place!
No comment
No comment
Came here for lunch with my coworkers today.  I had the massaman curry with chicken and it was delicious!  Service was quick and attentive!

Went there only once... Loved there decor! Very modern yet very bright and welcoming the massaman curry was yummy! I loved my pad kee mao!! Well balanced flavor not very spicy neither lacking seasoning great ambience price was okay... Great service as well
It's great srvice with great employees especially the guy named Anthony. He has a nice welcoming and the food is delicious
No comment

Went here last night while visiting family. Food is delicious. Every thing was so good. Everyone was really nice and attentive. Any thing you order you won't be disappointed. Will definitely come back here to eat again. Price was right, atmosphere was great and dishes came out hot and fresh.

They have done big renovation of the space a couple of over the years. Most recently I went for dinner. There pad Thai was mushy. The sweet dishes was sweeter than I've had in the past. I still like the tom yum soup since there's a balance of hot and sour. You can be a loyal customer for many years but don't expect them to remember you. They don't and not that type to do anything special or remember what you usually order either.
Very nice Thai Food. Just stop by and grab a bite to eat. The Pad Gra-Prow was delicious!

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: I have been here a few times during lunch and I have to say the food is really good. I have had chicken pad Sui and I would have to say it is very good. The reason for the 4 star was because the portion was very little. The prices are reasonable. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. Would come back again for sure.
No comment
I find myself craving for their food. My favorites are massaman curry, pad thai, pad kae mo, ritto massaman, spring rolls, curry puffs. the service is fast and 90% of servers are very kind.
Pretty good food, nice ambiance, not too crowded
No comment
Very good thai food, but a bit expensive. Staff was also a bit slow. They have a cool promotion on Wednesdays where you can bring your own bottle of wine without a corkage fee.
No comment

I was very disappointed with this restaurant. The Thai milk tea was decent but definitely not the best I've had. The pad kee Mao was not flavorful and the shrimp was super super dry. It tasted like it had been sitting in the kitchen for hours before serving.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: My favorite Thai place in Long Island City. I usually pick up because it's right near my apartment but I have eaten here multiple times. Honestly, no frills, taste good, service is always on point!

This place has a good atmosphere and fast service, plus the food was very tasty and delicious. I had the duck with tamarind sauce and my boyfriend had the massaman curry and both were very delicious and perfectly balanced. The thai ice tea was a little too sweet but it was still very pleasing! I would definitely go here again. It is near the waterfront so after a walk and before going into the subway you can go and get a bite.

One of my favorite places to grab Thai food. I love the pad see ew, Massamum curry is delish, and the appetizers are great. Service is quick and friendly. Prices are fair. Love coming here. Also have great lunch specials!

Honestly this used to be one of my favorite places. I went right now. I had the mango cashew chicken and my mom ordered the grilled shrimp. Portions pretty decent. But I had it this time my mango cashew chicken and it had no flavor, wasn't like the usual. They asked me twice if everything was alright. I said yes thinking oh I should keep chewing. Not only that my mom got so upset because basically like 4 of the employees kept watching us, and my mom grew more mad. She said this is a the last time We are coming here. She thinks maybe cause she didn't ordered a drink they kept watching. But we grew so uncomfortable, mostly her, bcos i had my back towards them. But I did see it happen. Also if you ask for a drink with no ice they charge you an extra  50 cents. What the heck. Disappointed to be honest. Only server I like now is the guy don't know his name. Seems like everyone else likes to stare at customers while we eat. Wished we didn't eat there.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very nicely decorated place, and friendly staff.  The food is only OK though...we had the golden purse and papaya salad as appetizers, and the ducktopia dish along with BBQ grilled chicken and one of their spicy seafood entrees, I forget the name.  They looked amazing but tasted a little on the bland side.
No comment

I loved this place. It's such a nice area, not loud and bustling at all. It has a quiet, comfortable atmosphere which made the food even more enjoyable to eat. I had the Veggie & Tofu Pad Thai and I really liked it. I was glad that it had such a good menu for vegetarians, so that's definitely a plus. To top off the dinner, my friend and I had some fried ice cream, which was simply melt-in-your-mouth delicious. The food was also cutely decorated and served, and the waitress was adorable. Definitely would come back here and recommend this place to my friends. Yum :)
Called 2 minutes after the delivery window and got rejected. Apparently they "don't pay the delivery guy overtime." Mind you this was lunch time and not midnight. The attitude was also unnecessary.
No comment

I was beckoned by the 'People Love Us on Yelp' sticker on the door and entered to a pleasing modern yet warm and cute interior. Lunch specials were reasonable $7-9 and the employees were friendly enough. It looked clean and promising. After an order of to-go pad see ew I was reminded that Chinese food isn't the only cuisine plagued by MSG. Tough to judge by one dish but it seems that the lack of Thai competition in the 'hood allows this spot to stay open.
No comment

This is consistently my favorite place for delivery and I love to dine there. The service is a little slow but worth it b/c the food is the best Thai I have had in and around NYC. I order the duckaholic every time and addictive as the name you always have enough for lunch the next day so worth price of two meals. Appetizers are all great go w/ the Shrimp summer roll, or spring rolls can't go wrong. I have had almost everything on the menu but the new additions more traditional Thai dishes are the ones you have to try spicy if you can handle it and all amazing.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My bf and I usually go to Enthaice in Astoria, but gave this place a try. Pleasantly surprised! The staff is super friendly and quick. The chicken satay was on point. I ordered the chicken and broccoli dish (Pad Ka-Na) and it was so good... Don't ever change it! My bf had the Pad Kee Mao which he orders at every Thai place we go to haha. He prefers the one at Enthaice because this one lacked flavor. All in all, we will def be back to try other dishes!
No comment

So for my bday I wanted to try Thai good and my bf yelped and decided to come here. You walk in and choose where ever you want to sit. I ordered duck pat Thai and I loved it. My bf had the red snapper in the garden he loved it but I wasn't into it. It had apples ginger. And we also had the grilled shrimp that I loved with the three sauces on the side. The one that stood out to me was the peanut sauce I couldn't stop eating it. I can't wait to go back here. I loved the decor the women's bathroom had old newspaper articles from Thailand.
No comment

The food was average. The service was average. The waitress got us water and spilled it all over the table, I waited for her to come back and clean but the next time she came was to take our order, that was a little disappointing. Over all the food was OK but their grilled shrimp platter was really nice.

This was the best dining experience my husband and I have had in New York. It was a shining star in the face of the bad service we've received at various other places. Tom our waiter was so kind and attentive catering to our very need with out us uttering a word. A word of caution... When it's says spicy holy moly its hot! Beware! Other than that a great reason to visit Long Island city.
No comment
No comment
Exceptional service! My wife and I went here to eat one day while walking the pier. I had the Tom yum soup and tilapia mango salad was great.
No comment
No comment

I have been to this location many times.  The food are delicious but their services need improvement. The ladies have attitude. My favorite dish there is the Tilapia Chili. All the curry dishes are good. The only two dishes that I don't like are the Tuk Tuk Tofu and the Pad Thai. The Tuk Tuk tofu has not flavor. And for the Pad Thai, the noodle is overcooked. The place is clean including the bathroom. This is the best Thai restaurant I had tried so far in term of food quality .
No comment

I had a delicious lunch today at Tuk Tuk (massaman curry, salad, and jasmine iced tea). The food was excellent and the service was quick. I was in and out in 30 minutes and with a nice tip it was only $13. I highly recommend it.

Tuk tuk's shrimp panang curry is the first delivery order I ate my first night after moving to LIC... That was 6+ years ago.  Since then I have regularly ordered delivery and dined in and have never been disappointed.  Beyond the great and reasonably priced food the delivery is very reliable and fast!
No comment
I love Tuk Tuk. Both take out and eat in I have never been disappointed. Service is fast and the quality is great. This is definitely the greatest Thai food in the neighborhood.
No comment

No comment

What a great Thai place to have in Long Island City. The vibe is relaxed, the seating spacious, and the service polite. The menu features all the typical Thai fare, but being the adventurous person I am, I ordered the pad thai with chicken. The portions are VERY generous, which is always a plus, and Tuk Tuk certainly knows what makes an excellent pad thai - plenty of crispy peanuts, juicy chicken, and a sweet seasoning punctuated by scallions and mushrooms. The dumplings we ordered for an appetizer were also solid, but nothing groundbreaking. What really pushes this place into the 4-star range is its quite reasonable prices and perfectly timed service (i.e., not too quick, but only a small wait for food). Tuk Tuk certainly gets my vote for LIC Thai.

Always wanted to try this Thai place ever since I moved to this area. I finally got a chance to last weekend. Although I only had the Thai ice tea and their very spicy shrimp dish, it was delicious. Service was good and friendly. One of the best Thai ice tea I ever had. If you like spicy food, you should really try out their spice dishes. Price was average. Highly recommend coming here

Timely, friendly, attentive and knowledgable - the staff at Tuk Tuk is incredible. The food is delicious, and I will always come back here. My favorite Thai in LIC! I typically order the Pad Kee Mao. I would recommend it highly if you like your food a little bit spicy.
No comment

My husband ordered a red hot chili snapper two days ago as my little surprise Friday night dinner.  It was an disappointment.  The fish was not fresh, it was fairly dry inside and out and the sauce is watery with not much flavor.  It tasted like eating a piece of wood.  No comparison to the Thai restaurant in Elmhurst.  Not a going back place.

Yum! Best Thai food I've found in the Astoria/LIC area. We ordered som tum papaya salad, spring rolls, pad thai, and green curry. Everything was delicious and well spiced - especially the curry! Generous portions and Singha beer for $5. Will be back!
Pad see ew with fake duck was out of this world. Great service, cool ambiance, outstanding food. Will definitely be back!
No comment
No comment
Really good place and portions are very decently sized. Cute little place great for a date night.
No comment
No comment

I think the place was okay. Food isn't bad with good portions, service is cool, ambiance is nice. If you're in the area and craving Thai food, you should check this place out. My best friend and I always go to Spice when we come to LIC just because it's the most convenient but felt like trying something different today. I don't think it's a bad spot though to be honest but I don't think it's anything insanely special either. Wouldn't mind coming back.

Best Thai ever!! My best friend spent years in Thailand and says this is the closest she's ever felt to being back there!!
Food was decent. Experience was ruined by them not allowing my trans friend to use the restroom of their choosing.
No comment
No comment
We ordered, were in the mood for Thai.  Pad Thai was good but the chicken curry puffs were not good at all.  The Thai iced tea was good and the delivery was fast.
Amazing food!! Great portions. Awesome atmosphere. Very nice staff. Will definitely come back again. Already planning my next visit!
I am a fan of this place. Food is delicious and at a good price, service is quick, the place is clean.
No comment

Local spot in LIC. It has a nice ambiance and fixtures. The food was savory, had the Pad See Ew and it tasted fresh. Would definitely stop in again.
Tuktuk has been open for years, I also lived in lic for 7 years, I still love this place, much better than many other Thai restaurants in the city

The food here wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. I got the "Magic Mushrooms," which was a vegetarian mushroom dish. It was solid, but not amazing. My friend's chicken pad thai was a little.. unusual. The sauce was more sour than pad thai tends to be. Maybe it's more authentic? :/ I'd say the Magic Mushrooms would be a great dish to share family style (otherwise it's just too much for one person!), and skip the pad thai!

It's a nice little Thai place right off the Vernon 7 stop. Of all the Thai places in LIC and Astoria, this is one of the best bangs for your buck. The noodles and curries are all quite delicious, and they also offer many authentic Thai dishes in the "explore" section of the menu for those of us that are more adventurous. So if you're in LIC looking for a place to get your Thai food fix that won't break the bank, look no further than Tuk Tuk.

The go to place for Thai food in LIC. I have ordered from Tuk Tuk and eaten in too many times to count. Food is always good. They have a nice selection of your "typical" Thai dishes and some "rarer" exceptions. My main pain point is not being able to order online here. Sure, pick up the phone. But there are those times when you really really can't.

Really cute neighborhood-y place, with great thai food at a very reasonable price. When my mom visited a few weeks ago, we came here on a whim for a casual dinner without expecting much more than standard Thai fare. The food at Tuk Tuk seriously exceeded our expectations with great spices and flavors in every dish. we had a Roti for appetizer, tum  yum soup, chicken green curry, and beef pad knee mao, everything was delicious, the beef was tender, all well seasoned, and perfectly portioned. I can't believe we didn't stop here sooner, a gem in the neighborhood.
No comment

Went for lunch on the weekend. This place was way better than I thought it was going to be. We tried some funky stuff from the Specials menu that I don't usually see at other run of the mill Thai spots. Everything was quite good. Odd note, but the papaya salad was probably the best I've ever tried. Only disappointment was that my dish was supposed to be very spicy, but it was not really at all. I'm a tough critic with spice though, so take this with a grain of salt. Prob closer to like 4.5 stars, but I rounded up because it was a unique experience. Definitely plan on returning.

For $8 - $10, the curries, noodles and stir fries at Tuk Tuk are a great value. The curries are my particular favorite (Massaman, red, and green) - they are flavorful, generously portioned, and filled to the brim with vegetables. The noodles (pad thai, pad see ew, pad mee kao) are not as good, nor are the stir fries (and neither is quite as good a bargain as the curries) but both are solid options, especially for their respective prices. Delivery was usually prompt, though on busy nights they can be a bit backed up. Recommended if you're in the area.

Probably some of the best Thai food I've had since moving to the city. I would recommend the green curry any day ! It was the best dish I had - way better than the red curry IMO. The Pad Thai was also pretty good but wouldn't order it again. I asked for very spicy and it was indeed EXTREMELY spicy, perhaps not edible to most, but I love spicy so it was delicious - only problem being the next day/few hours of digestion burn haha!
Absolutely great Thai restaurant, beautiful setting, tasty food, very reasonable prices and the staff are super friendly!!!

I love this place! I come here with my boyfriend all of the time. My favorite dishes are the veggie dumplings, the papaya salad, and the pad see ew with veggie duck. My boyfriend loves the spring rolls and the spicy noodles with chicken. The atmosphere is friendly and clean, and it's cheap!
No comment
Good food overall.  Sometimes can be hit or miss.  Can be a 4-5 star and then 3.  Not always clear what items are vegetarian, even if you ask staff (fish sauce, flakes, in things).

OK, food is amazing. I have to admit I was impressed by it. Ordered the Pineapple Fried Rice. But I'm sure you can't go wrong with any of the dishes there. However, only reason why I'm giving them 4 stars and not 5 is that they don't deliver to my job which stinks because I'm in LIC and its really not that far.
First thaï restaurant in NYC in which I found the same flavors that blew me away when I visited Thailand. Everything on the menu is delicious, and the staff is beyond nice and efficient.
Consistently good food and service.  Their delivery is also usually pretty fast.   Appetizers slightly overpriced but meh, I'm glad this place is in the neighborhood.

Tuk Tuk is a great spot for consistent good food and service at reasonable prices. I often go post gym when Im really hungry and am always satisfied. Its not a destination or anything but if you are in LIC and hungry, you can't go wrong here.

The decor is a bit stark and bland after you go in through the moody wood doors, but the food here is great. The tea is good, but nothing special. The roti was fantastic with great massaman sauce for dipping. Nice and fluffy. The duckalicious was appropriately delicious and nice and tangy with the sauce and all the peppers. The skin was crispy and delicious and restored my faith in duck. The pork and wonton dish was also very good and had a nice mixture of lots of flavors yet each component was tasty by itself.
No comment

I get delivery almost once a week. The noodles and the curry dishes are your best bet, but on busy days the flavors and portions can be inconsistent. They prob need to revisit their quality control! It's conveniently off of the 7 train, so it's a great option for calling ahead and picking up on your way home.
Very good food but bad service. I'm from California, I don't expect FAST service but at least a smile.
Deserves the 4* rating.  Had the Tamarind Duck and Pad see ew.  Both great.
No comment

We came in on a Sunday evening and were seated immediately. Fairly busy, but no wait for anyone yet. Everything we ordered was delicious. The roti massaman is delicious, as well as the tom ka gai. The place is clean, staff is friendly, and it's a friendly atmosphere. Would definitely recommend it!

The ambiance is so nice and relaxing, and the food and service is great! A convenient go-to spot for me now. I liked how the food is so flavorful yet clean. Can't wait to go back and try their other dishes.
No comment
Great food, very nice staff, and very comfortable atmosphere. I went with a friend which was our first time and we both loved it! We're planning to visit again!
No comment
Great neighborhood spot for solid Thai food. They delicious, fast and very friendly. Never had a bad experience here.
I liked it. Quasi futuristic decor, little clay pottery and tasty food. Can't go wrong.  I recommend. =)

Good for the area but not so good when compared to places like Chao Thai in Elmhurst (or almost any Thai restaurant in Elmhurst/woodside in fact.)  Prices are high comparably and the food is sub-par, however if you are in LIC, this is probably one of your safest bets.

Came here with a couple girlfriends and though the service was friendly and very fast (almost frighteningly fast...I mean was this food pre-prepared???), the experience was just okay. The ambiance is a bit too bright and cafeteria like and the food was plentiful but a bit bland. The fried calamari were okay but nothing too memorable. My shrimp pad thai was quite bland overall even though it was a huge portion. I think I will stick to Spice for my neighborhood Thai fixes.
Great Pad Tai. Loved the wonton soup as well. Fast and friendly service. Great value as well.
No comment
No comment
Affordable lunch specials on the weekdays in the newly developed LIC!
Tasty neighborhood Thai place.  Good red curry, which is my baseline for good Thai food.  Also good Tom Ka Gai.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Good clean thai food. Little too clean. Asked for a spicy Thai Dish food was more sweet than spicy and savory. Food Quality was good, Clean, Service was ok, should put down plates before serving main Dishes
One of the best restaurants in LIC. I've never had anything less than excellent here. The roti for appetizer is a must - super buttery and flaky.

Just what I expected... walked into Tuk Tuk and noticed the contemporary decor, looked at the menu and noticed the different Thai dishes, took a bite at the food and it all made sense. There's a consistency in everything... and that's modern theme. You won't find straight-up traditional or genuine Thai flavors here.

I had been there twice after strolling through Long Island city.  The place has great service.  A nice cozy space.  Good for groups of 6.  I love the Thai ice tea, has an authentic taste.  We also ordered the fried fish, pineapple fried rice, and beef flat noodle.  They were delicious!!!  Definitely would go again if I'm in the neighborhood.
No comment
had the lunch special, decent prices and portion size. was pretty good but not very authentic.
One of the best Thai food in the area. Red curry is pretty good. Service was excellent. They know how to take care of you.
Friendly service. Pleasant atmosphere. I had their beef pad Thai made spicy and it was deliciously made.
No comment
I *love* this restaurant. Maybe my favorite Thai restaurant in New York City.
No comment

Delicious! I am a huge fan of pad-see-ew noodles and I think theirs are perfect. I've had a few other dishes here and they're really good. I like it better than Spice. Yum!

They deserve a 10 star review! I'm obsessed with this restaurant! Try their pineapple duck curry (house special) and their Panang curry which are remarkably good. Prices are fair. Portions size are ideal and service is excellent.
Ordered delivery from here - food was excellent quality and quantity and very speedy. Pad Thai and tamarind duck in particular were very good.

Really good, attractive restaurant. Great value. I was there for lunch. Had Pad Thai. Loved it. Want to go back and try more of the menu. Cheered me up on a cold day. Also gave soup with the entree. The beef at my neighbours table looked delicious too.

I have been to MANY Thai Restaurants around the world, and this is one of my all time favorites, especially for Pad Kra-Prao (Chicken).  When I ask for extra, EXTRA spicy, it is!!!  Just the way I like it.  I try to visit here for lunch at least once a week.  The service is very good, friendly and fast.  The prices for lunch and dinner relative to portion sizes is exceptional.  Go!  You will not regret it.

My favorite place to go to in long island city.  Awesome food at great prices.  The portions are huge too. This place has very friendly service as well and the ambience has a very relaxing atmosphere.

Tuk Tuk is my go-to for Thai food. The name might sound strange but the food is fantastic! Last week was my second time going there and this place never disappoints me. From the ambiance of the place to the generosity of the staff, it's an excellent place for a small group. I tried the vegetarian pad thai ($8) and had the fried ice cream for dessert - a must try!

No comment

Love this place! I order form here all the time and it is consistently amazing. I always get their spring rolls, red curry chicken and pad Thai. Their food is actually spicy, which I love. I usually ask them to make it extra spicy and it tastes so good! Be careful about ordering their curries if you can't handle spice though!

The best Thai food I've had between Astoria and LIC. The service is always great, they are in a fun neighborhood, and the food is always good. I have no complaints! HIGHLY recommend the massaman curry. Probably their best dish.

I was excited to try this Thai place. Ordered some Pad Thai with chicken which came with the soup of the day(some sort of pea soup). The soup was very tasty and the Pad Thai was deliciously cooked. The portion was more than adequate and the service was prompt and courteous. Great taste, great price and great service.

The food is amazing, but if I were you I would only order from here! Was with my 4 friends for the first time there to sit down and eat(normally I order) and service was not good, 2 ladies served us, we got different drinks then we orders, they forgot one drink, we were still eating the appetizers and got already our main mean and then was cold before we could start! There is only one really cute waiter, that was super nice. Making the  sign with his hands! So nice right ! But that was all! It is cheap, and so good the food! But if you go there.. Make sure you say you want the main meal after the appetizers!!!

Had dinner here for 3 with a total bill of $80. Food is average, do not order Duckaholic - it is absolutely not worth the $17. The Pineapple Fried Rice is also a joke for $10. My friend ordered Kau Gling ($14) which is supposedly majorly spice - it's so not. I think the taste of this place caters to the American palate and not to Asians.

Really good food. Everything we ordered was tasty and the portions were filling. The wait staff was attentive and helpful. My only complaint is that they charge a $10/bottle corking fee. I thought it was excessive.

Tuk Tuk is one of our Go To restaurants. Our favorites are their Chicken Massaman curry with extra cashews and their Pad Thai. Their Green Curry is also quite delicious.  We most often order out due to the smaller portions when dinning in. If you are looking for delicious Thai for a decent price, Tuk Tuk is a great choice.

Pretty reliable and consistent Thai food. Tried and tested we liked items include Duck curry, pad Thai.
Tilapia mango salad - really fresh. Not too spicy. The fish was fried but not oily. A bit too sweet though. Also ordered the Shrimp basil, but it looks like the salads are less oily.

Cute little place. There's never a wait, but it's rarely empty. The servers aren't up in your face, but the service is definitely there. In terms of the food, it's not the best Thai food ever, but it's definitely not bad. Good even. They don't have a soft hand on the peppers so be prepared for your food to be spicy! I think they were even more spicy than the ones we had in Thailand, but that might be restaurant specific. I had the best Tom Yum soup in this restaurant in Lanta and I'm still searching for that same taste. Tuk Tuk is close, but no cigar. Overall, great place for the price and the lack of wait! They are also byob for you wine drinkers!

Went there at around 7pm on a weekday with friend. Spring roll was good. We also had Tuk Tuk Tofu and vegan magic mushroom. Mushroom was full of garlic flavor but the tofu dish was kind of plain and not much tofu in it. Besides, very popular place, so little bit difficult to talk to friends.
My boyfriend loves this place. Personally I think is ok They do have some good dishes. I just worry about that B grade
No comment
No comment
No comment
The staff here is really friendly and the decor is cute. Try their green curry and pad kee Mao! It's pretty cheap too.

I discovered this place on Yelp while searching for Thai restaurants in Long Island City.  The food was great! We were a party of 8 and all ordered something different, everyone left very happy with their meals and the service.  The appetizer portions were a bit small, but still very good!

I usually order lunch takeout from this location. The food is always on piz-oint and always friendly and fast. You also can't beat their prices. Their lunches are $7.95 AND usually last for two days. Long Island City is lucky to have Tuk Tuk, they are great!
All around good Thai food. Not the best in the world but pretty good. The strong point is the quick service and low prices on lunch time.
No comment

We love this place!! It's quick, convenient and the food is tasty. It's not really "authentic" Thai cuisine, but good Asian food and spot on for the price. They have a nice variety of curries, stir fries and some Western dishes too.
No comment
Nice food, waiters are very courteous. But the portion size of their lunch specials is kind of small. You'd better order some appetizers or side dishes as well.

I give the food 2 stars, although the location would be 5 stars for me (it's close to where I live). The food here is mediocre, but it will do if you live in the area and are craving Thai food. Every time I decide to order from or eat here, I end up being a little disappointed afterwards. But they really don't have any competition now, so it works.

wow, this place is bad..... the food was laden with msg, i felt like i had popped 10 sleeping pills, i couldn't keep awake. The veggies on the dish i ordered looked like they had been through hell and back , definitely not fresh, i felt like there was no effort put into cooking my food....... Jesus says no way....thumbs down.
No comment

The food here is borderline edible.  I got takeout from Tuk Tuk, even though my friends in the neighborhood warned that it wasn't that good.  There was nothing extremely horrible about the food, it was just very not appealing and tasted like a child with no cooking experience made it.  We ordered a pad thai, mango chicken and a pineapple fried rice.  The pad thai and pineapple fried rice were very bland, nothing good or bad about it stood out, except that i could probably make them better myself.  The mango chicken had a very thick goopy sweet sauce that was not appetizing at all.  I would not order from here ever again, even though it is the closest Thai place near my apartment.  I am really surprised that they are still in business.  The prices are reasonable, but just not for such bleh food.

Tuk Tuk has sub-par thai food that just happen to be located in a neighborhood that doesn't have too many other options.  Their pad thai is SO DRY.  I had to add tons of lime and my own green chilies to get some flavor from it.  they claim to also be child-friendly but this SO is NOT the case.  the girl that took my order was totally rude, never made eye contact and didn't even thank me during the credit card transation.  is this economy that is the WRONG way to go.  i wont ever return.  tuk tuk RIP

One night, I stopped in at least 5 restaurants in LIC, seeking out some kind of vegan option.  Nobody really seemed to give a sh*t.  They all seemed impatient and bothered, and did not want to accomodate my dietary restrictions.  When I got to Tuk Tuk, I was immediately greeted by THE sweetest waitress.  She was beyond nice and told me they would certainly be able to prepare a dish in a vegan style.  The rest of the waitstaff was also unbelievably kind.  I ultimately ordered a delicious veggie dish with rice.  It was excellent.  As I was leaving the restaurant, a father with his two young daughters walked in.  One of the girls exclaimed, "It smells soooo good in here!!"  And her father replied, "that's why we're here!"  Not only was it adorable, but it's also extremely true -- this restaurant smells delicious and prepares scrumptious food!
No comment

Amazing Thai food, amazing prices. That might not be enough to get 5 stars in Manhattan, but here in LIC it is. This place is great for eating in or delivery. Ingredients are fresh, portions are satisfying, and the food is not heavy like cheap Thai places. If you want a hip urban atmosphere, take the train to Hell's Kitchen. If you want good Thai food, go to Tuk Tuk.

I LOVE this place!  Best Thai food I've ever had!  The food always comes really quickly, and the staff is really nice.  The only drawback is that the restaurant is usually pretty empty, so the atmosphere isn't fabulous.  But the food is incredible, so it's always worth it.  I highly recommend the Pad Thai and Pad See Ew.

Quite tastey and reasonabley priced, if perhaps a little loud (sort of echo-y).  Tried the shrimp summer rolls, duckaholic, penang curry, pad thai, and beef noodle salad.  All the dishes were surprisingly good for a random place in long island city, and when the bill came everyone was happy about the low cost.

The worst drunken noodles I ever had. The first time they made it, it was horribly salty so we asked them to ramake it which they did. But even the 2nd time arround it came out too salty and not testy at all. I love thai food and know how this dish is supposed to test like. I was expecting so much better.

Worst Thai food ever. And the half portion of chicken I got could only have come from some mutant hormone filled freak, it was so enormous and fatty. I suspect they use Monsanto chickens. I will not be going back.

Can't get enough of their Thai Iced Tea, beef pad thai was delicious as well. Servers were more than accommodating, they were so courteous it almost made me a little uncomfortable but no complaints here. The interior is bright and colorful, good place for brunch or dinner.
No comment

Love the food there but they should really try to prevent the noodles are all pressed and stick together when ordering to go/delivery, it is kind of gross and unconvinced that you have to spend time to separate all the noodles before eating. Use a bigger container or fresher noodles please!
They constantly pour you water. Literally you take a sip and they come and fill up. Excellent customer service. Good food too of course
One of my favorite rest in lic. You can taste very satisfying thai food and atmosphere is also nice enough to drink some beer.
4 star. Nice place for lunch and dinner. Love their coconut water. The price is affordable.

I love the decor in Tuk Tuk, It really sets the mood - fresh, pleseant, elegant,  casual, peaceful and modern. The food is always delightful and very reasonably priced. Lots of vegetarian options. Lots for everyone. I've taken a few different groups there and everyone has really enjoyed it - which in my experience is quite unusual!

Fantastic Thai place! I take out for lunch often, and eat dinner occasionally. The Honey Wasabi Tuna (seared tuna) is great. The other dinner special are also good, like the Duckaholic and the grilled shrimp. They also have a lot of standard Thai fare, like Pad Thai, Pad Rama, and all sorts of curries. I find this stuff to be great for lunch takeout.

Bravo! Great nabe Thai place. Not too fancy, not too hole-in-the-wall casual. Staff is friendly. Dishes are familiar and yet they have a unique twist. Portions are decent, as well as price.  Don't trust these reviewers who gave this place less than 3 stars; I'd pelt spring rolls at them all day.

Tuk Tuk has become the standby dinner choice because of the fact that it is very reasonable, the food is excellent, and the table service/delivery is always on point.  If you are a fan of spicy food, then you will definitely love a number of the dishes here including the wasabi tuna and a couple of the items in the From the Wok section of the menu.  The decor is very modern and enjoyable.  I have never even spent up to an hour there because the food is always served very quickly.  You really can't go wrong with this place, both for sitting, taking out, and delivery.
Great dinner with my fraternal little bro. Special props to our server Alexis, she's terrific.

Tom ka gai is so incredibly delicious and complex I dream about it.  Pad Thai is good.  Panang curry is yummy and just the right amount of spice.  mango sticky rice is heaven.  Delivery is quick, prices are great, portions are large

Great food as usual. I have tried a variety of dishes here and have brought many friends over the past several years. If you love Thai food you'll love Tuk Tuk. The curries are perfect, noodle dishes are great, and if you want to try something a little different try the Duckaholic. If you love a hot dish, go for the Kau Gling; it literally made me see stars!
I've eaten green curry in 6 countries and all over NYC. Tuk Tuk is up there with the best of them. If you are a green curry maniac, this is your place. Vibe is good too.
Not the worst Thai food I've had, but also not the best. The value was good for the cost, and they had a nice little wine selection.

Tuk Tuk is our neighborhood Thai place, and while it's perfectly fine, it's nothing to get excited about.  The food is just not the flavorful Thai food that I love.  There is a BYOB night (Wednesday), which is nice.  The service is fine and the decor is pretty cute.  I wouldn't come from anywhere else to go here, but if you're in the neighborhood, it's not a bad choice.

The food is a little greasy and not too flavorful just salty, but my friends who are less familiar with Thai food love eating there.  I'll eat it because I live in the neighborhood.  The decor and presentation is cute.  The staff is friendly.

Beautiful presentation, delicious food, fair price. Had beef prik king and several bites of my buddies crispy duck. Spicy but not killer heat. Only complaint is that their oolong tea came in a tea bag, not loose leaf.

Very good Thai food and reasonable prices.   I typically order delivery, which is usually very quick.  Big portions allow my wife and I to share an entree and explore the appetizers.  The Golden Purse is always a favorite, though it can be a little greasy.  Satay and spring rolls are also good choices.  Highly recommend the Chicken Pad Rama.

I had the curry puffs and the pad gra prow with tofu. The curry puffs were awful. The pastry wasn't crisp and flaky as it should be. The filling was weird and off. Pad gra prow was bland; it tasted like frozen stir-fry.
No comment

It's funny, the first thing that stand out for me about Tuk Tuk is the clean dining area and bathroom. I admit that I'm a little bit of clean freak. I cannot stand typical Asian restaurants mainly because of sanitation issues. 4 stars for the good variety of salads, my favorite is papaya salad. You will be happy with their Panang curry too.
No comment

Came here on recommendation from a friend and it was delicious. I had the good old massaman curry and it had a plethora of veggies and looked freshly made. Everything in their menu seemed delicious,  sure I will be back to try their other stuff :)
Their food is on point. One thing that bothers me is that they got B rating...

I am so glad I finally tried this place. I came with 8 friends and we got seated pretty quickly. The food was good and I liked the decor. The servers were friendly too. I will definitely be coming back again to try another entree

Tried the Pad See Ew and red curry. Both were excellent, but I think the pad see ew is the best I've had in a very long time :). I can't wait to come back for the more adventurous dishes, and order from them in the future.

Staff were great, very kind and friendly. The place is pretty and the music was great. Only problem was the food was really less than average in my opinion. We had the pad-see-eu (sp?), massamam curry with roti appetizer and one of the specialty chicken dishes from the back of the menu. The roti was really good, but everything else was super sweet. The food was sweet to the point where I no longer wanted to order dessert and could barely finish my food (and the dessert was mango sticky rice, my favorite!). I definitely won't be going back. Sorry Tuk Tuk!
Food was pretty good.  Kind of on the sweet side for me,  but not horrible :) service was good and they have a very handsome guy working there,  just saying :D

We ordered the calamari, wonton soup, basil fried rice with shrimp & pineapple duck for 4 people and we had left overs. The bill was $42. Service was great. We were lucky to get a parking just on the street. Overall a great experience!

Went here for dinner a few nights ago and found the food to be quite delicious. I don't go out in Long Island City much but this truly was some excellent Thai and a good value.  Ordered the chicken satay appetizer, pineapple shrimp fried rice and spicy chicken green curry. The green curry was excellent well spiced with a nice assortment of vegetables. The fried rice was equally delicious with large chunks of pineapple and large well cooked shrimp.
