My only criticism would be that I found the chicken satay a bit dry. Overall an excellent meal and I will be coming back the next time I am in Long Island City.

Tuk Tuk seems to be pretty popular in the area so my girlfriend and I decided to give it a shot since we already been to Bella Via a couple times already. I ordered the Thai Steak and she had the Pad See Ew. Portions were pretty hefty and there was a lot of flavor in both dishes. Everything was great but the only real problem was that the table we were seated in was really wobbly, it became kind of annoying but we could not move since it was crowded. Would definitely come back but I hope I could avoid the crowd just in case I get seated on a wobbly table again.

i ordered green curry with shrimp this past Saturday. My experience was pretty good at this restaurant, until 15 minutes later after the dinner, I got very bad food poisoning and was sent to ER... horrible experience... I definitely will not come back again. Watch out when you order shrimp here.

When I had dinner at Tuk Tuk, it was a cold winter night and the place was next to empty (sounds like a rockin time already, right?).  Inside, it was drafty and I had to keep ordering jasmine teas to keep my paws warm.  The food was decent - we ordered the Tuk Tuk Satay (which was the best part of the meal), the Tuk Tuk Tofu (won't make that mistake again) and the Pad Thai (nothing to write home about).  I think we have to go back and try something else.  I think it's still worth checking out again.
Really cool looking place. Great owners and cool atmosphere... Oh, and the food is wonderful. AND CHEAP PRICES!!!!

It is very hard to find Thai food as good as the stuff I had up in Boston where there are a lot more southeast asians, but I was very pleased to find this place upon moving to LIC. They have some more authentic dishes listed in a special section of their menu that are definitely worth checking out. The portions are humongous, and a great value, particularly compared to the new branch of Spice that opened up down the street. This is definitely a regular stop for me!

This place was okay. I was hungry so I went here. Food was good, not excellent. I've honestly tasted better Thai food but this place isn't bad. Giving it three stars for customer service and food presentation.
Delicious authentic Thai food and drink with a modern feel. Very inexpensive and great portions. I had the pad Thai, spring rolls, rice and tried their Thai iced tea. All great flavors.

I have been here a few times over the last year or so and this is probably the best Thai place in the area. The food is fresh and well cooked, and the decor is readily cute, comfortable and kitschy. I would definitely recommend the Pad See Ew with beef and a glass of Riesling.

Pregnancy cravings brought me here for a banhmi sandwich. I have to say the chicken banhmi was a bit tough but the beef banhmi was oooohhhh sooooo good. The place is modern and friendly. Will go again.
No comment
The food here was very good. I ordered Pineapple fried rice and it was amazing. The service was good here as well. I would definitely Recommend this place and I would come back as well.

Best Thai place! Their food is delicious, ambiance is comfortable. Perfectly quite to have a calm chat with friends. Service is great, and price is affordable. Their fake duck is a rare but tasty item. My favorite is Massaman curry, but I love many other dishes. You should try them all!

I really wanted to like this place. The bathroom wallpaper is a fascinating 19th century map showing Alaska as "Russian America." The prices are good and the food is tasty, but I cannot eat it. Don't go here if you have a food allergy. We requested no onions on one dish, sent it back, and when they finally delivered an onion-free dish, it also had no tofu. And my stomach was off for several days after eating here.

we have gone here a lot because the prices are reasonable for how good trhe food is...and especially how big the portions are!! pad thai and pad see ew are our go-to's!! so tasty and then have the left overs. service is always quick and nice..also a big size restaurant that can   allow for larger groups or last minute dinners

Went here with 6 people. We had two orders of the hot pot dumplings- disappointed to say the least. One of my friends and I had pad thai, we were extremely disappointed. The pad ke mao was pretty good but not the best. The basil fried rice and tom yum soup was pretty good. Thai iced tea was way too sweet. Would not return.
Great Thai food in LIC. They never fail you. I've traveled to Thailand several times and this is as close as it gets.
Great pineapple fried rice and pad Thai with chicken is delicious. The servers are friendly but service is a bit slow. Defiantly a gem in this neighborhood!

When i have no idea what to do about dinner, take-out from Tuk Tuk is the go-to. I don't love their Massaman (i used to work in a Thai restaurant, so I take my curries seriously!), but have liked everything else I have had from there... That being said, I had one batch of Thai iced tea that wasn't great...but that was only once among many.

This place is great.  Between dine-in and take-out, I probably eat here at least 2-3 times a month.  Wednesdays are good for dining-in because they have no-corkage fee for outside wine.  Delivery service is prompt averaging under 30 minutes.  Best item on the menu is definitely the pineapple curry duck, but you really can't go wrong.
No comment

Good food Good service! My favorite is a Wonton soup! Which is I ordered from here many time for my breakfast! Once I ordered the soup for my friend, he said this is the best soup that he never had! You should try! ;)

Wow! The pineapple fried rice was amazing. It's a very large portion that feed the whole family and was a huge surprise and enjoyment for all. Also try the coconut water which was awesome and in cute container to boot.
So good!  Moved to LIC and have missed authentic Thai available on the West Coast.  This food is delicious.  Reasonable prices.  Fast service.
No comment

Great little Thai spot. Excellent service too. Pad See Ew and Pad Thai rocked the house, as did the Green Curry. It's not the ultimate Thai Food, but it's very good and affordable, the drinks are great and cheap.

They have a great lunch menu, under $9 for most of the items. Very new and modern interiors. It's never too busy during lunch time so it's a good option if you're in the area and feening for some affordable nom's.

Great food at a great price!  Compared to many other dining options in LIC, this place is as reasonable as it gets.  Friendly staff and a decent menu too.  I'm eager for the special chicken dish with spinach rice to appear on the board outside again... and coconut fried ice cream is a decadent favorite!

Very good thai food. And reasonably priced. The room is nice however a strange layout with a large open floor in the middle of the restaurant as you walk in and the tables down the sides. Could be a cozier atmosphere if it was reddish bed.

Really enjoyed our meal there. Pleasantly surprised by the diverse and authentic Thai menu. Both of our meals were delicious and the food is incredibly well priced for what you get. Service was fast and friendly. We will definitely be back.
Best Thai food in NYC! The beef pad gra prow is amazing, as is the chicken pad thai. Makes the trip to LIC worth it.

Of the many Thai restaurants in LIC  Tuk Tuk is by far the best. Fresh food, and great service. The truth is in the dish, whether your into Red curry, pad kee mao , pad se ew, or pad thai.. They all rock!!!!  Definitely recommend
Terrible experience ! Service is really bad and food equally bad !  We got really disappointed.

Tuk Tuk serves up some really tasty Thai food. My faves--chicken green curry and tom yum soup.  I love that they have an "explore" section of the menu where you get to try not-underspiced-for-the-American dishes.

My go-to Thai place in LIC!  The food is authentic and tasty, and the staff is super friendly and always smiling.  Nice cozy, clean and modern ambiance if you dine in.  Delivery is usually relatively fast and the delivery guys are some of the nicest around.  Highly recommend!
Decent Thai food, ok service.  A few dishes I had were somewhat bland.  My favorite is the curry chicken, which is pretty spicy.  I prefer to order take out here over dining in. Reasonable price

A Thursday night booking at 8pm for two. Not many people when we arrived and we asked for a table away from the door The service was great and we ordered a bottle of NZ wine and a few starters (calamari) as well as 2 mains. The starters we great and this is where it goes down hill. As soon as we had fishing the appetizers the mains arrived, literally within a minute. Not wanting to eat the main immediately I waited and asked to have it reheated but it came back cold. After the second time it came back hot but the shrimp was so overcooked it was not edible. Staff great,  food OK but make sure you ask if you want to wait between the courses.
No comment
Nom, nom, nom, nom, nom....this food is freaking delicious! I love this place! Both delivery and eat-in are phenomenal. The staff is friendly and the ambiance is awesome. EAT HERE!

Big portions for fair prices. I'd eaten the pad thai, duckoholic, beef with peanut sauce and broccoli and the mango chicken. Delicious food, quick service and nice ambiance. I love this place as well as Leng Thai in Astoria.
I like this little place near my apartment, good Thai food reasonably priced with decent price. Their pad kee Mao is great and can get extra veggies for free!

Another solid Thai restaurant that I can recommend in Queens.  This place is conveniently located to the train station, has a nice modern decor, and the service was fast.  I had the duckaholic and it was a fantastic blend of spices with well cooked duck (not rubbery).  The prices are fair, the food was tasty, and I didn't get sick despite their "B" rating outside!  I was very happy that they didn't dumb down the spice level like so many Thai places and instead of being a purely sweet endeavor this place packed some heat.  Makes me want to try their sister sandwich shop down the street.

Tuk Tuk is a great spot -- very inexpensive, plentiful, good food.  Some dishes are a bit greasy, but that's to be expected with Thai.  The atmosphere is fun, and the service is very good.  It's a great option for dining out in this corner of Long Island City.

It's hard to find good Thai food.  That being said, I was pleasantly surprised when my curry chicken arrived!  Mmmm probably the best I have had in a long time.  Next time I'm in LIC, I am going to pay Tuk Tuk a visit.
The roti massaman appetizer is amazing. The peanut sauce is pretty decent. However, the Pad See Ew wasn't the best ever. I do have enough for leftovers. I just want more roti!

Cute little Thai restaurant on a hustling bustling LIC street. They serve great meals that are well portioned and very reasonably priced. The staff is always friendly and I am always impressed with how clean it looks. I love their chicken pad thai, curry, and thai iced tea. When I'm in the area, this is one of my go to thai restaurants.
BYOB Wednesdays :) Love their Tuk Tuk Tofu! This is a great spot to bring a big group as it's spacious. I'll be going back very soon!

Not what it used to be. Years ago before my wife and I moved to LIC we used to go to Tuk Tuk and their food was fantastic. I'm not sure if they've changed their kitchen or owners or what but its terrible now. The wait staff are rude and obnoxious and carry the "customer is never right" attitude. Their pad thai is gross and can barely be called that. Their food is over-priced and not worth the cost. I'd recommend steering clear of Tuk Tuk if you're looking for dinner.

I know LIC is not far from manhattan, but it's psychologically far. Even so, I'd travel to LIC for the green curry here. The portion is huge and comes with a ton of vegetables so it feels substantial. It's also sufficiently spicy, and I'm a Brick Lane certified curry monster.

I was so suprised by how big this place is inside! Great for meeting a large group of friends. Prices were reasonable, food was good, and there were a few more choices on the menu than most standard Thai joints. Will def return

I guess I have a higher bar for restaurants in NYC.  It's definitely a place for solid asian/thai food but it's not great.  I think in any other city, especially something like LA, this would be a 3 or even a 4 if you're feeling generous.  But for NYC where there is a city full of amazing asian/thai food, it isn't amazing.  The curries are good and so are the soups but it's not any different than some suburban place at a strip mall full of white people.
Awesome food. Hot lovin in the oven.

Its a stand by for me these days. we do delivery from Tuk Tuk at least every two weeks and eat here about once a month. The service is decent, the space is cozy and the food and price are right on point for what they should be.

I really like this restaurant.  Ive been here multiple times and each time the food is quick and easy.   its reasonably priced and its not hard to find in location.  However.. with the warm weather upon us.. they really need to step up ventilation!

I am new to Long Island City and when walking around, it looked like there weren't a lot of restaurants around. From the outside, I barely even noticed tuk tuk cuz it is kinda dark and tucked in. Luckily, we saw their sign, and it looked cute and clean.  We went in, sat on the side that was part booth.  The menu was pretty big and what was great, was that they had two price points for the food. stuff under ten dollars and stuff over that.  Quite good if someone doenst' want to spend a lot but still wants to get big good portions. I did get the massaman curry which was okay - a bit sweet for my taste. But the drinks were cheap, the enviornment was nice, the service was good, the toilets clean.  If I lived close to here, I would definitely frequent this place a lot more.  If I lived in Long Island City, I could see this as being my 'go to' thai place....

Went to Tuk Tuk with a few friends for lunch on a weekday and their lunch specials rock!  There's about a dozen entrees you can choose from with a salad for $7 plus tax and tip if you sit down.  You can't go wrong with any of the selections.  I've had the Pineapple Fried Rice, Pad Kee Mao, and Pad Rama so far and they've all been great and full of flavor.  Nothing is too greasy either.  Service is pretty damn fast for the weekday lunch with entrees that are ready in 10 minutes.  I'm usually in and out in half an hour and can make it back to work in a timely fashion.  With it's selection and great prices, Tuk Tuk is a great place for a quick weekday lunch and I'll definitely be coming back here to eat whenever I need to work in LIC.

Solid Thai. 4 Star Tom Ka Gai (I consider myself an expert of this Thai soup in a coconut broth). The Pork Dumplings were good - I didn't like the consistency of the the pork. It seemed like it was sauteed before it was put in the dumpling, so it sort of spilled out. The Pad Thai was some of the best I've had in New York City. Having said that NYC is not known for its Thai food. Several American Cities have much better Thai. I like it alot and it is in the neighborhood, so its all good. Great atmosphere too.

I honestly wish that I could love this place. The service is friendly, the atmosphere is inviting, and the price point is lower than most restaurants on Vernon Blvd. The food is agreeable enough that I keep coming back, but never because I am craving their dishes. The spicy dishes never seem spicy enough (something that I find central to the cuisine) and the pad thai is often just bland. If only SriPraPhai in Woodside was in walking distance...sigh...

Only been here once, for lunch, w/ a group including 4 ethnicities, 2 vegetarians, and a couple cheapos, including me. All were satisfied .  Special props to the reasonable lunch prices and that mysteriously awesome orange iced tea stuff.

Decent Thai food in LIC with decent prices. You can't really compare this place to some of the Thai restaurants in the city (i.e. Cafetasia, Klong) but if you're in the area and cravinng Thai food but are too lazy to go into city, this will do! Spice opened up around the corner, but think Tuk Tuk is slightly cheaper. The other downside is that they got a B health rating...

The food here is really good. This is my go to thai take out. I really like the pork pot stickers and the basil friend rice, the massaman curry is delicious as is the coconut soup. I am a pad Thai junkie and this place is good, although not my favorite pad Thai of all time. This place is old faithful ;)

This place is really good.  An excellent green curry packed with a lot of spice.  My wife thought her Pad Thai was one of the best she had ever had.  And the prices- mid $30s for two people with an appetizer...$11 for most entrees...cannot beat that.  A real winner of a place.
This place is great! Food was delicious, very reasonably priced, and the atmosphere is really nice. Definitely recommend.
I should have eaten my red curry dish on their cool couch! Nevertheless, my dish was yummy and I like the decor.

I've been in the neighborhood over 6 years and I've never had a bad meal here.  In fact, some dishes, like the pineapple duck curry, are among the best things I've ever eaten (and I've been to Thailand).  There are some Thai places in NYC that might have some more extraordinary dishes, Like Chao Thai in Elmhurst and Sripraphai in Woodside, but for a consistently excellent meal, Tuk Tuk gets my vote.
A great place on a budget.  I usually order the satay chicken, tom yum soup, or their papaya salad.  All of which are tasty, though the food can be rather greasy....

Love this place for some good spicy curry or pad Thai.  The spicy pork pot stickers are soooo good.   Service is always friendly and very quick, prices are reasonable.  I would call myself a regular, and proud of it!
Awesome! Great food, attentive staff, great curry dishes, all the dishes are enjoyable.
Love this place - never wait for a table, service is exceptional and food is superb ...
Solid Thai food. Cheap and fast lunch special. VERY SPICY. I like it very hot, but the green curry there was just too much for me. The panang is about as hot as I can go, but that said, it is great.

Went for lunch with a friend.  Good atmosphere.  Affordable prices, especially with their $7 lunch special.  Quality ingredients.  I had the Vegetarian Duck Salad and the Green Curry.  I highly recommend both.
Great food.  Great value.  Good for a quick healthy bite to eat
Pad Rama with Beef is my favorite. Thai iced tea also. Nom!
One of the best Thai places I've ever been to.  Solidly spicy when spicy, flavorful even when not.
Great decor, friendly service,  fairly good food and affordable.  BYOB on Wednesdays...definitely worth a visit.

Tuk Tuk is pretty much the go to place in LIC for Thai food and pretty good for the value.  I had the hot chilli red snapper which was very well done, especially the skin was very crispy but also very juicy, which is difficult.  Also, I have had their noodle dishes before, pretty delish and cheap.  They also do delivery so it's nice on a lazy day too.  Would recommend.

Thank goodness for this lovely Thai food joint around LIC. The food is authentic and tastes quite yummy. The restaurant itself is very small (3 tables and 5 stools). It's a cash only place and service is efficient. You place order at the counter and wait for your number to be called to pick up the food. If you are dining in, make sure you snatch a table before ordering. Have tried a few dishes and my favorite is Pad Kee Mao with beef. Too bad I only come here for lunch (since I work in the area...really just want to dash after work). Saw their Duckaholic on the dinner menu. I'm a huge fan of anything duck. Hopefully they will add a duck dish in the lunch menu in the future. BTW, the food is spicy so make sure you order the correct level of spiciness or suffer from consequence. =)
Some of the best Thai food I've had in NYC. Check out the Tom Ka Gai soup. Mmmmmmmm.
Delicious, cheap, service could be improved as the server wasn't slow at first, but the food is delicious!

Oh man, this place is so good. I had the penang curry and my boyfriend got the grilled chicken breast kanom-jeen, and both were delicious. Prices are good too--for the two of us, it was just under $40 (for an appetizer, wine and an entree).
Terrific food, very fast and friendly service.  Great for takeout but also nice atmosphere for eating in.  Highly recommend.
Great Thai restaurant, good food, good service, good value.  I have tried most things on the menu and have always had a great meal.  The service and ambiance are marvellous as well.

3 words: Pad Gra Prow.  So yummy.  We order delivery from here quite bit and have been very pleased with all the food, delivery time (15-20 minutes - it's nuts!), and prices ($9-$11 for standard dishes).  I've eaten in as well and it's a cute little place - it lacks a little personality but not a big deal.  I would absolutely recommend this restaurant, especially to the locals looking for an option in the neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

Food is aite. Nothing to rave about. The service, however, is horrendous. Don't expect to strike any kind of decent convo about the food, menu options, or asking for that rice doesn't crack your teeth. Delivery is probably a nice compromise.
No comment
No comment

Tuk Tuk is our go-to take-out place. It's probably our favorite restaurant in LIC (at least based on the quality/affordability scale). Favorites are the Massaman curry (sweet, spicy, and savory), pineapple fried rice (deliciously savory and sweet), green curry, Pad Thai, and Tuk Tuk Tofu. We often order more than we can eat in one meal so we have guaranteed leftovers! Most of their curries, noodles, and rice dishes let you select meat or tofu, so it was nice option for my vegetarian dad. The restaurant itself is quite lovely to eat at, too.
No comment
I love the friendly staff  and welcome any local place that delivers in a rain storm.

This is my go to for Thai food.  Their pad thai is tasty, but I just recently tried the basil fried rice which was outstanding.  One word of caution though.  When they say something is spicy, they mean it!  The staff are very friendly and there is never any trouble getting a seat.  Take out is also very speedy and will take credit cards over the phone.
No comment
DELICIOUS!!  We go here often because we don't love any of the Thai places in FoHi as much as Tuk Tuk.  Prices are great, the staff is super nice.  I am a huge fan of Tuk Tuk.
No comment

The green Curry is great and the Thai ice tea is okay, but God for bid if you want a take out order, you will be standing there for at least 15 to 20 minutes. The atmosphere is nice and very romantic and very classy and quiet. I have taste better Thai food before, but this is located in Long Island city and I didn't really expect anything else. Tuk tuk tofu which is actually really good is one of my favorite lunch specials to order from here. Expect to pay no more than 10 to 15 dollars for a solo bill, if a table for two bill should be around 30 to 40 dollars including tip.

Hands down the best lunch spot in LIC. The $7 lunch specials can't be beat -- big portions, rich flavors, and 12 different dishes to choose from. (I'm working my way through the list, but so far the Chicken Pad Rama is my favorite.) Decor feels surprisingly upscale given the price point, and service couldn't be friendlier. This would be a definite 5-star for me, if it weren't for the current B sanitation rating.
I absolutely love this place. The food beats most Thai I've had in NYC & the prices are great. Delivery is quick & service is friendy
No comment

A couple of friends swear by this place... so after a lot of talking and not much tasting they finally took my girlfriend and I..... Oh man, not what I expected at all! The kind of place where everyone at the table doesn't say a word. Only coming up for air to say 'thank you' as your water is being refilled as soon as its about two notches from the bottom. Great service, nice decor, AMAZING FOOD!!! Craving it ever since, as I live in Miami, FL. Why? I 'm now a believer (not that I ever really had doubt but you know)!
Tuk Tuk offers dependable, delicious food. It's a really relaxed, laid back vibe with super-quick service and some of the best, most consistently good Pad Thai I've had. Great for take-away as well.
Great food!  The deliver is speedy, the prices are low, atmosphere is easy.  Perfect for locals coming  home from work or just need to get out
No comment

Consistently good and light Thai food.  Service is also very friendly.  I know that Gaw Gai in Court Square is owned by the same folks but the food really is very different and we much prefer Tuk Tuk.

I'm giving this place 5 stars for having consistently good quality food and service for over a year.  I am happy to be in their neighborhood and love having somewhere I can pop in for lunch or dinner and know that I am going to have a great experience and a great meal.  I have tried many things on their menu, all are fresh and taste great.  Prices are reasonable and lunches are a great deal.  The service is always friendly and attentive.  They serve alcohol but also have a bring-your-own wine night with no corkage fee on Wednesdays.  Check it out, it has definitely become one of our go-to places.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Just joined Yelp and needed to start with Tuk Tuk.. Best place in LIC for Thai. I have lived here now for 4 years and I eat here or take out at least twice a week. Very convenient being so close to the 7. Nice atmosphere and also quick delivery. Food is cheap with large portions. The best thing is the food is consistently the same every time you order. Never any disappointments..

i've eaten in and i've ordered delivery from here. I order the pad see eu every time I want thai food. The food from this place is consistently good. Not a fan of their thai ice tea though. It tastes too watered down.

Being new to the neighborhood, we tried this place for take out recently.  Everything was bland.  Pad thai was really mediocre as was the coconut rice, which had no flavor.  The chicken satay was overcooked.  If you crave Thai, its better to go to the city and get some better food.

I ate here with a few friends on a Monday night and were promptly seated and served. The decor of the restaurant was simple and pleasant without bing overdone. Having spent some time in various regions of Thailand traveling I have often been unimpressed with Americanized Thai food but was blown away by this place. The food tasted authentic and best of all was affordable. Paying the comparison of one US dollar for pad Thai on the streets of Bangkok and finding places in NY that on average charge $15 is a bit hash so Tuk Tuk was amazing value for amazing food. I had the masaman curry but those with me had various dishes in which they were all happy with. The little tuk tuks in the lamps were a cute touch of the most prevalent mode of transport in Thai cities. Service was also very prompt. Will definitely be coming back here.
best thai in he area. nothing special. they have tasty peanut dishes and always super fresh veggies but the other sauces can be off.

I ordered Thai BBQ Chicken . They never sent me the rice, they didn't sent me a knife, and that chicken comes with the bones, so there is no way to eat it at work other than looking like a caveman in the floor with your hands. I am glad there are so many options in the area.

Dined at Tuk Tuk about 10 days ago and the food wasn't terrible, but they displayed BLATANT PREJUDICE to my lunch date and I.  When my friend asked to speak to a manager about the situation - the wise ass told us to come back at 11:00 pm...while they close at 10:00 pm!  It is obvious that they don't want African-Americans there - so, I would advise that we (and anyone else against such ugliness) should spend your money somewhere else!

This is by far my favorite place to eat in LIC and NYC!  I love the basil fried rice, the spring rolls, pad thai, pad sei wei,. its all very tasty and its affordable and the wait staff is always friendly and helpful!
Great and tasty thai food at a great price.  We usually get the pad see maw, the red/green curry or the pineapple fried rice. All good.  Would definitely recommend this place.
Food is great but they keep getting B rating from health dept!  Other than that, no complaints.

This is a really terrific and unique Thai restaurant, I eat there often. The Thai Steak is my favorite, just-the-right spicy, very tender and served with scrumptuous scallion mashed potatoes -- a nice Thai twist! I also love that they have different specials every week, like the best Won Ton soup I've ever had, it's a complete meal in a bowl! Every weekly special is something new and different, never a disappointment.  Great service , great prices and nice neighborhood feel...

The first few times I went there, the food was awesome.  They gave a good portion of tasty food.  It was spicy enough with alot of beef or chicken with rice.  After a few times, I noticed the portion got smaller and I just stopped going there.  Its becoming like the rest of the other Thai place where they serve a little portion of food.

Food is quite good but the service rendered initially was below par and could do with some improvement. The staff member assigned to our table was grumpy from the get go and literally banged the plates of salad down on the table. It did get better with the person that brought in our main courses. The rating of 4 is a reflection of the food and service - 5 for the food and 3 for the first impression with service.

I only had a problem here once where I just didn't like the food. Otherwise I've always been 100% satisfied with them. I used to live pretty close and I'd order in a lot and they were always speedy and kind. All in all a great place!

I've only had their food via delivery, so I can't speak to their actual dining experience.  However their food is delicious and very reasonably priced.  They consistently deliver quickly and their Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, and Pineapple Fried Rice are great!  Love the Thai iced teas too.  Whenever I walk by their restaurant it is always bustling with happy diners.
Dont believe the hype. Bland food all around

First time eating here this evening. We ordered the shrimp summer rolls which were steamed to just the right stage of tenderness with a sweet dipping sauce. Had a thoroughly enjoyable meal of Mee-Kiew-Hang -- pork with noodles, bok choy, peanuts and tasty little won tons in a warm but light sauce from the street food menu. I asked the waitress to help me choose between this dish and another pork dish. Her sudden enthusiastic smile when I mentioned this one sold me and I was very pleased with the meal. My spouse really liked his food too (a chicken special whose name I've forgotten). We'll definitely be back.

Awful food. Lax Service. Don't even bother ordering delivery, they will make you feel like you're bothering them. Do yourself and your taste buds a favor, this is NYC, there are plenty of great Thai options here. Look elsewhere.
Great dine-in or to-go.  An extra waitperson on staff (at any given time) would be a plus, but still a positive service experience.

The staff is so nice that I'm reluctant to say that the food is only so-so.  Every dish seems to have the same flavorings.  I go here often, but it's like going to the deli for a sandwich, you know?  Something inexpensive and ok, but nothing memorable.  The Pad Thai is...Pad Thai. The way tuna salad is tuna salad.  The Pad Grow is bland but ok.  The Tuk Tuk tofu is ok.  All of it is what my husband calls "functional food."  You won't say, "wow!"

Still not as authentic as other thai places in queens.  Tried the pad see ew this time and for some reason it was off.  I would say the pad see ew flavor was very light and a little bit salty.  Service is quick and take out took about 15 minutes.

I used to come here twice a week because I love the Tilapia salad, but the other day the "customer is always right" value went flying out the door, that is after arguing with the guy that works there in the daytime (not sure if owner-if so, poor way to run your business).   Fried Rice was the issue, and for the first time in a restaurant we were basically scolded over not knowing that basic fried rice was spicy, though the waitress who took our order RECOMMENDED (meaning we didn't order it from the menu) that we get it and said nothing of the spiciness.  No big deal, right?  Well it was to this guy and we ended up paying for it and taking it home in a "goody" bag just to get tossed out.  The really funny thing is that just across the street, a Spice has recently opened.  Guess where I go for my Thai now...  I tell this story to all my clients and friends (yes, I live and work in LIC) and some actually have a similar story with this guy.  One word, RUDE!

I must say, WOW!  What a great staff.  Had a party of 5 for mother day.  Made reservations the thursday before.  Table was ready for us on time!  That is a biggie for me.  I was with 3 picky women.  Different sizes and eating habits, along with my dad.  And verybody loved their dish as well as the resturant.  Great enviornment.  Had the red snapper in the garden with white rice and since yelpers speak about the pinneapple rice..why not on the side??  The tofu was very good.  Will be back to this place, without a doubt!  ohh yea, and the music...great stuff!  jazz...

very good - been living in the neighborhood for 4 yrs now and i come here consistently.  the food has never disappointed however i do notice the prices have gone up and the portion size has gone down... service is always satisfactory, not superb but hey it's not a 5 star restaurant here.  the only thing i would say is weak is the drink.  on my most recent trip i ordered pinot grigio and it tasted really flat (if that makes sense) ... almost like watered down wine. gross.  i am going to stick w. soda or water for here. but all in all a neighborhood stable.

This is awesome if you like delicious Thai food! Staff was very friendly and more than  happy to serve you. I loved my Pad See Ew and the Thai Iced Tea had the perfect balance of sweetness. I would definitely visit this restaurant again.

now this is good thai food! went here after a show for a late dinner and was surprised with the quality of food! i ordered the grilled lemongrass beef noodle salad and my girl ordered the duckaholic which was amazing! portions are a good size and you will leave full and satisfied.  good place to go on a date if you plan on staying local in LIC.  prices are competitive and the place is very warm and welcoming.  i will continue to go here and order for take out as well!

Great food, but uncomfortable seats.  They have good shrimp summer rolls, and very respectable pad thai and duck dishes.  I'd avoid their crab cakes though- they appear to be a frequent dinner special, and they have the consistency (and taste) of tuna fish...

Heard great things and after one visit I agree with them completely! Definitely going to keep coming back for the panang curry chicken and to try many more things! The staff is friendly and helpful. Great prices and portions! The three of us each took home almost half of our entrees to have for lunch the next day. Bottles of wine are priced $20-$25 so is a great slip for the table.
I have been going to Tuk Tuk since it first opened, great food and the service is always good. They are kid friendly too which is a plus!
probably my favorite thai in the area.  only flaw is that they don't deliver to greenpoint so i have to go pick up.   favorite is the pad rama.  the staff seems to be very friendly.
My husband and I eat here or order takeout at least once a week.  They have consistently good food at a great value.  I love their curry entrees, particularly the panang curry with bok choy!
Great place! I love our (almost) weekly date nights at Tuk Tuk. I thoroughly enjoy unwinding here with a glass of wine and good food.

I've been to Thailand a dozen times, grew up with Thai people and in general I think NYC's Thai food sucks.  Maybe it's too far away from Asia so it's harder to get authentic spices, not sure.  That being said I'm a regular at Tuk Tuk because it is VERY close to being very good (with certain dishes).  The spicy basil fried rice with chicken is the closest I've had to the real thing in NY and the Pad Prik King is also very good.  If you don't deviate from traditional items you're fine with the exception of the Pad Thai which I think is a little too "Americanized" but I guess the owners have to dumb it down for the locals.  I used to live in Greenpoint which has a bunch of Thai food and I still walked over the Pulaski Bridge for Tuk Tuk...
My boyfriend and I like this place and order to go from here frequently. My favorite is the curry puff appetizer!
Fantastic little place. My wife's favorite restaurant in our neighborhood.  Definitely in my top 3 as well. Hot pot dumplings hit the spot!

Horrible.  first take-out was fine, not great, not horrible.  The sit down experience-horrible.  Slow service, condescending waitress. Had to hail her to finally get her take our order. Monday night, not crowded.  When ordering I asked if the Pad cashew was mild, and she said yes. I was starving and started eating & my mouth was burning. seriously!  The dish was littered with dried hot peppers.  REALLY???  Not spicy? Mild? When we complained-they-the waitress and so called manager actually smirked at us.  Really funny...anyone who knows (has) Barrett's Esophagus knows it's not funny at all.  Will never, ever, EVER return.
I love this place the best Thai food I have had!! I just wish I lived closer ...

Not an expert on Thai food -- but we had a great lunch mid-afternoon at Tuk Tuk.  My wife had Massaman Curry with Chicken and I had the Tilapia chili -- both were great.  both dishes had subtle flavorful seasoning.  We had the marinated grilled pork skewers and the veggie spring rolls as appetizers -- again very tasty.  Service was pleasant and efficient.  Portions were good sized and the price of everything was reasonable.  Overall a very good eating experience.  I would recommend

This place is consistently good, with solid prices. I do think some of the reviews here are over the top. This is not the best Thai I have had, but always consistent. The currys are good, as well as almost all of the noodle dishes. Bring your own wine on Wednesday's which is great as well.
Veggie duck, I love you! The food here is so delicious and good. The spring rolls are crisp and yummy! The service is excellent! The pad thai is amazing. Yum!!

LOVE THIS PLACE! About 4 weeks ago my wife and I had a small lunch date here. It was very empty which we actually like because it was quiet and we like to talk. We were seated right away very nice. I ordered the Pineapple duck Curry and veg and my wife had the Duck Tamarind IT WAS COOL GOOD AND GOT ALLOT FOR OUR BUCK!... ohhh but we had the apps first right.. yeah I had the Hot Pot Dumpling and my wife had the Tofu Salad with the Ginger Soy dressing EXCELLENT! Food came out fast. We washed it down with some wine and Had alot of time to Talk! We are going back really Soon!!
Great food for a good price they deliver too, the place is clean and modern looking everything I had was so good. Great find!

I've ordered from Tuk Tuk over the past two years and the food is very tasty. However, after my experience with them last night, I will never eat there again. I called in an order that THEY got wrong. When I went back to the restaurant to exchange the food for what I did order, I was met with hostility from the manager. She claimed it was MY mistake, because she didn't understand what I was saying on the phone. Excuse me, but we speak ENGLISH in this country, and if you can't speak the language of your clientele, then maybe you shouldn't be answering the phone and taking orders. They refunded my money, and refused to give me what I ordered. So goodbye, Tuk Tuk...you Suk Suk. From now on I'll take my business to Spice, that just opened up one block away.
Very nice servers and amazing food!, wish I would have found this place sooner, and it's a great spot for ramen as well
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of the VERY few places with a cute/modern atmosphere that feels clean in Chinatown. We love walking around in the neighborhood, but the eating establishments there are usually VERY sketch. We were REALLY surprised to find this place and it turned out to be awesome in every way. Great service, food, drinks and an excellent value during happy hour. The Ramen was delicious, as was the rice bowl, the pork boa buns, shrimp shumai, an squid skewers.  Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Definitely a new spot in the ramen rotation. Loved the tonkatsu ramen here, perfectly rich and full of pork flavor. Serving size was very generous. Pork gyoza were also 5/5 wonderful. Nice cute space that is well decorated and cozy.

Walked in here at 4:30 for happy hour and I was seated immediately!! I ordered myself a glass of plum wine and jalapeño chicken wings to start and they did not disappoint. The wings were crispy, flavorful and not too greasy. I wish there was a dipping sauce that came with the chicken but it's still one of my fave dishes! I also felt hungry after drinking my wine (which was decently strong and sweet) so I ordered Takoyaki! It was crispy, creamy with pops of umami and also chewy from the octopus. That was really fun to eat. I can't wait to come back here the next time I am in the area. There are so many more items on the menu I am excited to try.
No comment
No comment
The ramen broth was rich and filling, the service was quick we sat and place our order and got our ramen. I just wish they had more selection.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Really great happy hour prices, sake, and ramen. The spicy selection adds great flavor but isn't totally unapproachable. Great appetizer selection as well!
The ramen is decent. The appetizers were eh. Nice place to try. Won't be back. Broths weren't too salty but when I got closer to the bottom a little too much.
No comment

This place was delicious! We got a little worried cause it was in a random alley, but the food is great! The oysters were amazing, def try the barnstable. The takoyaki was some of the best I've had. We also got the spicy tonkatsu ramen and the katsu rice bowl, both were great!
Solid happy hour spot- lots of fun and delicious items to choose from. We tried ramen, octopus balls, wings and oysters. Staff are friendly.  Looking forward to our next visit!
No comment
No comment

A quaint little ramen shop that also has an oyster bar. The place can seat around 25 and an outdoor section (wasn't open when I was there). I ordered the spicy tonkatsu and requested with the noodles a little undercooked. Noodles were cooked to my liking! The toppings were very sparse. Pork was cooked to tender goodness but something with the broth didn't impress me. Wonderful service, clean bathroom, nice decorations.
It was great! Staff was nice, ramen was delicious, and apps were rich! They took into account modifications well, and I definitely want to come back and try the salt broth
Great ramen - light broth, could use a bit more seasoning. Would recommend and would order from them again.

Came in for some ramen on a crazy craving however something made me pause and I ordered appetizers first. Not too many as not to get full but enough to give it a try and see what's what. That's where the trying ended. Ordered a negori (yum! Actually a delicious unfiltered heavenly sake) then got seaweed salad, chicken bun and shrimp shumai. The seaweed salad was soaked in a unpleasant overpowering dressing that's usually just a footnote with others so the sesame flavor could shine. Then came the shumai which was drenched in sauce and lacking in shrimp flavor. The bun. The bun, it was nicely moist however the chicken wasn't crispy and resembled more of a chicken nugget texture/flavor. Overall the place wasn't a let down as the appetizer were edible it just didn't make you want to eat more.
No comment
No comment

$1 happy hour oysters are what lured me to this place for a second time. We got a dozen and they tasted fresh and they were cleaned and shucked very well. I got the Miso Ramen and it was decent but the broth did start to taste a bit too salty towards the end. Overall this place always has great service and decent food for an affordable price!

Tasty, unique and high quality ramen. Glad I discovered this and would definitely come back here on a cold day. I had the spicy Tonkotsu ramen and it was perfect. My partner bravely ordered the Salt Ramen and it was so unique and amazing - highly recommend. The ramen was essentially inside a uniquely herbed but still perfectly light chicken broth (no more salty than the other ramens!). We didn't do an appetizer but a lot of guests where there for an oyster happy hour which we'd partake in next time.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: $1 oyster happy hour, $5 plum wine, great service, and delicious ramen? I can't get enough! I wish I lived closer. Overall, solid place and great spot for a small group of friends to get a night started.

I've never had a good experience getting ramen delivered at home so was skeptical this time, but was really craving it. I'm so so happy I went ahead and ordered from Zest because it did not disappoint! I got the Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen and it just hit the spot! Would definitely order again

It's a SOLID 4. I don't know what to criticize other than well yeah you can go deeper and spend more budget on manpower putting details to the broth or watevs but THIS place has everything you need for a night out. They got the appetizers, booze and the table. You can dine with friends or date, atmosphere is there. Beautiful interior ambiance, more into traditional Japanese feel. Price is on the medium to affordable. Service is standard, nothing to complain. Very nice people.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I love ZEST! I must say that the food here is amazingggg! I love my pineapple fried rice and California rolls. I order all the time from here and they never fail me. They are super clean. Robin the server is such a sweetheart super attentive and very helpful in choosing what to eat. The ambience is very calm and quite. I will always come back and definitely recommend
No comment
Great food and service, best ramen I've ever had? No.. but it was at a solid level and the wait staff were super on top of making sure all went well.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Zest ramen is managed well and has good staff they are nice and tend to your needs , the ramen is good even tho most options are pork based (i don't eat pork) my ramen with chicken was good , and a good earthy meal , THE BEST THING I ATE ON THE MENU WAS THE THAI SPRING ROLLS  we had to order like 5 more orders it's a crispy on the outside and shrimp and crab deli on the inside ‍‍‍

I ordered the Miso, my wife ordered Tonkotsu and we both had two orders of the Pork Belly Baos. Everything was insanely good, the best in fact. My wife and I both woke up craving Ramen; which sucks because there is no good Ramen near us. The flavor of the broth was perfect for both soups. It actually gets a little spicier towards the end, but it's still very delicious. The portions are also perfect. The baos were so good that we ordered two each. The best part about the Baos is that the pork was not just a bunch of fat. It was actual crunchy pieces of pork. I highly recommend this place. If you can make reservations I would also recommend doing so. It's rather small so I can only imagine that it gets packed on a busy day. We will be back here the next time we go to NYC.

Whenever I'm in New York City, I figure out a way to get down here to eat ramen. It's my favorite ramen place in the city. Have I tried all of them? No. But I have been to several places that left me wishing I had spent that money on the Korean ramen I can buy and cook at home. But not Zest. Once I discovered this place, I am hesitant to try other places. The broth always tastes so good and not as salty as other places, and the noodles are always perfect. Their appetizers are also yummy but I don't usually get any because I'm so excited about the ramen and it fills me up!
Delicious! Ordered ramen for takeout and it was ready when I arrived. The restaurant looked super trendy and I would definitely go back.
No comment
This is an approved place to get ramen. The whole meal didn't disappoint except for the small sushi, but other than that . (I forgot to take a picture before I digged into my spicy miso).
No comment
No comment
No comment
Wanted to go to another place nearby but it was packed so we went here instead and I was not disappointed. Literally emptied the bowl it was so good.
Good flavor !! I got the ramen and added wavy noodles and my boyfriend got a spicy tuna and crispy rice app and spicy salmon roll. Everything was fast and tasty ! Would order again

Came here for dinner with my sisters after a spa day together (pre-COVID). This restaurant has been on my radar for some time and I was so glad that we were able to squeeze in some time for ramen. My elder sister raved about the purple fries here and she was absolutely right - they are delicious!! We each ordered a Tonkotsu Ramen and the broth was so flavorful and creamy with ample amount of perfectly cooked toppings. The space is a bit tight, but service was great and the atmosphere was fabulous. I'd definitely return again to try a different entree and order more purple fries! Nom nom!
No comment
Very attentive, amazing service. Recommend going during happy hour! Perfect spot for meetings or hangout with friends

I came here on a chilly Thursday night right before happy hour ended. I ordered oysters and the spicy miso soup. The oysters were okay but what I expected. I really loved the spicy miso! Felt great on my throat. When I arrived, it was pretty empty which I loved for dining alone. By the time I left, the place started to get a bit packed and the single waitress seemed overwhelmed. This place is so close to my apartment and I'm really glad I found it.
Very tasty , fresh and great customer service ! Was greeted and seated immediately . The pork dumplings were delicious also. I highly recommend this place .
Amazing service!!! Stumbled upon this place in my neighborhood. But worth coming back to again. Ask for spicy ramen
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Completely unplanned visit turned into one of the best culinary experiences I've had. We got the pork gyoza and Shoyu ramen with the works. Hands down one of my top 3 ramen places visited to date. The gyoza was crispy and thin skinned, the shoyu broth gave me chills. It was rich, flavorful and full of umami. The pork belly was full of fat and richness. I never really finish a bowl of ramen and I almost licked my bowl at this place. LoL..highly recommended and I will be back 200000%.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite ramen spots In NYC. it's always not too busy which is nice and we get seated immediately. The food is amazing and I highly recommend the gyoza and yuzu salt ramen. The drinks are great too and service is awesome
No comment

Solid ramen. Went during happy hour, where drinks and apps are $5 each. Enjoyed the outdoor seating, casual ambiance, and yummy pork tonkotsu ramen. Portions were good, oftentimes I cannot finish ramen bowls but this one was the perfect size for me.
No comment
No comment

IT'S BACK! Zest Ramen just reopened today after the pandemic and has been my solid go-to local ramen spot, happy hour or not, for years. I'm so happy to get my rolls and ramen and rice bowls again (hopefully they'll have oysters and clams again soon!)

Zest Ramen is one of the best ramen spots in the city. They currently have outdoor dining with heaters and dividers. Their vegetarian ramen is so underrated and comes with delicious tomato broth, enoki mushrooms, bok choy, corn, scallions, bamboo and fried onions... such a hearty meal.
Dropped in for late lunch indoors. Service and food are very good. There's outdoor seating and a lucky red maple by the entrance.
No comment
No comment
This spot is absolutely amazing! Huge portion with a. Free appetizer for happy hour. Staff is accommodating and friendly
No comment

LOVED THIS SPOT! FOOD WAS DELICIOUSSSS and there was a all day happy hour $4.50 on certain sakè & beers the service was great our server was such a nice funny man. Very nice, set up was perfect on the table. I'm soooo glad I came across this gem!
No comment

After a second visit, I think Zest Ramen is one of the best ramen shops in New York City, even before price considerations. Their tonkotsu ramen, with black garlic oil, continues to be amazing and distinctive. Their shoyu ramen, with a deeply flavorful broth, is wonderful, too. Zest seems to have iterated on their pork buns since our first visit; they are among the best we've had in New York City.

Absolutely love Zest!! I was so happy to see they opened back up and have outdoor dining. 2nd time here and I will definitely be back again. I had the Yuzu Salt Ramen with thin noodles instead of wavy. So, so flavorful and they give you the perfect portion. We also had the crispy & spicy appetizer. Crispy rice with spicy tuna on top, awesome! Love this place and will definitely be back.
This place is so good. My friend and I were visiting Chinatown and found this place best decision we ever made. The staff were so sweet and nice.
No comment

So happy. Memorial Day Weekend has been cold and rainy. A hot bowl of Ramen really hit the spot. Have been to Minca but wanted to try someplace new. Zest Ramen was comfortable insdoors and we were pleased to see they hadn't abandoned best practices even though COVID19 restrictions had loosened up a bit recently. The service was friendly and our ramen was delicious. So glad to have found this neat spot tucked away on the LES.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great place for ramen! The outdoor dining was warm with heaters. The ramen was delicious with great happy hour deals 4-7. Hot sake and ramen is much appreciated in the cold.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came in for happy hour on a weekday night! (Happy hour seems to last until 7 during weekdays) Got oysters, takoyaki, tonkotsu ramen, and some sakes. All were pretty good and i have to say i was very satisfied with $9 ramen! (The price seems to be normally $11-13 so i think even then, its not bad!) i had the plum sake which i really enjoyed, pretty sweet and went down easy.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Every time I'm in New York City, I always make the trip down to a Chinatown to come here. This is by far the cleanest, friendliest and best ramen stop I've come across. The ramen come in a beautiful big bowl and if you get the pork belly it just melts in your mouth. The Happy Hour specials are cheap and honestly amazing but even the regular priced menu is cheap. I took my boyfriend here on a date and it's cozy and comfy especially at night. I definitely recommend you give it a shot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is okay. If you're hungry and want noodle soup, this will do. But if you're looking for authentic ramen, this isn't it. The ramen isn't very flavorful. It's more like basic noodle soup, with some of the usual ramen toppings. The noodles were thin and seemed similar to egg noodles instead of what you would normally find in ramen. The appetizers were decent but nothing special either. Service was fast, but I went when there weren't many customers. The people there were nice.

Run to this place! Delicious food, cheap lunch specials and warm, friendly service. Nice outdoor setup. Bathroom super clean and well decorated (sounds funny to say) with a chalkboard to leave your message!
Love this place! Everything is fresh and always consistent! Flavors are delicious, friendly staff, cozy vibe! Been coming here for several years. So glad they are still in business!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I only had the vegetarian one and was rather disappointed. You can make great vegi ramen without using tomato and creating a ramen like soup that tastes nothing like actual ramen
No comment

Came here on a Sunday because my boyfriend was craving ramen and we had my pup, Miso, with us. This was the only place I knew closeby that allowed dogs as they have a table by the door. Been to this spot numerous times for their ramen and it never disappoints. Love the flavor of their broth and the texture of their noodles!! The customer service at this shop is also phenomenal; the waiter even offered water for Miso! Best part, they have happy hour specials everyday from 3:30pm-7pm!! My boyfriend opted for the Tonkotsu Ramen ($9) and I got 2 pork buns ($8). We also ordered a side of chicken for Miso, which she thoroughly enjoyed. My boyfriend enjoyed his food and I thought the pork buns were delicious and well sized. You also get a cup of cold tea to end your meal which was very refreshing. If you're in the area you should definitely check this shop out!! Great food, atmosphere, customer service and prices! What more can we want from a restaurant in NYC?
No comment
No comment

This place is the tastiest ramen in the EV/LES area -- and yes, I say that knowing that Ivan, Momofuku, Ippudo, and Tastu are all just minutes away. Great ramen with bold, fresh flavors. Excellent customer service. I'm just sad they don't deliver to my place!
No comment
This place was such a delightful surprise. Everything was delicious + they have an amazing happy hour! Will definitely be back!
The ramen was okay, the pork had a lot of fat on it (there was a lot more fat than pork meat). The staff are very friendly. We checked into the restaurant on Yelp and got a free sake!
No comment
No comment

Ehhhhh.....ramen was okayish but it had a hint of game in the flavor which made me queasy at times. The broth was very nice but the meat was not tender and very thick and fatty. The service was very nice even on a busy day. The water they give you I couldn't even drink it. The cup or the water smelled sooo fishy. The atmosphere in the place smelled very oceany because of the oysters thank goodness we sat near the open door.
No comment

They were sooooo good. I've already came here twice with my boyfriend in the span of a month. The ramens were delicious, and super super reasonably priced. I will definitely be coming here again. Also, both times I was there it was the same waitress. She was very nice both times and very good service. Very attentive on refilling water.
Raman is yummy but I like the family style service more , very cozy and will go back again !

We came here for dinner.  We started with the purple potato fries (5/5) which was cooked perfectly and not over seasoned.  We also had the pork gyoza (2/5) which was not flavorful and you could tell it was likely the frozen ones bought from a store.  For ramen, we had the yozu salt (4/5) which was unique and you can really taste the yuzu flavor but not too overpowering, and the tonkatatsu (3/5) which was ok. The noodles and soup were ok but the pork belly didn't have much flavor.  The place is small and crowded and a younger crowd. Music is on the louder side but you can still carry a conversation.  Not the best place for ramen in the city but for around this area, it is OK.
No comment
No comment

Okay, so this is a quiet, and unassuming spot located on Eldridge tucked away next to Vanessa's dumplings and across the street from the Flower Shop. And so, this local gem doesn't get the attention it deserves. I highly recommend their happy hour appetizer specials, that's how I came to know this spot, their shumai, takoyaki, edamame, oysters, and skewered squid take the cake. But above all, jimmy, Jimmy is a gem of a human who'll remember you from years earlier and will cater his time and attention towards every patron with the same cadence. He's a sweetheart who know how to serve you and your group! 10/10 recommend for the value! THANKS JIMMY
No comment
No comment

We went to Zest Ramen a few weeks ago. I must say I enjoyed my dish. I got the Spicy Miso Ramen. It was very good and full of flavor. The pork belly was tender and full of flavor. The ambiance is great. The reason why I give it three stars is because the other types of ramen that my GF our family got were not as good. They were eating out of my bowl more than their own. They didn't have too much flavor and were a bit oily. Maybe it's better next time for some one else.

Went there during their "happy hour" from 3:30 to 7 and had their $9 ramen. Very delicious and affordable! Love ramen. Flavorful broth and nice fatty tender pork. Also had their takoyaki-nice and piping hot and delicious.
This is one of my favorite ramen spots in the city. We ordered the tonkatsu ramen, spicy miso ramen, and the gyoza. All were excellent.

Let me start off by saying the food is decent. I loved the broth, the noodles but the chicken was extremely undercooked and scary to eat. The workers tried to ensure me that it was cooked a special way, adding to why it was that texture-- but I know raw chicken when I see it and I am just happy I didn't end up getting sick. They gave me the fried chicken as a courtesy for my comments on the food, but honestly I just wanted my money back. Great place if you want to be unsure or what you're eating.
If you are looking for great ramen, this is not the place. However, If you are looking for mediocre ramen with good price, this is it. Plus, bun is good.

This is my go to place for happy hours. They have $1 oyster, $9 ramen and $4 for small appetizers. I tried most of their ramen, all taste pretty good. Even if you kiss the happy hours, the regular price is $13-$14, which is also reasonable.
No comment

Passed this place many times but didn't have the time until today and I'm glad I did.  I showed up during their oysters happy hour.  They had a great selections of oysters and the staff was very helpful explaining each oysters.  I went with 3 each making a dozen.  The oysters were fresh and you can taste the ocean.  I also ordered the spicy tonkotsu pork noodle soup.  It was not spicy but leaves a burn in your month.  The pork was tender and favorable.  The noodle is chewy, just the way I like it.  The best part is ramen was 9 dollars.  You can't find in midtown.  This place is always packed after 6 so I was there at 330.
No comment

Very cozy place with amazing food!!! The place is busy but the wait is not very long. We tried the spring rolls and the gyoza and I have to give it 5 stars! It was great! The tonkotsh ramen was delicious. Overall an awesome experience. Super affordable, the servers are very nice and the food is tasty. I will definitely be coming back

A really cute but fantastic ramen place. Its hidden on the inside streets and a tad bit far from the center of chinatown. This ramen place blew my mind. I grew up eating ramen and never really experienced the complexity of flavors that i experienced with this ramen. Shoyu ramen is truly the best one to get, we had the miso which was good but not great. The wavy noodles are reminiscent of the basic ramen we can buy at the supermarket but far superior in terms of freshness. This place is highly rated in my book. I will definitely be traveling back.  The bathroom and the restaurant is small but everything is really clean and your able to write comments on the bathroom wall (how fun!). Also the sweet server gives you a shot of green tea at the end. Overall a fantastic place for ramen. They also have $9 ramen happy hour from 3:30-7 which we missed but we will be back for.

My friend went back and told me that this time, her bowl was orange-red. They had actually given her spicy, meaning last time, they gave us the entirely wrong item. I find that strange since we each told our server spicy, and she repeated it back to us. We should have asked to confirm, but we were also the only two people in the restaurant, we ordered the same thing, and she couldn't get our order correct. Red flag.

Good ramen at a great price! Loved the spring rolls too. Service was great, ambiance was nice, seemed very clean, wasn't too crowded at the beginning of their happy hour, easy to get to from the train. It was the perfect meal for a chilly, rainy false autumn day. Will definitely be returning soon!
No comment
Not good. This is not ramen.  It is Chinese food that they are calling ramen.  There are so many places in the area for real ramen.  Don't bother eating there
No comment

I came here with a friend on a Friday night around 6PM, and it was already packed! We ended up sitting at the counter which was fine and a bit quieter than probably the rest of the restaurant. We came during happy hour which was great, and I ordered the spicy miso with wavy noodles. The food took a bit of time to arrive, but once it did, it was great! The noodles were perfectly chewy and there was a load of them. The meat wasn't very good though as it was hard, not flavorful, and thick; not the normal chasu. There was quite a bit of it though, four thick pieces. One of them was tender, the way it should be, but the other ones were really hard. It was also quite fatty, which I'm personally not a fan of. The egg was runny and awesome, but it wasn't flavorful enough either. There was one piece of fish cake, and lots of spicy oil. I liked how spicy it was! Service was alright as our waters were filled and dishes were cleared away appropriately. I may come back just for the cheap ramen, as $10.88 post-tax for a bowl of ramen is pretty much unheard of! I was mostly turned off by the pork belly, but maybe I'll try the chicken next time and it'll be better.

This place was so awesome! Went in on a whim looking for a good place to eat after not finding seating elsewhere and absolutely loved it! Happened to walk in during Happy Hour (3:30-7pm) and got $9 Ramen, $4 drinks and $4 apps! Awesome spot!

Good food and good price - def recommend the happy hour deal- you get one ramen and then any one drink/app for free and any after that are $5. They have ours door seating too, so you can drink hot sake when it's chilly out.
No comment

The Ramen was delicious I got the spicy tokotsu along with a fried chicken bun which was also good. If you like sweet alcoholic drinks the plum sake is the perfect choice ! Definitely would recommend and I plan on taking another trip. They also gave us a shot of green tea at the end of our meal which was a nice touch to cleanse my palette.
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Friday night with a couple of friends. It wasn't that packed so we got seated immediately. It is a very dim place but I didn't really mind. We ordered the spicy tonkotsu and spicy miso ramen which were both pretty good. The noodles had a nice chew to them and the sauce stuck to the noodles pretty well. The broth has a nice kick to it so if you're not a fan of spicy things I would avoid that. The pork was soft and broke apart easily and the egg was perfectly cooked. A lot of places don't know how to properly make a soft boiled egg but this place did it well. Overall I would definitely come back! For $12 a bowl that is pretty cheap and if you check in on Yelp you get free sake as well!

This actually seems like a legit ramen restaurant, and after eating here and it really is a ramen restaurant. It gives you ramen you would get in Japan and I'm not sure if it is the same quality as the ones in Japan but it is the best one so far that I've been too.
Everything was great. We had the fried oysters, pork buns and calamari appetizers which were delicious. Ramen was also great. We came during happy hour and the prices were great. Service was fast.

This was the best vegetarian broth I've ever had at a ramen restaurant. Normally, vegetarian ramen is so bland and boring. They make their veg broth with tomatoes and it is so flavorful and rich. My boyfriend loved his spicy miso pork ramen. We shared the fried chicken appetizer and it was delicious, too. I loved the dipping sauce. We will definitely be back soon.

First time going to this location it was a very intimate place. I ordered the pork belly bun and Miso Ramen. The pork belly bun was amazing, it had the sour carrot and white raddish with hoisin sauce, which reminded me of a vietnamese sandwich. The pork belly was super soft same goes for the pork belly in the Miso Ramen. Their Miso Ramen was delicious too. I've cleaned the whole bowl! Their soup was so flavorful and light. The staff was also extremely friendly. They even asked if I wanted to try samples of their special wine or champagne. They were very welcoming!
No comment

I tried dontaksu ramen and shoyu ramen so far. Both are decent. I prefer thicker noodle and more ingredients in the broth. If you like traditional thin noodle with simple yet deep broth, this would be the perfect ramen spot for you. The service was great and the location is close to Grand St. Station. I would've given 5 stars if the price a bit lower, considering I can get a pretty good $3 to 8 lunch around Chinatown area.

Zest Ramen is a hidden gem. The restaurant has a nice vibe-Cool music, high ceiling, and large seating areas. Authentic Japanese Ramen noodles are the best! I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.
We had a lovely lunch!  Great service, delicious dumplings and ramen, we will be back!
No comment
No comment

As all Australians know, we can't be without our Asian food. As Australians in NYC know, it's notoriously difficult to find good, authentic Japanese food at a good price. Zest Ramen nails it! A perfect bowl of ramen. Noodles, broth and the soft boiled egg take the cake. Their appetisers should not be overlooked either - the Takoyaki is my favourite. My partner and l came here twice in one week due to the delicious food and delightful service. Give them a go, and bring your friends too. Cheers!
No comment
No comment
The best takoyaki i've ever try. The place in chinatown is small but so confortable and cute, the restroom is very different with walls for you to write. The price is great and  lamen very tasty.

I will never forgive this city if we let this place die during these difficult times. They are doing $4 drinks all night and they have a cover for the rain and very affordable apps. The ramen is great and the pork buns are insane. The whole meal with drinks was $30/person. There are cute lights so it would also be a great date spot. Go, even if it's raining. I swear. I will never forgive you.

Love this ramen spot! We got the spicy miso and tonkatsu ramen. It was a very generous amount of pork belly, ramen and broth! You can also add extra ramen for extra 2$ and other ingredients such as seaweed, bamboo shoots, etc for 1$ extra. The broth is extremely rich and the noodles are perfectly cooked. The price is very decent for the LES; ramen from 11-12$. Their pork belly bun was really flavorful too, 2 buns for 7$. Overall, I love this spot! Will be coming back for ramen fix.
No comment

Their Shoyu broth is delicious. The service is friendly. But overall, their ramen fell short of greatness. The chashu was overcooked -- rough and chewy rather than tender, as one might expect from slow-cooked chashu. Noodles were slightly undercooked. But the prices are good and I may come back to try their other dishes.

This is my favorite ramen in the city. Its leagues better than ippudo, with quality ingredients, great flavor. Zest has not only great ramen but appetizers are spot on delicious. I would give this place 6 stars if I could. My wife and I have come every other week since we have been so lucky to find it. And the cherry on top...Dollar oysters

How does this place get such a a high review?  It serves subpar ramen coupled with basic frozen Japanese appetizers.  Throw some oysters into the mix (I'd check tags before trying) but kind of busy-ish for a saturday night.

column3: Griffith Park/Los Feliz, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Mediocre at best. Ended up getting the spicy tonkontsu. The broth taste was not great and the pork ended up being really chewy and hard to eat. Ramen meat should be extremely tender since it is a soup after all. It was almost like I needed a knife and fork to cut through it. Left 2 stars because the noodles were cooked nicely. I'm sure there are better options in the east village.
I've ordered their ramen delivery twice now, and will order again! It's difficult to face a successful delivery ramen, but this certainly was. Perfect for that comfort night in

Terrible service, will never return. Food is ok. Went on Saturday, not busy a few tables. Read the strong reviews and was looking forward to trying this spot but was very disappointed. Got our apps before our drinks, when we asked the server about them she quickly said oh yeah which should have been a red flag. She got my husband's order wrong so we had to wait for his soup while I had mine. The server only said a quick and half ass 'sorry' bc I kept making eye contact while we waited for his food. It was rushed so noodles were under cooked. He didn't finish it. And after all of that nothing was taken off the bill. So we paid full price for everything and still left a tip even though it wasn't deserved.

The space and ambience is nice and our waitress was extremely kind. She was very attentive. I ordered the chicken bun, takoyaki and ramen. Both appetizers were good. I got the spicy tonkotsu ramen, the broth and noodles were flavorful. I think the price was very reasonable for the items. The only thing I didn't like was the char siu in the ramen as it was kind of soggy and chewy. Almost like the texture of raw pork belly although I know it was cooked. They give you a little sip of iced tea at the end which is nice! Overall good ramen and ambience, I would come back if I was in the area and wanted some ramen.

How often do you come by a good ramen spot here in Chinatown?! This is definitely one of the places you have to come and try if you're craving ramen. I had the tonkatsu ramen. It's a MUST! The pork belly literally melts in your mouth, soup base wasn't too salty, and ramen is bouncy and chewy - just the way I like it. I highly recommend this place!!

column3: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: This is the best ramen place. I ate here to catch up with friends visiting in NYC and the ramen was tasty, flavorful and so enjoyable. Definitely coming back for more. Also amazing customer service and they give a shot of tea at the end.

Delicious! They have a vegan Ramen made with veggie broth and veggies! Delicious! The waitress was so kind and graceful! Highly recommend! I posted a video on Instagram and all of my friends want to eat here! I will definately be returning!
No comment

Zest Ramen is a hip place. The ramen is decent, but the appetizers made it a complete meal. Big fan of the purple yam fries and the fried squid. The ramen broth was clean, the noodles were average, the meat was good, and the egg was perfectly soft boiled. The service was amazing.
I love this Ramen spot. Probably one of the best in NY. The atmosphere is amazing! I can sit here and chill with friends for hours. And the server is really sweet and kind.
No comment

3:30-7p happy hour DAILY - can't complain about that! You'd think it would only apply to apps but they discount their ramen so that it's only $10! The fact that they also have oysters may be interesting to some.. but I love oysters so it's a-ok for me! As for the ramen, I ordered the tonkotsu - it came out quickly and was piping hot, broth was delicious but I wish the cut of the pork was a little thicker and it had more of a char on it. Otherwise, service and  music selection was good, atmosphere is cute - small, but you didn't feel cramped, and there was a steady stream of customers.

Had only an opportunity for a quick oyster happy hour while awaiting a takeout order nearby, but look forward to coming back to try more! Great $1 oyster specials and a cute and welcoming Asian themed atmosphere.

The place is small but nice and cozy. There is not that many options on the menu but what we got was chicken ramen. Omg! Like a home made. For only $11 and if you would like to add any other things its $1 extra. The staff is nice, very attentive and fast. Always checked on us if we are ok or need anything extra. Great location as well.
Cute and cozy place. We only have sake here and the sake came in a real cute can. It is 7 and 10 dollar sake and it came in a 200 ml can. Very cute, sweet place to hang out .
No comment

Just dine at zest ramen and I must say their ramen was super delicious my tummy was very happy. I ordered their yuzu salt, tonkotsu ramen and takoyaki for appetizer. Their tonkotsu was rich in flavors and the right amount of fat. Their yuzu broth was out of this world good it was savory and light with a nice hint of yuzu it's a must try. The noodle texture was fantastic, it was nice and chewy. Their appetizer was also very delicious especially their takoyaki. The prices for their ramen ranges from $11 to $12 which is relatively cheap compare to other ramen shops in nyc as well as additional toppings for just $1 to $2 extra! They also offer extra soup for just $5!! And extra noodles for $2! Their prices are unbeatable as well as their ramen broths. I can't wait to come back and try out all their other items on the menu. This place is definitely on my top 3 for best ramen.
What a awesome experience. People in here are happy, and also the place is very consent. Give it a try u will be missing out in $10 ramen, and 4.5 apps/ sake!! Super yummy
Blew us away! Went in with an open mind, without any expectations. Broth was rich and savory, noodles were fresh and firm, with a pleasant chewiness to every bite. Scores 4.2 out of 5 stars.
It was good. Yummy vegetarian Ramen. Hubby took meat based Ramen and says it was good. Reasonable price. Service was slow. Waited a long time but was worth it.
No comment

Came here for a weekday lunch. Had the Tonkotsu ramen + corn: broth was creamy and the black garlic oil elevated the flavor nicely. I liked that it wasn't overly salty where it could leave you feeling thirsty for a few hours after consumption. The thin noodles had good bite - nobody likes soggy noods, right? Egg was soft boiled perfectly. Pork belly could maybe be charred more so that the less lean pieces wouldn't make you feel as though you were chewing straight up mushy fat. Don't get me wrong, I love me some pork belly, but the three slices I had were basically all fat and no meat. The price was very reasonable and portion was great, most other ramen spots average $3-5 more per bowl.

I came to Zest Ramen on a rainy Thursday afternoon at 3:30 and had their $9 shoyu ramen for their happy hour. It was the best time to come and I highly recommend taking advantage of their happy hour deal. For the ramen, it was very filling and the broth was rich. The noodles were also good, along with the bamboo shoots and fish cake.
