No comment

Cute spot to refuel close to SoHo. Baked cookies were fresh out of the oven. Coffee and lattes were good creamy good. They have a few bar seats in front but a whole other section in the back with about 4-5 tables. Nice deco and quiet atmosphere.
No comment
One tiny croissant cost me $3.50. More than an americano. I used to be a huge fan of this place but I've got a growing suspicion that it's completely overrated.

The lavender hot chocolate is probably the best thing I ever tasted. At first sip, you literally are confused because it is such a different taste but by the second sip, you realize that you have been missing out on amazing hot chocolate your whole life. The cups are gorgeous too. I ordered a salad but I can not remember the name. It had apples, blue cheese, carrots, walnuts and some other items. I really liked the salad but my only problem with it was that I constantly found huge pieces of blue cheese and either I ate a huge piece by accident or was cutting it into smaller pieces. Besides that, it was great.
Very cute place, the lavender hot chocolate is a must try. The quiches were very tasty too.

I've been to Maman a handful of times when in Soho. This place is small but super charming and quaint. They always have a mix of varying pastries available, some being a tad eclectic. My favorites are the pistachio chocolate croissant and the nutty chocolate chip cookie (which could rival Levain's). I usually get the coffee, but the lavender hot chocolate is worth a try!

Great coffee and ultra soft cookies. A little too chocolatey for me but still delicious. Americano was also very good. Very limited seating in the back but really cute decor. The area is perfect for grabbing a coffee with friends or even doing work.
Quaint little French cafe! Pastries look AMAZING and the drinks are good as well. Seating is plenteous and the wifi and bathroom are added bonuses.

Such a cute store, bakery, and patio. There are some interesting food options, but the food was just ok. The service was great! We had 5 kids with us and they accommodated with high chairs, plastic cups, etc.

Great place for brunch! Chill and lovely! They had a lovely store outside and the restaurant is hidden behind the store. It took me a while to figure out where the brunch place is located. If you are looking for a place to chill and talk with friends on weekend, I think this is the right place.
No comment
No comment

Maman is a nice little bakery and lunch spot in SoHo that has recently received a lot of hype over its chocolate chip cookie. This review is for that cookie only. GrubStreet said it was "crispy enough on the outside -- like Blue Ribbon Bakery Market's excellent cookie -- with the kind of soft, melting interior that reminds you of Levain Bakery's famous creation." This is nothing but a bunch of artfully-phrased BS. The cookie that I received had an interior that was too hard and was nowhere near the soft melty goodness that Levain produces on a consistent basis. Yet again I find myself deceived by the restaurant industry hype machine. At least the size of it was substantial enough for the $3.75 price, but in my view, Levain is still the undisputed champ.
No comment

(1) Awwwful service. Waitress tried to take away a plate when I was ACTIVELY EATING IN FRONT OF HER. After a half-hearted "oh sorry", she placed my friend's fork in front of me. Another waitress took away the water jug- I thought she took it to refill, but NOPE she never came back so we self-served water. (2) Food is mediocre. Baked goods and quiches were not bad, but FAR from impressive. (3) Their hot chocolate is way too hyped up. Cute decor, though.
No comment
Love the branding, the design, execution and layout of the store but the drinks and desserts are just okay. The loaves? are very oily, not buttery, which is a downer but regardless. A pretty cafe.
Very enjoyable outdoor seating experience, friendly staff, adorable interior, great drinks, and lovely light and refreshing food! A good fit for a great morning. I'd eat here again no sweat.
No comment
No comment

Favorite NYC place. Quality coffee  (Toby's blend), delicious food, comfortable back room with an outdoor space and outlets. Cookies, coffee, and sandwiches all rival top NYC comparables. Quaint, cute, comfortable, and delicious.
One of the richest chocolate chip cookie I've ever had... right out of the oven! I was lucky... :-)
No comment
No comment

On a weekday afternoon, this is a great place to study or catch up with friends! It's super cute, totally ig worthy, but still provides the space to actually sit down and eat. I ordered the nutty chocolate chip cookie, which was huge and sooo good. I also got the berry iced tea, which was also amazing, although I was a little alarmed at the giant cup of ice the waitress originally had in her hand. The only reason I knocked off a star is because it's really pricey, and I got a little lost trying to find this place. I paid around $9 for just the cookie and the tea, and the large ice tea was about a grande in Starbucks sizes. Also, I walked into the restaurant section next door, thinking it was the cafe. The waitress had to stop me from walking any further, and told me to go next door. Awkssss...
No comment
No comment

It is such a lovely place to chill! Food here is not cheap but they all look delicious. The atmosphere here is really relaxing. Some people are sitting here enjoy their drinks or food. Some people are focusing on their laptops. I will definitely come here again. Next time I will try the Match latte. Besides, I love the music here. For some reasons, I cannot connect to the wifi here. They use the open wifi wework but not "maman". It is said that "Maman" is the private wifi. Still a good place to study, work, relax, or talk with friends.

This was a cute little find for a Wednesday afternoon meeting. I wish there were more seating options, especially with the weekly lunch rush. Their salad options were great. I wish that there were more gluten free / vegan options. Love love love their dirty chai!
No comment

Best cafe in NYC. Everything on the menu is amazing, the bacon jam on the breakfast sandwich is 10/10. Their pastries are also some of the best in the city, you have to try their warm chocolate chip cookie and almond croissant. They also have a hidden back patio that makes you feel like you are not in NYC... a major plus.

This place is in the middle of my rating. They have a lack of options in the menu and they do not have the best quality of food. I enjoyed there basil chicken sandwich but their mushroom and thyme soup was not the best flavor. I definitely tasted the mushroom, but alittle too much. It tasted like if someone just bit into a bush room and mixed it with water. They also have a slow waiting time. There are only about 5 ish tables and it wouldn't take that long since there were two waitresses and 1 table asking for water. I just thought that it lacked some qualities but it was also very décoratives!
No comment
No comment

My favorite place in the neighborhood for a morning snack and a beverage. Crochet Monsieur is excellent along with lavender cake and variety of salads they serve for lunch. Never tried anything I didn't like there. And how cute is the decor. LOVE this place.

Over rated, as someone mentioned there are way better cookies in NYC, not worth going out of way for 3stars. White chocolate cookie was basically an over priced sugar mixed in a lump of dough. Service cordial, ambience is what should get 4 stars.The petty annoyance was my $1 bill change that looked like it went through a few wars and washed over and over again, which I would have to take to the bank to exchange on my time; something the register person should do when they deposit their days cash, not try to get rid of it to a customer. Not kind, why I won't be trying to pass it along, no one deserves a badly shaped bill. That bill should be place out of circulation. No matter how good a cookie could have been that small action places a damper on someone's mood.

Such a cute, little, French café. Gets slightly busy during breakfast and lunch, but it is one of my favorite places to sit down and work. Their salads are delicious and very healthy. Their chocolate chip cookies are supposed to be amazing, but the one that I got was a bit dry, not heated, and I wasn't really into all of the extra nuts that they added. I do love their green tea though - so refreshing and nice (despite the higher price).

Adorable. Rustic. Chic. Oh my, I can't! Where do I begin?? Everything from the decor, to floor tiles, the the chairs, display, condiments was well designed. The staff was friendly, the seating in the back was not as big but cozy. All the succulent & hanging plants made it forget I was in the bustling part of town. The pastry?!? It was excellent, the fact that it was not overly sweet, I should ask next time if they use a lot of sugar because most pastries are loaded with sugar but when I had their peach tart & blueberry/lavendar pound cake and chocolate walnut cookie, I was like "this is what pastry should taste, just lightly sweetened like back in the days!" I can come here everyday & I want to thrown all my events here. Thank you Maman

I left my credit card here on a Sunday after I paid for breakfast. I came back on Saturday - realizing my card had been left there I learned that they THREW OUT MY CREDIT CARD!! In less than a weeks time.  They informed me they had trashed it and I should cancel it. I have lost cards in the past and always been contacted .  my name AND business were clearly on the card, it would have been such a simple and kind act to google me ( I would have showed up immediately ) and called to let me know I could come get it. Instead I spent 5 days searching high and low only to go back there and be told I should " just cancel it and get a new one " because they trashed it.  Anyone who has cards linked to purchases they need to return or automated charges and apple accounts knows that having your card unnecessarily cancelled is SO MUCH WORK.  Don't leave your card keys or glasses here because you can bet they will throw them out without thinking twice. I have a return that I needed to make linked to that card that I can likely no longer make without my card.

Very cute spot for a coffee and sweet treats. They also have some savory food but I haven't tried it yet. I looooved their matcha with almond milk and marshmallows on top! If you need a cozy place for a catch up with friend or to work or study, this is perfect. But it's not that spacious so hopefully you'll find the spot!
No comment
No comment
Loved this place for breakfast. Butternut waffles, quiche, and breakfast sandwich were all amazing. Precious atmosphere. Will eat here again.

Came here for the popular chocolate chip cookie. It was only ok, definitely not the best cookie I've had. The best part was that there was plenty of chocolate, some even melted. What I wasn't really a fan of was that the middle still seemed a bit under baked and somewhat soggyish. The edges was more baked and crispier. If only the rest of the cookie was like that. It was a pretty big cookie and for $4 it better be.
No comment

This has got to be one of the cutest little cafes that fits in so well with the young, hip, and trendy vibe of Soho! The rustic yet classic interior/decor that greets you the moment you walk in makes this cafe experience a one to remember. I love even the smallest details such as flowers and cup designs that Maman managed to execute so well - I sometimes order hot drinks just so that I can drink out of the pretty cups. The dining/sitting area is in the back through a small hallway, and that's the best part. There is great lighting created by both natural and adorable light bulbs, and the lovely art pieces and flowers that are placed all over the space makes the room a heaven for photographers or avid "instagram-ers" like me. Not only is the interior gorgeous, the pastries are absolutely delicious! I forget the names of the pastries we ordered, but they were both so good I don't even remember how long it took us to finish. I always go here for coffee and dessert, but I will most definitely return for the sandwiches. Every time I'm in the Soho area, I stop by because it's one of the best spots that can boost your mood.
No comment
No comment

MATCHA 100% love Panatea, this was my first try and it was absolutely delicious. The spot is so cozy and cute, and I might seem weird (I know) but I loved the bathroom. The design and how the place was thought of just reflects its location perfectly. I sat outside as it was still warm out but they also have a few couches to share inside. I didn't know about the back room, which I noticed when I was there and its a very versatile space for happy hours and possibly a pre-planned evening gathering.

Ordered a turkey club and specifically asked for no tomatoes, add bacon (which normally turkey clubs have bacon and instead of ranch I wanted mayo. Got the sandwich 2 min after I sat down. They turkey was entirely too thick and tomatoes on the sandwich. Took the sandwich up and told them what I asked for. They told me they never charged me for the bacon so I had to pay to have the bacon put on. They took the sandwich back and just removed the tomatoes and threw on cold bacon. Couldn't even eat the sandwich, turkey was just awful. Iced coffee was brutal as well. Try another place, you are better off
No comment

For the Cookies and Coffee, only place that ever came close to Levain with the cookies. Since Levain is quite a trek uptown, this place does a fine job of being a good substitute to Levain. Coffee is also very good.
No comment
OK coffee (drip). I took a look at the food and wasn't particularly drawn to anything. Maybe next time
No comment
The cutest little coffee shop in soho. The decor really makes it a great place to read a book or just enjoy coffee alone. Plus, their coffee cups are beautiful. Will definitely be coming back here.
No comment
Best avocado toast I've ever had in my life. Kombucha was a little weird but I swear to god the avocado toast is so flavorful I'd lay down my life for it.
No comment
No comment
Love this place. Great atmosphere, inside seating area is super comfy and nostalgic. Got a nutty chocolate cookie and a latte, both delicious!
No comment

This was a really great dining experience. Like a true millennial I ordered the avocado toast and it was the greatest decision ever. I got salmon on top of it and I don't like cold salmon or called me in general. They were kind enough to warm it up for me and I inhaled it. My friends also ordered avocado toast but with fried egg and my other friend ordered something with chicken on it I want to say it was a chicken sandwich and she really enjoyed that. We all got coffees and a coffee's were amazing and very well-made. We actually didn't realize that the restaurant was half a shot and half a bakery so we didn't get to try any of the treats but the food was just phenomenal. I will say that having us eat right next to where they sell various antique materials was a bit quirky but I liked it and it was very quiet. I hate noisy places in general especially noisy restaurants and so it was nice to just unwind relax and will hear our own thoughts and just eat!!!  I wish I had photos but all I could see in that moment with me, my food and my friends and I'm not sorry!!
I've had better coffee but this cafe is so cute! Easy to find a seat at 10:30 on a Saturday morning - I guess because not so many people know about it yet. It'll definitely blow up soon though.

The alain milliat juice is fabulous because of its rich nectar thick taste. I had the strawberry one. Also had their daily cake slice which is a lavendar cake. Very delicious indeed. mamans cookies comes with milk and the cookies are warmed to the right temp~ The environment seems a bit crowded as we had to share the table with others. Also it was sad they didnt have hot chocolate when we arrived:(

Cute interior. Lots of seating in the back. A lot of outlets as well but not at the large table where there is more seating. So if you want an outlet and planning to do some work, try and grab a seat during off peak hours. Typical NY prices for an iced coffee--about $5. Would come back if I was in the area often

I wanted to go here to try their lavender hot chocolate and I was slightly disappointed. First it's a cute, unbeknowing shop and in the back there's more seats. But the lavender hot chocolate didn't have much lavender smell or taste. Maybe, I hyped it too much for myself, but I wanted more lavender. It was still a good hot chocolate, but nothing special.
Great croissants, quiche and coffee. Lovely atmosphere but service could be improved ;)
No comment
No comment

I don't know how anyone can give this place anything less than 5 stars. Probably the best chocolate chip cookie I have ever had in my life. Coffee is delicious. Quiche Loraine? Whatever I had before was cheap imitations of what it's supposed to taste like, try it here and you will understand what I mean. If you are in the neighborhood come in even if it's just for their cookies, you will not regret it.
No comment
Read reviews on the chocolate chip cookie- picked it up and was disappointed. I've had better cookies (like Dominique Ansel and levain)
A great place to get good coffee/baked goods! The back side of the cafe looks like an indoor secret garden.
No comment
Stopped by for Saturday brunch. Food was exceptional but unfortunately the service was really poor. Long wait to order and long wait to pay.
Absolutely recommended. Smells like my grandmother's house.. Delicious pastries and excellent coffee. Cosy atmosphere and French design.
No comment

Came here with a friend on a Friday afternoon to grab a quick bite to eat. We ordered the quiche christel ($6.5), the Claudia sandwich ($8), and orange juice & coffee. After ordering, we were confused about the system of the restaurant - we decided to go ahead and seat ourselves. However, when we went to sit down, we were told that part of the restaurant was for dine-in guests only. This was a bit frustrating, as we did not know that this was a possibility when we were ordering at the cafe. Had we known this was an option, we would have opted to "dine-in" and order off the menu and have our meal with service included. Luckily, they had other seating available. The ambiance of the restaurant is very cute and quaint, especially the "dine-in" area which is very unique. It is basically an antique store at the front and a tiny restaurant in the back. Food was pretty decent and its a good spot to sit and chat or to get some work done. Service could be more polite and they should probably tell their guests the difference between the cafe and the restaurant itself to avoid confusion.
Such an adorable spot.  Great coffee and beautiful pastries.  Love the quiche.  Everyone is so friendly - it's a really warm place. Like a big hug from your maman.
No comment

Deliciousness!! Good service and great food!!! The ham and cheese sandwich was wayyyy more than the name sounds like. Toasted and hearty, everything inside was great. The Nutella Babka is a must-have! Good coffee stop.
No comment
No comment

A great spot for a peaceful weekend brunch. I love the back room with the rustic wooden tables, potted plants, and small patio. For a place with such a cute ambiance, the food was very good, too. We got the zucchini noodles, matcha waffles (previously on the menu, they were pancakes), and "rabbit hole" sandwich. The zucchini noodles were refreshing, and I appreciated that they had a creative healthier item on the brunch menu. It actually has grapes and basil leaves, which both meshed really well with the rest of the salad. The matcha waffles were tasty, though they reminded me more of Eggo waffles as the matcha flavor was very subtle. Portions were just right - not small, but not enormous. I hope the weekend brunch doesn't become too popular because I would love to come back!
No comment

Maman is a good bakery creating some unique sweets--with hits and misses. It is dim lit, has plenty of seating in separate room in the back, but no wifi. However, guests can easily connect to the nearby WeWork's wifi. Lavender hot chocolate with almond milk is really solid. Lavender flavor is subtle but really comes through without tasting soapy. Nutty chocolate chip cookie ($3.75) with nutella is not good--do not fall for this as they try to upsell you on the cookies. A bit burnt tasting with more-than-crisp outside. and macadamia nuts taste kind of old. Olive oil loaf cake with grapefruit glaze ($3.50) and white chocolate blueberry lavender cake ($3.50) aimed high and fell flat. Flavors did not come through. Crème brûlée croissant ($3.75) is ultra soft. A little difficult to eat because of how soft it is and how generously they packed in the cream, which is done so by slicing in half and simply piling it up before reassmbling. Can be very messy and I actually wish the outside were harder and the inside with less cream. I still recommend trying it out.
Cute little place with s lot of good tea selections. Really cool decor with private space that can be booked in the back

Today we want to introduce you to Maman - our new favorite coffee shop in the city. It has several locations but we of course went to check out the one in soho(our favorite part of the city). The place is cozy and has a very nice decor(feels like at home).We have ordered a hot chocolate, chocolate mint tea,salad, pistachio bread and creme brule croissants. Everything was amazing! Especially we recommend trying their salads- they are very delicious and fulfilling at the same time. Creme brulle croissant were to die for. We think this is a coffee shop for everyone: for the coffee lovers, for dessert lovers, for healthy lunch people, for the artists,for the bathroom goers and of course for the bloggers!

This designers did a hell of a job with this cute as a button French bakery. From the blue and white patterned to-go cups to the custom made rabbit mugs, every last detail was dreamt up to delight. And delight it does- from the addicting leek quiche to the exposed kitchen, communal tables and magazine racks in the back. I can't wait to try more of their treats!
Love this place!  Cute atmosphere, delicious food, and good coffee. The quiche loraine  is fantastic, and the cookies are spectacular as well. Would definitely recommend.  Good prices, too.
Asked if they could warm-up this piece of Quiche ($7.00) , they nicely said "yes", and it was cold ..  Disappointed  :-(

The Cappuccino here was amazing. There was only one employee working while it was extremely busy and none of it seemed to bother him which was perfect. Everyone was getting their coffee in a timely manner and with great communication as well. Will definitely be going back here.
No comment

Small gourmet cafe, few tables in the back room with no good view, maybe 2 seats at their front window sill that has a better view. I went over specifically to taste their chocolate chip cookie to see if it's better than Levain's Bakery, since Maman's is usually listed on Top 10, as well. It's definitely not better than Levain's. Maman's cookies taste better cold. It was still good, though surprisingly, their white choc chip cookie with a pretzel on top, tastes even better than their traditional chocolate chip cookie! Make sure to call ahead regarding what cookies they have available when you arrive. It's an easy drive by if someone waits on the curb while u dash in and out of the place. I'd go back. Their sandwiches looked fancy and tasty. The cappuccino and fresh squeezed orange juice are good too.
Good quality matcha latte. One of the best in Manhattan.

Cute French bakery, but actual baked goods were stale and tasteless. The price for a cup of hot water and black tea bag was $3.50! Ambience was nice, but overpriced and food pricing was not commensurate with the quality of food.
No comment
Great chai latte and they have oat milk! Coffee is alsp very good. Cookies look great, and small bites for lunch. A little bit small so can get pretty busy.

The lavender hot chocolate is a must it has a unique taste to it. However, i am giving this place a 3 star because the last time I went there the hot chocolate did not smell like lavender and it also tastes just like the barista dumped a lot of syrup in it. The matcha green tea drink was quiet good, but they tend to put a lot of ice in it. Did not have a chance to try the pastries yet. The store is really cute, though. A nice place to work but it has a limit of I think 45 minute stay at the cafe chilling area.
Had the tuna sandwich which was great and had cranberries in it. Pastries are excellent, can get crowded.
Super cute place, great pastries and amazing caffeinated beverages!
It's just such a wonderful coffee shop! It's super cute, and has the best lavender hot chocolate! And just tried their peach tart! Sooooo good! It's the best! Love it!

The food was great but the service was one I've never experienced before. Went there this past Sunday and the waitress gave us all sullen looks as we ordered. Forget about being friendly, she made us feel like we were annoying her with our presence there. Then she would turn around and start laughing and smiling with her fellow coworker. It was very demoralizing and I would never come here again just from that experience. I would much rather visit a different Maman location!
No comment
NO WIFI - they have a network but refuse to give the password out.  So don't go there if you are looking to work! The pineapple brioche is great and ice coffee could be stronger.
Great salads and fresh brewed ice tea.  Staff was very accommodating.  Restaurant and bathrooms were clean.  I highly recommend!
Good coffee, but good grief are they slow. They also refuse to fix the door handle that is not handicap accessible. Someone with carpal tunnel or joint pain can not get into the building.

I am in love with this place. Best packaging, best environment, cute staff, amazing food. Just adorable place that you want to make you 'local' spot. My only advise would be to expand you menu just a little..
No comment

I absolutely love this place. I love to visit after a Saturday morning yoga class, but I also love to use them for work catered lunches. Everyone is always blown away by how good it is. They're sweet and savory items are equally as good. Their coffee is great. And the service is so warm. I'm thrilled that they opened a restaurant in Tribeca.
the chocolate croissant was not very flaky, chocolate was a little too sweet and not dark/bitter enough.
This branch of Maman is really nice! Maybe the best Soho coffee shop to sit in and do work. Had a great chocolate croissant and iced americano. Wifi wouldn't hurt, but it's one less distraction!
No comment

I've been here three times and every time I want to get one of everything. Amazing and unique bakery items that are so fresh and very tasty. If you are looking for something a little more, go for the quiche-- SO good and a very generous portion.
Cute Little Café with lovely furniture and nice salads. Expensive but good. Nice drinks and very friendly service! Lovely spot in Soho.

Stopped in for a latte and chai today. Service was awesome and drinks were perfect! We had hoped to sit and enjoy our coffee but we were told the back tables are just for orders in. Wish that was more clear and that they let customers know this. Other than that food looked great!
Love the place, very hard to find a seat on a Saturday morning tho!  I had the pears almond pie, smooth and sweet for any sweet seakers such my slef!!! Loved it!
this is my first time here for brunch I tried the de constructed and it is so good also the green matcha and cappuccino good
No comment

Definitely one of the most aesthetically beautiful coffee shops in the city. It has a distinct character- an almost rustic and traditional feel with lots of textured wood and floral decor. The cups are decorated like the fancy blue and white porcelain ones you see in tea shops. The coffee itself is great, and their baked goods are stellar. You have to try the chocolate chip macadamia cookie, it's so rich I couldn't even finish it in one sitting.
The famous nutty cookie. Good , but for this price I will still chose levain bakery over it anyday!

The place's atmosphere it really nice, but the food is probably the worst I've ever had in manhattan. There was a fly cooked into my doughnut-i don't like buggy protein. Their juice was too sour, the tea is very bland, the Croque Maman was soggy, their cakes look lovely but are under cooked, and two of our forks were rusty . Although the food was absolutely terrible the servers were very kind and apologetic- if they work on the food it might* be better (eventually).

Love this place! Stopped in for the first time this morning and was so happy I did. Rustic space with the feel of the French countryside. My mom and I ordered the lavender blueberry cake, a chocolate chip cookie, kale and butternut squash quiche, and coffee. (We loaded up...and it was well worth it!) Everything tasted so good and I can't wait to go back! Je l'adore beaucoup!
Unique decor and nice staff. Espresso was smooth as well. Make sure to sit in the back room, tucked past the display and register!

This restaurant was unexpected as we were to go to the restaurant right next door which happen to be closed. We are happy things worked out as they did as this was a unique, quaint place with character and much attention to detail. The smoked salmon, my favorite, was soooo good and on a rye I never had before. Great selection of teas and the presentation was exemplary. The place reminded me of a high-end Starbucks and country bed and breakfast. Definitely planning a return visit when back in NYC.

I can't speak for other locations but the atmosphere is really lovely here. There's dine-in seating and a restaurant. Long family-style tables in the back help create an environment where you can have a nice conversation, even with strangers. There's a few smaller tables and bar stools in the front if you're visiting solo. I had the blueberry lavender cake. (It was okay. I think the lavender made it a little oily.) I liked the pistachio chocolate croissant much better. The quiche with the pears, parsnips & gorgonzola was the most interesting (in a good way) I've ever tasted!
Good food and drink. Back area is nice to sit and eat. Pretty decor.
I love having tea and a pastry here and sitting in the back of the shop. It has the best atmosphere  what a cute place!!!

Cute and quaint spot, especially the seating area in the back.  Had a slice of ham and cheese quiche that I liked a lot.  I also had a white chocolate and pretzel cookie that was ok, definitely not one of the best cookies I've had - sounded and looked better than it was.  Seems to be a popular spot, pretty crowded on a Sunday afternoon.  Lucky if you can snag seats and hang out.

The red pepper & goat cheese quiche and pistachio cake were delicious.  Communal tables in the back.  Giving four stars only because we were kicked out shortly after arriving because of an event with no prior warning.
No comment
No comment
Excellent lavender hot chocolate and chocolate chip cookies! Got too crowded on the weekend. Seating area is cute and cozy. But unfortunately the wifi doesn't work :-(

my friends stumbled into maman after discovering a long wait at two hands. the decor is airy and welcoming. the food is also plated beautifully. i had the rabbit in the hole, which was tasty with a mix of basil, tomatoes, comte cheese, carmelized onions and pastrami. my only grievance was that the service could be better as our food took a bit of time. i finished my coffee before getting my food. otherwise a delightful brunch spot. i might be back to grab and go.
i tried the orange juice and cookie! at 4 bucks - the cookie was nothing special and levains cookie is much better - juice was good but i will return to try the vegetarian lasagna which looked good
I usually don't like overly cute place. The food is good but not great. I visited in the morning. Not crowed at all. NYC has too many overly cute cafés.

Cute & cozy new spot just between Little Italy & SoHo. Tasty bites and teas! I will be back to try their other offerings. Sweet service and reasonable prices for the area. There is seating in the back (all food/drinks are ordered in the front)... lovely decor, and they have wifi :)

Finally some decently priced salad in the area (a small is $6.53 including tax). Very cute and boutique, switches up the menu of quiches, salads, and sandwiches every day. Not your typical Chop't or Sweetgreens salad that is just a bunch of greens with a few toppings. Also have a lot of baked goods but I haven't tried any yet. The seating is very limited in the back so it's better to get a grab and go lunch from here on your lunch break

Lovely little bakery and cafe. Happened to stumble in one day while looking for an alternative to Starbucks. Seating is kind of limited, with about two communal tables in the back and some stools in the front, but the ambience is very nice in general, trending less on the hipster side of things and more towards cutesy without being treacly. Matcha latte is nothing particularly special, but the nutella-filled madelines are quite tasty. There are plenty of other food options too, a great number of which contain kale, for better or for worse. Outdoor patio area should be opening up soon.

A quaint little place with good looking baked good. I've had the goat cheese and red pepper quiche and the blueberry lavender pound cake on my last visit. The egg part was velvety rich and soft but the crust was not as crusty or even crispy. The cake again had great flavors but was more on the gritty dry side. There is only one unisex bathroom with a baby seat inside easy for diaper swapping. This is probably a good place to hit up if you have a kid with you and you're just done shopping off SoHo.
Lovely place. Designed with taste. Great food and atmosphere. I tried their chocolate chip cookie. It was very good. Their salads and sandwiches looked yummy. I loved the back dining room.

They have the best Nutella cookies. Always soft and gooey on the inside with that chewy crispy texture on the outside. Pretty decent pastries as well. Had a cappuccino that was pretty good too. But their cookie is really the thing to get!

I love this shop. Love the aesthetic, love the lavender blueberry cake. If you want to get lunch there during the work week, come early or else all the salads you want will be gone by the time you get there (i.e. me waltzing in at 1:30pm)

This is a a great spot to stop in for coffee or snack in SoHo. I loved the quiche, lasagna and cup and decaf coffee! Note that there's not a whole lot of room in the back to sit and it's first come first serve.
Loved the lavender hot chocolate -- so delicious and creative...the place itself was very classy as well...nice little French vintage coffee shop!
No comment
No comment

Stumbled on this place near my workplace. Decor is so nice and cozy and definitely Instagram worthy. That alone made me want to try the coffee and food. the quiche I had was really tasty but the salad left more to be desired. However the chocolate chunk cookie alone earned the 4 stars. So freaking good it's dangerous. I know they brew Toby's Estate which is an awesome brew (I work at a place that brews it). Take your SO or best friend here on a cute date :-)
No comment

Came for the chocolate chip cookie and it was worth the trip! Melty, large chunks of chocolate and a cookie that is the right amount of done-ness. My mouth is watering just remembering it. We also enjoyed the pistachio bread and espresso. Cute little eating area in the back and bathrooms were fine. My only complaint was the service - not particularly welcoming or friendly. Great for lunch, breakfast, or just a cookie. It's small so not good for a group.
Beautiful. Tucked away. I hope this stays somewhat hidden!

This place is fantastic. I found it on yelp to do some work. They had a good selection of teas, coffee and pastries. I ordered the mint chocolate tea and a croissant. The tea was minty and not too chocolatey but I wasn't disappointed. The croissant was flaky and subtle, just the way I like it. I went to the back to sit down and really liked the quaint space. They had a good deal of outlets and the tables were commune-like so I didn't feel embarrassed to ask a couple with the baby if I could sit with them. It was pretty loud in there from the people just chatting and catching up but it didn't bother me since I had my headphones on. I would definitely come back here.
My favorite french café in Manhattan. Very cool and cozy back room for seating. Shared seating that is not uncomfortable.
The drinks are OVERpriced. But if you're staying for a while to do your work, it's a dream place. I think it's overpriced for a reason.

Well, it was nice while it lasted. The food, service and ambiance were all quite good. Now that they've franchsed the brand their interests are elsewhere. No more food or table service and burnt coffee with scalded milk. Adieu maman...

Love the vibe of this place! Super cute coffee shop, and so well decorated (like pinterest worthy). It was a bit crowded and there happened to be a really loud group sitting near me so I wasn't able to study as I had hoped but this place would be great to get together with someone for a cup of a coffee

this is probably one of the cutest coffee shops in the area! and know that there are a ton of cute ones around. the setting is very chill and there's so many open seating so it's great to meet up and have coffee or tea with some friends in the back!

Maman is a great addition to the area between soho and nolita. The case of sweet and savory items is beautifully displayed as is the layout of the rest of the coffee shop.  I especially like the grilled leeks quiche. Great selection of teas and the service is welcoming, friendly. My one point of contention- why carry all compostable utensils and not have a compost bin?
love this spot.  good ambiance. free wifi.  except the study group on saturdays.

Wow, this place is just amazing, great food so tasty and beautiful people working there. I've been here a couple of times with my friends and every time I'm leaving happy and excited for my next visit. Somewhat pricy but over all I love this place, u recommend it to all coffee and pastry lovers.
Love this place! Stopped in for iced coffee and grabbed a croissant as well - heaven! Staff was friendly and helpful.
No comment
No comment

Great spot for a quick and healthy lunch.  I loved that they had a significant amount of options for vegetarians!  It's a small place but we got a table for 3 in no time.  The french atmosphere was authentically cute.

Lovely French ambiance and food. So glad this place opened near our office. Most of menu changes daily. I tried cauliflower salad and kale salad with honey vinaigrette last week and was not disappointed. A coworker oohed and aaahed with pleasure devouring her egg salad sandwich too:). Picked up their famous nutty cookies for the office which were immediately inhaled. Full sized macadamias in these chocolate chip cookies! Yum.
I wish I had something positive to say but I could only think of two things. The space is gorgeous and the music choice is pleasant.
No comment

VERY good quality coffee and bake goods!! However the service is a 1 star, if it was not for the bad service I would give this place 5 stars. The two girls that work Monday-Friday morning are very rude and also seem to be irritated.
I absolutely love Maman! I stop in for their hot chocolate all the time. The baristas are fantastic and the seating area in the back is cute and cozy. Definitely one of my favorite cafés.
Cutest cafe ever! So cozy and comfortable! Delicious lavender hot chocolate!! I love the decor of the entire place. I haven't tried their food selections yet but they look pretty delicious! :)
Very friendly staff from the moment you step in.  Feels like france with all French speaking staff and customers.  There is a je ne sais quoi :)

Delightful cute French cafe that will easily become a to go to place for me. The decor is charming with lots of whimsical details, that really make the atmosphere. The chocolate cookies with macadamia nuts are amazing! I'm looking forward to trying their much talked about Dulce De Leche bar and the chocolate fondant cake next time. Maman is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood!

Super adorable French cafe with great food and atmosphere. Came here for breakfast. Quiche Lorraine was delicious and tried my first ever pistachio loaf - also good. They have magazines available for those who like to read, eat and chill out.

This little French bakery in SoHo is adorable. We went for breakfast and each got a croissant and a slice of the lavender blueberry cake (which even though that might sound like a dessert it worked perfectly for breakfast). The croissants were fresh and flaky and buttery and delicious. The lavender blueberry cake was incredible! Such an amazing and unexpected combination of flavors. We also each got the lavender hot chocolate which was different but soo good. Chocolatey but not too rich. We sat in the back which was so charming with exposed brick walls, blue China in the cabinet, strings of lights above and rustic mismatched tables and chairs. Not many seating options but strangers were good about sharing space- 3 different groups can fit comfortably at the long table. Even the restroom was nicely decorated. We would definitely go back for the lavender blueberry cake- yum!

I ventured in just the other day for a matcha latte and was not at all disappointed by anything other than the fact that I had to stand up to drink it. The space was absolutely gorgeous, cozy, full of flowers and interesting decor. It was very cold and windy outside and it would have added to the feeling of respite to be able to sit down and drink, but unfortunately I wasn't the only person that had that particular idea on a Friday afternoon. Nevertheless, I really enjoyed this place and even though it's off the beaten path for me, I do plan to go back for another matcha latte in the near future. It was delicious.

Had the white chocolate pretzel cookie for the first time in this quaint French bakery and let me tell you that cookie was so sinfully delicious it left me wanting more. It was served warm and was so oozingly soft in the middle of the cookie it was like biting into a piece of heaven. I highly recommend people try that cookie.

Come early for brunch or else the pickings are slim. They make a mean chocolate chip macadamia cookie (3.50). Spend the money, its worth every penny. The quiche was very nice and the hot chocolate was a steep $4...shldve gotten a cookie! The decor is beautiful, rustic and charming French parisian. Not a lot of space at all. Also it gets very crowded with two people serving. The owners are in the forefront serving, beautiful couple, polite and friendly.

I used to love this place, for food, ambience, baked goods. However staff is so hard to deal with, they always give you attitude or make you wait forever to be served. It used to be my to go lunch spot, everyday, but not anymore. I'm tired of their poor customer service.
Great coffee and ambience with seating in the back room ideal for a quick meeting or work study. Great neighborhood gem

Their famous chocolate chip cookie was pretty good. I prefer soft baked, which these are not, but that's OK. The flour and chocolate itself was average, and it is the salted macadamia nuts IN the cookie that sets it worlds apart tbh. Without it, the cookie itself would taste plain and generic. Its the natural fat in the macadamia nuts that gives the cookie all the flavor. I like super dark chocolate chunks, so maybe a more bitter cookie for me. But its hood, a nice mild, sweet and savory cookie with surprisingly generous amounts of macadamia nuts. The nuts don't taste stale, like a lot of store bought macadamia nuts do. $3.75 + tax = $4.08 for a quite big palm sized cookie is worth the calorie and wallet splurge every once in a while. I suggest getting it fresh out of oven or have them heat it. Makes a big difference
Great and cozy deco, great food, great team, perfect spot! A little gem in the middle of Soho!

This place is a perfectly acceptable cafe for coffee or tea, pastries and lunch snacks.  The decor is very charming.  The layout is challenging with insufficient seating - open area in front with seating in the back down a long hall.  The food is fine but nothing extraordinary.  I had shepard's pie which was a bit bland and a pear chocolate tart that was fairly good but dry and the portion seemed larger than needed.  No need to go back but it seemed pretty popular with the younger crowd.
No comment

I ordered the cappucino, which was great! I had the croque "maman" with bechamel sauce. Divine! Also, I've seen Ewan McGregor twice in one week there, so if its good enough for him, its good enough for me! Ha! The seating in the back is heavenly, but try to go early, because the food runs low after 4pm.

Met a girlfriend here for a quick breakfast before work. Lavender hot chocolate is a must here. So delicious. The decor is so warm and special. It is so different than other places I've been. I am definitely a fan of the chic French decor and menu here! Will be back
No comment

Cute little coffee shop.  From the outside it appears there is not a seating area in there, but it's in the back!  Very trendy decor and a number of tables.  Very clean, comfortable and I felt at home in there.  Not loud or congested at all.  Coffee was good too!
No comment
Absolutely delicious pastries and one of the best dopio macchiatos I've ever had.  Can't wait to get back.

Walked by with my sister and we couldn't pass it up - very cute, elegant French cafe/bakery. The cookies here are AMAZING!! Highly recommend!  Will have to go back and try some of their regular menu items.  Looked delish!
Cute place! Good food, service and beverages. It has a great little workspace in the back -- keep in mind that it gets busy though!

The lavender hot chocolate is not overhyped. It's so delicious, I'm surprised more places around the city aren't infusing hot chocolate. If you are a hot chocolate fan, it's a must try. The atmosphere is also very cute and quiet, though I went on a weekday afternoon. If I lived closer, I would bring my laptop and work here because it's just so peaceful and nice.
Love this place! Best coffee in NY so far and delicious fresh food. Salads are amazing xx
It's super cute and the aesthetic is great, even love the cups but the music selection NEEDS to be changed - down right awful
Lavender hot chocolate was amazing and the atmosphere was really cute.  Food was super tasty too!
No comment
I had a latte and a slice of Maccha cake. Both were good and the atmosphere of the place was nice!

Ive been here two times so far and its a very aesthetically pleasing little 'cafe'. The staff is very pleasant, and their pound cake is delicious. I recommend the pistachio pound cake. Besides the pound cake I've only had espressos, so I cannot comment on their other items. Espresso is "ehh", nothing special. I would definitely come here more often, even just for the ambience and the pistachio pound cake, but it is over priced.
The best coffee I've had in NYC, seriously. Their quiche is amazingly cheesy, and their soups are super creamy. Great place to go when you get tired of shopping in Soho!
Excellent lavender hot chocolate, excellent egg sandwich, and very friendly service. Cool place to chill and have a bite.

Maman created the most special evening of my life!  We had our engagement dinner here and Elisa & her boyfriend (the owners) did everything to make sure everything was perfect.  The food was served to us family style with delicious tuna, and south of france inspired vegetable dishes.  They played our favorite music, had our photos everywhere, and created the most romantic ambiance I could imagine. I cannot recommend this place enough, especially for private parties!  They have a great space.

I recently started a new job and lucky me it's about a 5 min walk from Maman. I treated myself to their famous cookie the other day and I will definitely be back. The only down side is they run out if their lunch salads pretty quickly... guess I'll have to have a cookie for lunch instead. The cafe itself is adorable!
The place is so darn cute. My quiche was rich and creamy and I can't wait to go back and try more things.
Great food, awesome décor, friendly enough staff. I only went once but loved it and will go back. Only had savory stuff (soup, open-faced sandwich), will definitely have to try that cookie!

i. love. this. cafe. the decor is delightful and makes me feel like i'm in a little coffeeshop in the streets of france. the lavendar hot chocolate i had was delicious and aromatic, perfect for a chilly day. all in all this place is a little piece of heaven in the city, and i'll return every time i'm in new york!

Pretty cute. Red pepper and goat cheese quiche was to die for, silky smooth in a lovely crust. Huge piece which I couldn't finish. Love the to-go coffee cups with their blue and white toile look. They didn't have a lot of pastry choices when we were there (Sunday at 9:00 a.m.). I ordered the chocolate almond croissant, but it wasn't really a croissant. The consistency was more shortbread like.  Delicious, but not a croissant. It didn't look like the chocolate and plain croissants that were still in the case as we left. Somewhere else on Yelp, you can see a picture of it. My husband wished the quiche was hotter, but the slightly more than room temperature was fine for mine. I also didn't really like the tan cardboard container the quiche came in, but now I'm getting picky. We had the back to ourselves. Not sure when we'll be back in NYC, but I might like to try some of their other pastries. I'll have to see if they are as good as Standard Baking in Portland, ME, our favorite in our home state.

Great little place in the middle of a busy neighborhood. Their baked goods are amazing and I can never wait to go back just so that I have an excuse to try something new. Coffee is very good, and I love the decor. Perfect place to go read a good book or meet a friend !

After a visit to New York City and hearing much praise about this wonderful new bakery I just had to check it out! I was presently surprised about the politeness of the staff and the amazing quality of the food. The quiche and salads were fresh and delicious and those desserts.....I even went back to take some more to go! Place was perfectly decorated and was enjoyable to spend time in. Well worth every penny this place and we will be back for sure

Cannot say enough good things about this place. The food is absolutely delicious, from the pastries to the sandwiches to the homemade salads. Everything is very fresh and the ingredients are excellent. It is moderately priced for the area as well. Seating is a little bit of an issue but the staff is very friendly.

A true gem in Soho! Travelled from Montreal to New York and fell on this amazing place. Can definitely feel the French and homemade touches from the decor to the food. I was there the weekend and went there twice while I stayed in NYC. Absolutely loved their famous cookie and food on the menu ... Ie quiche red peppers and eggplant and tartinette prosciutto and goat cheese. Delish! Service is personable and friendly felt like I was home. Definitely coming back when I'm in town, our new stop in NYC!
This place orders by checking on a paper. No dim sum pushing carts in this place. Lots of variety, very similar to Golden Unicorn on East Broadway. Very clean.
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

It's very rare to find a dim sum place that offers dim sum in the evening. My friends and I (a large party) came here to celebrate a birthday and we had a great time. The dim sum is very good, especially the bean curd roll and we were hooked onto the coconut pudding. The waiters are very nice and the service was fantastic. The atmosphere was very welcoming and the lighting was a plus. One thing I always check is the cleanliness of the plates and utensils and I was extremely pleased. Overall 11/10 would come again!

Latest outpost of dim sum palace, that's open late. Been to the 2nd ave location and the concept is the same. You order of pictionary menu of dim sum and some more hearty options, like chow fun with beef.  Tried a bunch of meat and veg options, including XLB. The wrapper was thick and chewy but broth and filling was otherwise tasty. Steamed ribs were mostly bone and cut unevenly.   Service was fine, place wasn't busy around 6. Would I want to come back? Probably if I was around late at night otherwise plenty other dim sum options.

Newly relocated Dim Sum Palace is one of the few places that open early for breakfast and closes late for after hour's karaoke. We were given a private party room in the basement due to the amount of people in hour party. The staff was friendly, the food came out quickly and without missing a single order. Overall the food was excellent. However, the only thing I would change is the texture and thickness of the rice rolls. Definitely returning here the next time I'm in Chinatown and the mood for Dim Sum.

Went here recently for some late night Dim Sum with some of my bros. We ordered what felt like was practically everything on the menu from turnip cake to beef chow fun. Everything came out fairly quickly and was fairly tasty. I would say how newly renovated the place would make one distrust the quality and authenticity of the place but it was all in all a good experience breaking bread. Would definitely go back again considering that they're open until 3am according to their sign, which is getting rare these days to find an establishment not trying to close earlier especially in Chinatown.

We were craving Sticky Rice Wrap so we ordered them from Dim Sum Palace. The order came super quick! The Sticky rice was enjoyably chewy with a slightly sweet taste. Our wrap was filled with savory chicken. It also game with a ginger sauce that brought out a burst of flavor. Overall, delicious and well fulfilled craving.

Awesome spot! Spacious and so many menu options. Speedy service too. Delicious variety of soup dumplings. Even the sautéed veggies were so simple but garlicky and tasty. And beef and fried rice were great. Also loved the duck for the buns. So tasty. Great spot for large groups

Had both dinner family style for Chinese new year and family dim sum. For dim sum the food was hot and picked from a menu - like that it wasn't cold food rolled on carts as usual. Variety of food was good too. And really enjoyed the dinner option too esp the lobster sashimi!

This place was surprising. I figured a new dim sum place in Chinatown with locations all over the city would be questionable. But they really delivered, love the shrimp quality - doesn't skimp like other places you may go to nowadays. The location is super convenient, but just know it's not a cart place. You order off a menu, and if you're trying to grab a quick bite, it may take a little longer than you may be planning. But the food quality is more than worth it. Great service with the pro level dim sum waiters you know and love. Bustling and loud location full of people from the moment they open the perfect environment for yum cha.

On their website, they said there's half price dim sum happy hour between 3-5pm on weekdays. When I walked in at 4pm, the hostess had no idea what I was talking about. So I only grabbed a menu and took some pictures.  But I still plan on eating there with my family this weekend. Seems like a nice addition to division st
The food is good quality and taste better than other dim sum restaurants in my opinion.
Excellent dim sum from pork buns, scallion pancakes and beef chow fun.  Everything fresh and tasty. New restaurant addition to this chain is well worth the visit!!

Went for New Year dinner.  Food was delicious!!  The duck was so juicy and the skin very crunchy.  The staff made into pancakes that were so tasty.  Shrimp with caramelized walnuts, so plump and sweet.  Steak was amazing tender.  All our hosts and staff very friendly.  Will definitely come back again!!!

The dim sum did not need to go this hard... but it did. I've had good dim sum in my lifetime but this was extremely consistent and had the best sauces I've ever had? Their chili and sweet soy sauce hiiiiiit. Their turnip cake was perfect. Hope they have a great opening!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Got a new design, the waiter or waitress. horrible the green tea matcha wasn't even green, it was gray or black because they used a random ingredient to replace the green tea matcha. But they didn't mention anything about changing ingredients, the service was great food was below average. They need better cooks in order to get a five star. Also, where warm clothing it is really cold no matter where you are.

Was eager to try this new place; had enjoyed dim sum at the previous tenant, Sunshine. We thought the dim sum was delicious. Everything comes out hot and fresh, and they have items on their menu that are different than the usual array. And your tea, served in a beautiful glass teapot that filters the leaves, is regularly replenished and stays hot. Only reason they are not getting five stars from me is the service. Everyone was nice and we got the right things, but they were obviously shorthanded. No sauces, no spoons to eat the Xiao long bao with. And the two doors, when both open, bring a blast of freezing air into the dining room, so some tables were literally in a stiff breeze, and pretty much everyone in the dining room had their coats on. We'll definitely come back, but would probably come back at opening time so they aren't backed up yet, and would make sure to be sitting a long way from the door if it's a cold day!
Absolutely delicious!!! The best Thai food in Brooklyn! The drinks were exquisite and tasty. The food was even better. It was fresh, bold, and flavorful.
No comment
No comment
No comment
It's great for lunch. The ambience is nice and intimate. The drinks are nice and strong will definitely recommend I've been here three days out of the week.
Amazing food, love love love! Fast service and awesome staff. So fresh, so good, tasted every herb and ingredients - will come back again!!

This place was so good. I honestly have no complaints just the massaman curry was a little salty but it wasn't overally salty . The vibe the staff . Everything was immaculate . Our server was the sweetest and so kind. I really enjoyed my drink . I had a lychee mojito and I also had the chive pancakes for a appetizers super delicious super fresh . I really enjoyed it . I would def be back here and the prices are great too .

The curry's here are delicious. I have to say the green curry is quite spicy. I loved the panang curry, great spice and flavors with all the veggies & chicken. The service, ambience, and lighting was lovely. They use real candles & flowers on the tables so it feels a little fancier than your everyday Thai dinner!
No comment

Glin was very good! Cute spot in Fort Greene that had a good amount of different options. To start we had the curry puffs, seafood salad, and their tom yum soup. All were great. The curry puff had great filling and was nice and flaky. The seafood salad I just loved! It had a nice subtle heat, which I really enjoyed. The tom yum had great flavor, a lot of mushrooms, and was served very hot. For our entrees we got the pad see ew with shrimp, and the massaman curry with chicken. The massaman was very good, although I do wish it was spicier. It was pretty mild in heat, which was a little bit of a disappointment. The pad see ew was alright, and leaned a little drier. I'd probably pass on ordering it when I come back. However, everything else was amazing! The passion fruit lemonade is a must order as well! Overall, great place that I'm happy we stumbled upon.

Excellent food! Perhaps the best Thai food I've had in NYC. (Even better, in my opinion, than a more popular michelin starred competitor in the city). Go for the branzino with mango salad on top (Pla Neung Manow) and the savory, spritely Crispy Duck Thai Fried Rice. Mango Sticky Rice is of course a classic (relatively sizable portion) and the pumpkin custard special was a nice and subdued nightcap.
This is elevated dining, not just another takeout Thai restaurant.  Dined in during restaurant week and found the ambience, meal, and attentive service to be A1.  Don't overlook them as a date spot.

This spot is an absolute gem with delicious food, drinks, and friendly service. I came on a Sunday afternoon and was seated right away. It was a super hot day and I don't think they have AC so it was pretty warm inside but they had the entire front open (doors/windows) which helped a little. The lychee lemonade was sweet and refreshing and my friend enjoyed her Thai iced tea. It was my first time trying chive pancakes and wow! So so good and crispy. We also started with the spring rolls which were cooked perfectly. The shrimp fried rice was so flavorful & a big enough portion to share. I also really enjoyed the pad see ew. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. I will be back soon to try more!
No comment

Glin Thai is my go to place when I want good food, good vibes & great service. My friend introduced me to this spot, but I've taken over  My fave is the Drunken Noodles w/beef and the passionfruit lemonade
Don't sleep on this place. Wonderful staff, romantic atmosphere and delicious thai food.
No comment
No comment

My sister and I stopped in this place as a last minute decision and it was such a delight! First off, the staff were so friendly and personable. I didn't get the waiters name, but he engaged in conversation and shared their story of how they all came from Thailand and started this business together. He made it such a warm environment on such a rainy day and even gave us a complimentary thai ice tea to try!! For food-- I've had Pad Thai from over 100 different restaurants (one of my fav foods) and this one ranks top of the list as well as the pad se ew. After we left, my sister and I kept talking about how great both dishes were on our walk home. We'll definitely be back and excited to try all the other options on the menu!!!
No comment
Great service - good food, ordered 2 apps - curry puffs and seafood salad as well as a noodle and curry dish to share. Vibes are cute. Would go again for happy hour!!
No comment
Best Thai in the neighborhood. Love this place so much. Highly recommend the red curry!

They have a decent lunch special. For $13 you get a choice of a soup or a salad, I got the soup  , then I got the beef pad see-ev w/ pancakes on the side. This time it wasn't as greasy like the last place this was.(Ace Thai  ) I definitely finish my meal .portions are small . But very tasty . If you post your entire meal on Instagram/ or Facebook you get free dessert! In this case we did. So I also got the cookies and cream ice cream w/ whip cream on top! . That filled us up for sure ... they also have happy hour here too. Till 7 pm so I ordered the passion fruit martini. It was a bit strong but I like it the way too! . We sat in the front section. The have bar seating too and more seating in the back! . The staff here is very friendly as well .

Delicious food, friendly staff and beautiful space. I came here for dinner and it was so delicious and beautiful that i hosted a 13 person dinner in the back. The manager worked w me to select a four course meal and the staff was so attentive and kind. Go eat or celebrate an event at GLIN!

I went in there for the first time since they reopened.  It was formally Ace Thai, I am assuming its still the same owners and they just got a bit of a facelift.  And I like it very cute but still super casual.  The food is as good or slightly better than the Ace.  Very friendly service and food comes out quick Happy Hour everyday 12-7PM.
No comment

made my second visit for lunch special after work today. A Thai restaurant owned/operated by Thai people, which is actually hard to find!!! Lunch special includes appetizer and main dish. So, So good. I had pad thai both times and they use thinner noodles, which is unique! Their sauce/dressings are gentle. you can get free iced thai tea or lemonade (?) during lunch special if you dine in, for Grand opening. Excellent service - attentive and smiley

The food was top notch along with the service and atmosphere. Cocktails were made fresh. Duck was hands down the best duck i ever had. Crispy skin and boneless with a delicious sauce. Drunken noodle and pineapple fried rice was perfect. Curry puffs and chive pancakes were a great start.

The end to a wonderful meal! First time going in person after having a great ordering in experience. We got the chive pancakes (delicious!), the papaya salad, green curry, pad see ew, the eggplant tofu and the chocolate lava cake. Everything was great! Can't wait to come back to try even more. -- definitely the best Thai in the area!
No comment
Stopped by glin for a casual lunch. Enjoyed the food. Ordered the crispy chicken wings which were delicious and fried to perfection. The service was also great. My server was kind and attentive!

V impressed w Glin Thai Bistro. So thrilled they just opened. Ordered the pad Thai ex spicy (thai spicy), and superb. The noodles were thinner than the usual but still aldente. V fun to eat. Had a great balance of flavors- not too sweet, not too tangy- and that charred wok taste. Bf had massaman curry, and it was also excellent. Beef was tender, rich, complex but balanced flavors. Tom yum soup was also v good. Had a bit more depth than the usual Tom yum. Think it might've had a splash of coconut milk? Overall will def be back, and bringing more company! Hope they have longevity bc you can tell there's a lot of love here!
Excellent service, atmosphere, food, portions, price. Rare restaurant that checks all the boxes.
No comment
Amazing and so glad this opened up in Fort Greene! Great service and incredible food. Very good prices too for NYC! Will definitely be back soon!
Really tasty specials. I recommend the fried fish. Kind service, I'd come back! The pricing was great for the portions too.

Their food and service was so good that me and my husband came here twice in one day. We had their Pad Cha Seafood and Tom Yum Seafood and they were amazing! The Tom Yum had the perfect amount of spice and so much tasty seafood in it. And to finish it off we had their mango sticky rice both visits, which were the perfect ending to our visits. But even above their food, we say their service was out of this world, they were super hospitable and kind during both visits. They made sure we had everything we needed and were super attentive to our table. Definitely a must-try spot for delicious Thai in BK!
Delicious Thai food on Myrtle! We had the papaya salad, green curry, and pad see woo. All 5/5!
No comment

Came here by myself for a solo date Saturday night and I was greeted and seated immediately. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I ordered the old fashioned which came with a brûlée orange slice that you eat before drinking it, it was delicious. I ordered the Thai wings for my appetizer and Pad See Ew for my main and both were great. I will definitely be back soon. Loved the atmosphere.

Not one bad thing to say about Glin. The food was fresh, flavorful & fun to eat. The seafood Thom Yum Hot Pot was delicious and we managed to get the last branzino--- a true treat complete with sweet mango salad. Will definitely be returning in the future.
Glib Thai has such cute ambiance and the food is deliciously fresh! We adore the whole fish with mango and onions- tangy crispy and a great balance of sweet mango and fresh herbs!!!!
Great Thai food in the area with the authentic tastes. I would recommend Khanom Jeab (thai dumplings) with homemade authentic sauce. Also "Pla Lui Suan" is a must to order. Love it!
No comment
Delicious food and a really kind and attentive crew working. The Massaman curry, tom kha and pad see ew were delicious.
Beautiful restaurant. It's awesome drinks. I extremely recommend signature cocktails.

This restaurant was not crowded but met the quality standard of any great NYC Thai restaurant.  The atmosphere was great with warm, scented air and tropical decorations.  The house special cocktails were all well crafted, and the happy hour goes until 7.  The food was also good, with all the standard Thai dishes available and well made.  The fried tofu appetizer in particular is worth trying.  If you're in the fort green area, this is a spot worth checking out.
Excellent plating, service is very friendly. They keep live flowers which is a nice elegant touch. Food is well seasoned and prepared to my liking. Wish I wasn't a tourist so I can keep coming back!
Great Pad see ew with chicken. $15 plus tax is a great price. Friendly staff, and they were open on in the fourth which was nice. I wish then luck, I'll be back.

New gems in Brooklyn. Very cozy Thai place. The food is fresh and everything we order is delicious. We went for a large group and they were able to accommodate us right the way. The staff were beyond nice. Reasonable price and very nice decor. Signature drinks are so so good.
Amazing Thai food!! The Pad Kee Mao=Drunken noodles was flavorful with beef. Spring rolls and and soup also delicious. My favorite part was the iced coffee!!

We were excited to try Glin and we were NOT disappointed! Very happy to have Glin in the neighborhood. The flavors were more complex than what's typically on offer at "standard" thai joints. Good stuff! The staff was super friendly too.
Best Thai food in the neighborhood! I love the Tom yum goong especially. Service and ambience are also excellent.
I love this restaurant the food very delicious and good service , I feel very clean atmosphere
I was so sad about Ace Thai closing, but wanted to support the new spot. I'm glad I did! Food was delicious and incredibly fresh.
Went here last night and it was SO GOOD. The vibes inside are so cute, the service was excellent and all the food was 15/10! This is the best Thai food on myrtle for sure.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with a group of colleagues for lunch during workday at around 12pm. We made a reservation however it was empty at 12pm. I got here earlier but the staff was friendly and let us in before business hours. Interior design was pretty pretty and classy.  This was my second time here, last time I came here for dinner and I had a great impression. Came here again and ordered the oxtail quesadillas. The meat was soft, juicy and not over cooked. They marinated pretty well. However, didn't know the serving size was this small, only two small pieces compared to other regular quesadillas. I wasn't full after the two small pieces, wish they indicated how small/how many pieces the order came with on the menu so I could order more next time. However, I recommend this restaurant!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Happy hour drinks were a great deal! My friends and I got multiple plates and enjoyed the vibes (great music). Would definitely come back for happy hour but probably go elsewhere for tacos.

This was my second time coming to this restaurant and it was just as delicious as the 1st time. My friend and I shared and enjoyed the pork, steak and fish tacos with a side of fresh chips and guacamole. I'm a sucker for frozen drinks so I ordered the Prickly Pear frozen margarita and it was delicious while my friend ordered the Rompe Corazon which he enjoyed. I definitely recommend giving this restaurant a go. The atmosphere and vibes are nice trust me you'll enjoy it.

very rude service. When I got my food the proportions were really small but the food was amazing especially the sauces. Those made the whole meal enjoyable and not so upsetting about the small portions.

The food is not so great here & neither r the drinks. I think the busy downtown crowd overwhelms the establishment. I came for HH, ordered on margarita on the rocks & empanadas, $10 each. I wish I took the pic of the empanadas, they were small and unflavored. The margarita was ok.. probably wouldn't come back for HH or any other time.

Food and service is excellent! Beautiful intimate setting with a tropical vibe! Rib Eye Churrasco was tasty and cooked just right! Churros was a perfect ending! And washed it down with a Sangria!

Delicious food at pretty high prices TBH. The upside is that the interior is beautiful (especially the "outdoor" indoor patio outside the restaurant, and no one else was inside the restaurant the entire time we were there... (we ate at 5 pm on a Friday evening)... The cocktails were strong, which was a plus. They did forget one of our items (an app), however they caught the error themselves and asked if we still wanted it served prior to removing it from our check, which was gracious of them. Overall, probably won't be back, but a solid choice in the Fulton St area.

Came for brunch with a friend and there's a brunch menu but their dinner menu is available all day which is why I got fish tacos! I also appreciate their mocktails selection which had actual pineapple fruit in the drink. Overall, it was great enjoying the food and their outdoor space is great!!

Fun ambiance, great service, and delicious drinks! The food was just ok. The carne asada tacos were very cheesy but the steak was overcooked. The mole sauce was overwhelmingly smokey.

I know I came here just a few months ago but I feel like giving an update. When I came last time, it was for taco Tuesday and I definitely thought that this place gave off date night vibes. My bf wanted to take me out for my birthday so I chose Las Santas. I made reservations just in case--I don't think it's necessary to but I don't think we would have gotten the seats we did if I didn't. I liked our seating--we could sit next to each other rather than facing each other. It reminded me of that movie "Date Night" with Tiny Fey. Anyway, we were promptly seated. Our server came to take our drink and appetizer orders. I knew there was a drink called Not a Piña Colada but I didn't see it listed--it turns out that they took it off the menu but they still made it for my bf. I got the Rosada Negra--it's frozen and delicious (after taking a sip of my bf's drink, I decided to get one for myself). For appetizers, we got the chips and salsa and coconut shrimp. I like that they give a variety of salsas and the chips were not too salty. My bf was all over the coconut shrimp. For entrees, I got the churrasco with yucca fries and avocado salad and he got the salmon with truffle mashed potatoes, mashed sweet potatoes and Okinawa mashed purple potatoes. My steak was cooked perfectly and the salmon was really good. I had a good time like the first time--it's a great place for drinks or a date night.
No comment

I was excited to try this place but was pretty disappointed. Staff was kind and relatively attentive but twice went to take away our plates before we were done. Ordered the spritzes with our brunch food and it was definitely flat not bubbly. (For how many amazing drink reviews are on here I was fully surprised how not good our spritzes were) Food came out so fast we didn't have time to hang out really. Space is suuuuuuuper cute though I will give them that and the food was decent. Not my favorite experience but not the worst, therefore, 3 stars.

This was a very cool place! The inside is very neat and chique, with dimmed lights and really queues a nice environment. The staff was nice and friendly and the food was delicious! I got the steak fajitas and the steak was cook beautifully- it was truly great.

The ambiance of this place is fantastic. Behind the curtains is the indoor seating, which was beautiful. We each had the 3 tacos for $10. My fish tacos were great. My husband said his carne tacos were just ok. The nachos were truly the best nachos I've ever had. The pickled onions and jalapeños on top were the perfect flavor. We had the chorizo on the side for my husband, and he ate it all. There's no kids menu, but the setting is completely appropriate for kids, as long as they are pretty mellow. Mine is used to restaurants, so he was good to go. He had the cheese quesadilla, which came with some beans inside and was really delicious. Would absolutely recommend this place.

Mexican spot with good food and good drinks, was able to come at 730pm on a friday and immediately be seated, which was nice. Food was tasty but didn't feel worth what I paid in my opinion. The burrito says "$16", but then you have to pay an extra $6-8 to add meat, so I expected a lot out of this burrito. All that for a burrito, I still ordered it hoping I would be overstuffed but it was much smaller than I expected, like the size of a wrap. What I especially didn't like was after paying $22, I asked if I could have any sort of hot sauce/salsa for the burrito, as most places automatically serve, they charged extra for that too! It definitely was a tasty meal but overpriced to me.
No comment
What a wonderful place to eat! For a busy night, the service was fairly good. Try the fish tacos  YUMMY
I loved the food, although the portions could've been better for the price. I liked our service. The ambiance and view of the street was nice.

I came here with some friends right before a basketball game. I had high expectations for this place due to the reviews but unfortunately, I was really disappointed! I got the fish tacos and they were too salty. I definitely liked the atmosphere of this place! The inside was super dim. However, I will probably not be returning.

Eh, don't come here if you were looking for spicy Mexican food.. waitress wassssss not helpful and didn't check in with us nearly ever I had to flag her down every time we needed things. Food was aight but I was starving so

Las Santas mushroom tacos might be the best mushrooms tacos I've ever had. They are deliciously savory! I love the seasoning/marinate that they put on the mushrooms and you can't beat 3 tacos for $10 for taco Tuesday. Not only was the food amazing, but our waiter was such a great host. She was very attentive but gave us room to eat. The decor also made you feel like you were getting a full 360 dining experience. I would 100% recommend and will be coming back!

Stepped inside of due to it being happy hour after the week I had I definitely needed a drink. The atmosphere of this place is amazing. Great decor, music selection. The menus are digital, the food is amazing though I only had multiple orders of the nachos (steak Nachos to be exact) I definitely plan on returning to this spot on another day.
birriah quesadilla were so good i loved them. great service and cute cups! food came fast

Near BAM, tucked away on a side street. I went on a weeknight and it felt empty (but the place is, to be fair, huge). The food was surprisingly good! I suspect this place fills up on weekends and does a lot of local parties.
