Plenty of outdoor seating! It was packed on a weds for tiki night. Music is lively, Service is awesome and food came quick. Staff wears masks and gloves. The bathroom has a push door so no need to touch any door handles! I brought my little pup who sat quietly under our table and they were cool about it. The drinks are strong and tasty. I got the mango island (Rum base) and he got the sharknado (whiskey based drink). I'll be trying the pina colada next time since I see a lot of people ordering that with their meal. The corn and peppers are YUM. Guacamole portion is a bit on the smaller side but still tasty. The soup is FAB. Will definitely get that again especially as it gets chillier through the months. The tacos come with 2 in a order which is perfect for me since I can never finish 3 plus all the apps! Fish taco is . Not overly fried. Fish is flaky and not too much breading. The carnitas taco is heavier but good; with a lot of meat and fried pork rinds on top for a nice crunch! Flan is good but on the richer side. I'll try the churros next time. So glad this place is a short walk from our apt!
No comment

I recently ate at this spot for the first time this past Friday. The ambiance and vibe were great for a Friday night. There was a DJ playing a mix of good music. The menu was great with vegan option available. The wait staff was amazing. The food was tasty and serving size was more than sufficient. My margaritas were delicious. I ordered the margarita pitcher which served about 6-8 glasses. I will definitely be returning in the future.
Amazing spot- love the usual chicken soup, and fish tacos and fresh guacamole with my go to - guava margarita.

First and foremost, the owner was so accommodating and went the extra step to make us feel at home at Las Santa's; from allowing us to change tables and occasionally checking up on us to see how our meals were. The food was just as amazing. I recommend the baby back short ribs and the enchiladas de pollo. The ribs were so tender and the enchiladas were full of flavor and a great portion size. The atmosphere was beautiful as well. Will definitely be back! Thanks for having us
No comment
No comment

Vicente is a very caring and attentive server. He took great care of us even during Covid regulations. The mood and food were all amazing and consistent. Beautiful food on a tranquil Brooklyn city corner. Definitely recommend the shisito peppers and and corn! Love!! It's a whole vibe!

My boyfriend and I had a date brunch here...so glad we did. The wait staff were attentive, the ambiance was awesome, and the food was fantastic! Not to mention the drinks were pretty good too. Definitely will return!
This place is great. Been here a few times and the food is always amazing. My server Vincente was awesome, great customer service.

Pre Covid, this place was great, great food great atmosphere. I went back this weekend, not as good as before. New management, new menu. Bring back the house made tortillas, now your using cheap pre packaged tortillas. $10 bucks for chips and salsa is steep. Everything else we ordered was ok, not great.
Amazing steak quesadilla, empanadas and drinks  and service was so fast with our attentive server Vicente!!! Had a great experience
No comment

Average trendy Mexican place. Overpriced but nice outdoor seating option in downtown Brooklyn. Wasn't a fan of the watermelon margarita but I'm sure their other margs are fine (can't make a bad marg!). Had the fish tacos and didn't love them. We ordered the salsas with hopes that the peanut salsa would be awesome but it was weird. The other salsas were great though. Basic tasty guac. My friend got a quesadilla and she really liked it. Again pretty average but worth a try!

The drinks are good but come in a baby size cup definitely not worth the price!! I had the shrimp quesadilla and it was mostly cheese definitely not worth the menu price they could've gave more shrimps then 6!!! Staff was friendly!! Due to the prices I wouldn't recommend or come back again!!!

I cam here with my friend the other day (during covid). The drinks were really good, even over flowing. I had a mango margaritas which was really tasty along with the steak tacos. The service was amazing, we got seated right away and the tables were safely distanced. I loved how you have to scan a qr code to receive the menu so you aren't touching menus that have been touched. Also the staff gladly replaced my drink after a fly flew into it . I will definitely be coming back for more margaritas and tacos.

column3: Southeast Colorado Springs, Colorado Springs, CO
column6: Food is overly expensive and not great. I rather go to Taco Bell. Even if they lower the prices to 50%.
I am so glad to have come here with my friends! Food, drinks and music was so good!! Vincente was amazing as our server! Went above and beyond to make sure that we were all happy

This is for the mushroom tacos only. They are delicious unless you have a thing against mushrooms. Fresh, balanced, and juicy. 10/10 would recommend. Ordered one set of three and promptly ordered an additional plate of three after tasting.

Tried this place on a Sunday and it wasn't crowded at all. I ordered the steak fajitas with a side of guac and a spicy margarita. The steak was good but the rice was undercooked and the beans lacked in flavor(could've just been the cook for the day). My margarita however, was amazing! My server was awesome and attentive.
Brunch time ! Outdoor atmosphere is cute and they have good music , excited to try the marg and the tres leches cake... i would come for sure when the weather is nice

Went here the other night because we were walking by and it looked really spaced and not crowded- we didn't realize til half way through our meal it was because they were almost closed- even though they were closing they were so kind to us and the food was delicious, we had a great time and great food! The tacos are great as well as los esquites
Everything was delicious, shrimp enchilada and chicken tacos where on point. Fresh natural juices. We enjoyed the outdoors sitting.

My Husband and I were celebrating our fourth wedding anniversary and had such a great time here!! The libations are delicious and strong! We only ordered chicken empanadas because we weren't that hungry but they were delicious. Our waiter Juan S. was amazing and attentive. The outside is sexy, relaxing, and enjoyable!
No comment

If you want fresh authentic Mexican food you must try here. This restaurant is bigger than you think can easily sit 50+people. The complimentary salsa and chips was delicious. The chips were freshly made and their homemade salsa had a roasted flavor. The vampiro Tostada was delicious filled with an ample portion of charred steak. I just wished for its price it was two. The steak was well seasoned and juicy. The guacamole was fresh however,  I prefer my guacamole to be mashed not chunky. The guacamole had a nice zesty flavor from the lime juice. My best friend said the chicken quesadilla was good and that avocado crema ?? (light green sauce) was really good. I added that on top of my steak. I ordered the Paloma which was made with fresh grapefruit juice. This drink was so refreshing and had the right amount of tequila. For the month of January they have a pass you can get on Eventbrite to get buy one get one free drink. The decor is also pretty. I wished I took more pictures but I will definitely come back to try other foods.

Food was delicious and fresh. It seems like it's made to order. The drinks were good and the service was great! All in all this is a solid place. Not to mention that actual restaurant is decorated beautifully and the bathroom was clean which is IMPORTANT!
No comment

The food was delicious, but the impeccable service made it all that much better. From the moment we walked in - whether it was someone taking off our coats and bags and hanging them for us, or proactively replacing our order after a mishap in the kitchen, we felt truly taken care of during our time there and def would go back anytime!
Food was amazing and our waiter was even better! Thank you, Vicente, your service was magnificent. Great drinks too!!
No comment
Great food, amazing service! I would recommend this place as a great pre-game spot before a fun night out. Fuel up on some great food, have a drink or two, then you're ready for a great night
No comment

My boyfriend and I came here for my birthday weekend and we had a really great time! We had the Baja fish tacos, chicken tacos, Yuca fries, and coconut fried shrimp. For drinks we had the coco loco margs and dessert we had the churros with guava sauce. Everything but the chicken tacos were amazing(those were just ok but hey, they're chicken tacos)!! I'm going to dream about the yuca fries lol. The ambiance is beautiful, the waitresses and waiters are awesome, the gentlemen that sat us at our table was great, and the salsa music playing in the background really added to the entire experience. We will definitely be back!
No comment

The food was awesome: guac, queso fundido, and fajitas. Surpassed my expectations. The four star is for the truly awful frozen margarita. No idea how they messed it up but I should have send it back. Don't order, just do a regular or another drink/cocktail.

Love Mexican food ?? Me too' can't go wrong  with Las Santa's .. i love the ambiance , it was lunch time so it was a cool vibe . The window seating  is great , drenched with natural sunlight , the bar has a wide variety of liquor . Our waiter  name was "Andre " he was a darling ! The food was great ! Parking is limited because of the busy down town traffic . But  the food is definitely  worth your while , i feel like this  place can  be family and kid friendly ! GOT MY VOTE
No comment

Drinks were good. Great service. Love the decor and ambience. However the food was undercooked, mediocre, & had the most random ingredients m. My nachos had one piece of a chopped carton which I believe didn't belong there, but the waiter claimed they used "non traditional" ingredients in their food. Also the chicken in my nachos was cooked medium. I see the vision but the execution is poor. Glad I tried it but I won't be returning.

I went here as an impromptu girls' night for drinks and a bite. The food was well seasoned.  We had the shrimp and carne asada tacos, guacamole & chips, shrimp fajitas and a burrito (which was tasty yet not enough). The drinks were flavorful and was balanced with enough alcohol. The service though.........was unsatisfactory. They were slow and not attentive. Mixed up our order and asked were we sure of what we ordered. Had to wait for drinks and again the wrong thing was brought. If they were busy, I would have given it a pass, but with limited sitting, few patrons, and full staff, it was very disappointing. They get a three star for food and ambiance.

Wanted to try this place after reading  so many good reviews. Was not  disappointed with service And food . Our server and bartender Andre made a great guava margarita. The food was fresh and tasty.  Would like to come back for happy  hour and dinner next time.
This place is super cute! Love the vibe. Lenny and Juanes was our server and provided such great service! Definitely going to come back. Happy hour was amazing!

First time coming here and it wont be my last! Love everything: staff, bar, seating and most of all food!! Would love to throw a party or fundraiser here when it gets warmer! Def order the tres leches pancakes, absolutely love the strawberry compote (and of course the tres leches one!).

probably one of my favorite meals i've ever had in NY. the bartender was speedy and working her butt off. our waitress was amazing, food was ON POINT and the vibe was perfect. literally such a good experience. would absolutely tell a friend to go (often).
Excellent food, great service, beautiful interior, A+ presentation. Best kept secret in Fort Greene!

Las Santa's was amazing. I came in at 6 and didn't know about the happy hour specials. I was greeted by the hostess with a super cute mini happy hour menu. The prices were phenomenal. I wasn't planning on eating but had the best 7$ nachos ever and 2 tacos. Mai the bartender made me the perfect margarita on the rocks and when she wasn't available I was served by James who brought out my food in literally 5 minutes and kept checking in on me throughout my meal. Both bartenders were so warm and friendly and I had a great meal at the bar for such a terrific price with drinks!!! Best spot in downtown Bk. I will be back !!!
No comment
Amazing fish tacos. Our table also had the chorizo and steak tacos, chorizo empanadas, churros and tres leches cake. All were great!

I came here and was refused service for no reason and I was the ONLY BLACK person there. He claimed that I sounded drunk which I was not ! I told him that this is how I speak (I have an speech impediment) and he continues to refuse me service and told me to leave. I was so embarrassed and felt like this was a racial discrimination. This is unacceptable and I will make sure something get done about it
Went pre-covid. Nice decor, nice ambiance, food was okay. I can see myself going back purely out of convenience
The place is amazing, felt like I wasn't in New York but rather on a mini vacation  Vicente was so nice and attentive, the food and vibe was amazing, highly recommended!
No comment

I'm so glad this place opened after quarantine. It is a great spot for delicious Mexican food and cocktails. 100% recommend churros for dessert. Our waiter's name was Vicente, a very pleasant person who provided great service and made sure all of our food needs were met. Definitely will be back!

Decided to go here last night.... very spontaneous move after walking home from target. We walked in and it looked super cute so it was an instant YES for me. The waiter was amazing he gave us time to look at Menu and informed us of their daily yes DAILY happy hour specials. Everyday  2-6 you can pick from 3 empanadas 3 tostadas or 3 tacos. Your choice of filling chicken, veggies or chorizo plus a alcoholic beverage for only $15. Don't even have to say how amazing this is. The food was amazing. I ended up getting 3 chicken tacos and a marg which made the tacos even better. We also got guacamole & chips and it was super fresh and delicious. Would recommend this place in a heart beat & for sure going back again.

Such an amazing find!! Came here for happy hour after work on Friday! The space is amazing as the restaurant has an indoor/ outdoor feel and also tables outside. Happy hour ends at 6pm and they have great (somewhat small) margarita specials. My husband and I also both ordered the chicken tacos which were so delicious. We ended up ordering their entree size once happy hour was over since we really loved it. We also had chips and guacamole for the table. Great scene! It was pretty packed so the waiter didn't come around as often as I would have liked but what can ya do? Highly recommend this place.
No comment
Vicente has been amazing tonight! He was very attentive and the food and drinks were amazing. They will have outdoor bubbles and heat lamps soon so get ready!

Excellent menu and high quality ingredients packed with old and new world Mexican flavors. The energy and service reminds you of a good home cooked meal with attention to providing a seamless experience. Salsa music is also trendy and fun!!

The restaurant was super clean and organized. It was our first time here and we had the pleasure of being served by Vicente. He was really friendly and attentive in helping us choose an app, course and dessert. He was really prompt with making sure we got it all perfectly. Everything was delicious. We cant wait to come back. Thank you so much Vicente!
First off, thank you to Vicente for making my birthday brunch so relaxing and fun. The food was absolutely delicious. This is definitely a place to go for a good time :)

Trying new restaurants can be daunting with a garlic allergy. When I saw Las Santas pop up on Caviar I decided to give them a call to see if they had any garlic free offerings. The gentleman who helped me was  kind and thorough, he checked with the kitchen and they offered to make me steak & chicken fajitas with vegetables. He even called backto let me know I could not eat the rice & beans but they would send me plantains. Everything was delicious and I'm thrilled to have a new neighborhood restaurant I can trust.

I love supporting new places in the neighborhood and was so happy to see a Mexican restaurant open up so close by, so knew we had to try it! The space is huge, which you don't often see in the area, so we were able to sit immediately on a Friday (it was crowded too, which was great to see). In a nutshell, I was not impressed. The drinks were good, but the food left a lot to be desired. The guac was tasteless, chips were stale. The tacos...we had the steak, chicken and baja fish. Would say the fish was the best and the steak was awful. I was happy to see a lot of meat in it, but the taste just wasn't at the level it should be, and there was a lot of fat. The service was also extremely slow. Perhaps we hit it on a rough night.

Stopped by las Santa's last night before I had a show across the street At bam. I just have to say this from the time me and my partner walked in the entire staff was friendly. Jose was our server and was  attentive through our meal. The food was excellent me and my partner-although enjoyed the dishes. I would recommend a little more salt  however. shared a few different tacos, fish, chorizo & chicken. Also had the guacamole which was very fresh. I would definitely come back and bringing some of my friends !
Amazing service by Vicente , the food is delicious and everyone was very  kind. Definitely I recommend the Mango Margaritas and the fish tacos. For dessert the delicious churros with chocolate.
Vicente the best server in this place . Great environment great food . Awesome service.  Vicente is the best . If I can give 10 starts I would.

I went to Las Santas after work with some friends for my birthday. The happy hour prices are very fair and the drinks were great! Our server, Vicente, was amazing. Very personable and fun. Definitely plan on going back.
We just moved into the area, it's our first time time here. We came for lunch. The lunch and drink special is amazing and our server Vicente was so quick, efficient, and fun! Definitely coming back!
SO happy this place is UP AND RUNNING! Vincente ALWAYS makes my night!!!!!!! Food is BOMB too

So this is instantly my favorite spot. The fish tacos with a side of chipotle is the bomb. And the bartender Gabriel is sooooo bomb and personal!! We click immediately and then the manager James came over and you would've thought we were all family how we all just vibed. I think this spot might be my go to.
Such a great atmosphere! Lenny and Juanes were such great servers! He was so fast and kind! A really enjoyable happy hour
My sister and I had a wonderful time!! The carne asada special was amazing!!! Good music and great service! Our waiter Juan S. Was the best! We really enjoyed having dinner here!

Vicente he is an amazing waiter and so happy when he serves me. James is an amazing manager, he always bring laughters when I come to order. La Santas is just an all around amazing spot to be at, music is great and vibes are amazing.

This is a great addition to our neighborhood. From the margaritas to the queso fundito to the chicken enchiladas to the fish tacos, everything was great. The service was fast and friendly. Our waiter, Ben, made some excellent recommendations on the different salsas and entrees. Going back tonight.

The menu had so many unique and delicious options. We had the tuna tostada, the bacon wrapped shrimp poppers and the whole fish. All were 5 Stars! The interior is simple and stylish, with a spectacular open kitchen the length of the dining room. The service was friendly and professional. Go!

I got the chicken quesadillas and the shrimp tacos and they were pretty close to inedible. Extremely salty and lacking in flavor for a $50 dollar delivery. Giving two stars since I'm hopeful the other menu items are better but if you are thinking of ordering the items I ordered above, I highly suggest making them at home or going to a local deli for higher quality at a fraction of the price.
Great evening, good meal, and perfect service! The tacos were amazing highly recommend the fish tacos they were delicious

Dinner at the end of "happy hour" was noisy, as it should be, and the food was very, very, very good, - real Mexican cooking, a rich blend of smoky/hot spices in the  chicken enchiladas and tang in the shrimp enchiladas.  Go there, eat well.  I'm going back.

Juan S is the homie! Awesome happy hour, 3 mini tacos and a drink for $15! You can also get 3 empanadas or tostada's, totally worth, and the food is very fresh. This Yelp review got us free tequila :)
No comment

worth the trip. Shared the Jicama salad and the shrimp fajitas with my mom. I would have been happy with a full order of either but so glad we shared and got to try both. The salad was so good- full of different kinds of extremely fresh greens, jicama, pomegranate, thin sliced cucumber and a refreshing lime dressing. The fajitas were served with homemade tortillas, yummy beans and rice and these perfect roasted veggies. The shrimp was delish but the veggies- wow! It was this combo of cauli, zucchini, beets, peppers, onion, greens but they were roasted and seasoned to perfection. Ended with the bananas foster. It was as good as the meal. Love that this is fresh and healthy. The portions are right sized and seasoned well. Not a bunch of cheese on the food . Definitely on my list of places to come back too.

It was my first time at this restaurant and I got food poisoning from their salmon and rice dish (I don't know which part of the dish caused the food poisoning). Spent the entire night after dinner vomiting and I still feel pretty terrible. The staff was polite and the manager said they would process a refund. I wasn't planning on writing anything but I'm worried for other customers. Please take steps to ensure food safety.
Great decor, solid queso, terrible chips, and average fish tacos.

Love a good Mexican food restaurant and this one hit the spot! Let me start with the most important, tequila! Very good selection and great margaritas. I didn't try any other cocktails but they looked really good. Food is super fresh and authentic which is a big plus for me and the family.

This is not your typical taqueria. This is Mexico City at its best. Authentic food, natural ingredients with the right spice and heat. The tacos are pressed and grilled by hand in a beautiful open kitchen and dining room. The meat and chicken are grilled to perfection  The margaritas are perfectly simple, 3 ingredients, as it should be. There is no shortage of handmade guacamole. Try everything, because there are misses.

I made reservations for Thanksgiving for a  group of four days in advance. I received confirmations, emails, and alerts about my confirmation. I was told that a table for four would be reserved for 5:30 P.M. . When we arrive some lady comes out and says we have to leave because they are having a private party. I showed her the reservation and she gets upset and calls the bartender over. He tells us that we have to leave because they are technically closed and I tell him that we have reservations. The bartender tells us that we are mistaken and that we have to leave. I asked for the manager and minutes later some guy comes out. I ask if he is the manager and then ask for his name. He tells me my name is Robert and I am the manager what's the problem. I asked him for his last name and he tells me that Robert is sufficient and we must leave because they are having a private party. I tell him the website says the restaurant is OPEN and I show him my reservations and the emails, confirmations and alerts. Robert tells me that's a mistake and we cannot stay that we have to go somewhere else and he would call me later, what ever that meant. I made reservations to avoid the shopping, preparation, cooking, and cleaning this Thanksgiving. I traveled with my elderly mother, my pregnant fiancé, and our eleven year old son to eat on Thanksgiving  and had to eat McDonald's because the place could not get it right. WTF!
Loooove this place! Drinks are amazing, food is delicious, must try shishito peppers, guacamole, takos, steak fajitas and fish !

This location must be cursed - every restaurant that occupies the space is truly inedible and this restaurant might be the worst one yet. We received nachos with literally no cheese that were freezing cold, steak fajitas that were chewy and a meat that was a taste I've never experienced in any meat form of even mediocre quality. The one star is for the vegetables that came with the fajitas that were decent. Not to mention, the service is horrible - especially for an empty restaurant at 9pm on a Saturday night - the poor bus boy was the only person who visited our terrible ever. What a shame this prime location and nice space is so horrible.

The staff is really nice, so there's that.  A decent looking space, as well.  Unfortunately, service is poor (25 mins for drink, 20 mins for the check), the sangria tastes like cough syrup, and the food tastes cheap (calling it Mexican food is a bit generous, the dishes feel more like generic Mexican options at an American chain).  Better off going to Tacombi across the street if looking in the immediate area, or Ojala a half mile away for more authentic Mexican.

Such a great atmosphere, lively, fun and you can still have a conversation. Service is so friendly and the second time visiting, we were warmly acknowledged straight away! Food was also great, fresh, and cocktails also refreshing. Looking forward to trying their brunch!
Food is mediocre at best and yet incredibly expensive. Come here for a drink, but that's it. No, don't get the guacamole either.

Such a great place to grab a drink after work with friends! The cocktails are incredible and the service is very friendly and efficient. The nachos got demolished as soon as they came out and their happy hour specials are phenomenal. This is absolutely going to be the new regular place to come to!
No comment

Absolutely exceptional and one of the best Mexican restaurants in the city. The food is very flavorful and delicious with great service to boot. The chef came out and recommended his personal churros recipe with bitter chocolate to dip, phenomenal!

Super cute place. The back is adorable. The food is great and the servers are very friendly. Attentive but not overbearing and very patient. We were there until closing and didn't even realize as they let us enjoy ourselves without rushing us. Thank you!
Great food and great service! Better vibes than Tacombi if you're looking for a pre-BAM dinner spot.

I have been here multiple times and this is by far the worst experience. The food lacked seasoning and did not taste as good as it did in the past. We noted our concerns to the manager and he took it off the bill. Kudos for customer service.
My family and I decided to try a new restaurant to spice things up. Outstanding service and delicious food. The decoration was beautiful, I highly recommend this restaurant. I will be back very soon.
Really nice place. I've eaten there twice now.  Unique dishes - some good vegetarian options.

Finally a refreshing experience I truly enjoyed!!! As a person who loves to try new restaurants this one is  definitely a "GO TO" for great food and amazing drinks. Ambiance is also beautifully set up. Now all they need is a dance floor!!! Go LAS SANTAS I am hookedd!!!

Had an amazing time here last night. The food, decor, service and drinks were outstanding! This spot is literally perfect for any occasion: date night, group dinners, or popping in for a few drinks. Wishing this place a successful soft opening and I definitely hope Las Santas is here to stay!
No comment
No comment

Great customer service and food! Vicente took care of us with a very pleasant and friendly manner. Definetely going back to eat more tasteful and delicious guacamole, taco fish and churros! Ohh and the  frozen mango margarita was delicious too!
Received these laughable products in return for $50.  Inedible, late, missing items.  Stay away.

We were eager to try this new restaurant that opened just down the street from us.  Started with the chorizo nachos to share.  Chips and salsa are complimentary.  Sister and I shared the whole fish and Mayan ribs, both of which were really good.  The fish was particularly juicy.  Others had the fajitas, chicken and shrimp, which also looked good.  Didn't have any drinks but others ordered the habanero margarita, guava margarita and michelada.  The tequila in it was tasty and actually spicy, likely due to the hot sauces that are made in house.  Tortillas are also made in house by hand.  Probably due to the first month opening, but the flow of service is a little slow but nothing terrible.  All in all, really happy restaurants are finally opening up in these new construction retail spaces along Fulton, and hopefully las Santas is an indication of what's more to come.
One of my new favorite Mexican restaurants! Food and cocktails are so authentic and delicious! Loved their tacos, guacamole and enchiladas. Will definitely be back
This place is great! Mai (the bartender) took very good care of us. James (the manager) did as well. Food is really good! Definitely a must go
No comment

Great place! A bartender made 2 different cocktails that weren't on the menu and both were delicious. Food was great, tacos were extra delicious and a waiter was the most pleasant human ever. The entire vibe was great and very much needed during the pandemic

Las Santas located in one of the most hottest places in Brooklyn, is run by a fantastic staff and the food was great. The bartender Gabriele was nice and gave a bunch of suggestions on what I should get to eat. I ultimately had a frantic pork taco with a side of chips and a fantastic margarita. The manager James is a kind, he came over to check on me a few times throughout my visit. I can't wait to come back & try more some different dishes.
Came here tonight and it was amazing !. They had a DJ playing great music, the food was amazing & well balanced. The staff was also friendly and quick. I will certainly be back with some friends.
No comment
Vincente is the sweetest and super attentive. The passion fruit margarita was so fresh. Will definitely be coming back for happy hour.
Great food ,went for Happy hour on Tuesday dinner was great ,drinks were great got some shots Casamigos .,it was a great night.Recommend for  a good girls nite out
Amazing service, delicious food, beautiful atmosphere. They really made my visit wonderful. It's a good place for a date or fancy occasion.

We dined at Las Santa's on Sunday for Brunch. Vicente was amazing. He was upbeat and knowledgeable. The restaurant followed COVID precautions and was safe and not crowded. The food was amazing and I will definitely dine here again.
Vicente OMG  He Was Great! Very Attentive. He kept checking in to make sure we we're okay and well taken care of! Come here you will be Pleased! THANK YOU VICENTE!!! SEE YOU AGAIN!! KAY

I ordered on the Yelp app, which was super easy to begin with. By the time I got there, my food was ready and bagged. The bartender was really friendly and let me eat my take out at a table. The food, which I'm still eating, is absolutely fantastic. I couldn't wait to write the review because it's THAT good. I'm eating empanadas, quesadilla with chicken, and plantains. All of it is insanely delicious. Well done Las Santas, I'll be back for more!
Vicente is amazing!! The wait staff are great and friendly and the food is AMAZING!!!!

The tacos and margaritas are soo goood! The ensalada verde is also amazing! The atmosphere is so chill! Definitely one of my faves and Vicente was amazing!! He went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience.
Great service.  Little to no wait time.  Jose the waiter was professional, kind and a good vibe in all.  Enjoyed the food and drinks.   Definitely coming back soon!!
Las Santas is amazing. Make sure to request Juanes or Lenny as your server they are awesome!!! Great service and so much fun

Impeccable service and the food was amazing!! Thanks to ur waiter and his recommendations on the special for the night!!! Finished the night off with free tequila shots!!!! A definite go to! Good food! Good drinks and good music!

I absolutely loved this place from my very 1st visit. The location,  the atmosphere, the vibe, the music and omg the food and drinks . The staff is very welcoming,  friendly, and attentive . My personal fav is VINCENTE. He's such a sweet and bubbly soul. If you ever visit ask for him and you're gonna understand exactly what i mean
Our server Vincente was simply amazing. The food was absolutely amazing and the drinks to die for! My fave was the passionfruit margarita !!!

We had a really great night and the food was delicious. Shoutout to the most excellent server Vicente who was busting his butt to grab us food and drinks so quickly and with a smile on his face. Great margaritas and the queso was awesome. Highly recommend. Loved it!

What a wonderful place. I came here last weekend and the outside was beautifully done with plants and tiki torches, it really give a great vibe. The service was great also they were very attentive & always nearby. The food & drinks were great as well. this place is literally immaculate, the servers are wearing masks and gloves (which I saw them change often) & the establishment itself was also very clean. I spoke to the manager (John or James) I think & he was also very pleasant & knowledgeable of the menu & drinks. I will certainly be back and recommend this place.
Went here for the first time during covid even though I've lived across from it for three years. Vicente was amazing! The service was fantastic. Will definitely be back.

WOW WOW WOW. We were looking for a place to eat out on a Saturday and found Las Santas in Yelp. We decided to give it a try even though it was new and were we happy we did. This was one of those kinds of meals where after every single bite you put in your mouth, from beginning to start, everyone can't stop saying how good it is. The food and drink were SO fresh and the flavors were out of this world. Some standout dishes were the empanadas, shrimp ceviche, tortilla soup (best that I've ever had) and the enchiladas with the dreamy mole sauce. We cannot wait to bring others back with us!! The best part of it all was that the prices were so reasonable for such top notch, authentic food. They also have a really cool bar in the front and will be starting HH soon!

Please save me from over the top Mexican restaurants Where the decor overshadows the food. Huge dining room, very gaudy and loud. Food was Mostly bland, small servings and lacked authenticity. Served a thimble size of salsa with small saucer of chips. Drinks were watery. More splash than substance. I give them 3-6 months at most.
Great brunch spot! Nice drink selection and tasty brunch options! Great service with an accommodating staff.
Great service, nice bartenders, fresh, delicious food! My after work go to spot! Mai was great bartender!! Friendly owner!

Came here for Sunday brunch with some friends for my husbands birthday. We were surprised to find how empty the restaurant was for that time slot... Including ourselves, there was only one other table of guest. First I want to say that the service was good and the overall decor and cleanliness were nice. However the food on the other hand was a little lackluster. Our bowl of guac which was $13 (a little pricy even for NY standards) was 75% tomatoes and onions. There was barely ANY actual avocado! I reminded me more of a salsa than a guacamole. That is NOT acceptable in the slightest especially for how much they charged! I have honestly never experienced a restaurant to be that cheap with their guacamole. For entrees two people order tacos and the other two ordered quesadillas, both of which were bland. I was able to taste more cheese than actual steak in my quesadillas :( Overall I wouldn't come back as there are tons of better Mexican restaurants in NYC.

Beautiful new spot just opened near Barclays Center and BAM. Good food, fun service. We had the fish tacos and the queso and both were fantastic. Our server Abby had a great sense of humor and was very helpful. I would definitely recommend a drink or bite before or after a show!

Amazing restaurant, great presentation and quality service.  We wandered in her on Christmas Day and the experience was amazing!   Alessandro is all kinds of awesome.  Go here.  You won't be disappointed!

Came here tonight with my friend, we ordered the nachos and they were the best we've ever had? Bartenders were so friendly and we felt right at home. Gabrielle really made us feel welcome with his charm and hospitality, we can't wait to be back tomorrow!

A great spot with incredible food and delicious margs. Gabriel, the bartender, was incredibly friendly and full of wonderful recommendations. They've got a great weekday lunch special for $12 that actually comes with a surprising amount of food. Will defiiitely be planning to stop in regularly.

I enjoyed this place so much. The baja fish taco was to die for. Definitely authentic, which is comforting to find. I also enjoyed the service. Mai was attentive, sweet, and made sure everything was going well. Definitely recommend!
Food is incredible- super fresh ingredients and delicious cocktails! Have been back multiple times since opening. Staff is incredibly friendly.  Such a great addition to the neighborhood!

I grew up in San Antonio and have always had a hard time finding good Mexican food in NYC. This place was so great. Some of the best guacamole I've had. Amazing, thick tortilla chips. I had the nachos and they were really great. Super friendly waiter. We went on a Saturday night and there was a DJ playing reggaeton that I could have done without... But otherwise great night!
No comment

Great casual bar with fantastic drinks and friendly service. Very welcoming staff and upscale cocktails. We were looking for a pre-show drink before heading to BAM and this was exactly what we needed. Thank you!!

Valentina was such a lovely bartender! And Ben - I think that was his name - made extra laps around the restaurant just to make sure I was taken care of, so definitely would recommend! Oh - and the food is delicious, most importantly! Yay for new restaurants !

We had our staff holiday lunch here yesterday and all of us from the Center for Fiction loved everything. The room is beautiful, the people are all welcoming, and the food was delicious and reasonably priced. The guacamole is especially good. I plan to become a regular and hope lots of other people will as well, so that this place stays open and thrives. The neighborhood desperately needs it.

Great food and service. If you're in the mood for authentic mexican food, this is one of the best places I've found and I visit NY, Chicago, Miami, etc... The service was quick and efficient and everything I have tried on the menu has been top top notch
Nice place clean and creative food , need salt on table though food needed a little salt for my taste drinks were good but was disappointed with mimosa when it came with ice in it

Visited this place on a Tuesday night. It wasn't very busy so we had a secluded booth or ourselves. We took our time with apps and cocktails.the mango and classic margarita were both very refreshing. Loved our tacos and even got corn flan as a dessert on the house courtesy of management. The service was excellent, I wish I could remember our server's name because she had such great suggestions and was so nice. Would definitely recommend.
Delicious food, super fresh taste.   Excellent service and very attentive personnel. Highly recommended

My first YELP review. I was eagerly anticipating this restaurant opening and I can say that I was not disappointed. The food and drinks were on point. I stuck with appetizers this time around but will be back for entrees.

Had an amazing time at the bar with Gabriel! Super nice bartender, very passionate about the restaurants food and drinks! I'll definitely be stopping by soon to try out more food and drinks on the menu!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Xu's Public House offers some delicious dishes in a swanky setting!  I don't eat seafood so we stayed away from their extensive seafood selection. We loved everything we ordered. The snow white pork buns were exceptional. The outside is crisp but then instantly give way to a fluffy, slightly sweet dough and savory filling. We also ordered the sheng jian boa, but they were showed up by the snow white pork buns. The Shanghai soup dumplings were excellent. The dough was thick like I like it and the filling was hearty and delicious, especially dipped in the vinegar sauce. The beef chow fun was very tasty as were the sauteed pea shoots with garlic (these were even better than Han Dynasty's because they were less garlicy). The scallion pancakes and egg tarts were also good, but not as special as the other dishes. In addition to the yummy food, the service was very attentive.
No comment
No comment

This is a really solid Chinese place. Dishes all tasted pretty good across the board. Favs: chicken with assorted veggies, the grilled fish filet, pea shoots, pinecone fish, XLB also good. Environment is chic inside. Overall great place.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came in for lunch to go and there was a hair in my chicken corn soup :(((( the ambiance is great, food came out fast, they let me sit at the bar as I waited for my to-go order and even gave me water. Unfortunately I couldn't finish my soup due to the hair. :(

I came with my bf on Sunday night for dinner after visiting the Union Square market. We ordered salt and pepper squid and it was tasty. The batter was light and crispy. We also ordered the dim sum platter aka the Three Kinds of Dumplings which comes with 2 prawn dumplings, 2 Su Mai and 2 Bamboo Fungus dumplings and their Singapore Mai Fun. Service was friendly and attentive.
No comment
No comment

I ordered Kung Pao Chicken, I have no idea what recipe that  the chef follows to make this dish. It is totally different from traditional Kung Pao Chicken that I have eaten ever in around New York City and the world. It tasted so bad. I have order same from fast food Chinese joints which is better than this one. Horrible. They have the audacity to charge three times the price other restaurants'. DON'T GO THERE, DONT SPEND YOUR MONEY THERE.

This is the place if you're looking for some fancy and unique dim sum! I came here with my family when we were visiting nyc for the weekend. We ordered about 8 dim sum dishes for the 4 of us and we were pretty full! We ordered the snow white pork buns, Shanghai soup dumplings, crab meat soup dumplings, prawn dumplings, Avocado & shrimp spring rolls, elegant swan puff pastry, salted egg custard buns, and fried pot stickers. Everything was really good! My favorites would have to be the soup dumplings and swan puff pastry! It is on the pricier side but I would definitely come back here!

Normally, I am pretty intimidated going into Chinese restaurants, expecting to use Chinese to order food, with the unfounded fear I would be judged for ordering with an American twang. The servers were very nice and attentive when we went in a large group and helped explain the menu to my non-Chinese party members so I would not have to. While I am well acquainted with many of the dishes, especially Xiao Long Bao (also known as soup dumplings) and Chinese broccoli, it was nice to eat upscale Chinese food at the heart of Union Square.

Xu's Public House was a bit disappointing. While it markets that it has a bar with specialty cocktails, they seem to only have one bartender and if the bartender is not there then no cocktails. In fairness, the manager will make you a gin and tonic or a martini but that is about. There wine list is very simple, Red or White. The dim sum now seems to be brought in from outside rather than being made in house. With that said, xiaolongbao (soup dumplings) are very good. The rest of the food is also pretty good too except that the sweet and sour pork is made from a very poor cut of pork. Seems to me that they are cutting too many corners.
No comment
Had the cucumber salad amazing had the shrimp wonton soup so good and the ginger beef was delicious and service A+

Lovely servers, big portions, wonderful for sharing, great ambience -- what more is there to say? It's a bit on the pricier side, but we had a wonderful experience. Plus, they bring out oranges at the end! I feel like you can't go wrong with any of the dishes (we really enjoyed the garlic chicken, salt and pepper pork, and scallion pancakes. The egg tarts were fantastic too). I will also say, the value for money is great. As you can see below, the portion sizes are quite nice. Overall, wonderful experience. I'll be back!!
This is a new team operating the restaurant. Different menus but uses the same name and apparently same yelp profile...

Unfortunate that this place is currently closed. It was really good. I went twice and both times everything I had was delicious. It was upscale Chinese food in Union Square. I loved all their dim sum. Their truffle wontons and shumai were delicious. I also loved the giant soup dumplings they serve. Their noodles are fresh. I love the King Crab cold noodle dish. Their salt baked lobster and cheese is really good as well. Their egg yolk buns are definitely what you have to order for dessert. I truly hope they reopen. If they do, definitely check it out!
Overall good quality, attentive service. The food is quite delicate and light. The lobster dish is delicious and good portion for two.
No comment

The food was high quality and came out quickly. The pine one fish was definitely a favorite and very shareable! A bit pricey, but for the quality, it is definitely understandable. We sat near the door so it was cold with everyone walking in and out, but the place was otherwise great! Took a bit to get seated, so I would recommend a reservation.

Clean restaurant and cute ambiance. The service was great even tho the food/drinks took forever to come out. Some dishes looked well decorated while the taste is on the traditional side. The fired eggplant that was recommended as appetizer/veggie dish doesn't look good for picture yet quite tasty.
No comment
No comment
Good restaurant to go, very nice food with good service. Especially second floor , nice place for private party.
Chinese Asian Fusion Restaurant in Union Square. Jus plain nothing special Chinese fast food please. Just not food that I expected.
No comment
Delicious food and quick, friendly service. The kids loved it. Can't wait to return!!
Nice environment great authentic food (we had dim sum) all in convenient location near Union Sq!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Stopped by on the way back from the yankee game with a friend for the "soft-opening" under the new ownership. What a great stop. Beyond the exceptional service the food was delicious. High quality Manhattan Asian cuisine. Would stop by again and recommend to a friend.
Best chinese restraunt in town. Have to come to try, as a Chinese, high recommended the Gulu pork, and dimsum delicious and yummy!

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: I called today inquiring about a private event pricing and a man who picked up was very rude. I asked for the price for 70 people which he responded to $35/person; but according to him it is impossible to buyout the entire restaurant for 70 people. According to him, he can do 50 people. Which then I asked, is it the same price? How much will that be for 50 people? (Thinking there might be a price variance given that there are less people) which he then answered "I already told you it's 35!" And remarked something in Chinese thereafter. What comes next? He hangs up. Given that this place gives an elevated dim sum experience compared to its China town counterparts like jing fong or golden unicorn, the communication and public relations are sub par compared to the latter mentioned. I can attest to that since I am in contact with the other dim sum places and was simply appalled by the impression and representation this man made.
No comment

Very expensive for a dim sum type restaurant. The mushroom xlb was interesting but difficult to eat. I didn't really care for the truffle shrimp dumplings, though my bf was a fan. The pork buns also seemed undercooked... I'm used to a nice sweet glaze on top too, but it just tasted like uncooked dough. Overall, the food was very nicely presented, but just ok taste wise for me. A bit too pricey as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

It's really one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in NYC. It's more like a mix of Shanghainess food and Cantonese food. My bf and I ordered crab meat soup dumplings (pretty authentic), and BBQ pork buns, one of their branding dishes. I like the creativity in the BBQ buns although it meets more the taste of Americans. Tao Jiao egg tarts were full of milky flavors (but almost too much). Fish filet tasted fresh and tender. Ginseng soup was not great. But overall I'd like to recommend this place.

To be honest its more like a 3.75. I came here with a friend after seeing all the raving reviews and i was slightly disappointed. Pros are that the restaurant's decor is upscale without being suffocating and they are surprisingly creative with food presentation. The food however are not as impressive. We had ordered the Shanghai soup dumpling, the bbq buns, the shrimp dumplings and the pork bone broth noodles. They were all ok, the best being the bbq bun. This is not to say that the food wasnt good though. The food was not impressive but neither was it disappointing.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My fiancé found this place and since it's new we decided to try it.  Very nice, modern atmosphere, with a good layout.  Service was great and quick from start to finish.  The menu is authentic Shanghainese and all of the courses were delicious. The truffle wontons and blue crab with rice cakes stood out the most!  We also had an amazing tea with our dinner which was extremely refreshing.  The ribeye entree came out with a bang (see photo) and did not disappoint.  Overall a great experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was good overall but overpriced, even with a Yelp coupon. The snow buns are solid tho but nothing was amazing for the price. I feel like you're just paying for the nice decor that you're eating in which isn't what I want but for some it's what they want to pay for so make your choice
No comment

I really have no complaints about this restaurant. Food is an A+, service is an A+, interior design A+ and pricing A+. Xu's Public House is a hybrid between Chinese traditional dishes such as dim sum and soup dumplings, with an American flare. So far I've been here twice (once for lunch and once for dinner) and each time, I try to order something different since their menu is bountiful. I really enjoyed their truffle dumplings, porn buns and dim sum items. When you come for dinner, they provide you with complimentary Hong Kong cakes to start! Two big tips  for this spot, if you check in on yelp, you get 10% off of your original bill and this restaurant is also  BYOB! Reservations are easy to make online as well.
No comment
No comment

Amazing contemporary Shanghainese Restuarant in Union Square. I came in with my friend around 5 Pm and they seated us upstairs that have spacious tables and amazing decor. The manager Kenny was very friendly to come greet us and tell about his restaurant and top dishes to try. We ordered the bbq pork buns, live crab noodles, mushroom Xlb, steamed sea urchin egg, peach jelly egg tarts, live crab rice cakes,  and blueberry yam pudding. Every thing was plated so well. If you want to experience a more upscale Shanghai joint, come here.
No comment
No comment

Some of the food items were over priced I believe but their food quality is pretty good. Some is worth and some is not. We ordered the soup dumplings, was 3 pieces for $9...so I had high hopes of differences but it was pretty typical to me. It was of course good but I had similar ones at cheaper price... However the cold noodles with king crab and uni was reallllly good. Though its like $42 I guess it's worth a try if you care more about the food quality. The noodle texture was perfect and the crab was fresh. Their chrysanthemum tea we ordered was good. I also like the atmosphere here!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The place is just soft opening but gave a pleasant surprise when my husband and I went there last night. Immediately you can tell from the decor and setting at Xu's, the owner's  ambition for an Asian-inspired fine dining experience. Overall, the atmosphere is amazing. For food, we ordered BBQ pork bun, fried wonton for starters and they didn't let us down, especially the BBQ pork bun, you can feel the layers of flavors gradually build in as the pork melts in your mouth. For main course we had King Crab cold noodle with sea urchin-- a taste of summer, I'd say, which reminds me of the good old days by the sea. We also had soup and sea urchin steamed egg, etc. For service, the waiters are very nice but kinda of lack experience, which shall be improved with time. Overall, 5 starts, I'd love to see more experience-oriented modern Chinese restaurants in the city.

Very nice place with decent food! Probably 'g top Chinese restaurants here. The food comes in small portion, and generally not oily/greasy. For cold appetizers, we get blueberry yam and seitan( kaofu). For food, we have special- chicken casserole, rice soup(泡饭), asparagus and mushroom, etc. Fresh ingredients that are not overwhelmed by spices or oil. There are also dim sum items: I would recommend any soup dumplings, snow mountain pork bun and egg tart. The place looks like it's a high-end pricy place. It's moderately priced with byob option if you are into this.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wonderful upscale Chinese restaurant. The food is picture worthy as well as tasty! Interior is nicely done. Manager came out and chatted with my table. Wonderful chat. Food quality is super nice as well. Certain items made from scratch, how awesome is that. Will definitely be back soon
No comment
No comment

Awesome Shanghai food. I like its upscale decor immediately when walk in. Newly opened. Great place to treat friends and have a party. The service is very attentative from waitress to manager and owner. They are all hands on and take care of customers for any little problems. All food are like an art piece. It has Chinese tradition also fused with American culture. Highly recommended!

Over advertising. mediocre taste and service. I do not feel welcomed at all. We spoke him in Chinese he responded to us in English, so I figured that he did not understand Chinese, so I started to speak English with him, but he responded to me in Chinese.... for the whole time he talked in very low voice including bringing our food. I barely heard him. The food was just OK. Nothing special. But the price was not low at all.
Food is good！ They might need more waiters or waitress to help because the sercive was a little unorganized.

Most food in this restaurant are very delicious. I really like the ways they make food and keep the original taste, especially the steak cooked with high temperature rock, so different from those steak burned and oil everywhere in other restaurant. Plus the place is nice and soon enough they will get a wine license then I can sit there have a red wine and enjoy the steak.

Can't say enough about the food. It makes me miss China. We love everything we tried, the tofu soup, see urchin tart, crab soup dumplings, foie Gras tart, Tao Jiao tart etc. The taste is delicate and well balanced. We can't wait to go back again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Came here for lunch, dim sums were on point. The BBQ buns were our favorite. Everything was great for the price we paid, except the waitress was ice cold!
Fantastic place for dinner. Food is amazing and waiters are soooooo nice. Highly recommend it.
Beautiful decor and Exceptional dishes. Delicious with the capital D! Highly recommend people to try this modern Shanghainese place.
Very good quality of Shanghainese food, the environment is nice and the dishes are elegantly prepared. Squid ink tofu soup is very special.

Service is a bit slow and chaotic but food is not bad. We dined on Friday night it was medium packed. The hostess seems very disorganized maybe need more training. Recommend abalone and chicken, salted egg rice cake. Will go back for dim sum and congee.
No comment

Wow. Just wow.  Authentic Chinese food combined with the plating of an upscale Michelin restaurant.  We ordered the Hokkaido sea urchin pastry, squid ink shrimp dumplings, king crab cold noodles with sea urchin and black truffle stir fried lobster.  Everything was bursting with flavor .. can't wait to try everything else on their menu!
No comment

Xu's Public House at Union Square is pretty good. The stirred Wagyu beef with edible rice bowl is excellent. Soup dumplings are tasty, but a little thicker and not as soupy as Joe Shanghai's. Upscale and modern looking place without an upscale price. Great service and nice atmosphere. Would eat here again.
I love this restaurant so much! The ingredients and the taste is perfect! I totally recommend this restaurant not only for daily meals or family gathering.
The beautiful environment, the dim sum is very delicious and the presentation is beautiful , the waiters were very nice . Just same like last time when I was here,Quality is same as very good

This place is a little overpriced. Portions are small for Chinese restaurant. A medium size crab meat soup dumpling is sold at $12 without much crab meat (most filling is pork). Service is good but I'd rather have food with better value. Four of us ended up going to East Village nearby to have a more solid second meal.

Awesome food, 2 stars less because service was not up to the mark. The server got the shrimp dish but we were waiting for 20 minutes for the rice. Obviously, the shrimp got cold meanwhile. But the shrimp & crab noodles were so full of flavors. Appetizers & entree, portions were unreasonably small for one person. So, order accordingly. Ideally, this restaurant should be rated at $$$ if you relate price of the dish with the portion served.

Everything we got here was so delish. Highly recommend the Shanghai truffle wontons. They are to die for. Service is great. Atmosphere is nice and cozy. It's on the pricier side but you can taste the quality so totally worth it.

As a guy borned Guangdong and grown-up in Shanghai, this restaurant made the taste of my memory. I can't i imagine I can taste all these ingredients in such price. If you are a foodie who loves the original taste of the ingredients, you should definitely come and try.
Authentic food from Shanghai. I like the sesame balls desserts the most. Noodle entrees were a little mild on flavor. Overall good experience!

Great dine in experience for Chinese food. Very delicate and delicious dishes with very high food quality. Staffs are super friendly and helpful. Will check it out again in the near future for sure!! Highly recommend this place for high quality Chinese food!!
The environment is great, but the food really tastes mediocre... We went there right after it opens. The kitchen was too busy so they forgot one of the dishes we ordered. Gave us a 50% discount tho.

Beautiful Shanghainese&Asian fusion place hidden at union square west. I was surprised by the skylight on the 2nd floor, stunning decor and fine dining experience. Good place for a date or group gathering. we started with the avocado smoked salmon, a fresh combo of seafood and veggies. Snow mountain BBQ pork bun was amazing, best BBQ bun I have ever had. Different flavored handmade dumplings bring me the memories of what I had in Shanghai years ago, worth to try. The Morchella esculenta chrysanthemum tofu soap and Lobster risotto are very tasty too. Definitely will come back.
Great restaurant with awesome and innovative dish, owner attempted to achieve more than satisfactory experience from all eater.  Return is must.

This is a very disappointing experience. You can tell that the place is trying to be upscale but it lacks attention to details. Examples include the rest room is super dirty, the tea cup they gave to us was broken and filled with dirty cleaning water. Servers are nice but you can clearly tell that they are inexperience as I have to raise my hand for more than 30 seconds for them to notice me. Service is extremely slow. We didn't order much but we ended up spending two hours here for lunch, mostly waiting for food. This is very surprising as the restaurant doesn't seem to be that busy with plenty of empty seats. The foods are just ok, and definitely not worth it considering the wait time. The pork bun is not as good as the ones at Tom Ho Wan. The soup inside Shanghai Soup dumplings is really good but one of our friends from Shanghai said the meat is too lean. She has had better ones in flushing. We are very surprised by the four bubble yelp review. We do not recommend this place and will not come back again.
Food looks pretty but the taste is not local. Not good for Chinese to come here. But the environment is perfect which is quiet and beautiful.
No comment

In the four years I've been in New York, this is the best Chinese food I've had in the city. Beautiful decor and the dishes are Chinese with a modern twist that works really well. They just opened and it's definitely worth the visit before they get too popular.

I ordered a delivery through the RICEPO app. I ordered the ginseng chicken soup which is undrinkable. It was the bitterest thing I taste in my whole life. Since I'm Chinese and I do cook, I know it should be some of a bitterness if u add ginseng in the food, but that soup was wayyyy too much. And there were no sign of saying that this soup is a bitter soup base anywhere through their menu or elsewhere. I asked for help and see if they made a mistake in the ingredient, all I get was the answers like:"drink slow, it is bitter, it's your fault that u can't handle the bitterness". I don't even want a refund from this, but the attitude of the restaurant is just ARROGANT.

The place gives you a high-end vibe when you walk in.  The skylight on the second floor is definitely unique in NYC. However, this is all the positives about this place.  The service is better than average, but waitstaff is very obvious that they don't know much about the menu.  The biggest disappointment is the food.  Almost all the food we ordered are very underwhelming, taste bland and low quality.  I think they try too hard on the presentation, and completely overlooked the taste of the dish.  We will not go back.  There are so many better Chinese food for lower price too.

I wanted to love this place. It has two floors both beautifully decorated. Very cool and comfortable. We went there last night to celebrate two birthdays and we were a table of six. This place doesn't have a liquor license so we brought sake.  We asked the hostess for sake glasses.  She looked as if we had asked for this in a Mexican restaurant. I mean it is an Asian fusion place!  She was not able to offer a glass in lieu of the sake glass. We suggested water or wine glasses. She finally affirmed that she could bring wine glasses!  I mean you advertise you don't have a liquor license.  I would think you would be able to articulate glassware for it!  Then the waitress who honestly responded " I am not good at explaining things" when simple questions about the menu were posed   Then the execution of the dishes!  Forgotten dishes followed by inefficient delivery of the ones that were ready! Like we want two orders of shrimp dumplings and we get one.  In response to where the second one is, we get it's cooking!  At the end when entrees were being brought, 4 people got their dishes and two did not like for 1/2 hour!  We refused it at that point.  After asking to speak to manager they agreed to take the two dishes off the bill. I would think so since you never brought it!  Awful awful awful!  To top it off, the taste of the food is not great. It is meh at best. We are veteran restaurant eaters all New Yorkers.  Worse over all in a looonnnggg time!
Food is great, but needs to work on service. Also no alcohol licence yet... Well go back in a few months time...

Not sure why the host is a grumpy old dude. Not a good first impression when you walk in. Food is very average and bland. Soup dumplings were a huge disappointment. Hand picked crab meat is a nice idea, but really can't tell the difference except the small pieces of shell left in them. 红烧肉太一般，不嫩，没味儿。
I would rate it 4.5 but had to choose between whole numbers.  Refined subtle flavors, lovely presentation, and good service all contribute to a pleasant dining experience.

This is a brand new superb mainly Chinese style restaurant. We had 2 of the teas: five elements and a fruit tea both excellent. All the dishes and soups and appetizers were outstanding and all ingredients very fresh. Also the egg tarts for dessert are not seen outside of China. Highest recommendation for  food and service and modern clean decor.
such a nice place. Food is amazing!!! Please go try the food and enjoy the environment.

This brand new restaurant nearby union square is bound to be a gem once people step inside its doors and realize how incredible it is. The flavors of the food blew our minds, because the attention to detail and quality ingredients really shows. Not sure where to start because everything we had was amazing. My favorite dishes were the uni pastry (buttery uni topped onto a sweet flaky layered pastry) and Orange shrimp (crispy and huge shrimps with a tasty orange sauce). We also loved the Yangchow fried rice. It's made steamed instead of being cooked in a rice cooker which maintains the natural shape and flavors  of rice. This is just an example of how the extra time they put into the quality of the food really pays off. Other things to mention that we're top of the line - steamed egg topped w caviar, tiger prawn and lobster risotto, morchella esuelenta soup dumpling, squid ink shrimp dumplings, five elements tea. Last thing to mention of course is the beautifully designed interior and incredible service. We can't wait to be back as this spot really exceeded our expectations.

No comment
The outdoor seating area has an extremely retro vibe with neon lights and vintage posters!

The $38/person option (EP) is a GREAT deal, but know that it is for 2 people so you cannot do it alone. My highlights were the legendary burger, and the chopped cheese rice cakes. The vibes are great, they play awesome music!
No comment
No comment
If you want a true korean bar experience you're better off going to ktown. The food is overpriced and salty and the drinks are lackluster.
No comment

No comment

The food here was so tasty. We got the fried chicken and legendary burger. The chicken had the perfect crispy texture to it and the radish perfectly complemented the flavors. The legendary burger was juicy and I loved the sauce on it. The restaurant had a fun vibe to it. Next time when I'm hungrier, I would definitely splurge for the tasting menu.

Amazing experience! The atmosphere is so fun, and the food was delicious and unique. We did the EP tasting menu, and our favorite dishes were the chopped cheese rice cakes, legendary burger, and the lamb skewers. The flavors were incredible in everything  we ate, and the service was fantastic, too. We had a great time, and I am so happy we tried this place!

Nowon was amazing.  The food was excellent and for the price for the pre fix ($48pp) you get a lot for your money.  We decided to add the ricotta dip as an additional appetizer, which was delicious, as well as the shrimp skewer as an additional item because we wanted the salad instead of the skewer as part of the pre fix. But, you really don't need to order anything additional than what comes with the set menu as it is a lot of food.  For the items that you could choose between, we opted for the kale salad (which was phenomenal), and the Legendary Burger (also fabulous).  We ordered the extraordinary tots and got half of them curry flavor and the other with honey butter - both delicious, but I preferred the honey butter.  I would definitely come back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great place for meeting up with friends! The restaurant is pretty small so the tables are intimately close but everyone is very mindful about keeping the noise level down. Most menu items are on the smaller, tapa like sizes so my friends and I started off with the truffle rice cakes and honey butter tots. The truffle rice cakes reminded me of a pasta dish and was actually very filling and the tator tots were crispy with a subtle hint of honey butter favor. I got the chicken wings appetizer as my entree and was very full! They give you 4 huge pieces that are perfectly crispy, juicy, and flavorful alongside little pickled radish and dill leaves. Pretty expensive in my opinion but overall, a great upscale Korean restaurant!
No comment

No comment
Fantastic food! We got the burger, fried chicken, tater tots, and chopped cheese rice cakes. All incredible, we will definitely be back.
No comment

Great food, friendly service.  Went with friends who are regulars and correctly guided us to the burgers.  Dry aged burger was well-cooked, flavorful and moist.  The truffle burger had a generous shaving of truffles and was also tasty, but was a close second in my mind to the dry aged.  Whipped ricotta toast and chopped cheese rice cakes also highly recommended.

No comment
Cool digs and Korean-American fusion! Whipped ricotta toast with chili oil, shrimp skewers, chopped cheese rice cakes and the dry aged burger were highlights. The staff was also so lovely.
No comment

Incredible! The burgers are so good, the meat melts off the patty. The buttery tater tots are also incredible I don't know how they make them! I am not one to eat tater tots but these are a must have. Would come back many times to try other things on the menu. Also the waiter was lovely. 10/10.
You gotta get the legendary burger. It's cooked perfectly with all the right toppings and flavors. I did the first of the two pre fix menus and thought it was a great value for what you got.
No comment

No comment
No comment

We ordered the cheese rice cakes, chicken wings, legendary burger and honey butter tater tots. Everything was incredible! The vibes inside were also so fun. And yes the burger with kimchi was worth all of the hype!!! Highly recommend

Great spot in the Lower east side. Every dish here was a hit and the cocktails were wonderful. Loved the tater tots and the burger here was to die for. Great flavor and had a spicey kick. The kimchi pancake was also a great. It's a bit crowded inside where each table is close together. But you'll get that as it's so popular. They can easily do more covers in a larger spot. Great service and very informative. Will be back.
No comment
No comment
The food is so good. It's more like small dishes, so order a lot so you can share. The cocktails are not bad either. The music is pretty good also, will definitely come back for more
No comment

No comment
No comment
Note to everyone: COME HERE! No doubt about it. First time in NYC, first meal, and... aaaaamazinggggg! Everything is beyond delicious. So worth it

Really solid restaurant with great music. Opted to do the remix classic so I could taste the popular items. I loved the chicken wings- I did spicy, chopped cheese rice cakes were delicious with great texture, broccolini was amazing and the burger was to die for. I wasn't crazy about the steak tartare or the curry spiced tater tots but they were still pretty good just not my favorite. Drinks are ok. Im still giving 5 stars because they get creative with what they have to work with and I can't knock down my rating because of that. With that being said this is a great place to just chill eat great food and listen to great music. I will definitely be back.
No comment
No comment
So yum! Get the cheesy rice cakes and the tots! You will def not regret it! They're also gluten free friendly!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I first tried Jae Lee's food in his pop-up at the Black Emperor bar and became an instant fan.  Nowon never disappoints.  Although I pretend to look at the menu, I always opt for the legendary burger and blackened broccolini.  They are so good, I would lick the plate if I were by myself.  The staff are so attentive and courteous and always make me feel at home.

We came for dinner and sat at the bar. We ordered the black truffle burger, curried tater tots, chopped cheese rice cakes (tteokbokki) and the drinking game set for two. The burger and tteokbokki were delicious and comforting. I'm late in writing this but they were memorable dishes, especially the tteokbokki. The drink set included a descent amount - two beers and a bottle of soju. This is a fun lively environment with good food and great service.

Update- this place has really streamlined quality and service since first opening! The food is so so so good! Taking traditional Korean flavors and blending American (read NY) favorites for the perfect casual filling meal! Chopped cheese rice cakes was my favorite it reminded me of eating hamburger helper but wayyyyy better with better ingredients. Just has a nice homey feel to it! The burger was giving McDonald Big Mac if McDonalds had actual chefs preparing each burger made to order especially for you! Juicy, well seasoned, stacked, meaty! So good! Not to mention the ambiance! Great music for a lil pre turn up vibe or fun to impress a date with (they'll think your super cool, trussst me). Also affordable! Thanks Nowon!
No comment

No comment

Delicious tater tots!!! The service was good, food was great! The tater tots were by far the best thing we ordered. The Korean fried chicken on their menu was good but a little hard to eat. Would definitely go back and I liked that they have outdoor seating now.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delicious food and nice ambiance! We got the chopped cheese rice cakes, broccolini, and the burger. I'm surprised they're able to do Korean fusion so well. The rice cakes are apparently famous, and they were super satisfying. The right amount of cheese and carbs. I was little hesitant about ordering the burger bc like why order burger at a Korean restaurant? But I'm so happy I did! I'd definitely come back and order more off the menu
No comment
No comment

Amazing Modern Korean restaurant for food and soju cocktails. New spot in East Village area that has great atmosphere and the service is outstanding! Juan, all around made it a great time and explained couple items of the menu. Food was outstanding and the vision was executed. Definitely worth the trip and it does get busy for dinner, so make a reservation!
No comment
No comment
