column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Highly recommend if you're looking for a unique place in the east village!  The food was great and the bar tender was super friendly. I had the kimchi rice, which you must get with cheese on top (it's extra, but worth it). This was pretty heavy for my main course so I ended up splitting it with my boyfriend. The broccoli was INCREDIBLE and was definitely the highlight of the meal.
No comment

I had dinner here tonight and it was one of the best meals I've had in recent years. My fiend and I got the $45 tasting menu which came with about five dishes plus a dessert. We subbed in the truffle burger for the burger that came with the menu. EVERY SINGLE DISH was incredible. Very inventive and full of flavor. We came without a reservation and I can't believe it wasn't packed. On the way home we walked by Katz's deli and I wanted to tell the line of people out front to go to Nowon and they would be much happier. I will be returning here many times and you should too.

For $17 I expected the kfc would constitute at least a reasonable portion of a meal. Sadly, not so. Not much more in the box than a few crumbs. Tasty crumbs, but still very disappointed in the size of portions.
No comment
No comment

My god. Came here for dinner and wow. So glad I did. While the menu is small and chic it has something for everyone! Dishes are well thought out and made with great care. You can tell the recipes I use are authentic and come from the heart. The service is incredible prompt, friendly, and very welcoming. I can't say enough about the staff how common anything they were and how they made our special requests happen. Things that weren't actually on the menu we were able to order and they accommodated  everything that we needed or the wife wanted. The food itself was simply stunning beautifully presented and serve piping hot. It was a great night of Korean food. Prices are extremely competitive especially for the homemade dishes. I'd highly recommend coming here after a night out or even for a dinner date. The ambience is very romantic and the service cannot be beat. I can't wait to come back
No comment
No comment

Great vibe, amazing staff all around , very friendly! bartender Sam was so welcoming and made custom drinks for us and honestly was like being in someone's home- he hosted us !! Definitely coming back. We had the chicken and it was ssooooo yummy !!!!
Good burger, but could've come with some fries or something perhaps.

Loved Nowon! We had a great experience here. Not only was the food amazing, but they have a fun cocktail menu and beer pitchers/drinking games for a really fun spin on classic drinking games. Some of our favorites on the menu were the chopped cheese rice cakes, and the tofu sandwich (truly SO good!!!). Definitely recommend for a group of friends needing to catch up.

Nowon, in the East Village is an eclectic restaurant featuring small plate Korean American cuisine. The menu offers some preset options, they call remixes, to pick from. We opted for the classic remix -- Vol #1 which included a gem salad, charred broccolini, Korean fried chicken, burger, crispy tater tots, and yuja donut. The 'Chopped Cheese' rice cake was simply excellent and we also loved the fried chicken and the Yuja donut. Be sure to also order one of their cocktails. They were dangerously delicious
No comment
No comment
Their team was very professional and accommodating when helping us secure a group reservation. Great food and even better vibes! Would highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
The food was amazing. The music was bumping. We were in town for the holiday weekend and this place did not disappoint. Seek this place out!
No comment

Really good spot with really good food. Came here twice within a few weeks of each other. The first time my friend and I shared the fried chicken, burger, chopped cheese rice cakes, and honey butter tots. Everything was really good, only downside was that the burger was quite salty. The second time I went back my friend and I got the mixtape, just be aware that they give u much smaller portions of certain items such as the chopped cheese rice cakes which was upsetting since it's the best thing on the menu. If I knew they were smaller portions I would've rather ordered the dishes individually. We also got rushed out after 90 minutes since someone else had reservations but we weren't told there would be a time limit when we sat. The burger was salty yet again. I'd come back again just for the rice cakes but not in a rush and probably wouldn't go out of my way. FYI parking is impossible here so don't drive!
No comment

Get double patty smashed cheeseburger was amazing, I only regret having to share it. Also got the kimchi fried rice, they asked if we wanted to add cheese - definitely say yes! Both dishes so delicious, wish we could try their whole menu. Picked up a jar of their chili oil, too!
No comment

Having heard so many good things about Nowon in the East Village, I had to try it out. Nowon is a Korean American Gastro Pub Fusion, the place itself has such a groovy interior and perfect place to have dinner with a friend or to grab some burgers or wings before a night out. The food didn't disappoint either, we ordered the K.F.C (Korean Fried Chicken), Legendary Cheeseburger and Crispy Tater Tots. The K.F.C (Korean Fried Chicken) has a gochujang glaze with blue cheese buttermilk which gives it such a savory and unique taste. The Legendary Cheeseburger has smashed double patties, american cheese, kimchi mayo and b&b pickles, which was a delicious twist on the classic. Lastly my favorite were the Crispy Tater tots with honey butter, never would I have thought of this pairing but I would go back specifically for them.
No comment
Came here on a Tuesday night, and it was poppin. We didn't have much of a wait and got seated in 10 minutes. Every dish that we had was super good. Don't sleep on the burger or the tots.
No comment

Easily one of the best restaurants I've been to. Great music, super friendly staff, and killer food. Still thinking about the tater tots. Seriously that good. The burger was also *chefs kiss*. You need to come here!

Went back to Nowon for the 2nd time and it did not disappoint. Food, drinks, and service were all outstanding. Got several different things to try. The chopped cheese rice cakes were a big hit. Of course, the burger is amazing too. And the vibe and music are so lively and fun. Definitely a fun place to go out with friends. Check it out!
Swanky Korean fusion restaurant with a full bar inside. The portions were way too small. Loved the Korean Fried Chicken though.

Honestly incredibly overrated. Seemed like a place where 20 year olds come to get drunk and loud. The food was awful. Ordered the fried chicken, the Legendary burger, the tater tots (inedible) and the broccoli.
Just mind blowingly delicious food! Went here for a date night and had the most amazing time. Highly recommend!

Last night I went to Nowon with three of my girlfriends. I hadn't heard of it, but they were all dying to try it. We each got the tasting menu which was fairly priced. first came out two salads and the charred brocollini or should I say charred crack. the salads were OKAY but the brocollini was amazing. We also got the slippery noodles, the chop cheese gnocchi dish and the burger. I could go on and on about each of those dishes because they were all fantastic. The drinks were great and the people working there were so helpful when ordering and extremely friendly. Great service, great atmosphere and great food. Nothing more to ask for!
No comment

I stopped by Nowon on a Saturday night for a late night meal with the girlfriend, now ex-girlfriend(HA!). We were astounded by the food. Chef Jae Lee is an amazing chef and unbelievable host. I'd take a date here any day of the week.
No comment

This place has instantly become a favorite of mine. The Korean-American cuisine is something so creative and delicious. My daughter and I shared a few dishes (Guacamole, Chopped Cheese Rice Cake, Curry Tater Tots, Legendary Burger and the Porkbelly dish), and let me tell you itv was outstanding. The innovative mix of Korean and American food is beautifully done.

Came here for a snack after shopping at Soho. We ordered the 3 piece shin ramyun wings and the dry aged burger and shared. The wings came with a side of ranch and were nice and crispy. It did not necessarily taste like shin ramyun but had a nice slightly sweet and spicy flavor to them. The burger was pretty good, but the bottom bun of the burger was completely soggy. I think it may have been because the burger was cut in half. The service was great and the waiter did a very good job of explaining the menu and their daily special.
Great to know there's another place serving solid burgers. Tried both on their menu and was pleased. The tater tots were a good complement as well.
No comment
No comment

Food came out quick and delicious! Honestly best chicken sandwich I've had in a very long time :) The server was very sweet and attentive. Not only is the food good but the entire ambiance & aesthetic of the place mixed with the r&b / rap music that plays is a total throwback to the early 2000's and I adore it. I will definitely be coming back.
No comment

Went with a group of friends.  Food was great esp the broccolini.  Service was good. Nice location.
No comment
Amazing burger. One of the best. Kimchi Mayo is on point. It's like elevated bar food. Chopped cheese tteokboki cmoooon that's what you want when you're drinking.
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Best burger in NYC!!! The whole restaurant had a cool vibe. The menu had lots of different flavors and was not your average spot. The burger was 10/10 a must try!

I tried this place for the first time a few weeks ago and I absolutely loved it. The service was great, the employees were so laid back and friendly, and the food was absolutely spectacular. I loved how unique and flavorful it all was--I've never had anything like it! We got the kimchi burrata, chicken wings, burger, and honey tater tots and it was some of the best food I've had. The drinks were also super good AND they have happy hour on weekends!! If you're in NYC this place is a must visit!!

This was excellent. First visit, we got the rice cakes, three-piece wings, tater tots, tuna kimbap, and the burger. The rice cakes were outstanding (very cheesy) and a must re-order on a future visit. The burger was excellent as well, and right up my wife's alley in particular. The wings were (somewhat surprisingly) my favorite dish of the night, and I definitely want to try the fried chicken sandwich next time around. We loved the tots too, but they were very heavy. We'd probably skip the kimbap next time.
No comment
No comment

The food here is amazing, the local summer ale they had on draft was very good. I was blown away by every dish, and the burger does indeed compete for one of the best in NYC. Fried chicken was INSANE! Get the spicey version, it's not too spicey. Even the salads were unforgettable! You won't forget this spot.
No comment
No comment
Did the tasting menu and every single item was amazing! So good, service was amazing, vibes are really fun. Highly recommend!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very good! Service was quick (could use a little more attentiveness) but hey it t was a Friday night! All the food came out hot, burger was excellent and decadent. And if you drink can't go wrong with the NoWon Fashioned the barley soju sets it apart and gives it a depth.

This spot is another one that's really flavorful and yummy. I really like the vibe the food was delicious and the service was great . They have a really nice menu and drinks. They only have one dessert on the menu but that dessert had my tummy going for another bite. I recommend this place
No comment
No comment
No comment

The pop up at Black Emperor bar launched the culinary Korean fusion wave here at Nowon. The dry aged double cheeseburger, honey butter tots, chopped cheese rice cakes and fresh kim chi were the highlights of our evening. This cheeseburger is no joke. Very rich in flavor and you can tell the quality. The honey butter tots were delicious. Sweetness of the honey was great with the fried tots. The ambience here is great with the dim lights and cool NY hip hop theme. Thrillist and Eater NY got me hip to this and I'll definitely be back to try the shin yun ramen wings. Great service and execution by the staff.
Can't say enough amazing things about this place. Just get everything on the menu and you won't go wrong!
No comment
Food is delicious! Love their broccolini, rice cakes and burgers. Vibe is great w good music, staff are really nice and accommodating.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Drinks and sandwiches were amazing.  Appetizers, however, stunk.  Who serves cold shishitos?  Not mentioned on the menu and confirmed by server that they were supposed to be cold.  Terrible.  Who serves cold burrata?  Should be about room temperature, I've had burrata a zillion times and never cold like this.  Also terrible.  Go for the drinks and sandwiches, avoid the appetizers.  Prepare for a wait.  Oh, and we reserved an outdoor spot but they didn't have one on arrival, which was also very annoying in this age of COVID.  Reservation clearly says outside.  So don't bank on outside seating.

Amazing every single time we go. My husband John can't get enough of this place. My favorite dish is the rice cakes but let me be clear TRY EVERYTHING. Nothing will disappoint you. We came across this establishment for the burger which I feel is number two on the burger list of best burgers. Drinks are always up to par. Clean and super friendly establishment. Going into the bathroom is an experience all on its own. Lol. Would recommend over and over again. Consistency is most important for me. Hope you enjoy it as much as we do. Hidden gem.

The kimchi and burrata appetizer. The fried chicken sandwich. The burger. I went 3x in a span of a month and I now go pretty regularly. There's a great happy hour and they have a super cool Korean American vibe!
Definitely going to become one of those classic New York restaurants. Food is insane, ambiance is quintessential east village, and the staff is the sweetest. Go here while it's still under the radar.

3.75 Had this place on the list for a short while due to the IG posts my lady has been sending me. We also pass it every time we are in the East Village. We just decided to go for it. Service is very friendly. I think the selection of classic Hip-Hop (Wu-Tang, DMX, Lox, etc) earns an automatic point! I was loving it. We started with the chopped cheese rice cakes and the wings. The rice cakes, while not reminiscent of chopped cheese (at least to me), were still delicious. The wings were crunchy and pretty tasty, but an order of 6 (really 6 halves) for $20 is very pricey. We also got the chicken sandwich and the burger. The burger was good but not great. My gf and I had split opinions on the chicken sandwich. She though it was ok and I thought it was really good. She wishes they used thigh instead of breast (an opinion I am not at all mad at). I will say the breast was still very juicy and I thought the sandwich had great flavor. The cocktail list is very limited and also a little on the pricey side. The vibe here is cool and it's a place I would love to come back to once indoor dining resumes (hopefully ASAP!). If you are in the East Village I would recommend you stop in for a bite (or two). ENJOY!!!

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Standing outside Nowon after being carded by the bald host and being told to wait 15 minutes for a table. While we were waiting a server came over and asked us for our drink order. Then after waiting for our drinks the same waiter comes over 5 minutes later and asks us to see our IDs. We think it's strange we are being carded twice but give them to the server anyways. The after looking at our 24 year old California real-ID's - he says "sorry we can't take those". Mind you this is a restaurant and we didn't even need drinks. The strangest out of the blue power trip from this host. Food was over hyped anyways.

Went here back when the weather was warm and outdoor dining was just starting to be a thing I felt comfortable doing.  They have a great set up and the meal and the service was tasty and everything felt very save.  They had hand sanitizer at the table and a clear communication about time limits for tables and expectations around ordering.  Our waiter was very kind and attentive and made good recommendations when we were wavering with a couple of our choices.  They were able to split the chicken sandwich for us before it was brought to the table and were able to give us a new plate when we had too much sauce on the once we had used to be able to put our sandwiches down :). Sometimes its those little things.  I hope to be able to dine there again to support them, I know they are doing great work :)
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here late Friday  night without a reservation and the staff was very accommodating with no wait. Got a pitcher of the Juicy Bomb IPA which was delicious. My boyfriend go the fried chicken sand which that he really enjoyed. I got the fried tofu tacos which were incredibly tasty. Great service and great modern/ trendy environment.
No comment
loved the vibe of this place and the drinks are super refreshing and smooth! would highly recommend the fried chicken and donut holes!!

Great food and service! I had the Legendary burger which was indeed superb (it uses kimchi mayo, b&b pickles). We also had the nacho chips which had a very unique dip, one of the most delicious I'd ever encountered. Also the staff are SUPER nice. Above and beyond. Can't wait to go back.
An NYC MUST EAT !!! Korean flavors with cheese. Literally how can you go wrong? Still dreaming about the chopped cheese rice cakes
Such good food and good vibes. Service was really good and the frozen watermelon drink was to die for- not too sugary, just right. Definitely would recommend.
Best hamburger and tater tots i've had. Elevated but casual korean/american food.

the food is great, this is one of my fav spots. maybe just an off moment, but the host was pretty rude. i opened the door and asked for a table outside and he acted like i was asking him to move a mountain. he was extremely dismissive and had a nasty tone when he told me i could take one of the high tops by the entrance. this entire interaction happened in maybe 5 seconds but it was so cutting. i know it wasn't in my head either because he seemed to have realized what a jerk he came across as and proceeded to be so cringe and try hard trying to accommodate me, but it was so obviously forced it felt so uncomfortable. i was really hungry or else i would've just said nevermind and left. it made my entire experience super awkward since he was also waiting on my table. i just kept my head down and tried to get out of there as quickly as i could. i love this place, but i'm questioning whether i'll return if i'm going to be made to feel like i'm a nuisance from the second i open the door, if i see that he's at the front i'll just avoid it and go somewhere else. we all have our moments, but for him to default to being so rude as soon as i opened the door and barely said four words was extremely uncalled for and weird.
No comment
The food is beyond amazing. Between the three of us, we ordered most of the items on the menu and everything was delicious. Everyone working there was nice and helpful.

Had pretty high expectations of this place since it garnered high reviews but must say was pretty much disappointed. We got the octopus and soy chicken wings as appetizers. The octopus was two small skewers and rubbery. I didn't even want to finish my small piece. The wings were small and nothing spectacular. Go to turntable for real wings. We got the dry aged burger and honey butter tater tot's. These took almost 40 mins to arrive after we finished the apps. And then the burger was cold. Probably sat out for 5-10 minutes before someone realized to push out the order. The burger was small and had no flavor and no other condiments other than the spicy mayo. For a $24 burger you expect it to be somewhat good and larger. It does not come with any fries or tots which you order separately. The tots tasted like frozen and the honey butte flavor was a bit overpowering. To summarize there are way better spots to spend your money and to get Korean gastopub experience and food.

Stopped by to grab lunch before heading to Tomkins Sq and we were NOT disappointed... takeout can be hit or miss but this was definitely a hit. Loved the burger, the korean big bird sandwich and the honey butter tater tots. So much flavor in everything and cooked perfectly. 100% recommend for takeout and I can only assume by their friendliness at pickup that dining in would be great as well.

Went with a few friends last weekend and I am in love with this place after my first visit. Each dish was really creative and came out in the order that it was prepared (shishito peppers, kimchi burrata, crunchy cucumbers, charred brocolini, chicken sandwich, and of course a burger with honey butter tater tots). Each plate stood on its own but together it made one of the best meals I've had in recent memory. The staff was wonderful and attentive. My only complaint is that they are not on my block. If they were, I'd be here every week.
No comment
10/10 this place is amazing great vibes unreal energy and food and worth this word limit 100%

Found this spot randomly. Originally we were suppose to eat at Barrio Chino but it was pouring hard and no one was leaving their table. So I go on Yelp and "Nowon" pops up. I check their reviews, photos and I call. The lady on the phone was so eager to help and even did me a favor by taking my name over the phone for a table for 5 (they don't usually do this so please don't ask, it was raining, you get the deal). We got there and everyone was so accommodating and helpful. Even in a shitty rainy day, they made sure we were all comfortable in our table. We ordered everything from the wings (a must) to the buttered tator tots (a must). Everything we had was so good, fresh and I would definitely come back here. It's probably going to be a go to for me and a place I take friends/family visiting NYC.
No comment
No comment

We picked up dinner here and we were BLOWN away. Possibly best meal of quarantine. We continually debate which item was our favorite - friend chicken sammy, chicken wings, burger, tater tots. There is never a hands down winner, bc they are all insanely good for different reasons. Wowza. Thank you!
No comment
No comment

my friend made a reservation here for dinner for us and her boyfriend. there's indoor & outdoor seating. the atmosphere is pretty dark and the bathroom is such a vibe. we ate basically everything on the menu here haaha. the cheese corn was alright - it tasted like a deconstructed elote. the rice cakes were definitely a nice spin off on the korean spicy version - tasted more like an american version of a chili rice cake. the mackeral was probably my favorite - was very tasteful. the fried chicken tasted like popcorn chicken - did not meet expectations. the galbi steak was okay, reminded me of a reuben sandwich. the dry aged burger was pretty good but not as flavor-ful as much as i would have liked. the yuja donut was a perfect light way to end the night but i don't recommend if you don't like sweets as it could be a little bit too sweet. otherwise, not bad as a korean fusion restaurant but not amazing..
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We were hooked since the him_ny pop up, so glad Nowon has its own space. We made a dinner reservation for 5pm on a Sunday, we recommend a reservation since people without reservations were not able to be seated. Got the honey butter tater tots, numbing cucumber salad, spam and octopus fried rice, shin ramyun fried wings, spicy prawn jjampong, and the famed double cheeseburger. All of the food was good. Service was good - offered us to add another wing to the order so that each of us had one, which was the right move, since the wings are so good. The bathroom is a party. One small wish is that the dining room wasn't so dim... But really great music playing, so it was still a lot of fun. Can't wait to find another excuse to go back!

We got this recommendation from a friend and it makes me question why we did not know about this place soon. We had more food than the pictures but we were so hungry and it was all so delicious we didn't even have time for more pictures. My husband had the burger and I had the chicken sandwich. Even my picky kids loved the wings. Highly highly recommended!
No comment

Another smashing success. I'd give it a 4.5 if I could. But rounding up for a new restaurant delivering this well. We walked in and were offered a table for an hour. But the hostess moved things around to get rid of the time crunch. Nowon is a very dark spot that feels like they have a DJ playing. But why hide this amazing food? Octopus was perfectly cooked with an interesting flavor. Squeeze the lime. It makes it even better. The cucumbers took a minute, but get the juice from the bottom to really take in the peppercorn. The wings were as advertised - outstanding. And the mung bean pancake was a thicker, juicier scallion pancake. We are definitely quite satisfied. I hope the menu changes so we can try even more things.
No comment

Food is so good! Had outdoor dining during COVID times - it was a hot day and wished I wasn't burning as I was eating but what can you do. The honey butter tater tots are the best fried potato type food I've EVER had!! The cream cheese dolloped on the top went really well with the taters and they were subtly sweet. And the Jae Mac is SOO GOOD, which means a lot because I don't even like burgers all that much. Super messy to eat but in terms of taste, 10/10. The shin ramyun wings didn't taste very shin ramyun-esque but were still good and worth a try! Will definitely come back because I think this is now my go-to burger spot! And those taters.... I think about them a lot.

The atmosphere is fun and light. The food is different and delicious. The rice cakes was a table favorite. The staff is so friendly and fun. And the bathroom is it's all little party. Loved everything about this place. New NYC fav!

If you love Big Macs and are looking to graduate, the Double Cheeseburger is the best burger, period. Korean Chopped Cheese is peak comfort food. As an Asian American myself this food tastes cool, personal, and genius. We plan to ring in the new year with bellies full of Nowon, only the goodness.

The nowon burger is amazing. Must try to honey tater tots-they pair well with the burger (and are super crunchy!). The wings are huge. Really cool restaurant design, great music, friendly staff. They also have great happy hour specials.
This was a horrendous meal, the burger is too expensive and tastes like someone chose random ingredients to place on top of each other

Nowon is a buzzy kind of place whose reputation allows it to upcharge just a little more and demand that you buy a meal's worth of food if you wish to hang out there for 1.5 hours. As a result, I got to sample a variety of food I probably wouldn't have otherwise. The food here is mostly korean bar food, so don't expect health. I had the pickles, the kimbap, honey butter tater tots, kimchi burrata and the charred broccolini salad. The kimchi burrata was an unexpectedly delicious combination. The honey butter tater tots were tasty but it's hard to mess up deep fried carbs. The kimbap is not worth getting at all. It's fine but not great. I probably would have more to rave about if I ordered less healthy things like burgers or wings, but other people have already done that for me.

Food was stellar. See my pics, yum. They had a nice outdoor dining area with some warmers which was great. Make reservations, there were people that were walk in and the wait was too long and they all left. Just came on yelp to say I really appreciated the great service by Ian. He had a great energy and was kind when I asked questions about the burgers at Nowon. Will be back.

Favorite place for a cheat night. Pro tip: come with friends (more the merrier) so you can eat the whole menu. The burger is a must get, although I guess everything else is too. To top off your meal, try the Makku drink- cold, bubbly, smooth, and refreshing. If I lived closer to Nowon, my waist would be in trouble.

For the record this is the first bad review I have ever written and I would give zero stars if I was able to. This restaurant has the worst customer service I have ever seen. I made a reservation for 5:30pm (NOT a popular time) the morning of (so clearly this was not a reservation that people were trying to make since it was available that morning) and when I was unable to attend my reservation because I was asleep sick in bed and worried I might have COVID, the restaurant charged me $40 ($20 pp). I attempted to cancel the reservation on Resy and it did not give me the option to and said I could not cancel within 24 hrs even though the reservation was made less than 24 hrs before the time of the reservation. I emailed the restaurant to explain the situation and they were very rude and said they were still charging me despite my covid concerns. Most gyms and restaurants are being extremely cautious and understanding of cancellations due to covid but this restaurant was so rude and strictly adhering to their policy despite these unusual times. I would not trust going to this restaurant as it does not seem they are concerned with the risk of covid and would have rather me attend indoor dining even with the risk of having COVID.

OMG. Everything was amazing. We had the kimchi fried rice, chopped cheese rice cakes (their take on the chopped cheeses sandwich), ribeye steak, and honey butter tots....simply genius. I can't give them a high enough rating. DELICIOUS
Great food, nice wine, super professional wait staff and friendly as well. Will be back again.

Food was good but beware you have to order at least two small dishes or one large dish for every drink ordered. Because of that, we ordered food and didn't finish. Three of us all ordered cocktails, but it wasn't strong at all so slightly disappointed.
Amazing food amazing ambiance. Great outdoor seating during the current times. Highly recommend the wings, j Mac, and chopped cheese rice cakes.

Let me tell you, Nowon was definitely great. Everything is delicious, fresh, the staff is very nice the place kept very clean. The food was great, Wok Roasted Dry-aged Ribeye Steak was yummy. 5/5 for service. I certainly see myself returning here in the future.
Really great spot! I would say the tator tots are just a little to sweet, but very interesting. Loved the wings which came on special with a carafe of Suju and Hite beer. Left very satisfied!
No comment

Fantastic burger - one of the best I've had in recent memory. We also split the octopus and spam fried rice and the charred broccoli and both were delicious. Servicw was great but they need to get their liquor license or at least a BYOB option. Also the strobe light situation in the bathroom was weird - esp given the lack of alcohol.

WARNING - ABSOLUTELY NO ALCOHOL. This place caught me by surprise as I do not see it mentioned in reviews, but be warned, as of February 2020 there are mock-tails and water only. I have mixed reviews of the food. The chopped cheese rice cakes were delicious, couldn't have been better. The burger was fantastic, I would put it on par with Emily/Emmy Squared. The tots were just normal tater tots drenched, and I mean drenched in butter, avoid at all costs. The cucumber salad starter was devoid of flavor and I wouldn't recommend. Service was fine, atmosphere fine, though there was a table with several children sitting next to us for a 9:30pm reservation on a Friday night. But for a dry joint this may be the norm, I am not sure. Bottom line, I would hit it again for a burger some day, but not until they pull it together and pony up for a liquor license.
No comment

Had a wonderful time at Nowon last night! The burger, tots, and chicken wings were phenomenal, and the service and the 90's jams truly added to the experience. We enjoyed speaking with Chef Jae Lee about his journey to opening the restaurant and he even surprised us with a complimentary mung bean pancake!  Looking forward to coming back when the liquor license comes in and hopefully a dessert menu!
This place serves up truly, truly delicious food that's also unexpected and new. I really can't recommend it enough. Get the chicken sandy and the tater tots and the cucumbers and... all of it!

Had an awesome meal here last night with a small group for outdoor dining. The outdoor setup was cozy and warm even in the freezing temperature! All of the food was amazing, especially the burger, rice cakes and tater tots. We also loved our waiter/somm Ian. He was so friendly and knowledgeable about the wine list, giving us lots of great recommendations for natural wine! Can't wait to come back!

Unbelievable, man. Just a great culinary experience, from the exquisite burger and honey butter tots to the snug comfort of the chopped cheese rice cakes. Chef Jae is the future, this place deserves extra love so here I am.

From the second you walk into Nowon, it is an excellent experience. The food was phenomenal. Each dish was more surprising and flavorful than the last...ORDER THE CHOPPED CHEESE RICECAKES. They were absolutely insane. It was a very unique combination of flavors and cuisines, in the best way possible--the same is true of the wings, the honey butter tater tots, and the octopus & spam fried rice(don't miss out on this either). The burger is one of the best in Alphabet City...and if you're lucky enough to be there on a night where they have the deviled dkeggs special, do yourself a favor and order them without question. All around, can't say enough about what an amazing addition this is to the neighborhood. Great food, great vibes. 10/10 would recommend
Their spam fried rice was ridiculously overpriced and not good.   However their chopped cheese dish was fire and made up for it.

Placed an order for pickup. Was overcharged. Never received my full order. Called the restraunt for them to fix the issue, they said they would issue a refund. Of course they did not. Will call my bank and issue a chargeback. Shame on this restraunt. The waiter/staff do not care about their customers.
No comment

Nowon was amazing!! I live nearby and had been dying to try - they did not disappoint. Got the burger, tots, rice cakes and this beautiful chicken sandwich and am still thinking about the whole meal. The staff was also awesome. Will definitely be a regular spot
Vibe food service all too notch watch out when they start serving beer and other drinks this place will rob your wallet try everything bring everyone
No comment
No comment
No comment
Ordered the burger and strawberry matcha cocktail. Absolutely amazing! Really enjoyed the food and waiter was awesome too.
My all time FAVORITE Korean spot with a menu done right! Every dish is perfect and I can't wait to go back!

they surprised us with a delicious corn tea at the beginning. we got the happy hour special (beer + soju + chicken wings), the fried chicken + caviar, the cheesy jalapeño rice cakes, the steak tartare, the shrimp + avocado dip and the tater tots. Could've skipped the tater tots but everything else was so so great! Truly unique experience

This gem is in the East Village. Amazing food, good service, great small selection of natural wine, good soju bottle options as well as soju cocktails drink selection, cozy ambiance and good price for amazing food. We ordered the guacamole shrimp dip, which was delicious, flavorful and unique. We ordered the chopped cheese rice cakes that were also outstanding, cheesy and so delightfully topped with minced meat and with scallions. We also ordered a side of kimchi which is home made, mild spicy and delicious (had to order an extra side). The fried chicken wings are a must, crunchy skin with a sweet and savory flavor and the juiciest chicken. Simply delicious. The only thing that didn't impress in the menu was the dry aged burger, maybe because it was too much mayo and maybe because the cheese tasted like Kraft cheese...apart from that, everything was beyond delightful and I recommend and I will be back again for sure!

Went here with a few friends for dinner and drinks and we had a great time. The food was amazing and service was top notch. We had the dry age burger, the Jae Mac, chicken sandwich, Shin Ramyun wings, shrimp and avocado dip, and deviled eggs. Everything was delicious but my personal favorites were the Jae Mac and the wings. Aside from the food they also have a really unique drink selection; we went with the golden barley soju and the red rice makgeolli. Both were delicious. Overall it was a great experience and I will definitely be returning soon.

Ok where to begin. I usually don't leave reviews but feel a need to for Nowon. This is by far my favorite restaurant in the city. The food was amazingly good, love their menu. The staff is top notch. They have a really cute outdoor section now and they're just really clean, professional and basically treat you like family. If you haven't been here YOU HAVE TO GO CHECK IT OUT!!!
No comment
Recommend by a friend and so glad we found this gem. We had four small dishes which was perfect for a happy hour meal. Definitely visit the bathroom for the music.
New korean spot in the east village- unique down to earth interior with food to match. Chicken wings and the juk were great, cannot wait to go in again to try other items on the menu!

The Burger with Kimchi Mayo gets first place, very closely followed by all the other dishes we ordered. The numbing cucumber salad was delicious, the charred broccoli finger licking good and the sizzlin' Kimchi rice was super tasty. In all a great experience with excellent service and ambiance on the lower east side. We will be back soon.

Amazing food, perfect ambiance, and great service. Can't really go wrong. Stopped here before heading to the Nuyorican Cafe and it was well worth it. We had the fried Chicken, rice cakes, and broccoli. I'm still dreaming of the food. Also the bathroom feels like a club, yes I said the bathroom.
Amazing new spot! Went early for the burgers, but will definitely be back to explore the full menu once the liquor license clears.
Gabriella was so nice and patient and accommodating to us. Best service and food truly bottomless they don't let you see the bottom of your glass
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Okay this pasta is $14, how can you go wrong!? For that price this pasta was A+ I would definitely come back. Garlic bread was a miss wouldn't recommend but the pastas 10/10. Got the vodka sauce for one and eggplant for the other. Also got the tiramisu which I didn't like at all because it was not sweet, so if you're a fan of not sweet desserts then get this. Space is huge, we just walked in and got seated.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I got the fusilli with the alla norma sauce which was unique as it had tomato sauce with dashes of pesto and cheese cubes. It hit the spot and was flavorful! The atmosphere is nice and I didn't have to wait on a Friday night. Overall, a great pasta place and I'm looking forward to trying another create your own pasta.
No comment

I visited this place for brunch and enjoyed the bottomless mimosas and the shrimp scampi. I sat in the makeshift sidewalk area which honestly was cute and cozy but kinda distracting. The food was delish and I didn't leave feeling uncomfortably full. It was the perfect portion.  Our server was super friendly
No comment

Popular brunch spot on weekend. We had to sit at the car without a reservation, and it's a good location. The food was delicious we had mozzarella appetizer, eggs Benedict, kid loved the spaghetti and said it was the best she ever tasted, also the desserts were really good and fresh. Recommend place for a good meal and a fun atmosphere!

Mediocre pasta (though they claim it is made fresh in house) but somehow surprisingly popular. The prices are very good and the portions are generous so I imagine the target demographic here is NYU students. With so many better pasta options in the city, I don't think I'll be coming here again.
No comment
No comment

Great spot for a birthday dinner. I have been here 3 times and always had a great time! Last night they even served the bday girl a complimentary dessert. Usually family style / bottomless drink prefixes don't have the best quality, but that's not the case here! Sometimes they are a bit slow to refill the wine but it's a busy place so I'm not too bothered by it. Will definitely be back!
No comment
No comment

This place has a nice vibe, good for a date or a night out with a few friends. The service was not good though. We were given dirty plates and utensils when we got our appetizers to share. We asked for new dishes and it took them so long to bring it that by the time the new plates and utensils came, the entrees already came out and we hadn't touched our appetizers yet which were already cold. Regardless, the appetizers were average at best. The pasta was the only thing that brought this up to a 3 because it was actually decent.
No comment

Cozy little restaurant.  Absolutely delicious pasta entrees!  Pasta is homemade and sauces are super flavorful!  Delicious!  Five-star rating for the food offerings.  Have to knock of a star for service & floor layout.  After we got our food, no server ever came by to check on us.  It was very painful trying to get someone's attention to refill our water and then to get our check.  Restaurant is cozy but I feel that too many tables were on the floor.  It was very difficult to move between each table.  It is winter and most patrons had draped their thick coats and scarves on their chairs, which take up aisle space too.  I am not a big person, but it was difficult getting though between tables without knocking off someone's coat.

column3: East San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: The pasta was good. Parpardelle with meatballs was good. The marinara and meat was good. However the pasta is not soft enough. I get some places do it like this but my preference is softer. The sauce wasn't anything I'd come back for. Good try though.
No comment
No comment

Definitely one of the most affordable pasta places I've been. Their menu gives you the option to choose your own pasta shape and sauce. They also have a brunch menu, but ends at 4pm. Their portions aren't the biggest but you get what you paid for. An appetizer I highly recommend trying is the eggplant parm. It doesn't even taste like eggplant in a good way and the sauce that comes with it is delicious. My favorite pasta would be the pear & gorgonzola ravioli. Something about the sauce and the walnuts in it makes everything go together. The portion is kinda small. It only came with 7 raviolis.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Sunday around 1pm and to our surprise, we sat down right away! The place was spacious and had a very causal but intimate vibe, perfect for catching up with friends or a date. My friend and I ordered mimosa by the glass but the bottomless option is such a great deal too. I love how you're able to customize your pasta dish here - from the shape of the pasta, to the sauce and toppings -super affordable too. I decided to try the rigatoni with pesto and my friend got spaghetti with bolognese! Both very delicious and we were very full by the end. Would recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a place serving fresh pasta without breaking their bank
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Don't think I'd go back for dinner. While the ambiance and service were good, the food was not worth it. Under seasoned and not unique. Eggplant was good, the seasonal ravioli was not good at all
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great food and service, reasonable prices for drinks as well. Wine, $8/$9 for glass or $28/29 for bottle. Pastas are the best I have ever had.

The service was slow, the pasta was hard and nothing special. That being said, the restaurant itself was beautifully decorated and the prices were great. I enjoyed the menu and how you can build your own pasta-- made it special. The garlic bread was really good.
You guys should really consider adding LAST CALL 10pm for people who are not from the area. Are more friendlier hostess.
No comment
No comment

Wonderful meal and service for our party of six this evening. We did the prix fixe dinner menu which offered great choices and included alcohol. Good value and exceptional quality. Our server (I think his name was Cade) was very attentive. Will definitely return!

San Marzano is my favorite restaurant. I love every single one of their sauces. The pasta is always perfectly cooked. Whenever I have friends over, we always make a stop here. Once upon a time it used to be a lot quieter, however now it's very hard to get in. I suggest getting there very early, as the waits can be long but it is so worth it.
No comment
No comment

Came across this place online to find some pasta to eat for dinner. The pasta was alright, service was great, sat outside on the patio, place was busy, and the portion size is small and not too filling for $14 a plate, finished within 3-4 bites. Not much else to say about this place, a bit lackluster.
No comment

A very down to earth pasta place at very affordable prices. I had the wild boar ragú pasta and a glass of Chianti - not the best you can get, but at the price point there is really nothing that I can complain.

Great service, really beautiful interior and decoration. The pasta was 100% the best ever. It's fresh pasta made in house like wowowow. Pappardelle shape, tomato-vodka sauce with ricotta on top is what I got. Incredible!! And it's not overpriced at all
No comment

Delicious and affordable brunch spot! San Marzano offers bottomless mimosas for $14 or a glass for $5, but they're strong enough that a glass or two are plenty. The french toast is absolutely delicious. It had crispy edges and melty centers. It comes with a whipped ricotta-butter topping and a small pile of fruit toppings. Syrup was pre-drizzled but it wasn't too much! I would definitely come back for brunch, as you could have a decent brunch for $20-25.

When we went on Saturday around noon, the place was extremely busy, and it could only take walk ins at the bar. However, the bar cleared out pretty fast and the bartender was extremely nice and accommodating. The food came out fairly quickly, and they were both very delicious. The only thing is that the portions were a little smaller than I had expected.

The ambiance was so cute when we entered with great seating and we the service was really quick; we didn't really have to wait for the food. We got both of the Rigatoni's and they were both absolutely delicious and super creamy. My absolute favorite was the Rigatoni Alla Norma and the prices were so reasonable for pasta in Manhattan (only ended up paying about $18 per person including tip and tax). It's a must visit! Also, the portions may look small in the photo, but each pasta is perfect for one person. On a side note, the water is served in cute little mason jars!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had the wild boar spaghetti. I honestly didn't know it was meat because many of the other dishes that did have meat actually tell you in the description mine just says tomato sauce and cheese! But maybe that's my fault that I didn't ask. It wasn't bad, I just didn't eat all of the meat. VERY SMALL PORTIONS! I'm mainly giving it 2 stars because of the atmosphere and the portions. very loud. apparently it's for college students? Two friends told me this when I left. I wish I knew this. The only seating they had available was at the bar and again a place with really uncomfortable barstools! I think if I got another sauce, I probably would've liked it better. But honestly you get more for your money elsewhere.
Food is good! Bottomless mimosas are pretty weak but they come around for refills often. Mostly a early-20's crowd in groups of 6+ on weekends so be prepared for those vibes.

Came here with some friends for dinner and overall solid dinner experience. Split a pitcher of white sangria, as well as the Brussels sprouts and eggplant rigatoni appetizers. The sangria was fantastic, and I've heard from others to order the white over the red here. For my main I ordered a rigatoni alla norma. The pasta was cooked nicely al dente and the sauces were flavorful. It did feel a little on the heavier side towards the end, but the portioning and paired with the refreshing sangria, it made for a satisfying meal.
No comment

Horrible!! I ordered a Rigatoni alla vodka and they took 50 minutes to bring out the food even though there was only one other table in the restaurant?? My food comes and they give me the wrong order and if you look at the pictures that shit looks nasty asf. Pasta was watery and looks like someone shat in my plate. Usually if I get the wrong order I'd just eat it because I'm not a picky eater but that was just inedible. Waiter asks me if I wanted my order remade but I said it's ok since they took 50 minutes to bring out that disgusting food. Anyways don't come here. The waiter who looks like Ryan Reynolds was clueless the whole time and I had a strong urge to smack him in the face.
Love it here. Great food but very cheap. I come all the time for dinner and bottomless brunch.

This is my second time here. First time I came here was before COVID, and I loved it. This time around, I ordered take out through DoorDash. Sometimes with takeout, quality tends to go down hill-- this is not the case here. I can honestly say this place continues to serve incredible food for reasonable prices. The pasta is fresh, the sauces and flavors are vibrant and incredible. After trying other Italian places in NY, I can honestly say this is by far my favorite. I recommend the shrimp scampi, the pear Gorgonzola, and the flourless chocolate cake.
No comment
No comment
No comment

god I'm obsessed with this place. Idk I kind of want to gatekeep it. I've yet to have problems with a wait, and the prices are insanely reasonable. Food is just delicious. And they do bottomless brunch !!!!
No comment
No comment

This is a really affordable place for good, solid basics. Their pasta is simple and yummy. They offer bottomless mimosas on the weekends. You usually have to come to out your name down so sometimes it s a wait, the bar is first come first serve though
No comment
No comment
Affordable pasta that taste good. Smaller portion size but the pasta is delicious. The drinks are very watered down so I would not recommend. They have both outdoor and indoor dining.
No comment

The pasta was good - not great - but the atmosphere and wait staff are awesome. Our waitress was so fun and friendly and really allowed us to get our money's worth on the bottomless wine. Highly recommend for a good deal and fun night.
No comment
The food was delicious I enjoyed my spaghetti's I will be coming back for another dish also the waiters are friendly and polite

Came here for a post movie dinner. We ordered garlic bread, the Gorgonzola and pear ravioli, and the bolognese. I ordered the ravioli! It was so flavorful and weirdly complex? Usually cream based sauces can be so overwhelming but the onions and walnuts really cut through the heaviness of the cream. I recommend adding prosciutto. The bolognese was simply alright. I feel like the sauce was missing a lil something. Definitely will be back again just for the ravioli. YES it's that good
No comment
No comment

This place is amazing. The food is wonderful. The atmosphere is great. The servers are amazing and the manager Jen is one of a kind. She gives you the best recommendations, she treats you like if you were visiting her home, makes sure you leave there feeling happy, satisfied and full. Truly one of my favorite places to eat in the city. And you cannot beat these prices. The dessert is outstanding. The sangria is lovely. I can go on and on and on about how amazing this place is. If you're in NYC make sure to stop by
No comment

This place is definitely a bang for your buck. I mean $11 for unlimited mimosas in NYC is unheard of. However, this brunch was most definitely not unlimited. I probably had 3 mimosas while there and our waitress was very inattentive on refilling your glass. They also stopped service exactly 1.5 hours after our start time, even though we weren't served until about 20 minutes in. The food selection is pretty good and they have something for everyone. If you're looking for something good and cheap, however, this is a good spot.
No comment
Easy cheap bottomless brunch! Gabby was our waitress, and she was so kind and attentive. Kept our glasses full the whole time!!! Can't recommend a better easy brunch spot in EV. We will be back

The pear and Gorgonzola ravioli was absolutely delicious but wasn't enough of a portion that I was full, but it's $11 and freshly made so no complaints. I also appreciated the Parmesan cheese was freshly grated and not powder. Highly recommend this one. It blew my mind.
No comment
No comment

column3: Kendall Park, South Brunswick Township, NJ
column6: No comment
No comment

First time coming to this place after my other dinner plans fell through for our anniversary . Cute resturant ambiance, and the waiter was super kind. However, the food wasn't too great, I got the parpardelle with their version of vodka sauce, and unfortunately it was so extremely salty I couldn't get through half of it. Additionally, we got the garlic bread and antipasto as appetizers, and unfortunately both were very anticlimactic. The garlic bread was unfortunately inedible, I wasn't even sure what it tasted it. Lastly, the rose was affordable, but tasted so awful I didn't finish half a glass. Overall, the price and service is good, but wouldn't recommend for anything other than a quick bite for take out, definitely don't go for a special occasion or you will be let down.

The pasta taste it very good it's very unique and the portions are very great for one person. Although it was very good I felt like the pasta could've been cooked a little bit longer because I ordered pesto spaghetti and it was a little bit raw in the middle.
No comment
No comment

Consistently good homemade pasta at the right price. Portions small but get some drinks and you'll be set. Pitchers of drinks are OK - too much ice. But the great staff and atmosphere make it ideal for brunch or an early dinner. Consistency is what I think of when I think of san marzano

Came by this rowdy Italian spot I always walk pass to see what the hype is all about and I will confidently say I will be coming back. My friend and I walked in on a Wednesday night and got seated immediately. We got the burrata appetizer to share and a drink and a plate of pasta each. It all came out to just over $50, completely unheard of in NYC. Our server was very warm despite how busy the place was, and we were served relatively quickly. The portions were reasonable for the price point, and the food tasted like a hearty home cooked meal. One of my favorite east village spots no doubt!
No comment

came here for brunch with my friends. Food was okay, I got the pappardelle and we got a basket of pastries and orange juice / iced coffee. Service was good. The only downside is the restaurant is super super loud and noisy so don't come here if you want to catch up with your friends

A group of 14 of us came to San Marzano for bottomless brunch on a Saturday and it was absolutely amazing. Alice and Bella were truly incredible and made the entire experience much better. The food was tasty and the drinks were great (and refilled quickly). I cannot recommend San Marzano enough!
No comment
I had the rigatoni vecchia bettola. It was so flavorful and the pasta was cooked just right. I loved this little spot and the price point is awesome.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This was my first time in New York and I was definitely amazed by the incredible service! Our waitress Christina gave the best energy and really made it a welcoming experience. I would highly recommend coming here!! And ask for Christina!!!
Very mid italian place.  I've gone a few times, it's very meh. It is real cheap, and has some good deals, but overall I have never left impressed

This place was excellent! It was priced so affordably. I only gave it 4 stars bc my noodles were slightly firm and I like them very soft. I got the bolognese my favorite and the flavor was right on point!
No comment

We visited on the advice of a friend that was very enthusiastic about their $11 pasta. The place itself is very rustic and nice. We had gone around 5, so it was relatively empty, but when passing by the next day it looked like it was popping! We ordered the shrimp scampi, broccoli rabe with sausage, and eggplant pasta. We asked the waiter how big the portion sizes are, and were told that they're "not too big or too small, the perfect amount." Well, you get what you pay for I suppose, since $11 is cheap for NYC pasta. All three were pretty mediocre and the portions were tiny. The sauces were a little strange and overall the food was very average. We left hungry and ready for another meal, which is never a good sign.
I'm always so taken care of when I come here. The staff is so kind and accommodating and the manager Jen always makes sure I have the best time. I love this place

I love a good pasta as well as a good deal, and this place had both! I ordered the rigatoni alla norma and my friend ordered the rigatoni with vodka sauce. The sauce and the eggplant with pesto added a richness and savoriness to the pasta which definitely made for a very satisfying meal. I sampled some of my friends pasta and I loved it as well- the sauces are really what make the pasta stand out and stand apart. The rigatoni itself was a bit chewy, but overall I would recommend both dishes. I don't have any complaints- both of our meals came fairly quickly and were worth the price we paid. I'm looking forward to eating here again!

Stumbled upon this restaurant while looking for dinner with a friend. What a great find! Well priced fresh pasta, appetizers and desserts.  Cozy ambiance and very homey. We both got the boat ragú which was excellent. Portions are more most which matches the pricing. We also got a tiramisu which was good, although a little different flavor and could use more espresso punch and ladyfingers to cream ratio. I will definitely be back and try more items!

column3: Coral Gables Section, Coral Gables, FL
column6: No comment

San Marzano is a true treasure for one reason: prices. They are one of the only rest surfers where you can sit down and have a nice dining experience and not pay an outrageous amount. $6 glasses of wine, $11 pasta.. it doesn't get any better than that!
Great place for good, cheap pasta! Service isn't bad. I ordered the Boar Ragu with pappardelle ($13) and burrata ($4). It was good!
Outstanding service from Kennedy. Always attentive and recommended wine options for this night. Always made sure we were taken care of. Definitely recommend 100% love this place.
No comment

Came here for bottomless brunch a few weeks ago. The prices are great, but I will say that as a result, the mimosas weren't as strong, but can't really complain at such a reasonable price. Instead of brunch food, I got their fusilli alla Norma and genuinely it was DELICIOUS. I think I would recommend going here for the pasta mostly, because that alone is reasonably priced and absolutely scrumptious.

column3: Hills and Dales, San Antonio, TX
column6: No comment

San Marzano has decent food for great prices which is the reason I've continued to come back, however, the service is quite subpar. Most recently, we came for a friend's birthday and found both the host and wait staff to be very rude and impatient. It took a very long time to flag down someone to grab our orders and although the drinks are marked as bottomless, it seems that they make a point to only stop by once in a while. My friends who did the bottomless deal ended up getting three drinks in the span of 90 minutes. You can definitely find better Italian in the city but again, the prices are hard to beat.
No comment

My go to cheap bottomless brunch! What a steal for this area too. The bottomless + entree won't run you more than $30 (at least a few months ago, early 2021), which to us new yorkers is quite something to be excited about. Love the wild boar ragu papardelle and the pear and gorgonzola ravioli. Always a pleasure dining here.

This place is great for a cheap brunch. The $29 deal for food and bottomless is unbeatable. The only annoying thing was that we made a reservation for 6 - which means everyone at the table has to participate in bottomless no matter what. The virgin brunch is $20 which is way overpriced considering it only includes food and bottomless coffee (only hot though, not iced). I would come here again, but make sure everyone's doing bottomless drinks!!

Maybe it was because I got it Doordashed but the portion was insanely small and the quality of the pasta was a no-go. Pasta dough didn't taste fresh at all and in general tasted almost cardboard-like. The Wild Boar sauce was tasty but pasta overall wasn't good. The chicken wasn't tender at all either, also almost cardboard-like.

Staff is kind and attentive, ambiance is casual and food is acceptable. Has a homemade feel, idk why but I had higher expectations. I guess I wanted to be wowed by the sauces and they turned out to be a bit on the simpler side for me.

Second time coming here for brunch! Wait time was around 20 mins which was fine since we were still waiting for some of us to get here. First time I came here I actually ordered breakfast food when I most definitely should have gotten the pasta! So that's what I did this time around. We got our meal with bottomless mimosas, which as you should if you ever come here. My party and I all ordered pasta pesto with different types of pasta (fusilli and tagliatelle). My boyfriend wanted prosciutto in his but they ran out... strange because it was so early in the day around noon. Food was fresh and yummy. Not too much, not too little. Crowd is on the younger side like college or just fresh out. Recommend that if you get bottomless you drink at least 3 servings of it to get your moneys worth ($12 for unlimited, $5 for one... you can do the math). Can't wait to come back!

This place is a staple for me and I always recommend this to people when they ask me about good and affordable Italian restaurants. I've tried an array of pastas here and I've even tried the chicken sandwich. My favorite so far has been the shrimp scampi and their meatballs are also so flavorful. you HAVE to try their tiramisu it is to die for! I always look forward to dessert here. The ambiance is amazing and even on a weekday it will be busy. If you want to come on the weekend I suggest booking a reservation and doing the pre-fix meal.

Did the pre fixe dinner menu last night and it was pretty good overall.  The appetizers were fantastic, would definitely recommend the burrata!  I got the pappardelle pasta in the pesto sauce which was superb!  Overall great quality, but they were really rushing us out at the end of the meal.
No comment
A great place for delicious pasta. The portions were a little small, but it was definitely worth a visit. I love how you can customize the specific pasta type with the sauce.
No comment

this place was amazing!!! the price was unbeatable for pasta in nyc, and the food was absolutely delicious. the waitresses were super nice and let us charge our phones in the back. definitely coming back when I visit the city again.
No comment

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Showed up shortly after they opened the staff told me they were only seating by reservations even tho their website says they only take reservations for 6 or more people. They said it was due to them being understaffed. Three staff members were sitting outside vaping. So clearly they were not understaffed. The couple behind me were sat even tho they did not have a reservation. I was also a party of two like them. I wanted to love this place bc of the hype but unfortunately was let down.
No comment
No comment

Delicious food. Everything smelled so good when we entered and had an even better taste. I ordered the spaghetti pesto and also had a taste of the pappardelle bolognese which was just as good as the pesto.  The place was beautiful as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is one of east village's gems! It's not so hidden so you should definitely expect a wait when you dine here. We had to wait 25 mins for a table of 4 but it was totally worth it. Great food and some of the most reasonable pricing around! You get to choose what type of pasta you want for every dish. The portions are just the right size and the sangria was the perfect amount for 4 people. One of my favorite places to stop in and would definitely recommend to any local who hasn't tried it!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing and affordable brunch spot in NY. If you're looking for bottomless, this is a great spot it is just so cheap compared to other places but the food is still really good quality. Definitely order the pasta since it is house-made, the pasta dishes are the best things on the menu! Also make a reservation or arrive right when they open.
No comment

delicious and just the right amount of pasta portion and ingredients tasted fresh and cooked and seasoned perfectly. they have Energetic ,  Enthusiastic, and friendly staff. Unfortunately, the tiramisu was just alright. It lacked the espresso punch, creamy sweetness and texture that excellent tiramisu should have.
Recommend by TikTok. Portions were small, but the prices were amazing. Would come back to again.
No comment

While the food here is nothing crazy, I highly recommend this spot. By far the cheapest restaurant in the city for a decent, nice sit down meal. Everything here is solid and you won't be disappointed for the price. Especially recommend the bottomless brunch or pitchers for a great deal

The best deal in Manhattan and the staff was so great. I constantly crave the pear Gorgonzola ravioli and goat cheese salad. And the wine and sangria is good at such a great price. Will definitely be making this a regular spot of mine

Solid pasta place, very good value - $27 for bottomless mimosas, $11 if you just want a pasta. Fun, chic vibe. French toast was yummy. The ricotta and burrata were meh. Overall, would recommend and come again.

Thank you to the internet for this great recommendation in the East Village. Affordable fresh pasta speaks to my heart, and this place did not disappoint. There were so many difference pasta shape and sauce options as well. Stopped by for an early Sunday dinner and went with a wild boar ragu papparelle paired with house sangria. Also got to try my companion's pear and gorgonzola ravioli---yum. If you have a big appetite you might want to add on an appetizer or salad but the portion was just right for us! The bathroom situation has been commented on so definitely be prepared to wait in line, especially if the restaurant is busy.
food was not good at all. service was ok. bottomless is cheap but they arent consistent with refilling. 5/10
No comment
No comment
I regularly come here as one of my favorite pasta places in the city for great fresh affordable dishes. Always a treat and staff are especially kind!

The staff was a little laid back for the experience I was looking for. The restaurant itself was beautiful. The brunch was awful. The eggs Benedict were way over poached and there was maybe a neglectful amount of hollandaise sauce. When the waiter came over and asked if everything was alright. He said he was checking with management if this is how it's always prepared and never came back.  I will not be returning and I recommend you walk past, unless you are trying to get drunk on bottomless mimosas.

If you get Kayla as a waitress...immediately expect the worst. we were charged for bottomless brunch despite our group not drinking. we were told AFTER WE HAD ALREADY EATEN that since we had a reservation we had to pay for bottomless, even though we did not drink. so we basically had to pay for something we didn't get. this is an absolutely ridiculous policy. not to mention Kayla was rude and neglectful.
No comment
No comment

column3: Merriam Park West, Saint Paul, MN
column6: FUCK THIS PLACE NEVER GO HERE!! They charged us 3x what they listed the price as and forced us to tip. The food was watery. Fuck San marzanos I will never be back

Pasta here is AMAZING. We came on a Saturday night, fully packed and still had a great experience. Our waiter was absolutely attentive and wonderful even though I'm sure they were extremely busy. Great experience; I will definitely go back!

As their name implies , you'd go there for their pasta. In close proximity of St Mark Pl and great options for Japanese barbecue, San Marzano offers a great alternative! We ordered shrimp scampi and spaghetti with pesto - and garlic bread and Brussels sprout for appetizers. Their pasta and spaghetti are awesome but I wasn't impressed with added chicken - so perhaps just choice of pasta with sauce would be a better option
No comment

Such a sweet little restaurant in the city. Really GREAT food for incredible prices. We got the pear ravioli and pesto pasta which were both amazing. We also got the sangria but you can skip out on that.
Was overcharged for the food, the waitress Kayla did not explain the fixed drink charge despite our group not drinking and was charged $30 for a $15 pasta dish
No comment

Great food, very mediocre service. We had a party of 8 for dinner so we had the $48 pre fix menu - 3 apps to choose from, an entree and bottomless drinks. The 90 minute bottomless starts the moment the server drops the last cup in the first round of drinks. We were ready to order more drinks and he never came to check on us, we always had to flag him down across the restaurant. We ended up staying for 3 hours because they weren't ever coming over to our table, so we only were able to order 3 drinks each over the 3 hour period we were sat at our table. We also waited 30 minutes just to pay the check. The literal only saving grace for this place is that the food is so good and it was extremely cheap. I recommend the pasta dish with the roasted eggplant, the meatballs and the burrata.

I'm not sure, maybe you get what you paid for but the food honestly isn't that good. I've been there twice and the first time I ordered a pesto pasta and it was literally the driest pasta I've ever eaten. We also got the garlic bread with mozz, but it hardly tasted like garlic and just a piece of bread with cheese on it. Sangria pitches are the only thing that made it worth the visit cause it was good. The Cesar salad has hardly any dressing and it's so much quantity with such little dressing or croutons. The meatballs were pretty good, so there's that. We also got a panini which also was not so good. The service was pretty good tho, I'll give them that and the restaurant itself is cozy and beautiful and enjoyable. But the food, Idk. I'm not sure if I'm just going on their off days or if the food I chose was just bad.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The vibe in the restaurant was very chill and peaceful! It wasn't too crowded at 2:30 on a Tuesday. Our server was super nice and attentive. The food was fantastic! I got a rigatoni bolognese which tastes pretty good and the spaghetti alla Norma was the best (recommend). It's cool that you can customize your pasta if you know your taste. The garlic bread was a little too crunchy but still good

DO NOT COME HERE. I have never been treated so poorly by a waitress in my entire life. Kayla was the most inconsiderate, unpleasant, and argumentative waitress I've ever had. She was arguing with me about overcharging us by $200 dollars trying to justify it and their policies. Luckily I was able to speak with someone else about the overcharges after I had to get up and find someone because kayla would not help. The food was good but it's not worth the rudeness I dealt with. I will not be coming back.
No comment
No comment

San Marzano is a must-try restaurant for everyone in NYC. Great food, great prices, great staff, what more could you ask for? I went this past weekend and got the bottomless mimosas for $12 (nearly unheard of in the city), chicken panini, and delicious pasta. I absolutely loved the food. We ordered the Boar Ragu Tagliatelle which was phenomenal. The pasta was al dente, the ragu sauce was perfectly seasoned and was so worth it for the price. We were scraping the bowl at the end. The chicken panini was also amazing; the flavors perfectly complemented each other and the baguette was nice and crunchy. I did find that occasionally the chicken was a little dry/tough. The bottomless mimosas were also extremely delicious; not too strong on the champagne but not pure orange juice as well. Our waitress consistently filled up the mimosas and we were never waiting around with empty glasses. I highly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a delicious but not too pricy meal. I feel like this is one of the most worth-it places in the city. I will be back!
The food is delicious. The place is packed with young people. We got there at 11am when it opens and it was the right decision.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cheap bottomless brunch in East Village, but nothing more than that. We came for bottomless on Sunday and thought it would be a tipsy brunch. The mimosas were very heavy on the OJ and didn't have much champagne unfortunately. I ordered the Butternut Squash and Sausage Rigatoni, and it was honestly something I could've made myself. My friend got the Benedict, and the english muffin was so hard that she gave up on cutting it and just ate it with her hands lol. Neither of us were impressed by the food, but glad we tried it because this place is always so busy. Bottomless is cheaper here than at most other places in the Village, so it's good if you're on a budget. Just don't expect to leave tipsy or very impressed by the food.
such a great spot! homemade pasta and awesome brunch deal - $29 for bottomless WITH an entree and can pick from brunch or pasta menu, YUM
This place is amazing small but the food is delicious. My first night in NYC and it was a great choice for dinner!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The Garlic cheese bread is what have this place 4 stars. It was absolutely amazing!!! Ordered grilled cheese and was not very good. Alfredo pasta and shrimp scampi were tasty. Don't pass up the garlic cheese bread!

Some of the worst service I've ever experienced. I didn't have water for our entire stay even though we asked for water three times. I looked down at my utensils and was shocked to see old dried tomato sauce all over my knife and napkin. I'm not someone who is super picky about service. I worked as a waitress so I know how hectic things can be but this was just ridiculous. But the pasta was really good. I'll give it that.

Even though the food was very good and our waitress was excellent.  The treatment by hostess/manager was appalling.  We were a party of 12, we did not come for the bottomless drinks, instead we ordered salads, appetizers, a few bottles of wine and main courses.  The bill was a several hundred dollars.  We were then told that  we were over our time limit.  She said we were over the 1 1/2 allocated.  I have never been told that there is a timer on how long to sit and eat.  She was incredibly rude.  I understand that it is a very busy restaurant but this was ridiculous.  We were still eating when she tried to hustle us out.   I'm giving 2 stars because our waitress was so good.
No comment
No comment

Wow. All I can say is that my server, Kayla, made mine and my groups night. She was amazing!!! The food was delicious, but Kayla was the star of the show. Kennedy was also so funny and sweet and really helped us out while it was busy. I had a 11/10 experience at San Marzano. It was a good vibe.

We dined there, yesterday and it was such an amazing experience! Fresh pasta are delicious. We have tried too different kinds: ravioli with pears & nuts and fusilli alla Norma. I recommended this restaurant for food but also for good vibes.

I normally love this place and I don't know if they just got disorganized after reopening but don't come here if you're a party of two. This place is super accommodating to groups and groups of more than 6 can make a reservation which makes things easier, but for a party of two they are not accommodating at all. We put our name down at 1:00 and was told it would be a 45 minute wait. We came back at 1:45 and they said it would be just a few minutes more. We asked about the status 20 minutes later and they said we were next on the list. Then they proceeded to seat multiple groups of 3 and 4 before us (who got there after us and did not have a reservation). We ended up waiting 2 hours and never got a table. We decided to eat at the bar because it was 3:00 by that time and it was clear that they were never going to seat us despite saying we were next in line an hour ago.

Came for brunch and was not disappointed. This place offers great bang for your buck; you get bottomless mimosas for $12. NYU students flock in here just because the food and drinks are such a steal. It gets pretty packed and loud on the weekends. I tried the smoked salmon bagel and an omelet and they're alright, nothing to be wowed by. Next time I definitely want to try some of the pasta options. However, the main selling point for this place is the drinks. I thought they were decent; slightly on the weaker side compared to other place's mimosas, but you come for the "bottomless" part anyways. The service is solid too, our server refilled our drinks often and checked in at a reasonable pace.

column3: Central City, Salt Lake City, UT
column6: Best quality and price for italian food in NYC. I usually get the burrata and any pasta with the Vodka Sauce.
No comment

Delicious fresh Italian cuisine! I had the Brussels sprouts and Caesar salad with a Pinot Grigio. My friends had the meatballs. Delicious sauce which I tasted with the bread. Next time I will try a pasta!

Came here for the $27 brunch which included bottomless mimosas, an entree per person, and 3 appetizers (they were out of pastries which is what you usually get). The paninis were huge, but the eggplant one didn't have that much flavor. I really recommend the brussels sprouts. They were my favorite. The garlic bread was hard as a rock. Our server was really nice and attentive. He was always ready to refill our empty glasses. It was the perfect spot for bottomless brunch.
No comment

A friend and I stumbled into the restaurant while passing by and decided to try it.
