We enjoyed the overall atmosphere of the place and were impressed by the prices as well. $11 for pasta & $6-$7 for a glass of wine which is a steal for a nice, sit down restaurant in NYC. Not only was the price great, the pasta was so delicious! You can tell the pasta was fresh and made in-house and the portions were a decent size. Will be coming here more often, especially for days that I'm just craving pasta togo. We also ordered garlic bread ($5) mins which had really good flavor, but was a bit too toasted/hard for my liking. It was a bit hard to chew for me as I prefer softer breads. Other than that, my friend and I really enjoyed the place!

Came for brunch with my friends. The food was amazing, the service was great, and the mimosas were awesome. While some of the reviews complained about attentiveness of the staff, this was not the case for us. Our waitress made sure that our mimosas and waters were always full. Everything came at a great price as well. Would love to come back
No comment

My go to pesto pasta spot! The eggplant app and sangria are also great additions to your meal. Can't complain with how cheap the place is. Been here one too many times and will continue to come back always!
No comment

Stopped in for lunch since I had the day off yesterday. It always looked appealing since it was always crowded whenever I walked by. We got seats right away and the service was very good - quick, attentive and professional. We got the arugula salad, the pappardelle with wild boar ragu and the rigatoni alla Norma. Didn't love the ragu but the rigatoni alla Norma was outstanding. Highly recommended for a quick, cheap meal.
No comment
Great service and really good food that's surprisingly reasonably priced. Highly recommend this place

We literally waited an hour for food and it was extraordinarily mediocre. The server didn't tell us what was happening and quite literally told as our food was on its way and we waited 30 minutes past that time. I have never done this before but I am considering speaking to the manager.
No comment

This place was on my radar for years, and after one order I don't get it. The alla norma pasta had almost no tomato sauce. Though very disappointed in my own entreee, the meatball and eggplant appetizers that I sampled seemed better.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Favourite pasta spot! Really cheap and amazing pasta. You can choose your sauce and pasta combination and everything on the menu is really good. I come here very often for my pasta fix. Gets pretty busy for dinner times and great brunch spot as well.
Bland mediocre food. Had vodka sauce with rigatoni and it was super underwhelming. Don't recommend.
No comment
No comment
Waited 25 minutes to get menus and water. Completely ignored most of the time. Waitors name was Jacob

This place in NYC has handmade pasta at a great price (and you can taste it, too!) Make sure you go on a weekday night, because walking up could mean a long wait. I always return here when I come to the city.

Had a bit of an issue sorting out our reservation but mistakes are mistakes. The way you correct them is what makes a restaurant. The staff was incredibly friendly and apologetic after a reservation error, and the attention paid to detail from there on out makes me think this place is going to be around for a while. Excellent food, excellent deal, excellent vibe.

This place is fantastic. The pasta is very good, as are the paninis! I've dined here various times and have always left very satisfied. Brunch seems to attract a very energetic crowd, so if that's not what you're looking for, perhaps a different time would be better to go. The only flaw is that they don't take reservations unless it's for a big party, which by now, I guess works for them but a definite let down since they can get very busy for dinner. If you really want to try it, lunch is your best bet.
delicious pasta! i got the flat noodles with pesto and loved the noodles so much. felt hand made and really chewy! a wonderful interior and friendly service.
No comment
I went into this little pasta restaurant and got greeted by the most amazing guy with tattoos. Very positive man and made the pasta even better.

Came here for a girlfriends lunch.   We made reservations.  The food is ok but bland.  We had rigatoni (didn't know they charge extra to add ricotta and mozzarella until I got the bill), chicken panini (very dry),  garlic bread (pretty good ), ravioli (good) and Brussels sprouts (burnt and tasteless).   What I found Interesting is that we asked to if they could breakdown a $20 and the girl said they don't do that.  I'm like don't they take cash payments??? How hard could it be to give a couple of singles and a $10 bill or whatever.   Anyway this is a good place for tourist.

The pasta is pretty good here but the deal is really what seals the deal. The bottomless brunch for 29$ and bottomless dinner for 45$ is unbeatable! This is definitely a good place for large groups who enjoy making the most of the bottomless drinks. It does get extremely loud and close quarters especially if seated inside for dinner so be prepared for that! Our waitress could've attended to our bottomless drinks with more attention but overall, I enjoyed my meals here both times.
No comment

This place odd a nice affordable Italian place with great sangria pitchers and a cute location! I love how you can build your own pasta, plus the options are all amazing! No reservations though, and it does get quite busy so come early or be prepared to wait!
Sucks not worth price for prix fix menu would not recommend , sorry not sorryyyyyyyyyy

Honestly, the avocado toast was bomb. Was it supposed to be bottomless mimosas? Yea. Was it bottomless.... Hmm let me think. NOPE!!! Let me tell you... we found the bottom... and it was just not all it was cracked out to be....

Drinks were good. Food was okay. Waitress and other waiters were rude and didn't respect our space. Mimosas were not bottomless and although getting seated 15 minutes late were told to leave and not given anymore drinks with 15 minutes left in our 90 minute time. Pitcher was not left on the table, slow.
No comment

Pls don't go here!! I took my friend here for brunch  since I was treating her out since I flew all the way to nyc to visit. Besides us waiting outside in the rain and cold (which was also painful) We both got food poisoning and were fighting demons!! something used in our food was expired :(( lt ruined the rest of my trip since I threw up and couldn't keep anything down that week and my friend had to take extra medicine. We both rlly regret coming here :((
No comment
No comment
Decent pasta for its price. Beware of long lines especially on a Friday night and on weekends. The wait can be up to 1/2 hours. My go-to is the Brussel sprouts, Alla Norma with meatballs.

The value here is unbeatable. Pastas, apps, wine, all for an affordable price! and YUMMY!!  The decor is also so cute. If you happen to sit in the corner right table next to the old medicine cabinet: make sure to write a note and stick in one of the drawers and read some notes left! I love this and I always smile reading people's notes :)
No comment
No comment
No comment
Honestly one of my favorite spots to go to, the food is so well priced and delicious. I love their pear and Gorgonzola ravioli! Their sangria is also delicious
No comment
No comment
No comment
Awesome bottomless brunch, great pasta (small portions but doesn't matter when you're drinking a lot)
Super great Italian food that's a great price. The staff we interacted with were amazing. Food arrived quickly to our table after we ordered
No comment
No comment

Amazing deal!! It came to $60/person including tip and tax for the unlimited deal. My only complaint is because it was so packed the service was a bit slow but I highly recommend for a birthday dinner. The unlimited sangria was delicious
Pastas are now $14 instead of $12! Place was cute and the wait was short. Would recommend for a date night

Bottomless mimosas is a term used very loosely at this establishment. Unless you consider 2 glasses of 98% orange juice to be bottomless brunch, I would recommend going elsewhere. The service was poor, food was well below average.
No comment
No comment
Absolutely love. Had the brussels sprouts, bucatini amatriciana, ricotella, and cappuccino. Everything was delicious and service was great!

For the price and just in general, this spot is amazing! Great food, good portions, and unbeatable prices! My only complaint is that the seats are so close together and the restaurant is VERY loud so I have to scream at my friend for her to hear me. But that is kind of a vibe sometimes.

Came around 5 on a Sunday and there was no wait. I got the rigatoni with pesto and chicken. It was nice and al dente, but nothing extraordinary. We really liked the white sangria though and for $16/pitcher it was such a steal. I'd def come back as the price you pay for how much you get is worth it.
No comment
No comment

My mom and I came here on a Sunday afternoon around 1pm. They said the wait was over an hour but we could be seated right away at the bar so we did that. My friend that used to live here recommended it as a nice affordable place with good pasta and she was right! Entrees are about $10 and the menu is very big. It was very loud and I realized that's because they were offering unlimited mimosas with brunch for $12. I finally realized that's why people were yelling and the average age was 22. Great food but pick your days wisely considering how intoxicated you want to get!

Bottomless mimosas actually has a bottom because after a time the waiting staff will just start ignoring you. Bring a rain coat too otherwise you'll get drenched from how often they spill drinks on you when they're pouring. As for food, the pasta we ordered was not even fully cooked and still crunchy. For the price and limited space you have would not recommend this place.
The pasta was amazing, especially for how cheap it was. Everything else tasted like cafeteria food.
excellent food, bad waitstaff. Got food in 5 minutes and was waiting an hour for the check.

Unbeatable prices and quality service. Our server William was welcoming, extremely helpful, and patient when helping us navigate the menu's different choices. S/O to William!!

My friends and I decided to try this place out, as the food looked good and prices were reasonable. We were absolutely BLOWN away. The food was mouthwatering, literally delicious. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5, is because they would not let me add shrimp to my pasta dish; even tho shrimp was posted on the menu. Definitely highly recommend, was the cheapest and best meal I had in NYC!
Tried calling 3 times today at different times and no answer. How is one meant to get in contact with the restaurant?

We went here for a friends bday dinner. They were easily able to accommodate our group of 12 people! We did the bottomless dinner option. It's $45 for an entree with unlimited drinks (sangria, wine, beer) and $32 for no drinks. They give you 3 apps to pick from and share with the table also. Although their food was amazing their pricing was a bit inflated. Regularly their dining entrees were so affordable it felt like we should have got more for the bottomless option! Regardless, I loved it!

The first time I came here it was packed on a Tuesday night, rightfully so this place is the best bang for your buck. You get high quality tasty dishes that taste great and you can have a meal that costs under $30 in NYC that's close to public transport. Highly recommend if the "NYC surcharge" is getting too old for you.

The garlic bread is so good, but the pasta is absolutely vile. I'm sorry, it's the worst pasta I've ever had. It was the shrimp scampi & it looked like dirty dish water, noodles, and shrimp that was cooked in the dish water. I had the shrimp scampi, it was so bad and very sour. I know scampi has lemon in it but it was extremely sour.

I am a first time customer and was very excited to celebrate my friends birthday. We walked in and unfortunately our twenty person party was not accommodated with a table altogether. After being seated separately from my party I was not feeling especially valued. That, however, was until our lovely waitress arrived and turned our night around. Antonella was especially thoughtful. She made our table feel like we were the only one's on her radar despite tending to many other parties. She was quick and on top of her customers in a way that made them feel special. Antonella was the best part of our experience and I hope that she gets recognized as such!

Located off the corner of 2 Ave, there's limited seating inside the establishment but there's enough. The pasta here is handmade, very good flavor and quality.  The portion size is large so for me it was enough to have left overs. If you're a pasta lover then this is a hidden gem. The petals all start out at $10 and it's your choice to add extras. I'll definitely be back soon!

The perfect early pasta dinner date spot. The portions are just right - think no leftovers but hits the spot, which is also great if you plan on taking your night elsewhere for drinks and don't want to be held down by a huge amount of pasta. This place is particularly special because you get to custom size everything about your dish - type of pasta and sauce. Great appetizers and cheap drinks as well. Some of the seats are very close together, almost touching the person next to you,  it if you don't mind that it adds to the experience!

Food was good but server was racist, rude and unprofessional, told me she "didn't want my f**** cash" after we had planned on tipping cash, started referring to me & my black friends as 'you people' saying our kind werent going to tip anyways, she was very rude for no reason. Have had previous experiences that ran smoothly and had no issues, so I'm not sure why there was such an issue this time. Here's a tip: don't assume black people don't leave tips. And if you'd like a bigger tip, maybe ask nicely why we didn't tip more instead of being rude and aggressive for no reason. Sometimes people leave cash tips, it is normal.
Cannot beat prices $35 for wine glass, beer, 2 entrees, and app!! Wait was like 5-10 minutes at the bar around 7pm

We came with a large party for a reservation and that was a mistake. They charge $48 per person to make a reservation, and you get a prix fixe menus which ended up being around $60 with tax and tip. With this comes a pasta dish, 3 appetizers, bread, and unlimited beer/wine/sangria. This sounded like a good deal but it definitely was not. If you had just ordered you own separate items it would have been much much cheaper. The portions are small, and the sangria was very watered down and mostly ice. We had 8 people so they gave us 2 of each of the 3 apps. Our waiter didn't bring out our 3rd app, we asked for it, and then he didn't believe us even though there was no 5th/6th plate. And then they only brought us 1 of the last app. This was honestly such a ripoff- you are 100% paying just for the convenience of having the reservation but I would suggest not doing that unless you want to pay 3x the price. The food was good but for $60 per person I could have gone to a much better place.

Went here for the first time the other night. Heard about this place from my friend Paris who goes all the time. I'm from LA and and wanted somewhere casual and cute to eat. The food was really quality Italian food for the price and the staff was super friendly. Our waitress was chill and helped with the wine menu and the host with the buzzcut was really sweet and recommended the pappardelle with ragu (he told us to add ricotta which was amazing) and we loved it so shout out to him. Definitely will be visiting again next time we're in the city and wanna try the brunch because the hosts sold us on the unlimited mimosas. Thanks for the meal!

Food is good for the price, and the bottomless brunch price is a steal, however don't come here if you're looking to get drunk/have fun. They don't play music and don't let you get rowdy, and they don't do pitchers of bottomless mimosas. With that, our waiter actually told us we couldn't chug the mimosas at all and purposefully ignored our table and went to others first.... So what's the point of advertising bottomless brunch if it's not really bottomless. Probably good for a smaller group of like 4 girls, but wouldn't return otherwise. 3/5

I've been coming here for 3 years and it's delicious every single time. $11 for fresh pasta & $35 for a pitcher of sangria is impossible to beat. Highly recommend the ala Norma, the bolognese, the ragu, and the sausage and butternut squash!

Giving this rating a 3 star for the food. However, the service was horrific. The waiter was unbelievably rude and had an attitude the minute we sat down. Very disappointed as I have been to San Marzano plenty of times and never experienced something like this. The waiter was careless and barely took into account that someone had a deadly peanut allergy at the table. He seemed annoyed and impatient when asked any question. What an awful experience.
Antonella is absolutely the best server I have ever had. Food and unlimited mimosas was amazing. I found a new friend for life today.

This is probably the cheapest fancy dinner you can get in NYC. The service is great, the ambiance is bustling, and the food is fantastic. The first time I went I got the eggplant pasta and it was so good. I came again and got the pasta with the vodka sauce. The burrata is a must! Can't wait to come here again and try all the pasta on the menu!

Never in my life have I been treated so rudely. We confirmed our reservation for 9 outdoors multiple times leading up to the date. When we arrived with 9, they informed us our reservation would actually be indoors. My reservation was not honored, and they would not even accommodate by at least opening the windows by our indoor table. They diminished the importance of being outdoors as a precaution for covid. One of the most disappointing dining experiences I've ever had. My group ended up leaving to find another spot to eat, especially because the staff was unwilling to acknowledge and remedy their mistake with our reservation.

PLEASE READ: I had a severe allergic reaction in this restaurant due to apparent cross contamination in their kitchen. I informed my server of my severe allergy to tree nuts and she ensured me that everything I ordered was nut-free. Turns out there ended up being pesto (with pine nuts) accidentally in my dish, and I ended up in the hospital. When I called the restaurant the next day to ask for their list of ingredients, I was initially offered that they pay my hospital bill, however later was informed that they could only offer me a "free glass of wine" to make up for their mistake. They took no responsibility for their mistake and refused to apologize or show any remorse for my ending up in the hospital with a life threatening reaction. They even went so far as to accuse me of lying- saying that I could have eaten something after I left or maybe I "kissed someone who ate nuts." They still refuse to pay my hospital bill, and only offered to pay a fraction of it in return for my promise to drop the issue. I recommend that you DO NOT eat here.

We all got really sick definately Food poisoning we each got different entrees but shared around so we don't know which was the problem. if you've ever had a group with food poisoning and 1 bathroom you can imagine.  We called the restaurant but they were just rude.  Needless to say we will not return or recommend.

Fresh pasta for an amazing price! My husband and I came for lunch during the weekend, and could have waiting 20 minutes for a table, but we just sat at the bar. We got the brussel sprouts for an appetizer which were delicious and only $7! For pasta, I got the pappardelle (thick and flat noodles) with pesto and my husband got garganelli with broccoli rabe and sausage. Both were amazing with fresh pasta and flavorful sauces. For $9 you really can't beat the price, and the food is top notch. I definitely recommend this place! We had great service and a great experience.

This was really good and well worth the price.  The pesto pasta is super bomb and the burrata and brussels sprouts are excellent appetizers. The sangria is also quite affordable.  The only thing is the sausage and peppers sauce is too bland and the bread was very tough. But it's $10 per pasta (generally) and it's fresh.  Get there early because no reservations for parties less than 6 I believe.

Nonetheless, be aware that if you reserved through OpenTable, they will forced you to take the fix menu which is 45 dollars, too expensive for what the food and drinks actually cost here. In the OpenTable app there was no information about this. I even tried to reserved a table in the rest. to see if what the waiter was telling was true, and it doesn't say anything. So is a scam. Moreover, my waiter Cade, was kind of rude about it and didn't offered me the choice of no fix menu, until I raised the concern to him and get upset that they were trying to scam me. He forgot about us most of the night, we have to ask to order drinks,  and then it was like we were not there. Not very nice, when I was telling him the truth. On OpenTable there is another review claiming my same issue and that's what confirmed what I was suspecting. Not right, so be aware.

Wow this place is amazing. The price is pretty decent too, especially when you're eating in the city. Each pasta dish is $10 and they taste great. You honestly can't go wrong with getting any dish here. I also got the burrata and sangria. A+ would go back again and try the other pasta dishes again.

We've been coming here regularly since the place opened & have always enjoyed it. I'm sorry to say it's gone downhill. Mainly becayse they now require parties of 6 or more to order the prix fixe menu, which you don't find out until after you've made the reservation and is a LOT more expensive than ordering ala carte: $45 prix fixe includes 1 main, 3 apps for the table & unlimited house wine or beer vs $11 mains/$9 app/$7 house wine. Luckily, my spouse knows the owner, so we were let off of the expensive option but it left a bad taste of scam. The waitress verged on rude & wasn't the least attentive. Did I want dessert? no one asked. Did we need more of anything? not a prayer. The food is OK for the price but our days of haunting San Marzano are over.

By the end of the meal I was perfectly satisfied, not that overstuffed feeling you sometimes get from pasta, so portions were very appropriate. Check it out!

Very disappointed with the system. I wish I could give negative stars. We're a table of four and the manager were cornered us into using the prefix of $45 per person (or cancel the reservation and pay $20 person). One of my friends couldn't drink and still forced to pay $45. We didn't even know we were charged for gratuity of 20% until we see the bill, of course. Very shady.

This place is great for bottomless brunch! I came here on a Saturday morning at around 10:30am and had to wait an hour for a table. Luckily, there are a couple of shops/coffee spots nearby so it's easy to kill time until you get a table. The atmosphere is cute and it's a very popular spot so it can get pretty noisy inside. There was no AC even though I went during a heat wave. Prices are reasonable for what you get and quality of food is also what you would expect for the price. Service was pretty average, nothing spectacular. Overall, it's a great place for bottomless brunch on a budget - just beware of how long you'll have to wait in order to get a table!

Can't beat the price! They forgot some of our food but didn't hesitate to take it off the bill when we mentioned it. Our waitress refilled our mimosas regularly and the pasta was decent. Overall good brunch experience would come back!
No comment

If you're looking for a great bottomless brunch place in NY, look no further! I'd recommend arriving between 11 am and 12 pm to ensure a table for brunch as it starts to fill up quickly. Bottomless Mimosas for $12 and a Grilled Chicken Panini for $9. Great deal to begin a weekend! The panini contained tomato, arugula, fontina cheese, chipotle mayo and of course chicken. Service was excellent and I enjoyed the interior design of the restaurant very much. Pulled off a vintage / cellar vibe to me. I was in between the chicken panini and the prosciutto panini (prosciutto, arugula and mozzarella) but ultimately pulled the trigger on the chicken. Looks like I have to come back for round 2! There is a wall of drawers at this restaurant that contains little notes on napkins placed inside that customers leave. My table even left a note in a drawer, see if you can find it!
No comment

Personally, their pasta was too al dente for me. So if you like soft pasta, ask them to cook it more. The meatball sauce was too salty for me since I usually do not use salt in my cooking. I think just tomato sauce with meatballs added might have been better for me. The ragu was good though, not too sweet nor salty. Burrata was delicious.

Someone recommended this restaurant to me out of all the places in New York for pasta. I was surely happy with the suggestion. All pastas are homemade and only $10. What a steal in New York!! They offer a selection of fresh pastas and sauces which you can freely pair. I ordered the rigatoni with bolognese sauce and the fusilli with pesto. Grated cheese on top by request. For an appetizer I ordered the Brussels sprouts that were charred beautifully with sautéed apples. Unfortunately, I didn't order a drink but was pleasantly surprised to see sangria for $5 a glass on the menu and a pitcher available. The quality for the price is unmatched! This is a Manhattan gem!

amazing spot in the east village if you want the best pasta and wine for your buck. great spot to go with friends, would not opt to go here for a date night as the crowd is a lot of young nyu kids and it gets very loud, sooo recommend bringing a big group and doing the bottomless dinner-- amazing value. if not, coming here with two or three people and just getting pasta and a pitcher of sangria is so great and shockingly cheap for house-made pasta tipsy dinner. the only reason i sock 4 stars is A) it is a younger rowdier crowd (not a bad thing, but is what it is)

I requested a substitute, Christina told me I have to pay. Unbelievable. Perhaps she needs to go back to school for waitressing. A bit smaller portion but health and scientific wise it's the perfect portion. Good sauce and chewy not soggy pastas which I prefer and is good in my opinion. Very nice price and good service. Decent speed and quite convenient with the 6 train at walking distance. A few different options and nice interior and atmosphere. Not too loud but not completely quiet either. Many seats so usually no need for reservations especially like a lunch hour on weekdays. Would definitely come back and highly recommend!

Great place for brunch, lunch and dinner! They seated all 4 of us almost immediately on a Monday night (which seemed like a very busy night!) I love that you can pick your pasta type and sauce. They have such a great variety and it makes it easy to customize. Pappardelle is my favorite and I love that I can pick a different sauce each time I come here. $10 for a big bowl of pasta. so good, great service, fun atmosphere. you pick the pasta type and sauce type which is awesome. the rigatoni and bore ragu were sooo good. they also did bottomless wine for 90 minutes at dinner for us. i already want to go back.

This is my favorite restaurant in New York, full stop. Casual and tasteful atmosphere, inexpensive but excellent food. Better pasta than any Little Italy restaurant I've been to and you get to build your own dishes, so every visit is unique. Drinks were great too! Staff was extremely friendly and service was speedy. Music was not too loud and the playlist is classic rock/ indie pop. Can't recommend this place enough.

If you are looking for an inexpensive Italian restaurant, San Marzano is your place. All the pasta is ~$10 which is really cheap for NYC. How it works is that you pick a type of pasta noodle, and then you can choose what sauce you want on top. I ordered the rigatoni alla norma, and was not disappointed by my meal. Honestly, the complimentary bread was not the best. It was a bit hard, but given the fact that the bread was free and that the pasta dishes were so cheap, I didn't particularly mind. I would go back again to try the other pastas on the menu!

Although the pasta was delicious, the service was not great. Our waiter seemed to be rushing us every time. He cleaned up our dishes quickly and offered us the bill as my friend was still eating her pasta and had a full glass of wine. I came in the early afternoon and there was plenty of seating available so I wasn't too sure why he seemed to be rushing us. As for the pasta dishes, I opted for the ravioli and it was delicious. Saucy and flavorful. I would return to try the other pasta dishes but hopefully we won't be rushed next time.

They said we would get free unlimited pastries with the fixed menu brunch, we didn't get unlimited pastries. They took forever to refill our mimosas for bottomless, at one point taking 25 minutes to come refill them. We ordered the burrata that came with prosciutto, and instead gave us 4 slides of tomato; when we asked if they had run out of prosciutto they said no just  that the kitchen had decided to make it with tomato... Then they automatically charged us 20% tip even when we were a 4 person party, not 6.  Waiter was not the best, and when we called another waiter over because ours was nowhere to be seen, she was rude as well. Not great.

I came here out of the blue during the storm and oh boy was this a great experience. I sat at the bar since it was pretty quiet, but I was more than entertained eating by myself. The servers Mary and Jacob were so friendly and kind to me. I will definitely be back because of them!

Good meal for cheap price. But smaller portion sizes. The sangria had a lot of ice in it. Great pasta dish though.

Absolute steal! We ordered pasta ($10) and a pitcher of sangria ($15) as well as a salad ($8) which all came out very quickly and with excellent service. Expect to wait up to an hour during their dinner rush unless you're a party of two. The atmosphere was really young however a little loud. The flavors of all the dishes were incredible and it really did taste like homemade pasta done right. We will definitely be coming back next time we're in the city.
portions were small but really tasty. we came here for the bottomless brunch and there was barely any champagne in the glasses

This restaurant is such a joke. I would never return here, not even if someone paid me to. It was my friend's 24th birthday and she made a reservation of 7 on the Seated App. When 5 of us arrived, we informed the restaurant that unbeknownst to us, two members would not be showing up. Mind you, we had no idea. Anyhow, instead of being normal or having common decency and courtesy, they scolded us on how they have a $20 fee per no show client. That is ridiculous. I never heard of such a thing. So you want to charge my friend and her guests an extra $40 on her birthday because she had no idea that two of her friends would stand her up last minute?! We went back and forth with a snippy waiter and manager who clearly had poor customer service and racial bias. Initially they refused to waive the fee. We even threatened to leave and the manager said, "I still have your card on file and will charge you regardless"--mind you, at this point we hadn't even ordered our food yet. Eventually, the manager realized it was her fault and that she made a mistake. She assumed we made the reservation on Open Table, which we did not. We told her, we used the Seated App and that nothing was disclosed about the no show fee and that we weren't even required to put our cards on file--thank God for the Seated app! The manager was upset, but finally apologized for this misunderstanding and did not charge the fee. After all that, they could have given the table something free or some sort of discount if they really knew how to accommodate their guests. Anyways, the food finally came--a required pre-fixed menu, which is almost always a scam. Appetizers were to be shared amongst guests and arrived in tiny portions. All this "Italian" place has as entrees is basic pastas, nothing super authentic and limited options. They draw in a young college crowd whose standards are probably too low and who are probably too drunk and not even originally from New York to even know good NYC Italian food. Anyhow, pasta also arrived in an unbelievably small portion and was subpar. My pasta dish was overcooked, watery and needed salt. The birthday girl's dish, in fact, had a hair in it and they had to remake her dish. After all that, they wouldn't even give her a free dessert for her birthday and all of the trouble we went through. We ended up ordering a "tiramisu". It was not authentic at all. It was literally tiramisu pudding. It tasted and looked just like whipped cream. I was shocked. Like is the owner a non Italian from some place like Ohio or something ??? What a joke. But, it gets worse. The overpriced bill arrives and they already include an indisputable 20% tip!!!! Of course, we didn't let the birthday girl dish out a cent for this mess. Please be warned to avoid this place! This is not real Italian food. Service sucks. Staff is racist and incompetent. Their "policies" suck. It's definitely not worth it to come here at all. I felt so bad for my friend. It was her freaking birthday! Luckily, we all enjoyed one another's company and headed to a comedy club after. There was no way I was going to let her end her birthday night with San Marzano being the last memory. I can't wait to post about this place on my blog and to warn others not to attend.

the pasta was super good and fresh! also the prices and atmosphere are really good and fun :) i highly recommend the ravioli!

went to brunch this past sunday with a friend, and firstly, i would say that i recommend making a reservation before coming. at first, when we got there, we were turned away as they were only accepting parties with reservations at the time. we stepped outside for a few moments to consider new brunch plans before the host called us back in, letting us know that there was space for the two of us at a community table shared with two others. i can see why it's so popular; bottomless drinks and food at unheard of prices for brunch. my friend and i actually opted for a $16 pitcher of sangria instead of the $10 bottomless mimosas, but we still feel like we got a bang for our buck. as for food, i got the omelette with potatoes and mozzarella whereas my friend got a rigatoni dish. i enjoyed my food, however i do wish i got the pasta considering that's what they're known for. my friend's food was delish. overall, not a bad experience for a boozy brunch.

Soo good and so affordable. We didn't have a problem getting a table for two outside at 6pm on a Friday but I think any later we would have run into a wait. Also great for big groups at night, about $40 pp for unlimited wine/sangria, a pasta entree, and some apps for the table!

There's something for everyone, my personal favorites are the wild boar ragu, sausage and broccolini, and the vecchia bettola. Great value for what you pay. Sangria is really good as well. Just keep and eye on the hostess' they sometimes seat people out of order and you have to remind them to seat you.

Tables are incredibly difficult to get here, which is the only con to this place!

My go-to spot. The Alla Norma is literally so so amazing. Please try it. Also the Sangria is lit. Get the pitcher.

My favorite pasta in nyc. Mikey the host was so nice and super accommodating- would honestly come back here because of him

Nothing too thrilling. Shared the burrata and prosciutto, meatballs and Brussels sprouts to start with three friends. I then had the pear and Gorgonzola ravioli, which was the standout to me, and a pasta with bolognese. Also had a bite of the pesto spaghetti. Service was fine, and the prices are definitely amazing, but I would say the food is average.

I really enjoyed this place. Great location with casual ambiance. I really enjoyed the grilled chicken with arugula panini. The panini was fresh, hot and had great flavor. Service was neglectful but the quality and price of the food is what I'd go back for.

One of my favorite places to go. Great prices, for everything. Cheap food and drinks are not so easy to find in NYC. I think the portions are extremely fair for price and quality. I recommend getting there early to get seated quickly or you may have to wait a while.

I've had good experiences in the past, but this experience was unprecedented. I'm a server myself, so I understand complications but our service was unacceptable. My party made a reservation not realizing that there was a prefixe menu, which was not the problem (we were okay with paying for the experience). However, our interaction with our sever (Mary) made the entire experience very unenjoyable. We made a reservation and when she was explaining the prefixe menu, she mentioned that hosts usually call for reservations explaining the prefixe menu but we never received a call and she made us feel very incompetent because she was annoyed that we had not looked closely at the bottom of our reservation email when she was explaining the prefixe menu. When we asked for the check, we were charged for two bottomless brunches even though we only had one person drinking. She left two mimosa glasses on the table (our mistake for keeping two glasses on the table) but only one person the entire time Wwas ever drinking from the glasses. When we told her, she said to us "I promise I'm not a d*ck" and then proceeded to get annoyed at us because she had left two glasses even though we said that only one person was drinking. There were inconsistencies in her explanation for the two bottomless charges because one of the people who ordered bottomless was charged for an iced tea but the other person she believed ordered bottomless was never charged for the coffee that he ordered (even though she refilled the coffee three times). There is also a bit of annoyance because I ordered a meal with a side of fries (believing that it came with no side) and she never told me that the food comes with fries which would've saved us $4 (not much but it's the little things). I understand that there was a lot of confusion, however, she made us feel very incompetent and was not understanding throughout the entire experience.
No comment

Came here for dinner at 5pm on a Saturday and it was absolutely delicious. I got the pasta alla Norma, and my boyfriend got the regular spaghetti and meatballs with grated cheese. The alla Norma was the standout!! An absolutely perfect plate of pasta- for 10$!! Unbeatable in manhattan. We also shared the ravioli and it was just okay. Lastly, we got the ricottella and it was AMAZING. The Nutella and ricotta blended perfectly in the hot crisp dough and it came with a very tasty creme on the side. Highly recommend. The next day I was already dying to come back. Next time will def take advantage of the 15$ sangrias, every table seemed to have gotten one. Go here and get the alla Norma and ricottella- it will not disappoint.

This was a delicious brunch spot in New York. The wait was not that bad but the food was delicious. The best part was that they have bottomless mimosas for only $10. For dinner i had the meatball pressed panini. The cook messed up my order so it had to be recooked but that was still okay because it gave me a reason to stay a little linger and have a few more mimosas :)

There is usually a line during lunch or dinner time so try to come at other times. The pasta is fresh with a good bite and goes along with some great homemade sauces. I love how you can mix and match sauces with pasta($10 pasta). The drinks are also very affordable($5 sangria). I would love to give it 5 stars but some of my pasta was stuck together. I assume it wasn't mixed while it was boiling and it wasn't busy when I came so I hope they fix that. Will definitely be back!

This is probably going to be my new favorite casual italian restaurant! Came here on a Monday night with a friend of mine at 6:30p and there wasn't a wait. Everything here is freshly made. We ordered the burrata, meatballs, pasta, and tiramisu. Definitely ordered too much but everything was so worth it!!  Nothing beats having freshly made pasta after a long day of work. Carbing it up this winter for sure.
No comment

I've been here three times now (twice for brunch, and once for dinner) and love this place! The prices are unbeatable for their boozy brunch (only $10 unlimited mimosas) + whatever entree you'd like (~$8). I ordered French toast and ricotella, which is essentially a calzone with Nutella and ricotta cheese. Wasn't sure if I'd like it - but it wasn't bad!VERY filling. I would recommend splitting it between 2-4 people as it's very heavy. French toast was amazingg and comes with a bonus of bananas (not listed)! My boyfriend ordered their eggs Benedict and loved them. Staff is very friendly and will answer any question you have. Although it can be very busy there, the wait time isn't all that bad if you come with a small group. But beware - if you're not a New Yorker and they tell you 30 minutes, it actually sometimes means 5 minutes. So don't go anywhere!

Great value and simple yet delicious food. The sangria is not that strong, however after chugging a $15 pitcher, it might creep up on you. The tiramisu dessert is velvety with just the right amount of expresso. I loved my experience here and will definitely be back!

Ordered delivery from here and was very disappointed with the outcome. Ordered the tiramisu and after one bite, I knew something was off. It was sour and smelt like spoiled milk. After contacting the restaurant, I am still waiting for manager approval (manager hasn't been in the restaurant yesterday and today which I find convenient) to get a refund for that item. Wish the restaurant would have immediately fixed this situation as I almost got food poisoning if I had finished this dessert and don't want to continue to have to follow up with them when this manager will be there.

If you're craving good Italian pasta for cheap, this is the place to go. This place is crowded and can get loud but has a nice ambience. I had the pear and gorgonzola ravioli and it tasted very fresh and flavorful. The portions are on the medium side but still satisfying. If you're super hungry with a group, I'd order an extra plate or appetizers to try all the different dishes they offer.

Delicious pasta with lots of options. Even a picky pasta eater will find something they enjoy here. I personally love the Alla Norma. My friends also recommend the pesto. The sangria here is must have for those who are 21+. The atmosphere is charming with mason jars as water glasses and wood tables and accents. The only thing is that this restaurant can get packed! Make sure to grab a table early or make a reservation. I've also had good experiences getting take out from here. Its also pretty affordable for those on a budget.

So AFFORDABLE ! Loved that it was easy to find, the host and bartenders were extremely friendly. Dinner for two came out to about $48 which is amazing for NYC. We ordered two pasta dishes and prosciutto - kind of wish the bread was warmed up though. Downside is that if you sit by the door (which is where we were seated) it gets a little chilly with the wind gust coming in and out. I'm only giving four stars because I didn't like that they gave us a time limit .. I just think it's a little rude to seat a table and tell them they have to leave cause they have reservations for another party.. so then why did you seat us there?! Anyways, all in all great food for an affordable price !

The pasta here is not only so fresh and delicious but it is also so cheap! You can personalize everything to exactly how you like it and the portions are also pretty big. This is a really good place to take to people if you want to save money but enjoy a night out with good food!

My favorite place to get pasta!! Prices are super reasonable at $10 a plate of fresh pasta. My personal favorites are the Alla Norma and the Pesto! Portions aren't huge but honestly it's just enough curb your hunger. Drinks here are super reasonably priced as well with $5 red or white sangria and glasses of wine ranging from $6-$8. My only complaint would be that I wish the service was a bit more attentive. Despite there being only 2 other tables other than my own, I found myself having to hail down the server whenever I needed something as they rarely came in to check on us throughout our meal. Otherwise I love this place! Definitely will be returning.

I've been here for happy hour, dinner, brunch, takeout... Just about everything. And it never ever fails to impress. Incredible fresh pasta, rich flavorful sauces, excellent drinks, great services, and RIDICULOUSLY CHEAP PRICES. All fresh pastas are $9. Brunch with bottomless mimosas is under $20. This place is unreal and will forever be one of my favorites in the city for any time of day!

Never go to this restaurant. The customer service is horrific and the menu is not that great and very limited. Go to any other Italian place. My friend made a reservation though open table and it never said that there was a mandatory prefixed dinner if you make one. The waiter said that it would be $40 each per person because there were bottomless drinks. We told them that we were under 21 and never received any word of the mandatory part. We didn't get a confirmation call like they said we should've. Without the drinks, they then told us that it would be $32 each to share three appetizers (they were ~$9) and each get one entree (~$11). They said the extra $12 was due to the fact that we made a reservation, even though it's free to make one and there were many slots open when we made it. The waiter then went to the manager to tell them of the situation where they proceeded to laugh and point at us. It made absolutely no sense and they were not understanding at all. So we left with no hesitation.
One of the best cheaper pasta places in NYC, amazing ambience and customer service. Already been here 10 times over! They are unfortunately closed in the pandemic however, as of right now.
No comment

We arrived around 6pm on a Friday night and were lucky enough to be quickly seated in one of the few tables available in their outside patio.  Their menu offers many customizable options for pasta, sauce, and choice of protein.  We ordered the fusilli bolognese and the tagliatelle with meatballs.  Portion sizes are generous, but we were not really impressed with either dish.  The pasta didn't seem as fresh and was luke warm when it was served.   It was a busy Friday night for them, so not sure if that had anything to do with it.

DELIZIOSO! Will definitely be back. I would also request the waiter Ray. He was delightful & generous. He made sure to never have an empty glass on our table. Very reasonably priced prix fixe menu. All the pastas are homemade. Between the 6 of us we all got a variety of pastas & sauces. I'm a pappardelle Patsy myself. I choose the Wild Boar Ragu - very flavorful. The Vecchia Bettola sauce (like vodka) had a spicy kick to it. The burrata, meatballs & brussel sprout apps were delicious as well. I can't wait to go back!

Great food, but bad brunch service. Got bottomless mimosas and only got 4 drinks. Our tab was closed off at 45 minutes when the bottomless is supposed to last an hour and a half... our glasses were left empty for the majority of our short time here also. Daniel gave us the check and told us he closed us out before we were done or even hit the actual time limit.. Sad. It was supposed to be bottomless, but we found the bottom faster than intended. A true bummer

Simple Menu, nice casual spot, and super legit $10 pasta options! What more can you ask for, don't get ripped off going to a Italian restaurant and getting a $30 bolognese when you can get 3 bowls better here. Get the Brussel sprouts is a must!

This place was extremely good! Me and a friend were walking down the street to another restaurant and came across this place because I saw someone's pasta through the window that looked really good. We looked at the menu and saw how affordable it was so we had to try it! We sat outside with a nice view. I ordered the Alla Norma and it was extremely good. I definitely suggest this place in the future. We got one meal, two glasses of wine and two beers for only $34. Which is a good deal for NYC I will definitely be back. I was so anxious to eat, I forgot to take a picture of my mind so I just have a the menu.

Was extremely disappointed in the service as well as the food quality here. This is my first visit to New York and I've had exceptional meals and servers the entire time I've been here. Except for here at San Marzano. The staff were extremely rude as condescending and even tried to fight with our table. In the middle of our meal, the hostess came and accused us of squeezing in an extra guest without paying for them.. which makes no sense as we had the same amount of people seated at our table as we had on our reservation. If that wasn't enough, I had to frequently visit the restroom after I ate their food.. Don't come here.

Amazing price for the quality of food you get here! The burrata appetizer is to die for. The salads were huge, I felt like I was eating a whole bag of lettuce, I would recommend sharing this if you want to get salad. You can pick your favorite style of homemade pastas and sauce combinations. Cheapest pasta I've ever had in NYC, I would highly recommend checking it out. I would go a bit earlier to avoid waiting too long, we went around 7:30 on Friday night and waited about 30ish minutes.
I ordered this for delivery and the pasta was over cooked and the sauce was not anything special. Did not taste homemade
No comment

THIS IS MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN NYC. I never really like pasta before coming to this place, and now my mind has been blown. The freshly made pasta is so satisfying to slurp down, and at only $10 for a dish, it's really affordable for a group dinner. The place is pretty packed and a little loud so maybe not a date / talk spot, but you have to try to Bolognese with the thin ribbon noodle it IS SOOOOO GOOD. You might to consider reservation if you have a large group, but I walked in both times and I got seated immediately. Please check this place out if you are in East Village for some good pasta!
No comment

I highly recommend this brunch spot in the East Village for a weekend brunch date. The only negative about this place is they don't take reservations from less than 6 and the wait was quite long. We were told we'd wait 20-30 minutes and waited about 50 minutes (not the end of the world, but annoying in the cold with not a lot of room to wait). Once we sat, we were happy with our meal! We were given a communal table & shared a 6-top with another couple and it was fine. We got the bottomless mimosas ($12 pp)  shared the yummy but greasy garlic bread.  My SO ordered the delicious grilled cheese w tomatoes, I got the pappardelle alla norma (eggplant, pesto, tomatoes, cheese) and it was soooooo amazing and delicious for our late lunch, and we were so full upon leaving. I will 100% be back!
No comment
No comment

A friend of mine suggested that I come to this location, and boy, I'm glad that I came! I brought my boyfriend here during date night, and we were satisfied from the moment we walked in, to the moment we walked out. I ordered an appetizer of meatballs which were so soft, and tasty. The bread was delicious as well! You can never have too much bread! For my main course I ordered small cylinder sized pasta with tomato sauce (with extra cheese, you can never have too much cheese) My boyfriend ordered a pasta dish with creamy sauce and he loved it! Anyone looking for a great place to take a date, or your pals, I suggest you come to San Marzano. I'm not sure what I loved more, the tasty food, or the affordable prices. $10 for quality food! And tip these people well, they provide great service!

Very delicious food for the price. I wish the serving size was just a litttttle bit bigger lol.

Great pasta if you are willing to wait way past your reservations. We were sat at a table with vents right above us. Our food was cold within seconds. When we politely asked for vent to be turned low our hostess just gave us a smirk. We were told the names were Michael and Michael. I seldom take the time to write a review but feel people should know what they are in for when coming here.
